reviews.review: Wonderful day with Yuriko. My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to have been the only ones who booked this day because it was just us and Yuriko, our guide. We spent a lovely day discovering traditions in Asakusa, electronic city in Akihabara, fun sushi lunch in Shibuya, peaceful Meiji shrine and shopping in Harajuku. It was a great decision to book this tour on the first full day in Tokyo so we could get a good sense of the different areas straight away. Yuriko was a fantastic guide, she answered all of our questions and it was just a very enjoyable day chatting with her. Thanks so much Yuriko, it will be a day we will never forget!

A lovely day in Tokyo. Having only one full day to spend in Tokyo, my husband and I thought it would be sensible to spend it with a knowledgeable person who could show us some of the highlights of the city and give us a short introduction to the city and Japanese culture and history. Keiko, with whom we had the privilege to spend our day yesterday, gave us all that and more, going to great lengths to make sure we enjoyed our day to the full (even trying in advance the restaurant she recommended for lunch and suggesting the best side to sit in the boat trip) . She kept us entertained all day with pleasant and interesting conversation about every subject we were interested in, and in the meantime making sure we were comfortable, received all the information she had prepared in advance and saw all the sights which had been planned. She kept to the timetable without rushing us and we felt we indeed made the right choice in spending our day in Tokyo with Keiko.

An experience to remember.. We couldn't speak more highly of our experience. Our guide Yakko really went out of her way to show us so many different aspects of Japanese culture and was extremely knowledgable about the many places we visited. We left with a deeper appreciation of Japanese culture and a love for Tokyo. We especially liked that Yakko listened to us and made additional recommendations each day which were perfect for us and so much fun! We will be back and definitely use Yakko and Travelience again. Thank you!!!

A great and comprehensive tour of Tokyo. We had a day tour of Tokyo with a tour guide for us alone as nobody else booked it which was great! We saw the highlights of Tokyo and got a lot of information about the city, the history and the culture. Our guide was really friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. The tour is a perfect opportunity to discover the city on the first day as doing it on your own can be a bit overwhelming. We are very happy that we did it and really recommend it to anyone!

Great private Tokyo tour with Nariko. Our full-day tour was planned on a relatively short note. Travelience support team always responded within 24 hrs and wes very organized and helpful. Our tour with Norico was full of historical, personal, and cultural connections. She discussed and adjusted our plan for the day easily. For our first and very short trip here, she was able to share historical background and not just the facts, giving us exactly what we were looking for--a personal feel for the city. She was able in 8 hrs. with us to share tons of history, traditions, customs, and evolving changes in this modern yet very traditional conglomerate of the city. We got to see Tsukiji imarket "inside and out", while learning about its history and evolving transitions. We enjoyed a wonderful sushi lunch at Sushisay. We saw the Asakusa area and walked around Sensoji, talking about the slow interwoven blend of Shinto and Buddhist religions evolving with good or tough times for Japanese, allowing peaceful coexistence of religions. Even street market was an opportunity to look at the tradition and people that carried them through the years. We went to a beautiful Hama-rikyu Garden and worked our way through traditional Matchu tea ceremony, taking in the quiet meditative park design sustained in the middle of booming economic modernity. We went to Ginza neighborhood to get the feel for shoppers rushing by and then to see Meiji shrine, and she did a great job again including the people of the temple and their daily life into our tour. We ended the tour with her graciously taking us to a wonderful traditional Japanese restaurant and talking us through many menu options, as well as handing us maps for shopping and directions to get home. All day, we traveled by subway allowing us to get many short glimpses at behaviors and customs she whole-heartedly talked to us about. I feel she did an impossible job of connecting our many interests with life, history, and customs of Tokyo in 8 hrs, stopping for a snack or a break just enough to make them a part of the experience. We loved every minute of it, and of the interaction. I could not give higher recommendation for a travel company and a guide. We would love to spend more time with Narico!

Could not be better! . Booked 2 all day tours with them. Noriko was our guide. From a communication and tour guide experience, there is nothing that they could have done better! The Company communicated very effectively and sent nice reminders via Internet. The tour guide was well versed and made us feel welcome in her City. Extremely knowledgeable, a perfect personality and one of the best my wife and I ever experienced anywhere in the world !

Amazing day in Tokyo with Keiko. We had a fun and enriching day in Tokyo with Keiko. We visited temples, shrines, shopping areas and ate at a fun, automated sushi restaurant. The tour was called "trends and traditions," and it delivered on both accounts. I loved the diversity of what I got to see, which really made time fly. Keiko is an amazing guide. She has so much knowledge to share. I highly recommend this tour.

Yakko was the best guide I've ever seen. Wow.. what to say. Tokyo keeps surprising me every day, and I'm really happy that I made the tour with this company specially having Yakko as our guide. She is by far the kindest person I met in all these months of travelling, she answered every single question we had about the tour, the city and even transport problems. 12 out of 10. Super recommendable.

A tour - but above and beyond!. We spent our first day in Japan with our Travelience tour guide, Mayumi, and it was just fantastic! We opted for a private tour for the 5 of us, and it was reasonably priced. Mayumi was so prepared and asked in advance via email about our interests, then created a suggested itinerary (with our input). She knew that my two youngest girls - ages 12 and 15 - were interested in the more funky Harajuku type experiences, but we had to balance it with the interests of my 17 year old son and his dad. She called ahead to make reservations for us, and had excellent suggestions of historical sites, shopping and restaurants to explore on our own. We felt we had an amazing overview of Tokyo in just one day! I highly recommend a tour for your first day or two to help acclimate yourself. Mayumi even followed up with an email after the tour as she had done some research into gluten-free restaurant options for one of our group. Talk about service above and beyond! We so appreciated our time with Mayumi who not only shared many highlights with us but also gave us a real look into life in Tokyo.
Wow what experience to be there.. The first day for me in Tokoy is to go to Kamakura -hase, when I saw the Buddha I said wow. very close to beach many nice Japanese restaurants.

highly recommended tour!. We had the pleasure of having Yasuko as our guide for a wonderful 6 hour tour around Tokyo. She was very friendly, fluent in English, knowledgeable and made our tour an enjoyable experience! Would definitely go back again!!!

Perfect Experience thanks to our guide.. My family and I had 1 full day in Japan and we were looking for a tour to see as much as possible. Thanks to Travelience, that happened.Our guide, Keiko Sasaki, met us at the airport in Haneda at 8AM and had a full day planned for us based on the specifics we wanted to do. She was so accommodating and even arranged for our luggage to be taken to our airport hotel in Narita via courier so we did not have to carry it around all day long.Once she met us, she took us via train to Tokyo where we spent the day in the city visiting J-World, Akihabara, Asakusa Temple and a few other places we had wanted to see. Keiko was amazing in every way. She scouted out the places my family wished to visit prior to our arrival, was in constant contact before our trip and made the most of every second of our day. My children will never forget the short time we had in Japan and certainly wish to return one day. On a side note, due to some of the sight seeing, we were about 5 minutes late to our last train which would have made us wait about 45 minutes to catch our bus to our hotel. Keiko quickly thought of a way to avoid that delay but taking us to the Narita Airport stop, and then catching the shuttle to the hotel. This was brilliant and went perfectly as we made it to the hotel much quicker for some rest before our long journey home!I would recommend this company to anyone looking for top notch experience in Japan, catered to what you want to see. Thanks again!

FANTASTIC WALKING TOUR OF TOKYO. Our tour guide was Mayumi. She met us at our hotel and guided us through many parts of tokyo via the subway system. We were able to see all of the major sites in about 8 hours. Our two kids (4 & 8 yrs old) were able to make it, although completely exhausted by the end of the tour. This was a very informative and efficient way to see Tokyo. There are other options such as the hop on/hop off bus tour but having a tour guide that speaks English really well was invaluable. I would highly recommend this tour company.

Excellent experience!. We travelled to Tokyo a couple of weeks ago and we spent 3 full days with Yuriko as part of private tours and I want to say that this is the best decision I've ever made! This is our family's first trip to Japan. My friend used Travelience last year and she recommended them to me when I told her about our plan to travel to Tokyo. From the moment I got in touch with Emi in February, I sensed that it was a legitimate company. Emi was prompt, professional and courteous with all of her correspondence. She answered all of my questions, made great suggestions/ recommendations and worked with my family's needs as I told her I'll be traveling with young kids and an elderly mother. I had in our party myself, my husband, 2 kids, elderly Mom and a cousin. She made the itinerary for me once I told her what we wanted to visit. I actually just contacted her for a one day private tour but it ended up being 3 full days as I really felt that I could get the best of our short stay in Tokyo if we had a professional guide to help us along the way. I settled my payment about two weeks before our trip and she assigned Yuriko to our group. I contacted her shortly thereafter and she responded right away as well.On the first day of our tour, she met us at the lobby of our hotel in Shinjuku and from there we navigated the Tokyo public transportation system. It is very intimidating as someone from California who doesn't use public transportation and a non- Japanese speaker on top of that! With Yuriko, we just gave her the money for fare and she knew where and when to get off the subway, train and bus. She was so pleasant to work with, had a good command of the English language and was very patient with my young daughter and Mom who at some point got so tired from all the walking! Our itinerary included 2 days in Tokyo and one day in Kamakura to see the the Great Buddha. My Mom skipped the 3rd day as she was very tired for the first two days so keep in mind that there will be lots and lots of walking. We also had to cut our Kamakura tour short as there was no way she could continue to walk without assistance as it was a very long day and her feet began to hurt. We missed going to the Tsurugaoka Hachiman Shrine because of this. Overall we had a great time and I highly recommend this company. We wouldn't have seen 1/2 of the sites we went to if we didn't have Yuriko with us. On our fourth day, we ventured on our own and I had made advanced reservations to see the Imperial Palace grounds. We went to the site without any problem but going back to the hotel, we got lost big time and spent a great deal of time figuring how to get back. It was then I realized that we got so used with Yuriko and she made it less stressful the first 3 days. I appreciated her even more after that experience. I just want to say thank you for making our trip memorable. My cousin who came with us has been to Japan several times before and she commented that I did a great job of getting a tour guide after she had a great experience as well. Apparently, on her previous trips she just did a DIY and she didn't see as much nor learned about some history/ back stories. It was worth every penny getting them and I truly recommend Travelience/ Yuriko to anyone who's going to visit Tokyo. I'm glad I listened to my friend.

Two GREAT days with Noriko!. Our family only had 3 full days in Tokyo so we wanted to try to pack as much in as possible in a short period of time. We arranged for two private tours for our 1st and 3rd day. We had arrived the night before so we hadn't had time to purchase Pasmo cards so she helped us with that since we would be using them all day. Our first day we did Sensoji Temple, Asakusa shrine, Nakamise street, Akihabara sightseeing, lunch at a fun conveyor belt sushi restaurant, Shibuya sightseeing (famous crossing, Hachiko dog statue), & Meiji Jingu shrine. I had mentioned to Noriko that I was interested in getting a Bao Bao bag so she took us to the Issey Miyake store so I could get one. She also was a huge help in making our train reservations. We were headed to Kyoto 3 days later so we went to a JR office and she basically made them for us. The person working did not speak English so it would have been very difficult to communicate our needs. Our 3rd day was the family's favorite...a day trip to Kamakura. She met us at our hotel and it took about 1 1/2 hours via metro/train to get there. We first went to Hasedera Temple and to see the Great Buddha. She took us to a great soba noodle restaurant for lunch. I'm a vegetarian and I had one of the most amazing meals of the trip there. After lunch we went to Hokoku-ji Temple and Tsurugaoka Hachiman Shrine. It was a long day but so different than what we had seen before.....we absolutely loved it. This was our first time in Japan and we were a little nervous about the language barrier. Having Noriko get us familiar with the city and the metro was a huge help and really put us at ease. Our 2nd day we were on our own and went all over the city using the metro and went to a baseball game that night (highly recommend!). I appreciated the prompt communication with the company when booking the tours and also with Noriko when our trip got closer. She even sent us a picture of herself so we would be able to spot her in the lobby which was thoughtful. I highly recommend Noriko and Travelience.

Enjoyable Walking Tour. I signed up for the Tokyo Traditions & Trends tour for my first day in town. I thought the tour was a great introduction to the city's various neighborhoods, and conveniently we visited a ton of popular sites in Tokyo over the 6 hours or so, including Meiji Shrine and Senso-ji. Despite this being a group tour, there was only one other gentleman who had signed up, so we each had plenty of time to ask questions. Our guide (who I believe was named Manami) was friendly and had a good sense of humor. She was knowledgable of the sites we visited and handled all of our questions well. This tour was also a good way to stay awake and beat the jet lag since it involves constant walking. The sushi restaurant for lunch was also hilarious (observe how the kitchen sends your food out) and tasty. Kudos to Manami who also stayed with me after the tour to write down several suggestions for shopping and tea stores.

Friendly tour guide.. Though we spent only one day with our tour guide (Miki), it was nice having a local help us visit the Imperial Place, Shibuya, temples... We would have a hard time getting transferring from one station to another without her.

Excellent private tour in Tokyo. Our family group of 4 adults had one day for a tour of Tokyo before embarking on a cruise from Yokohama the next day. I made arrangements with Akane online and our guide, Yakko, met us at our hotel at 9 am. She had a bubbly, enthusiastic personality and spoke excellent English. After helping us buy a one day ticket for the subway, we were on our way visiting the Sensoji Temple, Nakamise shopping area, Hamarikyu garden and tea ceremony, a relaxing river cruise, Ginza sightseeing and lunch, Meiji Temple, Shibuya crossing and Hachiko statue (we have an Akita). She was very informative about the history, culture and everyday life. It was great to have a private guide considering we knew no Japanese and had never been to Tokyo. It was also a breeze using public transportation. We paid for the tour in advance through pay pal. Transportation/entrance fees for ourselves plus the guide were paid with cash (yens) along with lunch fees for ourselves.

Perfect Private tours. We took two private tours on a Monday and Tuesday and between the two saw everything we wanted. Our guides, Michio and Yuriko, were perfect. Their English was excellent, knowledge of local history, culture and customs was given to us everywhere we went. Both guides went out of the way to be flexible on the itinerary, and help us out, even going so far as to take us to the station to buy tickets for our Shinkansen ride the next day. We were very impressed and satisfied and would recommend them for sure.

Awesome Private Tour -- Highly Recommended. We booked two 5-hour tours of Tokyo with Travelience. From start to finish, our experience with Travelience, Akane (trip planner), and Kanae (tour guide) was outstanding.During the planning phase, we communicated primarily with the trip planner, Akane. Akane wrote in clear, professional English and she always responded quickly. We sent her a list of personal interests which she synthesized into a travel itinerary that nicely suited our diverse interests.Our tour guide, Kanae, did a wonderful job. She speaks English clearly, and we did not have any trouble understanding her. Our tour encompassed a lot of different locations -- the Tsukiji Fish Market, Buddhist Temples and Shinto Shrines, panoramic views of the city -- and Kanae was well-prepared to talk about each location. She was comfortable discussing history and religion as well as matters of modern-day culture and arts. She even helped us by recommending good snacks and sake to bring as gifts for our friends back home. In addition to her efforts on the tour, Kanae was considerate of our trip as a whole. For example, she helped us book tickets on the Shinkansen to visit Himeji, Kyoto, and Hiroshima and prepared notes with routs and stations to help us navigate the confusing public transportation. Kanae was a special part of our first trip to Japan, and we are really grateful she was our tour guide.All the best,Liam, Connie, and LaTanya

Wonderful guide in Tokyo!. Travelience made it easy to arrange a personalized one day tour of Tokyo. Our guide, Keiko Sasaki, met us at our hotel at Haneda airport and traveled into Tokyo with us. Weeks before our tour I told her what my wife and I wanted to see. She came with a folder full of information and photos that were appropriate to those sites! She knew the history, and all of the facts! Her English was excellent.  She took us to a sushi restaurant where the 'locals' go. Huge lunch, super delicious, $10 for THREE of us!!  At the end of the tour, she knew we were going to have to take the train back to the airport by ourselves. She had maps, diagrams, and written instructions prepared for our return trip!  All this was above and beyond what we expected from a guide!  If you are planning to hire a private guide in Tokyo, I recommend that you go thru Travelience, and ask for Keiko!!

Outstanding Private Tokyo Tour. My family had one full day in Tokyo and wanted to make the most of our time. I had corresponded by email with the agency and they had helped me trim my list of what we wanted to see into a manageable itinerary for one day. In fact, we were able to see all of our must see sights which we could never have done without her help. Our guide was friendly, knowledgeable and orchestrated the events to suit our needs. Thank you Travelience. Outstanding guide and highly recommended.

Excellent Private Tokyo tour during our 11 hour layover at Nartita Airport!. Highly recommended. We had an 11 hour layover at Narita Airport and had never been to Tokyo so we booked a private tour to get a quick glimpse of the city since we weren't sure we'd ever get the chance to come back. It was super easy to book the tour over email, communicating w Emi, who was very easy to coordinate with. We wanted a guide to meet us at the airport and take us into Tokyo because we had been traveling for 3 weeks around southeast asia and this was our final stop and we just didn't want to think about any more travel details (didn't want figure out the trains/subways!). Yakko was our amazing guide, and she met us at the airport exactly on time, and exactly where we planned to meet. She spoke excellent English, and had incredible energy throughout the entire day. She was very passionate about her city and was extremely knowledgeable. She was an excellent guide and helped to make the most of our 5-6 hours in Tokyo. We really enjoyed her company, and really felt like we had a friend showing us around her city! She put us on the train back to the airport at the end of our tour. Thank you Yakko, and thank you Emi for organizing. (Brett &Corrine, from New York City)

Perfect Tokyo tour for a quick layover. My travel party of 4 had 11 hours in Tokyo and we couldn't resist leaving the airport and taking a tour. Our guide, Miki, was great. She was early to meet us at the train station, helped transition us to another station, took us to store luggage, and then gave us the highlights. She was flexible and listened to what we wanted to do and adapted. Her English was wonderful and the booking and payment process prior was simple. I'd highly recommend the tour to anyone traveling to Tokyo.

Great tour of Tokyo. Our tour guide, Miki, outlined a fantastic tour! We hit major highlights including The Imperial Palace Gardens, Harajuku, Shibuya, and Tokyo Tower. She was also flexible in adding in a trip to Tokyo Station for a stop at the Pokemon Store, which made our 9 year old's day. We had lunch at a fun restaurant we would not have found on our own. I came to Tokyo many years ago as a student, and my husband comes often for work but doesn't get to sightsee much. We saw a lot in a day (lots of walking) and with our guide (who spoke perfect English) we were able to get around much more quickly and learn much more than if we'd gone on our own.

Exploring Narita. Thank you Travelience...our family able to explore the Naritasan Shinshoji Temple which has a wide assortment of classical Japanese pagodas, halls and an awesome japanese garden... We have a lot of fun sightseeing the Omotesando Road and the food are great !Our short visit is worthed with your excellent tour guide Kanae Chida ... two thumbs up ... a great experience and priceless!From the Lingat Family , New York

October Tokyo tour. Spend 3 days in Tokyo in October and used Travelience to organise personal 2 day guided tour. Yuriko was our guide and she certainly kept us busy, found this was a great way of getting to know our way around, we could have probably have got round by ourselves but it would have taken twice as long. We purchased Pasmo cards (like Oyster cards in London) these were great time savers and you could also use them in Kyoto. You get them from a machine (cash only), you can also get a refund on the card from the station office of a metro station, less an admin fee.

Keiko is an excellent guide! Highly Recommended!. The guide has deep and rich knowledge about Japanese history, Buddhism, Shinto, Chinese and Japanese philosophy and culture. My trip was really rewarding and enjoyable. Highly recommended to the ones who are so curious about knowing the authentic and reliable information from the experienced local guide.

Yakko-san was a great guide!. Japan can be complicated because of the language barrier so we decided to book a tour with this company after reading all the excellent review. We have decided to book the hakone tour this time as we wanted our son to visit area outside of tokyo. Yakko-san was our guide and she was very friendly, informative, helpful and fun throughout the tour! Even my son who is usually very shy to stranger get along with her very well and at the end of the tour, he was kind of sad that we had to part. This is a sightseeing tour which we ride quite a few different type of transportation, I won't go into details here as I will leave that for you guys to experience. It was our lucky day as we get to see Mount Fuji from hakone and it's a clear view as well! During the journey while we were on the train, we get to learn more about japanese society and their culture, and the various thing a japanese family do from yakko-san. She also takes very good care of our son and my son had so much fun playing with her. I will definately recommend this tour and it's worth every penny.

Very nice day tour in tokyo with Miki from Travelience. We had just three days in Tokyo so we decided to have a private tour. Travelience send us Miki and she showed us Tokyo for nearly 9 hours. We had a really great day and visited the Tsukiji fish market, had lunch there with the best sushi ever, Hamarikyu garden, Asakusa sightseeing, river cruise on the Sumida river, imperial palace and tokyo tower. She told us a lot of the history and the background information of the sights and about actual life in tokyo. We had our first japanese tea session and could ask about everything. She also helped us organise the following days in Tokyo and explained us how to travel with the subway and railsystem. It was perfect.So thanks again. We will come again.

Kanae was a wonderful guide. We booked 3 tours with Travelience and had the lovely Kanae as our tour guide. She was so caring, patient, and informative. Loved exploring the city with her and enjoyed every minute we had with her. I don't think we could have navigated Tokyo and surrounding areas without her. When we told her we were going to Kyoto next, she offered to help us purchase our tickets to Kyoto and ensured we'd have seats together and that we'd be on the side that could see Mt. Fuji, which was very thoughtful. Kanae truly made our trip to Tokyo. Highly recommend Travelience for a special trip!

Michiyo taught us a lot about Japanese culture and gave us a very personal introduction to a fascinating city-Tokyo. With only a very short time to see Tokyo, we decided to hire a tour guide from Travelience for our first day. We prioritized what we wanted to see beforehand and Travelience helped us create our own personal itinerary. We were introduced to our guide Michiyo by email and immediately found her to be helpful and prompt to reply. Once we met Michiyo in person we saw that she was personable and comfortable to be with. Her English was excellent. Best of all, she was very knowledgeable about what we were seeing and taught us a lot about Japanese culture. Thanks to Michiyo we were able to overcome the fact that we didn't speak Japanese, learn from her how to use the subway system, and have a very personal introduction to a fascinating city. Judy W and Jule and Eric H

a great tokyo experience with kanae, our tour guide ;). as usual, when we go on a trip, i always plan our itinerary in a certain place, and we always succeed. however, Tokyo is very complicated because of the language barrier and signs. so, i checked tripadvisor to see which was the best tour guide companies in tokyo, and this one came out to be the best one from the reviews. and they actually exceeded our expectations. from the moment we planned our tour with emi, until the time we met our wonderful tour guide, kanae. she was great! she took us to the places we wanna go, according to our planned itinerary, and she also gave us a lot of tips and she took us to the "under the tourist radar" restaurants. it was an amazing experience for us, and we plan to have this company to be our tour guide again when we visit tokyo again. ariagatou gazaimasu kanae and emi!!!

Yuriko was great. We set up a tour with Yuriko from Travelience. They created a great itinerary based on our interests (off the beaten path), and Yuriko did a wonderful job. Her English was very good, and she was extraordinarily friendly and nice.

Underwhelming Tour of an Overwhelming City. At $65 per person for each tour, my wife and I did two group tours (tokyo traditions and heart of tokyo). I thought the tours were acceptable. Both days the group had about six people. The guide was a very friendly and sweet woman. She also happily took questions. Still, she had a low energy vibe and was hard to hear. She recited basic information about each site (sometimes furthering and referring to her handwritten notes). There was little in the way of interesting stories (historical or personal). She also didn't give a great deal of historical context. Sometimes she wasn't entirely confident which way exit a subway station or find the next attraction. Perhaps she is new at this. Her English was fine but she didn't have a colloquial command of the language. As for the sights: I'd scrape the Imperial Palace because you just stand in front of the entrance for twenty minutes. You don't see anything. It's anti-climatic. Of the tour tours, the Tokyo Traditions one was better because a lot of the other tour you could do on your own (e.g. fish market, gardens, standing outside the palace, etc..)

Wonderful tour with very thorough planning. We had the pleasure of doing the private tour with Keiko. We did a private tour because we have a 2 year old with us and it was one of the best decisions we've made during our trip to Japan! We got to plan out which stops/attractions we wanted to visit in Tokyo through the company. Keiko did a fantastic job planning our stops very thoroughly. Keiko was very friendly and planned everything so well, including bus times and how long each leg would take. She even went out of her way to plan other festivals or events that was going on in the area that we might be interested in going to. She went above and beyond what we expected from the tour. It was a trip of a lifetime in Japan for our family and booking this tour made our lives so much easier! Keiko was so helpful with the language barrier and helped us looked for different souvenirs and goodies I was looking for in Japan for family members. Lunch at the fish market was the best sushi I've ever had. The fish was so fresh because it was in the vicinity of the fish market. We've visited different shrines/temples around Tokyo as well. Keiko took us to a Japanese store that specializes in different Japanese nicknacks/souvenirs. She even went as far as to scope out the area that we wanted to explore because she had not been there before. That is GREAT planning on her part! I want to thank her for everything she did for us and how much easier she made our first trip to Tokyo! I will definitely recommend Travelience to our friends/family in the future for tours!

nice walking tour. I booked this tour for a Monday which is one of the days of their preset tours, so I did not have to book a custom tour. Miki met the three of us right on time and we found out no one else had signed up, so we had a private tour! She was very sweet and informative. We started at the Fish Market, which was fantastic, then walked back to the Hamariku Garden and had traditional green tea in their tea house. I did not even realize that I could see the garden from my hotel window until I returned! We went on to have lunch, saw the Imperial palace, and the Zojoji Temple. We opted not to go up the Tokyo tower, because we were exhausted. The tour is very informative, but a few things I should mention. We went to the Imperial palace, but could only walk to the outside and see the bridge. I felt that was not necessary and if had understood that we could not see more, perhaps we could have gone elsewhere. The tour involves a ton of walking and riding the subway, so if you cannot handle 6 hours of walking, opt for a bus tour. Miki did a great job in showing us how to use the subway because we needed to use it the rest of the time in Tokyo. The price was very reasonable and the tour well planned out. I also liked that is was just a small group. I would recommend this company if you want a good overview of Tokyo. If you want to see other areas, then book a custom tour.

Day tour. Had a fabulous day with Yakko. She was more then accommodating and very organized and informative. Was able to see more in 8 hours with her then you could fit in a week on your own. Especially if visiting Tokyo for the first timeHighly recommended

Well worth the money!. We only had one day in Tokyo, and stayed over in Narita for our connection through Japan. So we wanted to see as much as we could in a day. And we spoke no Japanese and never had been to Japan before... Keiko showed us around everywhere - Sensoji temple, Hamrikyu gardens, and Meiji shrine. She spoke excellent English, planned a full itinerary to fit this all in 6 hours (yes we are Americans), and never wilted in the 97F (36C) heat! She knew lots of facts about the sites we saw, and also squeezed in some time at the end to introduce us to shopping in Ginza and then leave us on our own. We couldn't have seen a fraction of what we saw without her. Well worth it, and a very enjoyable experience.

My first time visit to Japan. i have been to Tokyo for 1 week and it was a great experience for me., i really thank to Yumi ueda(yumi-san) she is such a great Tourist guide, She explained me each and everything in detail about the places i visited for ex: Sensoji temple, Hamiryku garden, Meiji shrine...i really recommend these places in Tokyo and please take a better camera for taking photos as these places are the best Tourist attraction

Average tour. This private tour was average. Our guide was very nice. He answered all of our questions. The tour both started and ended right on time. He accommodated our schedule so we could go to an ATM. We had little time to plan our trip to Tokyo, so getting a private guide and having the trip itinerary planned for us for the day was really really nice. A few things we enjoyed less about this tour, which is why we thought it to be average. The itinerary did not allow for any time to stop and enjoy the sights. We rushed through the Hamarikyu gardens and having traditional tea, several neat cemeteries, and a cool local shopping area. Perhaps this was because it was extremely hot on our tour day. Also, FYI, not only do you have to pay for your guide’s transportation fees (stated clearly on the website), but you also have to buy your guide's lunch and entrance fees. These latter fees were a surprise to us and not clearly stated on the website. I would recommend the tour company add these expenses into the cost of the tour and allow the guide to then purchase these things on behalf of the customer, and also add in some time to explore during the itinerary. Overall, our tour guide was very nice and all spots on our itinerary were visited efficiently and on time.

Best Experience in Tokyo. We had the best trip and best experience because of Akane's planning and Makoto's guiding. I cannot recommend them highly enough. Akane spent hours helping me plan our trip and Makoto was so flexible and just a wealth of information. He picked amazing restaurants for us (hidden gems) and really wanted to make sure our trip was the best. And it was! Thank you Akane and Makoto!!

Revealing Tokyo. I definitely recommend it. After some days stunned by Tokyo but barely scratching its surface due to the language barrier, it was a wonderful opportunity to have a deeper insight into Japanese culture. Michiyo spoke fluent English, gave me great cultural explanations about Japan and was a lovely companion. My choice was a day that included Harajuku and Akihabara to know more about the urban tribes that make those areas famous. The tour also included Meiji Jingu, taking the opportunity of the iris blossom. Excellent time.

Great way to experience Tokyo!. I originally booked 2 tours with Travelience. We enjoyed them so much I booked a third while we were still here. Private tours are the best way to go because they give you much more freedom over your time. You are never rushed to get back on the bus with the group. If you want to spend a little extra time picking out souvenirs, no problem. Our first two tours were with Kanae. She did a fantastic job explaining the different shrines and temples, painting a picture of what life was like hundreds of years ago. Additionally, she gave us great ideas on how to spend our free time in Tokyo. Our second tour guide was Makoto, and did a wonderful job taking us to Nikko and Edo Wonderland. I highly recommend Travelience, and you would be lucky to have either Kanae or Makoto as your guides.

An Incredible walking tour. The company was very accommodating to customize a tour to hit our must sees for Tokyo in one day. It was about 9 hours and involved subway travel and walking. The guide (Noriko) spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable and informed. There were only the 3 of us so we could spend as long or as little time at each venue as we desired. We would have missed out on a lot if we had not used this companies services. They are a bit pricey but clearly did deliver value for the money. Highly recommended.

Very pleasant way to tour Tokyo. Booked a day tour with Travelience to get a general feel for Tokyo our first full day in the city. Our tour guide, Yakko, was very pleasant and provided a great experience. Given that we visited Tokyo during the rainy season, the originally planned itinerary was modified a bit, but it turned out to be a good idea. However, Yakko consulted with us to make sure we were ok with changes. She answered all of our questions during the tour related to the sites we visited, plus general questions we had as to how to go about enjoying the city on our own after the tour. The pace of the tour was comfortable, but we were able to cover a lot. Highlight included visiting the temples in Asakusa, and taking part in an improvised summer tradition of eating noodles from a big bamboo shoot. Pretty cool and random! Plus the sushi we ate around the fish market was divine!! Great service, Yakko! Note - the cost of the tour basically includes the service of the guide. It does not cover subway fares, meals, price to visit attractions, etc. Seems that many of the tours in Tokyo operate the same way, given that we booked a different tour with a different provider. Tipping - based on everything I read, tipping is not required in Tokyo (and Japan for the most part). The cost of the tour takes into account salaries and tips, very different from the service industry in the US. We greatly enjoyed not having to tip everyone we came across in Tokyo, although you pay a bit more upfront for everything.

An excellent experience from start to finish. After researching travel guides companies and reading Trip Advisor reviews about Travelience, I made initial contact with the company. They were quick to respond and answered all my questions to my satisfaction. We settled on an itinerary with their help. Our assigned guide, Michiyo, met us at our hotel exactly as arranged, and the tour proceeded as planned. We expressed interest in learning how to navigate via city trains, and she explained them thoroughly. We expressed our interest in photography, and she pointed out excellent vantage points for photos.Michiyo is fluent with English, very knowledgable about the area's history and one feels comfortable and at-ease with her very quickly. I definitely recommend Travelience and Michiyo and would use their services again if ever in Tokyo.

Get a Tokyo guide it's worth it. Tokyo is a huge city with so many famous sites to visit. In the first 48 hours with our guide Yuriko we got to see so many things and visit so many places. There is no way my wife and I could have seen nearly anything close to that amount. It's like having a good friend in the city your visiting. They know exactly where to go and the quickest way to get there so you save so much time. She knew which subways to take, which streets to walk down and what areas and restaurants were a good place for my wife and me. She was always on time and so nice.Have you seen Tokyo's Subway and train map? It's very intimidating at first glance but with the help of Yuriko my wife and I were riding it on our own by the third day. We also had another tour guide Yakko for the fish market tour. She was a sweetheart too. She met us at 3 am and was incredibly energetic and caring even at that hour. She broughts portable chairs and snacks for our two and a half hour wait for the tuna auction and recommended us to a great sushi restaurant and knife shop at the fish market.Bottom line you'll see three to four times as much stuff and you'll have less to plan and less to worry about and more time to enjoy Tokyo with a guide from Travelience. The money is well worth it and I would recommend them for sure.

Yuriko was the best! . My husband and I visited Tokyo in April. It was a pleasure dealing with Emi during the scheduling and planning phase. Very easy to communicate with.We spent a day/night with Yuriko and experienced more than we would have ever imagined. She was flexible and understood what we were looking to experience in Tokyo. There is no way we would have managed to see and do all our "must sees" in one day, but with her help we did! She was extremely friendly, warm, caring, informative and most importantly fun! She went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed ourselves and receptive to what we were wanting to experience. She was a highlight of our trip and I highly recommend her as a guide. Thank you Yuriko!!

Perfect Overview Tour of Tokyo w/Michiyo - LOVED IT!. Perfect day with Michiyo! Money well spent with this tour group. We were a family of 4 from USA travelling with children, age 14 and 22. We had several days in Tokyo on our own, but wanted a day with a guide to show us some places and give us a deeper understanding of what we were seeing. Michiyo met us at our apartment rental and immediately we were at ease. Such a warm and caring person! I've been to many countries with private guides and I believe she is the best! So friendly, we felt like we were having a great day with a friend. She is smart, organized and speaks excellent English. She showed us shrines and temples, Japanese gardens and more, but all the time explaining the importance and giving us background information. We went to a great conveyor belt sushi restaurant where we had a lot of fun and my son had a pile of dishes at the end.. :) .and it is so inexpensive compared to US prices. When my daughter wanted to stop in a pet store to pet puppies or look in a music store, Michiyo was always kind and let us go at our own pace. Wonderful memories of this day. We went from the East side to the West side of Tokyo with her. There's no way you could be disappointed if you tour with her. Japan was great!!

Helpful, Pragmatic and Responsive.. Emi was responded to my initial email, subsequently, she was very patient, helpful and responsive to all my queries regarding the Private Tour; by follows her suggestion and advise, we did manage to visit the essentials of Tokyo in short time.Mr. Makoto was our tour guide, he is very friendly, knowledgeable and speak good English. Throughout the tour he brought us to eat some of the authentic Japanese meal and visited some places that solely known by the local people.

Wonderful 3 days in Tokyo...excellent guide. Hats off to Travelience...wonderful 3 days in Tokyo. We had opted for Yuriko for all 3 days and she was excellent. Our trip was carefully planned and executed. Planning was easy and Akane was very helpful in suggesting where and what to see and do. They were willing to accommodate our requests (like helping us exchange or JR rail pass and reserve seats of the train - not easy to do if its your first time visiting Japan) and request for certain food for lunch (ie Takoyaki, etc). Yuriko was fantastic. She was very friendly and knowledgeable. She was willing to accommodate last minute changes provided that it did not veer too far off-course. The tour uses mainly local train and foot power (ie walking), so be ready with good walking shoes. Overall, very satisfied with the tour package we came up with. Again, Yuriko made the tour great. Thanks

Fantastic Day in Tokyo. My dad and I had a wonderful experience on a private full-day walking tour with our guide, Noriko. She was knowledgeable, unfailingly polite, well organized, and very open about sharing her insight on life in Japan. For lunch, we had a wonderful time eating at a unique bullet train sushi restaurant at Noriko's suggestion.Throughout the tour, I really appreciated that Noriko had clearly taken the time to plan our itinerary carefully and accommodate our requests as much as possible. She clearly went above and beyond to ensure we were getting the most out of our tour while having fun along the way. Thank you, Noriko, for an excellent day in Tokyo!

Excellent Guide. Yakko was our tour guide for the day in Tokyo, she was very knowledgable and friendly, modified the itinerary to meet our requirements and was always smiling with a good sense of humour, highly recommended.

Perfection!. We had the most memorable two days with a Private tour guided by one of the most gracious, knowlegeable, patient, funny and accomodating guide: Yakko Hamabata. She was always on time with a big smile and a lot of enthusiasm ready to show us lots of interesting places in Tokyo. Tokyo is fabulous but Yakko made it even more special! Lovely lady and so easy going with a sense of humor also. Yakko was flexible with our needs and interests, and we were two families changing constantly the program.The moment I contacted Travelience, I knew I was dealing with a Professional Tour Company. We received quick responses with suggesting itineraries for us to choose. They even provided us with a picture of our guide (Yakko) and her e-mail, so Yakko could be in touch with us before the trip. I e-mailed Yakko explaining we were two families with a big interest about the history of Japan, especially Shogunate, the Emperors. She came so well prepared with a fascinating way of presenting to all of us the important facts of Japan, that we were all very satisfied with her creative way of telling us about the history of Japan. Loved Travelience! Excellent tour company!

Good agency, disappointing tour guide. In order to be fair in this review, I need to separate the tour agency from the tour guide.First, the agency: The experience of setting up the tour was excellent. Akane was on top of all of my plans and helped me plan a great tour plan. The payment process was straightforward, and all that was promised was delivered.Now about the guide.... I won't use the guide's name on purpose. The guide was very sweet lady. She tried really hard to be helpful and nice. However, we felt that she was completely unprepared as a guide. Her English was slightly better than basic. She continuously couldn't find the right English words. Her continuous mispronunciation of basic English words made it very difficult to understand her. I would be okay with her English if she would try to tell us something that wasn't just obvious. She provided practically no historical or outside perspectives. She would point at a building and say the name of the building. She wouldn't describe it, or explain its significance. She took us to the fish market at 11:00 AM (our tour started at 10:00 AM) even though the market closes down at 9:00 AM. We saw lots of empty dirty boxes instead of fish. If we were told of this by the agency, we would have started the tour earlier. The customer (me) isn't always right, especially if the customer doesn't know these nuances. :-)We would walk around the tourist sites and she would be totally quiet. We would have gotten more out of those provided taped tours, but we felt it would be impolite to rent them in front of her.My wife and I felt that we did not get our money's worth, and were all too glad when the tour was over. Though we paid for 10-hour tour, we asked to be taken back to our hotel after about 7 hours. She did mention that she was relatively new to the tour guide industry, but that was no excuse for being unprepared, in my opinion, as a tour guide.Final thoughts. I would recommend this agency, however, make sure that you request a guide that is either named in these reviews or someone with many years of guiding experience. If they cannot guarantee you a competent guide, go somewhere else.

Good tour despite very cold weather. Day was well spent with Makoto. We booked an 8 hour private tour to view the Tokyo Tower, Asakusa, Roponggi and Akihabara. Instead we went to Asakusa, where we had the BEST Ramen. (thank you Makoto, we conclude that Tokyo does make the better Ramen), , Ginza instead of Akihabara since Makoto suggested we might not want our young girls to see the "sexy" CosPlay costumes. Ended the day in Roponggi Hills. It was very cold and drizzling. We are glad we booked a private tour. We would not have gone to so many places otherwise.

Great private tour. I traveled to Japan for business and wanted to take a couple of extra days to see as much as possible and try the various foods. I emailed Travelience about setting up a tour. I got a reply from Emi very quickly, and she helped me set up 2 days of sightseeing with Makoto. Makoto is very easy going and informative. I would use them again and refer friends and family to them.

Private guides tour of Tokyo. We had such a splendid couple of days with our private guide in Tokyo, Makoto-san.Firstly, Emi-san did an amazing job of settling an itinerary and choosing a guide for us (family of 5 with three teenage boys). She was endlessly patient and helpful.On the first day tour we saw bonsai nurseries, Omiya bonsai museum, sightseeing in Shibuya (and lunch at the amazing automated Genki Sushi restaurant), Meiji Jingu Shrine, Harajuku sightseeing and woodblock print shopping. On the second day we went to Tsukiji fish market, Asukusa sightseeing ( Sensoji temple and Nakamise Street), and Ginza.Makoto-san was very attentive, informative and had a good sense of humour. He had a relaxed, yet professional style that was a perfect fit for Australian travellers like us. I do suspect he was not too fond of guiding our youngest teens (12 and 14 years old) so he is probably best suited for late teens and adults. We strongly recommend Travelience as a high quality touring company, and Makoto-san as a terrific guide.

Greatest Tour Guide. Prior to our tour on December 16, 2014, I was given the name and email address of our tour guide. This was a perfect opportunity to fine tune what we wanted to see on our "All Day City Tour of Tokyo". Yakko Hamabama, provided many ideas/suggestions for our tour. When we had questions, she answered them quickly and always made us understand that we were in charge of our time. This, all before we were even in Tokyo. This helped save precious time when we would actually be on our tour.When on our tour, Yakko provided all we needed or wanted during the Tour. She helped us understand the Trains and Metro services, which would come in handed the week following our tour. She pointed out areas that we might like to see, that we didn't have time to see in our 8 hour tour. And, she was available, via email, to help out if we had question after our tour. And, we did use her assistance after our tour to find a couple of areas that she suggested. She was there for us even after the tour. What Service.I recommend asking for Yakko Hamabata if you need a Tour Guide who loves her City, Knows her City and loves helping others enjoy her City. THANKS YAKKO!!

Great time in Tokyo. Our family's first time to Tokyo and we had a great, wonderful time. We decided to book for a private tour and settled with Travelience. Our guide, Noriko, was very nice, informative, and patient. She explained a lot of things on Japanese culture, traditions, and the places that we visited. We were very lucky we could experience local food, like okonomiyaki (pancake) and moving sushi restaurant. Our daughters were very happy to learn some Japanese words. My husband was very satisfied that he could visit the hobby stores in Nakano and Akihabara. Thank you Travelience and Noriko, for giving us a great Tokyo's experience.

A very personal tour of Tokyo. Ulreka met us very punctually and was a charming hostess and guide. She explained many of the curiosities for sale in both the tourist market and outer fish market. She found us a restaurant which offered both Japanese and quasi European food . During lunch she looked up all the particular pieces of information we needed both for our visit to Tokyo and Kyoto. Thanks to her advice we managed to use the Tokyo and Kyoto public transport systems. On our last day we returned to Tokyo and did all my Christmas shopping in Shinjo temple market and got tickets for one act of Kabuki theatre on fourth floor of theatre. Her day of information and learning really enhanced our whole visit to Japan. Thank you so much

INCREDIBLE!!!. We travelled the first week of October and booked with Emi for an all day tour of Tokyo. From the start Emi was so attentive via email and set up a tour with our exact desired activities. Once we arrived to Japan, TWO typhoons hit the country back to back. We changed our travel numerous times and each time Emi was able to re-arrainge our tour to o there days. She was so accommodating and understanding. When the day of the tour arrived, we met our guide Yuriko and had an amazing day visiting all the sights on our list including a super fun calligraphy lesson and a sushi lunch at an automated restaurant that was incredible fun. I highly recommend this company to anyone who wants a seamless, personalized and inclusive private tour. You will not be let down.

Great Start to our holiday. As this was our first visit to japan, my husband and I decided to book a tour. After reading TA Reviews we settled with Travelience. Emi, as everyone has already said, was so very helpful. We booked a half day tour that took us to Tsukiji Fish Market, Tokyo Tower, Asakusa & Sensoji Temple. We really didn't know what we wanted, and Emi provided us with an itinierary that helped us dip our toes into Tokyo. We arranged to meet Noriko at our hotel. Noriko was wonderful and we learnt so much that first afternoon. We were able to explore the markets, and had a sushi lunch which was thoroughly enjoyable. As we only had the afternoon, Noriko was mindful of the queues, and was very accommodating with what we wanted to see at the markets. She also explained lots of things about Japanese culture, and we feel we were able to experience the rest of our trip with some understanding due to her informative guiding. We would thoroughly recommend Travelience and especially Noriko and would love to do another, more comprehensive tour, if ever we are in Tokyo again.

Great job Makoto. I booked this tour company based upon TA recommendations. Emi did a splendid job with our reservations and we were able to pay on line. Our tour guide, Makoto was a wonderful, interesting, and knowledgeable gentlemen who guided us through the city. He showed us the sites from the best perspectives. We visited out of the way restaurants known only to the locals which meant avoiding the hour long lines at the touristy places. By soliciting our feedback, he would taylor to our interests and tastes. On top of all that, his photographic skills (judging from our pics) are to be commended. Makoto taught us so much about Japanese culture. Thank you!

Amazing time with Makoto!!. We had an amazing day in Tokyo thanks to Makoto.He took us to an authentic Ramen restaurant and we love it! Probably one of the best meals of the entire trip. All the tour was wonderful and we learn a lot about the city and japanese culture.Thanks Makoto!!!

Amazing 3 days in Tokyo. My wife and I booked a 3 day private tour with Emi Izawa of Travelience. The itinerary, which was quite flexible, was tailored to meet our wishes - less shopping and maximum exposure to the Japanese culture. The result was an amazing 3 day jaunt through the vast majority of Tokyo's neighborhoods, utilizing the metro system to a great extent. Our tour guides, Noriko (1st day) and Haruhi, were simply outstanding - knowledgeable and engaging. Not only did we tour numerous gardens, temples and markets, we learned a great deal about Japan's history, experienced neighborhood celebrations and dined at local establishments. We would love to return to Tokyo and would highly recommend checking out Emi at Travelience when planning a trip.

Makoto was fantastic!. We had wonderful full day tour with Makoto in early October. Tsukiji fish market was our first destination and it was a revelation. Makoto had arranged lunch at 1 of the sushi places around outside of market--not one of the big 2 inside which have huge waits and are over-priced. Probably 1 of the best meals of entire trip and 60 dollars Canadian-unbelievable bargain. We then embarked on highlights of Tokyo tour using metro and walking. Makoto's knowledge and his ability to communicate it were unsurpassed--he is enthusiastic and at the same time contemplative and unfailingly polite.

Fantastic 2 days with Yuka. I was travelling alone to Japan and chose to spend two days in Tokyo with Yuka.She was fun, enthusiastic and very knowledgeable about Japanese culture. We are a similar age and it was interesting to learn about the differences and similarities in our lives.I learnt such a tremendous amount from her and understood the significance of things that I would not have even noticed were it not for her guidance. She was flexible and adapted the tour to my interests. I feel like I had a real authentic experience and gained a friend. I would have no hesitation in recommending this company.I will return, this time with my husband, and would love to do a similar tour again.

Good correspondence prior to arrival - guide not great. I booked a private full day tour with Travelience for our first day in Tokyo. I corresponded with Emi before we arrived and she was fantastic. We didn’t request many specific sites (just a cat café and the Tsukiji Fish Market). Originally Emi scheduled the rest of the day in and around the Asakusa area. But on the day of the tour we requested something outside of this area since this is where we were staying and could explore it on our own. Our guide was very accommodating and instead took us to see more of the pop culture of Tokyo (electronics district, including touring around an entire department store of odd entertainment (to a Westerner that is), etc.).Generally it was a pretty good day and we appreciated the flexibility. I do feel our guide fell short on providing background on the areas we visited and their cultural significance and it felt more like he was just shuttling us to different places, rather than provided any “guidance” on what we were seeing. He also did the not-so-soft ask for a tip which left a bad taste in my mouth. I know that tipping is not customary in Japan, but this guide had spent a few years in the US, so perhaps this is why he felt comfortable with it. Given how expensive a private tour is (and that you have to cover the guide’s transportation costs, lunch and entrance fees) I was not happy about this. I also think (perhaps because we were somewhat close in age) that he was a little too casual about the whole day and the level of service provided. If in Tokyo again I will try a different tour provider.

Tokyo and round - Great tour company, best service, great people!. I started emailing Emi about three months before departure as I was taking my parents and wanted to make sure the tours were all perfect and suitable. I don't have enough words to describe Emi's helpfulness, patience, promptness and flexibility. She went well beyond her call of duty to answer all my questions and make several changes before we even got to Japan. Then whilst in Japan, she continued providing information, helping to make last minute changes and marvellously dealing with any issues. Next come Yuka and Yuriko. We took the 8 hour Tokyo tour and 10 hours Nikko tour with Yuka and the 10 hour tour to Mt. Fuji with Yuriko. Both Yuka and Yuriko were incredible calm, patient, caring, attentive, knowledgeable, informative and fun to be with. The Tokyo tour with Yuka included Asakusa, Ueno, Sensoji temple, Nakamise, River cruise, Hamarikyu garden, Meiji Shrine. Incredible places and without Yuka we wouldn't have found it so easy to travel around and learn as much as we did. Best thing was that she took it really easy without hurrying us so we could take it all in. She was also very patient whilst trying to locate a vegetarian restaurant for lunch! Yuka clearly loves Nikko as this tour although at first it seemed far, was wonderful. Not sure why people would want to skip Nikko, but I highly recommend it especially if you have a great guide! We walked a lot and Yuka covered every part peacefully and we all enjoyed getting on the Shinkyo Bridge as well. Truly a memorable day. It was sad to say bye to Yuka who helped me with other logistics as well and made some extra recommendations for our free day in Tokyo which we did explore (Food Hall in Isetan was unbelievable)!Next day we were promptly picked up by Yuriko with whom we went to the 5th Station on Mt. Fuji. We changed plan the day before as we were originally due to go to Hakone. Yuriko looked up the best and quickest routes and quickly changed the entire plan for us. I am SO glad we did what we did. The bus journey there was lovely and quick and Yuriko tried hard to get us to see whatever we wanted to despite the fact that we had a tight schedule so we did enjoy views of Lake Kawaguchiko before heading to the 5th Station where were able to view Mt. Fuji which was extraordinary (first through the clouds and fog and then the entire Mount)! Thanks to Yuriko we also managed to have some lovely vegetarian curry and noodles for lunch! Once back in Tokyo and off the bus, Yuriko added a visit to the Metropolitan Government Building Observation Deck from where you get to see skyline views of Tokyo that you see on postcards and photos. This was a great bonus as we wanted to go here anyway.All that remains for me to say is a massive thank you to Emi, Yuka, Yuriko and Travelience without whom we would not have seen and experienced as much of Tokyo and surroundings as we did making it a memorable trip - THANK YOU for EVERYTHING! And for all those who read this review, best way to see Tokyo!

The best way to see the highlights of Tokyo. My friends and I booked an 8 hour private tour with Makoto. He did a fabulous job! We covered Asakusa, Akihabara, Shibuya, Meiji Shrine, and Takeshita Shopping street. He did really well in providing the history lessons we didn't read up on in advance as well as answering all our questions on everything from where to eat out to how to take the subway or JR Line to various places. He was very personable and outgoing. I really appreciated that he allowed us to adjust the schedule as we went along and spend more time shopping. Thanks for taking us to the multi-level shopping mall in Akihabara...I love my fancy pens and Pocky! I think the highlight for all of us was a hidden gem for lunch. Tucked into a neighborhood, Makoto took us to an authentic Ramen noodle restaurant. There was a line out the door and no tourists. It was a great experience to sit at a counter with a bunch of locals eating some amazing ramen and watching the cooks make everything to order.We were short on a time in this trip so I'm glad we booked the tour. If you don't have time to plan or spend learning how to get around, this is a great option! We saw a lot and really enjoyed our time with Makoto.

A great introduction to Tokyo (and so much fun!). For our first trip to Japan (outside of Narita airport anyway), we booked a private tour for my family (me, husband, 5-year old, 2-year old, and my parents) for our first full day in Tokyo. We thought that this would be a good way for us to get to know a bit about the city and how it works before we explored on our own for the remainder of our trip...and we were not wrong! This tour was invaluable! From the very beginning, Emi was wonderful in arranging a custom tour for us; together we came up with a plan that could work with the kids' energy levels and typical meal schedules, and she was so patient in answering all my questions. Payment was super-easy via paypal. And our guide Yuka was amazing! She met us at our hotel and we spent a full day (8 hours) moving around the eastern part of the city, with her showing us how to navigate the subways and trains and giving tips for moving about the city, while giving us great details and insights into the past and present of Tokyo/Edo. She was so patient with the kids (and my parents!) and by the end of the day she felt like an old friend. We had such a fantastic time, and are convinced we would not have enjoyed Tokyo half so much if we hadn't done this tour our first day. Thanks to Yuka, we felt confident enough to explore the western part of the city as well as Odaiba in our remaining 3 days, even with 2 strollers and my not-so-young-anymore parents. Many, many thanks to Yuka and Emi for an excellent introduction to Tokyo -- we love the city, and will be back for sure (though, maybe we'll let the kids grow up a bit so they can walk for more than 10 minutes without getting tired!) :)

Want to see Tokyo, go with Travelience. I usually don't write reviews but I am compelled to write this one. Travelience is the company to go with if you want to explore Japan and Tokyo. It was a pleasure working with both Emi who put together a great 4 day itinerary for us, and the tour guide, Miki executed it to perfection. I would highly recommend this company.

Yusiko was brilliant!. Took private tour to Fish Markets, Tea House, River cruise & Temple. Considering my b .... Knee we went ok in spite of so many steps throughout. Yusiko was an outstanding guide & person. We would recommend the tour & her to anyone.

Fantastic Trends and Traditions tour with Makato. Myself, mother and 2 teenage daughters from Australia took the Trends and traditions tour with Makato. Another lady from Canada joined us and we had a fabulous day even though it was very hot and tiring. THe depature point was easy to find and our guide Makato was a lovely man with a great sense of humour. He was very knowledgeable and explained so much to us along the way. We saw so much of Tokyo and makato explained so many things to us that we never would have found on our own. He was patient with us ( especially with my mother who required lots of breaks) and showed us how to buy train tickets etc and travel around Tokyo. It was a fun and informative day. 6hrs inc quite a bit of walking but you can set your own pace.The highligh of our tour was going into a little place for lunch where you order your food on a screen and it arrives on a track in front of you. My girls loved it!! I would highly recommend it.

Thank You Yuka!. What a professional tour company! After we booked our 8 hour Tokyo tour we immediately heard from our tour guide, Yuka. We had an idea of what we wanted to use a tour guide for and what we wanted to see. What made it great was that Yuka advised us on how to make the most of our day. We wanted to do the Sky Tree first but she suggested to do it on our own the next day because we would wait at least an hour in line to get tickets. We ended up with this itinerary and couldn't have been more pleased.Asakusa - Senso-jiRiver CruiseHamarikyu garden and refreshing Matcha Tea breakCaretta Shiodome where we had lunch and a great viewMeiji ShrineAnd lastly a quick stop at Takeshita-dori in HarajukuEvery step of the way Yuka helped us learn the transit system, traditions and history of the places we visited.She gave us the confidence to navigate by ourselves for the next 2 days while in Tokyo.Thanks Yuka!!!

Excellent way to explore Tokyo. Everyone at Travelience was terrific! Akane immediately responded to my email inquiry and worked to arrange a two day tour for our family of four. We shared our various interests with her (manga, shopping, paper, cultural/historical sites) and she worked around our schedule needs to organize an informative and enjoyable two days with Yasuko and Makoto. Yasuko was our guide on the first full day. She shared information about the historic sites/temples, pointed out shops that would be of interest to us, and offered suggestions for restaurants and meals. We ended our day at the Tokyo tower, watching the lights come on and the sun set over the city! Beautiful! Makoto met us on day two and was most flexible and accommodating when we asked to change the schedule. He, like Yasuko, was full of information and wonderful conversation. It took us awhile to find Travelience, but we are happy we did! We highly recommend Yasuko, Makoto and Travelience!

unsurpassed. I was looking forward to a tour of Tokyo and Emi helped me plan an excellent night. But my flight was delayed several hours AND my mother had an emergency upon landing that was very unexpected. I was alone in Narita and exhausted. My guide, Yuriko, waited for me despite all these delays. She comforted me and was so kind, despite the complete change of plans. She helped me tremendously in my first few hours in Japan. The company as a whole came through for me in a big way, that I was not expecting. This is more than a tour company. It's like having a friend in Japan. Do not hesitate to book with them.

1-day in Tokyo and 1-day in Nikko. I contacted travelience tour last November for our 2-day pre-cruise stay in Tokyo this July. Naoaki (CEO of the company) responded to my email quickly within 24 hours and forwarded my request to Emi – the coordinator. Emi also promptly contacted me to customize our itineraries. She was always pleasant and helpful even I kept changing my mind regarding where we want to visit multiple times. I traveled with my son (17) and my daughter (12). Yuka was our guide for both days - one day in Tokyo and one day in Nikko.We all feel so blessed having Yuka to be our guide. She is very knowledgeable, courteous, and friendly. She not only teaches us about Japanese people and culture but also helps us to fulfill our individual wishes during the trip. Following here I will mention the highlights of our trip – don’t go into details.Day 1 – Asakusa sightseeing, Akihabara sightseeing, Shibuya sightseeing and lunch, Ghibli museum.  • Asakusa – Senso-ji temple: We had fortune reading and learned how to “cleanse” ourselves (clean hands and mouth with water) before getting into the temple to pray. We also tried fresh made bun cakes with red beans on the shopping street in front of the temple.• Akihabara – My son’s most favorite area. While waiting for my son went shopping, my daughter, Yuka, and I went to a coffee shop nearby to have a drink. I had iced green tea with honey jelly which was very good.• Shibuya – Yuka helps to take my son’s pictures while he was standing in the middle of the Shibuya crossing – that is one of his wishes to be there. After that, we went to a sushi restaurant where the order and delivery system are all automated. It is such a fun experience! In addition, the sushi was fresh, delicious, and cheap too :)• We had a bit of free time so that we went into an arcade nearby to have our daughter-mom photos and then had fun decorating them. And we went to a food fair by Shibuya train station, I had never seen so many well-prepared, well-decorated, colorful and delicious-looking food gathering in one place like this. (We love good food!). • Ghibli museum – because we are Ghibli studio fans. I reversed the tickets around 3 months in advance before we left to Japan. This is a small museum but it is worth seeing if you are Ghibli studio fan. We got some souvenirs from the gift shop but they are not cheap. Day 2 – Nikko – Shinkyo bridge and ToshoguWe had to wake up early on that day to catch an early 7am train from Tokyo to Nikko. We picked up breakfast at convenient stores in our hotel and also at the train station. That was a 2-hour train ride which we could see different sceneries - rural/forest areas. Toshogu shrine area is surrounded by green tall trees, waterfalls, and green moss with a spiritual atmosphere. The architecture is amazing. We also bought several different kinds of charm and souvenirs. For lunch, we had “tofu skin” lunch which is the area specialty. Then Yuka took us to a dragon painting gallery. Both of my children were able to customize their own paintings and the artist painted right in front of us. We went back to the hotel hot and sweaty after a long day walking in the hot and humid summer weather. However, we really appreciate Yuka being with us. We all love having her and miss her as a partner/friend in our trip. If we happen to be in Tokyo again, we will definitely ask for Yuka. Thanks so much making our trip wonderful and memorable :)

I didn't know I could get so much from the tours!. I landed in Tokyo with NOTHING PLANNED! I knew I was going to take tours but didn't have any until I looked at Tripadvisor and found Travelience. Emi matched me with and amazing tour guide, Makoto! He spoke perfect English and was so friendly, knew everything about the sites he took me to and the ones I suggested. He had a great plan and was flexible enough that we caught a local summer festival and improvised that event! I was glad we went because it also exposed him to a festival he had not been to before, so we both gained! He was always on time and kept us moving without being the least bit pushy. I'm so glad he made suggestions along the way. He not only taught me about the sights, but also the way Japanese people live and get around. He made my Tokyo stay much more profound for me and much more memorable. I'm so glad I called them and, while I'm sure the other guides are great, I'm glad I met Makoto, my new friend in Tokyo.

Introduction to Tokyo. Thanks to Travelience!Emi went beyond her duty helping me decide situations like airport transfers and other details of my trip. All our communication was excellent. Our guide was Yuka was our introduction to Tokyo. During the time we were together she enchanted us with comments and information, being able to adapt the itinerary to our needs.Super recommended!

Amazing tour!. Me and my husband booked this tour back on the 29the of March. It was our first trip to Tokyo and we are glad that booked this tour! Our tour guide was Miki, she was a great tour guide and very informative and helpful. She helped us with the metro system which turned out to be very simple. We visited Akasuka temple, nakamise shopping street, a mosque and miji shrine where we witnessed 2 weddings there which was amazing. We had lunch in shinjuku then went to Harajuku and finally to Shibiya to see hachiko status. We had a great time with so many information about japan's culture and traditions. I defiantly recommend this tour and Miki as a tour guide.Shaikha

A Tale of 2 Different Experiences. We booked this company only about a week before our trip, and Emi was very helpful with arranging it! We had 2 tours. One with Yuka and one with Michiyo. Yuka was 5 stars out of 5!Michiyo was 2 stars out of 5.Emi's planning was a 3.5 stars out of 5.I will preface my review that we were traveling with our 2 children ages 8 and 10, and my wife was finishing recovering from a sprained ankle. Emi knew this ahead of time, and we asked her to plan accordingly. We also had certain dietary constraints, but were able to eat at most restaurants as we could eat many types of fish, plain noodles, and a host of other items. I have been to Tokyo many times before, and the reason I hired a tour guide was to help us with direction, provide insight into the culture and lifestyle, and explain the significance of the different sights particularly to my children. Yuka was extraordinary! Michiyo was less than satisfactory...I have been on dozens of tours (both public and private) across the globe, and have almost always had fantastic experiences. Our experience may not be indicative of the experience others have, but I will share my experience.Yuka was wonderful! She ensured that the pace of the tour was appropriate for everybody. No one felt rushed, and although we skipped some of the items on the tour, she made sure that it was truly enjoyable for all of us. She shared with us stories of growing up in Japan, and discussed some of the unique political and cultural aspects of the country. She is a consummate professional with a passion for her country, a wonderful personality, and the flexibility to make changes as needed to ensure that everyone has a wonderful experience! My children can't say enough about their experience with her!Michiyo was clearly hoping to be somewhere else (not with my family), and by 3:45 PM or so, I told her she could just go home. We didn't learn very much about Japan (usually tour guides like to fill the empty time with stories and history). We felt very rushed, and my wife was unable to take all the pictures she wanted. Then we were taken to a hole in the wall vegan restaurant that looked like it was straight out of the 1970's. The walk to get to this "paradise" restaurant was very long up many hills (my wife had a fractured leg and we had 2 kids- both of which you knew ahead of time), with Michiya always being way ahead of us and we felt like a huge burden to her, and when we arrived there was no air conditioning, and the food choices were not kid friendly at all. Michiyo got lost, and didn't have any information about this restaurant so we could make an informed decision about whether it was the right choice for our family. She just said this is where we're going. Finally, we left and took 2 taxis to Shibuya to a normal restaurant where we had lunch. She dropped us off at the Sky Tree after recommending that we skip the Imperial Palace (we didn't want to slow her down or inconvenience her so we skipped it), and she told us where to wait and to take a taxi back to the hotel. She very graciously agreed to write down the name of our hotel in Japanese, although didn't include the address for the taxi driver which made things a bit confusing. We saw many people skipping the line at the SkyTree but that was never an option for us as we didn't get web tickets, which could have been arranged ahead of time (it was a busy Sunday evening with over an hour of waiting).
