The weather with Michiyo was perfect, yet she managed to make it an unpleasant tour.With Yuka it was rainy and overcast, yet she managed to provide us with a true first class experience, tailoring the trip to exactly what my kids needed, walking with us NOT ahead of us like Michiyo, relating to my children, and telling us stories and bits and pieces of the culture. As the success of a tour is so dependent on a good tour guide, I highly recommend the Gray Line group tour which is cheaper, and we also took (a different tour), which has fantastic guides.

Wonderful day in Tokyo. Our tour guide for the day was Masako, and she took excellent care of us! We worked with her to tailor our visit for our specific interests and she offered many helpful suggestions. She made it easy to travel around Tokyo on the metro and we spent just enough time at each attraction. At the end of the day, she showed us the best place to eat and catch the metro back to our hotel. We had a fabulous time with her!

Amazing 2 Days in Toyko!. Can't say enough about our experience with Travelience. Emi helped me arrange the details of our 2-day tour and she coordinated with our tour guide, Makado. We had a marvelous experience from the initial booking with Emi, to meeting Makado, our guide at the hotel and the 2 days we spent with him. He was fun, funny, interesting, flexible, willing to adjust the schedule to accommodate our interests and needs. He suggested altering one item on the itinerary when we realized it would be raining for part of the day. His suggestion turned out to be just what our family enjoyed. He is great working with families and kids and I could see how pleased he was when we were obviously having a fun time. I would highly recommend using Travelience and Emi to help book your trip, she answered all my questions and even suggested some travel items like how we could best get from the airport to our hotel and where to exchange currency. Little things like that made us feel comfortable as we started the trip and relaxed during the entire tour. Thank you!

2 days trip in Tokyo. I had so much fun in Tokyo! I was taking 2 days private tour in Tokyo on June 23rd & 25th. Emi was a great help when you tried to make plans for your day trips. She's lovable as i changed itinerary a lot in our scheduled plan, she always making fast replies to your emails and patient in answering all things that i need to know such as weather or even clothes you need to bring! Just ask her anything, she'll be gladly to answer and i made changes in last minutes like a drop-off by our hotel and it was manageable! Luv ya Emi, thank you so much for your kind understanding!!!! I have this customized tour as i went to Tokyo with my son (11 y/o) and we met Yuka san as our tour guide. She's great to be with!!! we went to Ueno park, visited asakusa temple where i got this my lucky good fortune and even have plenty of time to visit Miraikan science center and Odaiba to take a pic with Gundam robot with the monorail. Travel with Yuka became a shopping tour as i had long list of souvenir to buy, and Yuka was very helpful to try to help me to find out where we could buy all those things. She's great, i felt like i met an old friend of mine and we had so much fun together!!!!! Using trains and subways was so much fun and turned out we didnt need to worry as they had many signs or announcement made in english, just try to remember where you should get off! Then we went to Meiji jingu, takeshita dori, shibuya crossing, imperial palace, akb48 cafe, and we too had our luck to go up to Tokyo Skytree Tower without so much fuss and long waiting line! Yuka was our lucky charm ^_^ i definetely will book again with them when i travel to Tokyo again! Can't wait!!!! Thank you so much guys for your great effort!

Fantastic tours for my family with kids!. Emi helped me book two tours, one to Hakone and the next a city tour of Tokyo for myself, wife and 2 sons (11,12). Michiyo was our guide and I cannot recommend her highly enough! She was informative, spoke great English, was flexible to our needs, and was absolutely fantastic with the kids. We went to spectacular open air museum in Hakone, and saw the peak of mt Fuji on our tour! The tour of Tokyo was awesome, learning history and customs of the temples, best sushi I have ever had in my life, and wonderful experience in the shopping district of Ginza. Great, affordable company, but Michiyo made the difference, she was awesome and I will tell everyone I know going to Tokyo to use her for a guide! Thanks Travelience!

A wonderful day in Kamakura. My family and I spent a day in Kamakura with Emi's arrangement. My tour guide, Miki, was just simply the best. She is very informative and knowledgable about the Japan's history. We really had fun on that day, especially my daughter. My daughter said that she knew more about the history from Miki. Miki is very kind and helpful. Moreover, she can get along with teens very well.I must say that all stunning views are located in Kamakura - the Great Buddha, the great hydrangea hill, and the stunning bamboo garden with great matcha green tea and a great guide.

Outstanding private tour. I had to be in Tokyo for business and managed to stay 5 more days to visit the city and some other places nearby. I booked a private tour at Travelience. Emi was very helpful in setting up my itineraries and keeping me updated of any changes. I visited Kamakura, Nikko, Hakone and Tokyo with 3 different guides: Miki, Yuriko and Yuka. They were all very nice and knowledgable guides. Even though the rainy season started and the weather was bad for a couple of days, I really enjoyed my trip and they helped me make the most out of these 5 days. As a side note: I am gluten intolerant, which is not obvious in Japan, but they made every effort to make it possible for me to taste some delicious local dishes. I would definitely recommend this company!

Heart of Tokyo. We had a group of 4 on our first trip to Tokyo. Emi at Travelience was very helpful in setting up our itinerary + got us tickets to see the Giants baseball game at the Tokyo Dome.We met our guide Yuka at our hotel and started our adventure...Throughout the day, Yuka gave us insights and managed to lead us through the trains, crowds, etc to maximize our time and experienceFirst, we went to Asakusa and saw the Sensoji Temple...Yuka was very helpful in explaining the significance of the temple and the shopping area around the temple...We saw the Tsukiji Fish Market and Yuka guided us to 2 different local places to eat----a sushi place for our 2 sushi-lovers, and a ramen place for the 2 non-sushi-lovers....The ramen place was very unique and very good, as was the sushi....We then went to the Hamarikyu gardens and had matcha tea in the teahouse....Yuka was very helpful in explaining the tea traditions...Tokyo Tower was next and we went to the top, of course, and Yuka showed us all the local highlights....Finally, we were dropped off at the Tokyo Dome and we went to our first Japanese baseball game.....This was the highlight of the day....It is like a combination of soccer, football, basketball with a baseball game being played....The cheers are non-stop---every player has their own, unique cheer and ALL of the fans know the words, gestures, etc....The cheers also come with drums and horns.......To summarize, we had a very full day and a great experience...We definitely could not have accomplished all of this on our own....The money spent was a very good investment...

Very enjoyable day. My husband and I spent our first day in Tokyo with Yuriko two weeks ago. She was a fun and knowledgable guide. I would recommend this company which wasn't expensive but added immeasurably to our enjoyment of our time in Tokyo.

Great tour in Japan with Mikiko. We booked a last minute tour with Travelience during Golden Week. They were able to fit us in, and worked with us to see the maximum amount of Tokyo in our minimal time. The major help was that Mikiko picked us up at our hotel and took us to the train station, where we booked all our train journeys for the week on our Japan Rail Pass. That was worth the tour price alone. We also saw the outer fish market on a special holiday where they had 1/2 price sushi. We went to where the locals went and got great sushi for good value, and saw the show of the sushi chefs preparing and greeting visitors. In addition, we went to a park and had a tea ceremony with machi tea and sweets and saw the Imperial Gardens, and some other sights. We appreciated not getting lost, as happened to us on our arrival and when we got back near our hotel without our wonderful guide.

Trends and temples… do it :). We joined the walking tour " trends and temples" and had an amazing time. Yuka did a great job, gave us some special insight in japanese habits, showed us some funny trends (like the photobox, you have to do this, you will get extraordinary pictures; -), gave good portioned explainations for cultural buildings (e.g. meji shrine), found a vegan place for lunch and was impressively creative by readjusting the tour to our needs (cause we already saw a few things on the list) .

Great way to get to know Tokyo. My wife and I had the pleasure of spending 2 days with Michiyo and 1 day with Haruki during a recent trip to Tokyo. Both were friendly, knowledgeable, flexible guides who understood and spoke English very well. The recommended sites, with changes made readily according to our interests and timetable, were outstanding. Some of these included the Tokyo fish market with a stop for an outstanding sushi lunch, a tea ceremony at the beautiful Happo-en, Imperial Palace and gardens, Ginza, Asakusa, and Takeshita shopping/sightseeing, the Tokyo Skytree observatory, several interesting temples, shrines, and beautiful gardens. We also gained considerable insight into Japanese history, culture, and customs. We would not hesitate to use Travelience again.

Great introduction to Tokyo. We booked a full-day private tour of Tokyo, and it was very much worthwhile. Makoto was easy to talk with and knew his way around. He was at our hotel right on time on the appointed day, and sent a couple of e-mails to confirm in advance. He gave us a lot of insight into the temples we were to see and some of the underlying history and cultural background. He helped us get acquainted with using the subway and also made short work of purchasing our train tickets from Tokyo to Kyoto; we could have done this, but it was much quicker and easier with his help and good to get the task out of the way. It was fun walking around the Asakusa area and having him identify all of the treats we might want to try. He also made some recommendations of other things we might want to do during our trip. Makoto has a college degree from a U.S. university and spoke excellent English. Before the trip, Emi was very responsive and accommodating with customizing our itinerary. I would recommend Travelience without hesitation.

Outstanding tour of Tokyo. My wife and I took a half day Tokyo tour and loved every moment of it. Our Guide, Yuka Yoshida was amazing. She was very knowledgeable and gave us very interesting background of all the sites we visited. Travelling with her from point A to point B using very complicated subway and tram lines made the trip very enjoyable and trouble-free. Her help at the automated sushi restaurant was much appreciated and the food was outstanding as well. Most importantly she gave us a glimpse into Tokyo’s life from a local point of view. Overall we would give A+ to all the planning and attention to the details that we received during our tour and would highly recommend Travelience to anyone who plans to enjoy Japan. Happy travelling and ask for Yuka as a guide, you won’t be disappointed.

Walking Tour of Tokyo. My family of 8 adults and a toddler enjoyed this tour very much. Thanks to Yuriko who was a very pleasant lady who spoke good English and was very patient and to Emi who helped to organize the itinerary for us. It was a very good tour for us to learn how to get around Tokyo in a relaxing manner.We will not hesitate to use Travelience again when we go to Japan again!

Outstanding Tour Guides in Tokyo. We took three tours with Travelience on our trip to Tokyo. They were amazing from start to finish. We submitted a request online, and Emi replied right away. Our first tour was with Yuka and she took us to Hakone including the Open Air Museum, the cable car to Owakudani (where we ate black hard boiled eggs cooked in the hot springs), and a had a pirate boat ride. She was super friendly, and helpful and even helped us buy the train tickets to Kyoto that we needed for the end of the week, in addition to organizing an amazing day at Hokene for us. She was terrific with the kids, and had everything perfectly timed to catch the next mode of transportation.Next, Kaz brought us to ninja training on the second day. She was very knowledgable and told us about the ninja family that did the training. The ninja training was truly amazing, and fun; the sensei was very patient with the kids and was able to teach at a level that worked for both the kids and the adult in our group who did the training. It was a once in a lifetime opportunity for children and adults, and included real weapons (but definitely safe; you train with rubber ones first)--we really felt like this was an authentic experience, not an activity for generic tourists. It was the favorite thing our kids did especially since they study karate, and definitely was not "commercial" in any way. We can't recommend it enough!Lastly, on the third day Miki took us around Tokyo, including Asakusa for a boat ride to Hamarikyu (where we had tea in a beautiful tea house), a visit to Tsukiji (with pottery shopping and a fabulous sushi lunch), and shopping for a spy camera in Akihabara. It was action-packed, but still worked great with the kids (who didn't mind walking).We highly recommend all three tour guides and this company! This was a truly amazing experience in every respect!

Travelience for Tokyo tour. We used this service for a tour of Tokyo. Our guide Naoki met us at the ship terminal and gave us a very comprehensive tour of Tokyo. Her English was excellent and she tried to satisfy everything we asked for. It was a wonderful day. We used local transportation and did alot of walking. Our communication before the tour with the agency was excellent. The response to my questions were quick and informative. If you want a city tour that is personal , informative and fun try this agency.

Excellent Tour of Tokyo. Masako was an exceptionally knowledgable tour guide. She went above and beyond to ensure that we got the history of the sights we saw, but also interesting little facts that some locals on the tour didn't even know. Thank you for a wonderful day, Masako!!!!Lauren and Adam

Enlightening experience. I had organised a private tour from Australia prior to departure and was pleased from my original enquiry through to the email I received from Masako introducing herself to the tour itself. It was under difficult circumstances with a very weary family that we set off with Masako and took in Shinjuku, Harajuku, Shibuya and Asakusa. Masako took us to a great Ramen restaurant that we would never have found, took time to answer my many questions, explained about the different architecture, showed us how to use the train system both under and over ground and was very in tune with our requirements not her own agenda. Thanks to this we found getting around Tokyo very easy and enjoyable. Highly recommend Masako as a tour guide.
Great Experience. We enjoyed our guided day tour so much with Miki that we asked her to guide us for a second day. We strongly recommend Miki and Travelience; she was great with our 4 year old child.

Excellent Muslim Guided Tour~. I first saw the good reviews in Tripadvisor which prompted me to book a 1 day Muslim guided tour with Travelience. Boy, i was glad we made the reservation! There were 8 of us in a family and since it was mostly our first time in Japan, we really enjoyed the tour. - Prompt communication through email, checked. - Fabulous & considerate guide (Both Yuka & Nao-san are very good English speakers), checked. - Smooth & timely execution of tour on the day, checked.- Everyone had fun, checked.- Great value for money, checked.- Local experience (What's different between normal tour with ours is that Travelience customized our itinerary to include a visit to (& a chance to pray at) a beautiful Mosque & Halal Japanese style sumiyaki lunch in roppongi.), checked. We were also lucky because we've been chosen to be filmed for a documentary clips for Japan Tourist. My family were ecstatic and love the experience! All thanks to Travelience!Definitely recommended for a big group of family or friends like us. (^_^).

Wonderful tours.. In a nutshell- Masako was fantastic, and we would never have seen as much of Tokyo and hakone without her. My husband and I  did two tours with her - a tour of Tokyo highlights and the next day, a trip to Hakone. Pro- 1. TRANSIT: Tokyo is not the easiest system to navigate. We have been all over Europe and just came from China, and from our experience, Tokyo had the least chance of running into someone that spoke English, even in touristy areas and restaurants. Masako helped us navigate the subway system, ask about tickets, helped arrange transit, all of which would be extremely difficult without her.  Once you learn the system, you will realize that Tokyo is very efficient and its transit system is far more advanced and easy to use than NYC where we live, but it does require a few days to get used to, which I am guessing most people do not have. 2. Cultural and historical information - Masako taught us so much about the history and background of many of the places we visited, and offered much insight into the day to day lives of the people that live here.  3.  Customized to what you want to see. The benefits of going with a private tour guide vs tour group is being able to see what you want to see. If something piques your interest, they can add it to the trip. 4. Also masako herself was extremely sweet. She even brought coffee and cakes in case we were hungry. Cons:Not really much, except that it is expensive. We paid about 300 usd for the Tokyo trip and 500 for Hakone. This does not pay for metro and train tickets, entrance fees, or food (needless to say)Overall great experience, if you don't mind the expense. But then again, what isn't expensive in Tokyo!

good overview of Tokyo. We visited Tokyo for 4 days in October and greatly enjoyed the "Discover the Heart of Tokyo" tour offered by Travelience. Our tour involved lots of walking, and combined with the subway and boat ride, we were able to cover much of the city. The tour included several temples, a boat ride, a Japanese garden (Hamarikyu) and teahouse (the highlight of the trip), and the imperial palace grounds. Lunch at the sushi resto in Tsukiji market was a great value. We learned a lot about Japanese history, culture, and customs, and found the info on temples particularly useful for the rest of our Japan trip. Masako, our tour guide, was a Tokyo native and very knowledgeable about the city and helpful in recommending things to do after the tour. The only downside was the rainy weather. This probably contributed to the fact that we were the only people taking this group tour that day, but on the plus side, this meant we basically got our own personalized tour.

Highly recommended. We took two tours with Travelience: Discover the Heart of Tokyo with Michiyo and Tokyo Traditions and Trends with Masako. Both tours were very good. We are especially grateful for the second tour, Tokyo Traditions and Trends with Masako and partially with Naoaki (the CEO of the company). We were the only two people for this tour and they had not canceled it, so we basically got a private tour for just two of us. Moreover, both Naoaki and Masako went well beyond of their duties and time to help us to buy tickets for the bullet train and reserve seats. It was extremely helpful. Thank you very much to both of you.

Terrific introduction to Japan. We completed two small group tours with Michiyo, one of the best guides we have ever had, any place. We did both full-day Tokyo tours, and in the process discussed many aspects of Japanese culture, manners, and politics as well as the sights we were seeing. Thereafter we traveled for nearly a month in Japan, often being reminded of things that Michiyo clued us into. Highly recommended, and we are experienced and picky travelers! Value is excellent as well, and Nao, the owner, was just great at telling us what we needed to know as far as getting to the site, getting to our hotel from the airport, etc.

Good introduction to modern Tokyo. I initially registered for the Heart of Tokyo tour, but I arrived 10 minutes late because I couldn't find the meeting spot. I already gave up thinking the tour already left without me, but somehow I saw a group of people waiting and figured that they could be on the tour. And lo and behold they were. I guess the schedule changed because they put me down for just Asakusa tour. I was thankful they waited for me because I thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Those hot and fresh off the machine mini anpans (bun filled with red beans) were delicious. Since I enjoyed the morning tour so much, I decided to stay for the afternoon tour of Trends of Tokyo. I was looking forward to Heart of Tokyo tour because I wanted to go to Tsukiji fish market. But, they only do one of the afternoon tours per day, so I decided to go along with it. And I'm glad I did. They took us to Genki, an unusual sushi restaurant where you order from a screen and they shuttle the food to you on a conveyer belt. Almost like a futuristic restaurant. I had lots of fun ordering sushi, even though I don't really like it. I wouldn't have found this place or known how to order if I was on my own. Michiya was very warm and friendly and knows her city very well. She was very helpful in telling me which restaurant has good, reasonable priced sushi at Tsukiji market and recommended some dishes. The drawback to this tour was that we spent too much time for lunch, so it shortened the time for the remainder of the tour. We only spent less then five minutes on Takeshita Street which had some interesting shops because of the lack of time. But I went back to Takeshita street on my own anyways. Overall, I would recommend this tour because they do take you to the must see sites. I just wish the Michiyo wouldn't have rushed the last half of the tour and maybe extended it 15-30 minutes more.

Very fun and memorable tour of Tokyo. My wife and I had a great experience with the Travelience Tokyo tour. Before the tour, I emailed them some questions about good places to eat in Tokyo, and Naoaki quickly responded with many great and thoughtful suggestions.When we arrived at the meeting place, we met Naoaki and our tour guide Masako. They were both very friendly and had a great positive attitude and energy.We can't say enough nice things about Masako! She was such a great tour guide! She is very passionate about her job and obviously loves what she does, which made it so much fun to explore Tokyo with her. She was also very knowledgeable about Japanese history and culture, and had so many great suggestions for places to visit in Tokyo. She made us wish our trip was a month instead of only 10 days, because she had so many great suggestions we won't be able to do them all (but we will do as many as we can!).From the moment you meet her, it is very clear that Masako cares a lot about her customers and wants them to have a great, positive experience of Tokyo. She even spent a lot of extra time with us, which was so thoughtful. Our tour was only scheduled until 4:00, but she kept showing us around until a little after 5. Thank you so much Masako!We hope we will be back to Japan soon, and when we do we're really looking forward to another tour with you!-Zach and Daphne

Very knowledgable guide and interesting tour overall. Our tour guide on the heart of Tokyo tour was amazing! She was very knowledgable about Tokyo, answered all of our questions and was also very funny.Highlights would definitly be a tea tasting and sushi lunch at the fish market! Defs recommend!

Very helpful and knowledgeable tour guide. Michiyo was a very helpful and knowledgeable guide who gave us a valuable tour of the City and a proper local experience (taking us to the fish market, explaining local religious customs, etc.). She even went so far as to help me book my trip to Mount Fuji, including some reasonably complex logistics (all after our tour had finished). Highly recommend the tour as a good primer to the City. Travelience is a relatively new player in the business, and they definitely have an eagerness to please, which makes for a pleasant tour. Michiyo has been a tour guide for well over a year, and clearly knew her stuff.

Awesome time. I went on the cultural tour with my brother. With our luck it even ended up being just the two of us! We had Michiyo and Naoaki (temporarily) as our guides. I had talked to Naoaki before the tour started and told him that I had already been on an Asakusa tour so he shifted the schedule and replaced it with a tour through Koppabashi dori. Awesome! We checked out quite a lot of stuff there and then made our way to Ryugoku (the sumo area). We ate at a sumo restaurant which was truly fantastic! Next we headed to the Edo-Tokyo museum and Michiyo provided us with all sorts of cool facts. Then we went to the Sumo museum and check out some Sumo history!Next stop was Akihabara. Michiyo took us to some very interesting stores and showed us some secret passageways throughout the ward. She finally dropped us off at Kobayashi Camera (a super electronic department store) and we said our good byes.This tour was truly fantastic and I highly recommend you to use Travelience!And to top if all off, Naoaki even suggested some extra things to check out when we had time such as the Robot Restaurant and the Ninja Asakasa Restaurant. He even went out of his way to set up a reservation for us. Truly great service! I know that the next time I am in Japan, I will definitely use their tours again!

Lovelly time in Tokyo. I would like to share my experience with Travelience during my stay in Tokyo.I had lovely days with Yuriko and Masako (my guides), they are very nice persons and very friendly. I really appreciate them. I spent two entire days with them and I really enjoyed every minute. They have very good knowledge about the place we visited as well as they explained me everything in details.Everything was fine and I really appreciate drinking cold green tea in a traditional tea house overlooking a lake in Tokyo. I went to Asakusa, Ueno, Yanaka, Kappabashi, Ryogoku, Edo and Akihabara, they are very nice places to go.I have been travelling a lot and I always use local guides as it is the best way to understand the local culture.I am sure I will be back to Japan.

Fantastic Customer Service - Travelience Style!. Michiyo and Hana were my guides. Greeted by them at my hotel lobby. They were very courteous and excited to host the tour for me.Went to the various attractions. Michiyo helped me with the train rides and tickets, and was giving very good advise along the way.It was a really hot day in Tokyo. It was the first day of the heat spell. The thing that amazed me most is how kind and helpful the guides were. I was sweating, and Michiyo offered an extra face towel and a Japanese hand-fan for me. That was really thoughtful and kind of her.At the end of the tour, was even introduced to Naoaki, the CEO of Travelience, and Naoaki brought me to a nice pub for a cooling drink after a hot day, and we discussed on the tour experience and asked me how they can improve further.To me, everything was already perfect. Its really value for money. Will definitely return to Tokyo for another tour with them.Well done Travelience!

Totally amazing. Everything in the tour is completely amazing, because besides the others tours, this one makes you feel like you were a real Japanese. By giving you detailed explanations about everything in your surroundings, having a friendly tour guide that get along with the group which also can answer any question without any problem.This and a lot of others points I highly recommend it to everyone

Very nice tour at Asakusa Temple. We had a very nice guided tour at Asakusa Temple. The Tour was very interesting and the tour guide was taking all her time and knowledge to introduce and explain all the traditional meanings plus showing us those interesting stalls to buy souvenirs and handmade arts. Thanks for the nice time!

Thank you travelience. On may 20th, it was rainy but thanks to Travelience team's smiles, my day started the best way possible. I could enjoy the Asakusa Walking Tour lead by Yuriko-san, her interesting explanations and demonstrations too. I learned about Japanese beliefs and religions, about traditional souvenirs and snacks as well, and could appreciate this wonderful district which is Asakusa. Even under the rain, the temple and the shrine were still wonderful, and because I've been taught their history, it gave another dimension to my visit so that I could enjoy it even more. Thank you travelience, Nao and Yuriko.Vola

“Great tours”. We went to Tokyo this April 2013. First we did not have any paid “common” tour but because of the recommendation of one friend we paid this “friendly” tour. The tours are really good; we discovered places that normally in the “common tours” are not listed. My wife and me spent two days with tours and were really nice. The personal attention is excellent. The size of the groups are also good, because I believe that smaller groups can be more flexible in order to change some listed places to see or to spend more time in some others.Also we received advice of things to do in Tokyo, where to buy, what to do at night. To resume, is like if you were talking with a friend in Tokyo and he helped in everything you need.

Excellent Tokyo Tour. I truly enjoyed this tour. I gained understanding about Japanese culture, especially tea ceremony. I also enjoyed the sushi at Tsukiji Market. Michiyo was also very professional in explaining the different places of interest. I highly recommend this tour as I can try public transportation and experience real Japan. A pity I didn't try the foodie tour. Will definitely try the foodie tour in future. Hmmm.... It's amazing to know that the term "foodie" is also used outside Singapore.

These tours are fantastic!. I and two of my friends were invited on the free tour of Sensoji temple, and am I glad we said yes! The guides were very friendly and knowledgeable, and were willing to answer even the smallest of questions. They wanted you to get right in the action and to really enjoy yourself while you were there. Because of this great atmosphere, when they invited us on the 'Foodie' tour right after, we said yes without any hesitation. It was another good choice - the money you pay for the tour goes right to the food they buy, and they ended up taking us down to a beautiful spot under the cherry blossoms over looking the river. There were some good laughs, too - the best part of the tours was being able to just chat with someone who actually lives in Japan; you can get a different perspective of life in the area that way. Above all, I would recommend these tours to anyone. They were the highlight of my trip to Tokyo.

Free Asakusa tour and Foodie tasting. We have stubled upen the webiste and decided to join the free Asakusa our offered by Travelience. It was a one hour tour that provided some useful insights into the shrines and temples, the different customs and rituals. After this tour we were offered to join a foodie tour/tasting an thought why not. We picked up 6 different meals and headed to the riverside where we had a picnic and shared the meals we picked up on the way. It was a great experience as we got to try different Japnese food daily eaten by the locals. Highly recommended!

My Travelience tour was informative, professional, and most important of all, fun!. I traveled solo to Tokyo in March and went on two tours with travelience. I was going to just do one tour but I had such a great time I decided to go on another the next day. The tour guides are knowledgeable and take you to the top attractions around the city. I leaned and experienced much more then I would on my own. Everyone was very professional and focused on the happiness of the customer. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Tokyo!
Blessed in Asakusa. A great half day tour capturing the major shrines and temples and showing the many faces of old and new Asakusa

A wonderful time with Travelience. I arrived alone in Tokyo and it can be quite impressive to deal with this city. I heard about Travelience prior to my visit throught a friend and I contacted them. The guide was friendly, polite and show me around the major sights in Tokyo. This was the perfect start to discover Japan in a safe environment.Thanks again!

Perfect start on our 8 days stay in Tokyo, to have a personal guide. Me and my girlfriend have never been fantastic Tokyo. We contacted Travelience to show us a part of Tokyo on our first day in Japan. Our personal guide Nao guided us around the crazy and wonderfull Tokyo. Thats was a perfect start on our 8 days stay in Tokyo. I really recommend to contact Travelience, if you plan to go to Tokyo, and ask for Nao.

Great tour with Kazuki!!. We chose the hour and a half tour around Asakusa, and it was great. Saw the sights, learned some new things, visited temples/shrines etc. Best of all, Kazuki our rickshaw driver was awesome. Super friendly and just fun to be around. Definitely recommend if you're in the area!!

Great Rickshaw Tour With Ryo. My wife and I went on the tour this morning based on the strong recommendation of Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The Ebisuya Asakusa people were waiting for us at the designated meeting place with a sign with our names on it. Our Rickshaw Driver and Tour Guide Ryo S was very personable and knowledgeable and his English was excellent. It was like taking a tour with someone we had known for a long time even though we had just met him this morning. He took multiple pictures of us with different backdrops that we can share with friends and family. The equipment was very comfortable and Ryo took great care to be sure we got in and out safely. It was sunny but cool, so the blanket they provided for our legs was perfect. Now we know why the tour was so highly recommended and are glad to recommend it to others.
Cultural. We enjoyed drifting through and enjoying the tradition of this culture. You can take your time walking through the crowds and enjoying sweet deserts from the multiple vendors present.
Recommended tour in Asakusa. Driver 慎太郎 is great and always carries a smily face. He is funny. And he has a lot of great ideas taking beautiful photos. He brings a good experience to our Japan trip.

Highly Recommended!. We had such a fun time with the rickshaw ride through Asakusa.. Our driver was Hikaru, he spoke very good English, he was funny and informative, and, of course, he had very strong legs! We were part of a larger group, with 4 other ricksaws, and we all had a super experience. All of the guys had seemed to be enjoying their work and their interactions with tourists. Thanks Hikaru!

Fantastic Experience. We booked a trip and our driver was Kazuki. The trip was one of the highlights to our time in Japan and we would highly recommend that every visitor goes on a rickshaw tour with EBISUYA. Kazuki is an excellent guide and was very professional.....highly recommend, thank you Ken and Linda.

Highlight of our holiday in Japan!. Our guide, Sugar, was amazing! We introduced our group of four "old" friends to the Ebisuya Group, Yoppy, Koshi, Naski and Sugar outside the temple in Asakusa. After a quick visit to the local 7 Eleven store where we learned, with their help, how to purchase $1 coffee, we headed off in two immaculate rickshaws for a wonderful 70 minute adventure to discover sights we would never have found on our own. Sugar, who is proficient in eight languages - including English - was extremely knowledgeable (and funny). He answered all our questions, and didn't shy away from "difficult" topics. I just can't understand how these very fit young men can run, smile and talk, at the same time. Thank you - an experience we will always remember.

Highlight of our trip!. We took a 40 minute ride with YOPPI and he was the highlight of our trip! My stomach was sore from laughing so much! He spoke English very well but it's his comedy acts that will keep you rolling! It was by chance we met Yoppi early one morning, before the shops opened, which ended up being a real good thing as there are many photo ops and Yoppi will take fabulous pictures that you will treasure for life! Being that it was early in the morning, there was very little people/cars on the road so the rickshaw was able to maneuver around easily but most importantly, our photos are super special as it was just us sitting in the rickshaw, showcasing the beautiful scenes of Asakusa with no strangers to photobomb the shot! Mahalo Yoppi for an unforgettable time! Mahalo!

Great tour and the guide was so friendly. My boyfriend booked this in advance of us going and it was luckily a lovely day for the tour. The tour guide, Tomo, was so cheerful and informative which in turn made the tour so much fun. At the end of the tour we received a sticker each but after we returned to our hotel we realised we should have received some postcards aswell as we had booked a 30 minute tour. Was slightly disappointed to not have received those! All in all, recommend this tour to everyone but felt 30 minutes was quite short, go for the full hour!

Great rickshaw experience with our guide Yoppy.. Yoppy was a great guide, he spoke English and was very entertaining as well as informative. He gave us a tour of Asakusa highlighting all the historical features. Thank you, we had a great time.
Great way to see Asakusa. Our trip was fantastic 1.5hrs a great way to see many places. Our guide K had great English and was very knowledgeable and funny. A great start to our Japan trip. Thanks

A must do in Tokyo, Kazuki is the man!. This tour is by far one of the best things to experience in Tokyo. My wife and I are still talking about it. Kazuki was our guide and spoke great English. He kept us laughing with stories and experiences while teaching us some Japanese history. I would certainly do this again and request Kazuki if he's still there.

Fun rickshaw ride!. We went to Asakusa to try on some kimonos and walk around. We already planned on trying the rickshaw after walking around for a bit. One of the drivers, Leo, stopped us and recommended we do the rickshaw first then get dropped off near the temple. I'm so glad we did. Leo was an awesome driver!! His English was really easy to understand and easy to talk to. We booked a 30 minute tour. It was cool to see areas we didn't even know about, such as the geisha area. He even took amazing pictures of us at certain spots. I would highly recommend this!!

Great service! Kazuki is our happy and highly-energetic rickshaw driver !!!. My son and I had so much fun riding the rickshaw when we were in Asakusa last week. Thanks to Kazuki, our happy, highly energetic, physically fit, very knowledgeable, English speaking rickshaw driver. Will surely recommend tourists to take this tour to first time visitors. We were also able to take a nice picture of the two of us with Tokyo Skytree at background.

Simply flipping awesome!!. I was about to take a photo of the kaminarimon gate from across the street next to the asakusa culture and tourism center when I was approached by Tomo. He was extremely nice and friendly, which was definitely a good combo, otherwise it would've been a boring tour! (And thank goodness it was far from boring). I took the cheapest tour (LOL) which was ¥3,000, which I thght was the best option for me because I wanted to experience things on foot and take steady photos. So we went through orange street, raccoons, edo-period area, and a few other places. He would show me things and then tell me about them which was great since I knew nothing about the area! His English was impressive too! It was easy to make conversations with him as well! :D and let's not forget about the photos! He took some awesome ones with filters!!! I was impressed! Overall, I would definitely recommend it to anyone!!!!! Both informative and enjoyable!

Great end to my trip. I was sitting in front of Kaminarimon just burning up some time before my flight leaves when I was approached by Naoki Sugar. We started talking and I let him know it was my last day and I was just killing some time before my flight. He showed me a map of the rickshaw tour and suggested that it would be a great memory to end my trip in Tokyo. I had some leftover yen so I opted for the 30min tour and off we go. It was amazing how captivating our conversation was while we were doing the tour. I had a smile on my face the entire time. At the end of it he gave me some little souvenirs and we took some photos. If I have any regrets it's that I didn't do the tour sooner and I wasn't able to do the hour-long tour. Great way to learn some of the culture and history of Japan and would highly recommend to any and everyone.

Nice ride! Great Service!. We completed the 20 mins ride with Kota the driver. It was great!! Kota is very friendly and did a great job, he is a great driver!! We have this DSLR camera which is quite difficult to use, but Kota has learn how to use it quickly and took lots of photos for us. (photo attached)Thanks for the great rides and definitely recommended for whoever wants a relax activity. Thanks Kota
Fantastic. This was a great fun thing to do. Our driver was Motty and he was fun, happy and spoke brilliant English. Would highly recommend.
Amazing view of the skytree. Visit Kototoibashi and Geisha town. Although the price is not so cheap yet it worth to have a short trip.

Rickshaw with Taikai. September 24, 2016.As soon as you surface from Asakusa station you will be greeted by the Rickshaw drivers, don't be put off by that, they all speak English and offer a great service. If it's your first time and you are short on time, it is well worth the money to see Asakusa and the Sense-ji temple in a quick way. Our driver was Taikai Sato, he was awesome, in 30 minutes he showed us a variety spots, including shops, cafés, the geisha agency, Orange street, Japanese gardens, off the beaten path spots were locals hangout, he took great pictures of us along the way and explained the history and culture of Asakusa, finally he dropped us off near one of the gates to the Senso-ji temple. Overall it was a great experience well worth the money. Thanks Taikai.

GREAT FUN. My boyfriend talked me in to doing a rickshaw ride as i was very hesitant. We did a 30 minute tour and it was such an enjoyable experience. Out guide Taikai Sato ( Ocean) was amazing. He was very knowledgeable and super nice. Shared the history of Asakusa and even took some great photos for us. I really LOVED IT! I would definitely recommend it to anyone .

Masa- san and Kyosuke-san are recommended drivers!. They were very funny and informative, it's a fun way to get around and get to know Asakusa. Also, we get to experience what it's like to ride a rickshaw like Japanese people in the past time. Thank you Masa-san and Kyosuke-san for the wonderful experience!

Naoki Sugar did a great job!. While walking to take in the sights in the Asakusa district, I was approached by Naoki Suga. He was very personable as he shared information about himself, his company, and the value of a Rickshaw tour. I decided to take the 30 minute tour and was very impressed with the entire experience. I recommend the tour and Naoki, highly!

It was sooooo fun!. Thank Tatsuya for ur great service. It was fun n helped me understand better about Asakusa. Also, I could get a best picture at a best spot. It was a great experience! I hope to come back n collect the seasonal sticker:)

Great way to see Asakusa. This tour came highly recommended during our first trip trip to Tokyo and the Asakusa area. It was a perfect way to see the area and learn a little history in 30 minutes. Our guide Tomo was so personable and interesting, and his English was very good. He was very kind to put the cover up on the rickshaw when it started sprinkling. We will definitely remember this as a positive and unique experience. Highly recommend if you are visiting Asakusa!

Enjoyable experience highly recommended. We were in asakusa after visiting sky tree when a nice gentlemen approached us. He explained all about ebisuya and the service they provide also showing us the different routes which were catered to our viewing needs. We were going to go down toTemple so we chose the tour which went through all the traditional spots. Our driver was named ocean (jaikai sato) he spoke amazing English and he also wanted to visit the UK he was a big fan of the Beatles. While on the tour around asakusa ocean showed us some amazing spots and was very knowledgeable of the place we visited. He was a very socialable guy we talked about anime and japanese music he liked baby metal which was awesome ;) at end of tour my leg was a bit numb as I stepped off the carriage ocean was quick to grab me and he apologised even though it wasn't his fault. He gave us some free postcards which I've already used and a free sticker which I've put in my scrapbook, he also showed us the way to the temple which was a min away from where he dropped us off. Would definitely recommend this for people visiting asakusa, not all of the men working speak English but some do so don't let that put you off this experience. Thank you ocean :D

Wonderful time with wonderful ride~~. Masaya Sato was our driver. The ride was fantastic even though it was raining that day. This is not your typical rickshaw ride! My husband and I been to many other rickshaw in different country. I gotta say, this is the most fun, worry-free, well worth the price rickshaw. These guys love their job and treat every little details in the tour to the finest; from get us to be the most comfortable as we can; take the awesome picture for us; make sure we are not too hot/cold. entertain us and our little girl; explain all the things that are around the area that they take us through. Sato's English was very good and that also help explain to us in many aspect of Asakusa. The most unique and awesome part in my opinion is at the end. They wrote us receipt that come with small postcard gifts, cute little rickshaw guy drawing seasonal sticker (for collection 4seasons for price). I gotta say this is the most memorable rickshaw experience my family ever have. Definitely will get on the ride again when we visit japan next time !

Great fun, recommend doing this. We took this tour because it seemed to be a nice way to experience some of the past tradition, and to get some history. Diasuke was knowledgeable and made the trip fun. It was especially cool that we happened by the Geisha school in time for one of the people there to exit the building and offer to take our pictures. Diasuke also asked us what we wanted to see or know, and recommended restaurants and activities for later. I would recommend this to anyone who would like something different.Just a heads up for travelers. The rickshaws can be a little narrow, so be sure you don't mind being close to your fellow traveler. If you like your space, you may want to book your own vehicle. They can accommodate several people traveling together. Also, if you know in advance you want to do this, booking ahead can save you money (I booked through Viatour).

Simply unforgettable. It was a breezy and clear day. The winds were cool, signalling the fading transition of summer to autumn. Me and my mum wore our yukata and strolled around Asakusa. The sights were pretty but I've seen them before. I didn't expect much of the day after, 'til our friend booked us a rickshaw ride. It was a first for me, and it actually made a really strong impression--strong enough to make it one of the best experiences I've had so far on my 3 months stay here in Japan.  Our rickshaw boy was named Shun, a very charming lad. At first I was reluctant about the whole thing, as I'm sure most see it as somehow a little degrading for the rickshaw pullers. But then, I gave it a shot to try to see a different perspective of it. Shun was very polite, as with most Japanese people, and he was quite genuine about his job, as well. He started off, pulling us in tow and gave detailed backgrounds of what we are seeing on the ride, usually adding his own quips, to his usual script I assume. He noticed my mum getting a little drowsy (due to being tired and sleepless btw), and so he made extra effort on keeping us engaged throughout the ride. Needless to say, it made the whole thing more interesting and fun, with us taking pictures at special stops. Time flew by and I understood how rich and unique the experience was, with Shun showing great enthusiasm and minimal to no fatigue. By the time it was over, we were endowed with a simply unforgettable experience. Thanks for the very cool experience. Props to our energetic rickshaw boy, Shun! Here's to hoping for another great ride soon. :) --hiro

Reo was such a great guide!. Just yesterday I had a fun ride through Asakusa with Reo. For the first time being at Tokyo, this is a must for anyone. I only did the 30 minute tour but that was enough to know the origin of things. Reo always had a smile and was very easy to talk to. Perfect english. He had great humor and was very enthusiastic to share his knowledge of Asakusa. Anytime I asked a question he was there to answer. He also had taken great photos for me too. I'd suggest requesting Reo! Thanks Reo!

Superb ride and tour!. Naoki encouraged me to take the rickshaw tour to experience how it feels like to move around the old city of Asaskusa. It was a delight! Naoki was able to share some interesting and wonderful stories about the history of the place. Plus points because he speaks good english! I would totally recommend you to try this tour! Maybe next time I'll avail the longer time tour so I can tour all around Asakusa. I'll be back soon!

Naoki Suga is a super nice guy!. Naoki took me and my friend on his riksja. He was super friendly and knew Asakusa very well! We are from the flemish part of Belgium and we were happily shocked when he started speaking dutch. Also his french, german and english are very good! It was a great experience, Thanks Naoki!

Super Fun Rickshaw Ride !. The Yuki Brothers provided a super fun rickshaw ride throughout Asakusa. They were very respectful and were constantly attending to us to make sure we were ok. We stopped at several points along the way to take some great photos. Overall my wife and I had a really fun experience despite being a little hesitant at first. They were also really funny and were making us laugh the entire time. And after we paid, which was at the end of the ride, they even gave us some great little parting souvenirs! If you ever get the chance to ride a rickshaw in Japan, these are the guys!

Fun, informative & short Tour. I went to Sensoji Temple by myself and had read on TripAdvisor about the rickshaw tour. I was approached in front of the temple and decided to do it. It was early and the markets were still closed. What a great tour! Daisuke spoke English really well and I learned many things I would've not known otherwise. I asked what other things he would recommend to see and he mentioned the Matsuginyama Temple which was worth a visit without the crowd. I would highly recommend the tour!

Wonderful experience!!. Take chan was a super friendly Rikshaw driver with a Kansai dialect! I was there with my friend and he explained so many things about Asakusa - he was good with suggesting where to eat especially! Haha we had such good laughs all around Asakusa! Take chan many times offered us to take pictures - and the way he took pictures were just so professional! Lol you don't regret and it will make your trip to Tokyo a very memorable one! :)

A totally fun tour. We hadn't planned a rickshaw tour but our hotel concierge suggested it to us. So glad he did. After getting off the train in Asakusa we easily found the guides on the Main Street. We decided on a one hour tour which was going to provide us with a great overview of Asakusa. Our guide, Daiki was so helpful, full of information , showed us all the sights, even stopped at all the right places to let us get the best photo opportunities as well as taking plenty of photos of us during the time. Loved this tour!

Rickshaw 😎. Rio-sama and Kengo-kun are super friendly and funny. Their english is good also, so we can understand them easily. They introduce some part of asakusa, from temple, cafe, geisha, etc. And when we want melon bread in our ride, they offering themself to buy it for us. We can choose the road we like rather than following their lead only. We try 45min ride and it cost 13.500 yen for 2 person. Just try ebisuya asakusa when you visit asakusa. Ps. Rio , our friends Angela says あなたが恋しい (i dont know the writting corrent or not) *just kidding*

Fun, original, very interesting. It was a spontaneous decision to take this trip. We were so tired, went out from the metro and saw them. We were headed to the Asakusa temple and it was so in time for us! We took a trip to the temple and our charming, so lovely guide Kazuki told us a lot about the history, the culture and...even about the insect named Semi, that made such a lot of noise around. Kazuki, if you read it, thank you!)) It was a great pleasure!

Tanoshikatta. Absolutely loved the experience. Thank you Shin San for the wonderful tour.For people looking to make their Asakusa trip more enjoyable just travel around with Shin San. His English is very good, interacts with you alot and most importantly he took great pictures of ours aswell. So just look out for him. You may find him just outside the Kaminarimon.So just go out and take the rikisha ride with Shin San for sure

I am very grateful to visit Asakusa.. We had a great experience to visit asakusa and to ride jinrikisha. I went here with my coteacher Cindy and my Japanese friend. Thank you so much to our driver Mr. Tetsu, You speak English well. Sorry but we can't speak Japanese.thank you for introducing and taking us to different places in Asakusa and ofcourse for carrying our heavy weight. (Hahaha). Its one of my unforgettable experience. Its our pleasure to meet you.

Rickshaw Adventure!. As we came out of the Metro, following the very clear and precise details are provided to us by the tour operators, we were greeted by the smiling faces of the Rickshaw runners, and a lovely sign with our names on it. We immediately felt very safe and comfortable in the rickshaw, and our runner, Daisuke, took off down the road! His English was very good, he was cheerful, friendly, and gave us very interesting explanations of the areas in the Asakusa district that we passed through. We stopped at a couple of locations, and he obligingly took photos of us in the rickshaw together. One highlight that we particularly enjoyed was stopping at a beautiful Buddhist temple, Matsuchiyama Temple, that was calm and serene, and not thronged with crowds, as the largest temple in Asakusa is. We felt very reverent and appreciated having the customs and history explained to us. We had some lively stretches through the Geisha town area, and the comedy theatre area as well. We finished up at the main Sensoji temple. The last memory was of the wonderful smiling face of Daisuke, waving enthusiastically as we disappeared down the street. We would recommend it to anybody wanting to enjoy exploring Tokyo with an enthusiastic (and very fit!) guide. Thanks so much.

tatsuya was so kind👍. we was experienced liksha at first in japan, asakusa. we met tatsuya . he was very kind. his talking and drive was smooth and sooo good. we could understand asakusa well. maybe i want to take liksha again;)
Don't you miss this tour!. Not only a tour, but a lesson in Japanese history, religion and art. Price is really fair for what you get. Highly recomended!

Very nice ride with Kazuki & Konishi. We loved the tour in Asakusa. Our drivers Kazuki and Konishi were very charming and guided us well during the tour. I wish we could have had a longer ride. We will next time for sure!

Great experience at Asakusa. It's a good experience to do when you are in this district. You can appreciate the view of different places.The driver was really nice, he explained in English all you have to know. We know this is an hard exercice but he was good.

Good service. Thanks for driver Mr. Kazuki, He has very good service, speak english very well and very active to service us. We went to Asakusa on July 19, that trip make us very happy and wonderful trip.I recommend traveller to try Ebisuya city sightseeing

Great way to see Asakusa. We had a great ride with Yuki. He spoke little English, but was still able to explain things. Had a great sense of humor and super friendly.We enjoyed riding through the area and seeing the place.We thought it was a bit overpriced but it was fun.

Fun in Asakusa!. This was a really fun informative way to see some of the sites and back streets of Asakusa. Our guide was funny, took great pictures, and taught us about the area. Definitely a unique Day-so it!

Amazing rickshaw ride around Asakusa. I took a 1 mile 15 ride with a guide who takes you around and points out and explains interesting things. It's a fun way to explore and find things you wouldn't by your self.

A must do in Asakusa!. It was the first thing I did in Tokyo! Once you get out of Asakusa station you will be welcomed by the friendly guys of Ebisuya!! We took the 30 minutes tour and our guide (named Kohei) was very informative and showed us Tokyo's oldest movie theatre, comedy district, geisha house, and the oldest theme park in Tokyo! Very friendly and even offered to take photos for us in different places!
Good drive around Asakusa temple. Very nice and fair people. Stops for explainations in englishPrice is very fair and I learned a lot

Wonderful trip with ebisuya Andalusia.. Fantastic and great experience in Asakusa. Lingo and Micky took us around eastside and westside Asakusa. They also took pictures and introduced Asakusa Temple for us. It's interesting and hope we can been here I'm the future.

Great Experience. Daisuke-san was an exceptional guide. Great English skills, great sense of humor, and full of interesting information and suggestions. It was raining the entire tour, but we didn't get wet at all. Very professional, very considerate, and incredibly polite. Can't say enough about what fun we had. Well worth the price for a great experience.

Brilliant Rickshaw Tour. Ebisuya were very professional and the communication began as soon as I booked and paid online, providing me with all the appropriate information. I booked the 1 hour tour for myself and my three sons through viator and because I signed up with them , I received a discount. It was so great from the very beginning when we were greeted with a welcome sign with our names on it. Miki and Tai were our drivers and they were excellent and kept us entertained. Their English was also very good , so we learnt a lot too. I didn't want it to end and wished I had booked the 1 1/2 hour tour instead , so I would suggest you book the 1 hour tour as a minimum. Keep up the great work Ebisuya and I will be sure to recommend you to my friends and family. Many thanks Asha.

Awesome Guides!. Had not planned on taking the rickshaw ride but super glad we did mainly because our guides (2 guides for 2 rickshaws for 4 people) We had Tomo and Taku. Excellent experience only because of Tomo and Taku. They were awesome, energetic, informative, funny, and so very personable: overall gave my family a great experience. Yes, they spoke very good English. Domo Airrigato Gozaimas!

Brilliant Rickshaw Tour. Ebisuya were very professional and the communication began as soon as I booked and paid online, providing me with all the appropriate information. I booked the 1 hour tour for myself and my three sons through viator and because I signed up with them , I received a discount. It was so great from the very beginning when we were greeted with a welcome sign with our names on it. Miki and Tai were our drivers and they were excellent and kept us entertained. Their English was also very good , so we learnt a lot too. I didn't want it to end and wished I had booked the 1 1/2 hour tour instead , so I would suggest you book the 1 hour tour as a minimum. Keep up the great work Ebisuya and I will be sure to recommend you to my friends and family. Many thanks Asha.

Great guide and host!. Really enjoyed my experience with Ebisuya rickshaw company. They are professional and answered every question I had. I love how detailed they were in their explanations and really wanted us to have a good time.They took us to the geisha quarters and told us how we can book geisha in Asakusa. I really appreciated all the recommendations!

A must do!. So much fun our guid was very pleasant had many great information about what places to eat at first and what sights to see too. Very excited to practice his English since our Japaness was very bad. We did an hour tour wish we would had time for longer tour. The rickshaw it self was nice felt safe, even had blanket if we got a little chilly !

Wonderful ride by Trishaw Ride by Driver Mr Kengo & Mr kota. My family had a wonderful trishaw ride experience in Asakusa. We have 2 very good drivers Mr Kengo & Mr Kota, both speak very good English and they are not just driver, they are both very experience, courteous and knowledgeable Tour Guides to me. I learnt a lot of information and histories from both of the about Asakusa ... I look forward to future rides again when I go back there .. Thank You Mr Kengo & Mr Kota for the excellent services rendered to me & my family . All the Best to you both .

Awesome tour and guiding. We booked a 30 minute tour including Geisha street before we ended up at Senso Ji. Our driver was amazing and he also took many pictures of us along the ride. We highly recommend Kota who spoke excellent english and was really fun to talk with. So happy he got us to buy a tour! :)

What a ride!. Saw this on the Internet and thought well why not and what a great decision to make! We were greeted as if we were royalty with a large welcome sign. Great start! Second as we are large adults they quickly turned our one rickshaw into 2 and provided 2 fun, fit and knowledgeable drivers in Shin and Daisuke who made the ride so enjoyable. They gave us a great tour of Asakusa, always happy to answer our questions and provide us with information of the passing scenery. A truly memorable experience made even better by these two wonderful young men!
Must go itinerary and especially vote for Mr. 松本礼央. Nice journey because of Mr. 松本礼央 and my dear! Many nice pictures were taken! Good tour guide, friendly smile even under hot scene.... wonderful!!

THE way to see Tokyo!. We did the 2 hour tour in both Tokyo and Kyoto and both were a fantastic way to see each city! The rickshaws are in excellent condition and drivers are friendly and knowledgable. Highly recommended for new comers to the city and those who just want to get off their feet for a few hours and enjoy the sights and sounds of Tokyo!

Good experience riding rickshaw. The ride was very smooth and you get to take a lot of pictures during the ride.千喜良 Hikaru is a great driver and tour, he is familiar with local attractions, friendly, talkative, and able to communicate using English without any problem!

See Tokyo In Style. Taikai "Ocean" Sato was our guide, he spoke fluent English and provided the best tour that I've taken since arriving to Japan. Ocean provided a historical documentary during the entire tour...and an indebt history of the many shrines, temples and markets along the route. He also provided a photo shoot in front of the multiple landmarks during the stops along the route. At the end of the tour, we received free packages of post cards, tour stickers and discount coupon tickets for our next tour or to share with friends that plan to see Tokyo via Rickshaw. I will definitely take another tour and I plan to collect all four of the Japanese season stickers and collect my special Ebisuya gift. If opportunity permits while in Tokyo, I highly recommend you see the city via Asakusa Rickshaw Tour Ebisuya...and if English is your first language, ask for Taikai "Ocean" Sato!!

Great thing to do in Asakusa. My husband and I took the 30 minute tour and had a very friendly driver, Dai, whose English was very good. The ride was extremely comfortable, and Dai stopped whenever we wanted a picture, as well as taking a few photos of us. He showed us the sights and had good information about what we were seeing. Would do it again!

Learn more about Japan in a rickshaw. This is definitely a great experience to learn more about Japan. You ride in a rickshaw and are provided information by the person touring you. Our tour guide was Daisuke and he was awesome. In addition to the history he shared with us during our tour, he was really funny. He even offered to take our pictures!

Great tour guide!. Had a really good time on this tour earlier this year, and Tomomi was such a sweet and great tour guide!Saw a wide range of attractions in Asakusa and good that you do have some different routes to choose from.

Don't Miss Out on This One!. While in Asakusa we did a one hour tour in a Rickshaw. It was amazing! Our guide spoke English - told us lots of stories about the sights and took lots of fun pictures. Glad we did this tour! Our driver/guide was Daisuke! Daisuke was wonderful!!

Excellant and enjoyable service. Amazing and most wonderful tour ride with Yutai Okurano. Speaks very good english. He took us every corner and explained every details. He takes beautiful pictures of us (my daughter and me )After the tour, he guide us where the best place to eat. Thank you Yutai

Ask for 'Yoppy'. Yoppy has a very good 'motor' and had his work cut out with 2 big lassies to steer round...we did half an hour and he stopped at the appropriate photo stops and took our pictures. He was happy and polite and would not take a tip, saying rate me on tripadvisor... So 5/5 for Yoppy..!!

Perfect when paired with kimono rentals!. Got dressed in kimonos with a friend in Asakusa and thought, why not take one of the rickshaw rides to complete the experience? We talked to the first "driver" we saw near Nakamise Street, Daiki. He was very friendly and, luckily for me, he spoke very well in English. He explained the options/courses available very well, and after being informed we were on our way.He was very informative and a fun person to talk to and listen as he pointed out many of the historical aspects of Asakusa, and on the ride he took us to the Geisha town, which was our first time there. The ride was pleasant, the weather was very warm but with a cool breeze on a rickshaw it was a very pleasant experience, especially while wearing kimonos!And as it turned out we had a 10% discount on our rickshaw ride, for renting kimonos (my friend acquired a coupon from the rental shop, Kyoto Kimono Wargo).Highly recommend this, especially in conjunction with a kimono rental!

RICKSHAW RIDE THROUGH ASAKUSA. Great one hour rickshaw ride with our guide Shin - which I had booked before leaving Australia online - they were very helpful and great communication with the company prior. A good start - gave me perfect directions to get to them via the train and on arrival had my name printed on a sign - Shin our guide was great, very happy very informative great English and lots of fun...stopped regularly to explain sites and point things out and was a great photographer - taking many photos for us. It was a great way to familiarise yourself with the area - I would recommend trying this way of sightseeing and recommend trying the sweet potato Japanese Cake that Shin recommended - thankyou !! I had to have a piece every day while in Tokyo! Great tour recommend to all

Awesome guides. Really enjoyed the 2 hour tour. Our guide Ikuma was excellent. He was energetic and had a great attitude. The others that work for this company were all very friendly. I highly recommend this tour if you want to get more familiar with this neighborhood and its history.

Rickshaw ride is a must for your trip. Tetsu was our guide and it was the very first experience I had with rickshaw ride. I asked for 30 min ride to start with, because I wanted to make sure that my kids (age 4 and 2) will love the ride, not scared. However, just for the first 30 mintues. Tetsu already made my kids impressed. I loved the part that they kept calling him "superman" "super hero". My wife and I felt that we were very lucky to have Tetsu as our first ever rickshaw ride guide. He was very knowledgable to describe all the sights and was able to communicate back and forth with us. Be honest, I was worried that we couldn't communicate to each other before taking the ride. Anyway, long story short. We extended our trip for another 30 minutes to explore more in the neighbourhood. It was a very great way to see everything and know the culture in such short time.

Surprisingly good. We got off the subway and were confronted by this guy wanting to take us for a ride. I thought here we go another tourist scam. Wrong! Very friendly guy who was super polite took us around for 30 mins. Showed us the town. So impressed with the tour and the athletic ability of Tetsu. Would recommend to anyone.
Must Do!!. Had a great time! Saw parts of the city I would have never seen. Our driver was Kenpan. He spoke english and was delightful.

Had great time with great person. initially I didn’t have planning to do this tour but because I wasn’t to confident strolling around so I decided to do this tour. Got a very nice person, unfortunately I didn’t remember his name, but he was humble person even his English is just so so,,I still understood what he told about,,

Rickshaw Ride by Tetsu & a Trainee on 7/5/2016. We had Tetsu & his trainee as our rickshaw pullers. They were awesome n we had a good time! Both could speak English and we were glad that we took the ride because there were so more places in Asakusa that we didn't explore by foot. Thumbs up, Tetsu n team!

very interesting. We were approached by this Japanese dude , his name was Tetsu. he speak good English and he was very polite and fun to ride with. We took 30 minutes ride for total of 9,000 yen for me and my friend. he gave us a tour around the area and finally dropped us at the temple. i highly recommend this

Short and sweet. Went for a half an hour jaunt around Asakusa with these folks. Really fun way to experience the sights. The guide pointed out this and that. Not a detailed tour but if you can afford it, its definitely different.

Fantastic experience - HIGHLY recommend!. My fiancee and I LOVED going on this rickshaw ride with Ebisuya Co. Booking ahead of time was easy and I messaged Inoue back and forth several times - he was really considerate about what I wanted to see so that he could plan his route. When I arrived at the train station, I wasn't sure how I was going to find him. No worries, he had printed out a sign with my name on it, kind of like in the airport. I felt so special! The rickshaw ride itself was great, smooth and at a good pace. We stopped every once in a while for him to explain the history (in really good English!) behind the more famous spots as well as take several pictures. After they ride was over, he gave us a few souvenirs (stickers and postcards). Overall, fantastic experience and highly recommended to anybody looking for a great way to spend 30 mins (in tiers, up to 2 hours) touring the city in a unique way with great pictures and personalized historical tour.

Rickshaw Heaven!. Daisuke was our guide, we told him where we had been and he structured the ride to take in new sights. He gave us cultural and historic information about what we were seeing in an interesting and entertaining format. He was charismatic and funny, took lots of pictures of us. We highly recommend that you do this, very enjoyable.

Fun and Friendly Guides Make the Difference. A group of us took three rickshaws for the one-hour tour of Asakusa. From beginning to the end, our guides, Shin, Motty and Subaru were unflagging in their enthusiasm and general cheer. They took us around the immediate area by the Sensoji temple, through the markets and the oldest establishments in Japan. We were travelling with two young children and they made the effort to engage them too. Asakusa has terrific variety of shops and eateries which our guides gave us the backgrounds of. Conveniently, they took photos of the group at various points of the trip without us having to leave our rickshaws (and they came out pretty well!). Shin, Motty and Subaru were a great bunch of people who gave us the impression that they couldn't do enough to make sure we were having a good time. They made our stop in Asakusa such a warm and fun experience.

Entertaining tour of Asakusa. Taking a rickshaw with Ebisuya around the traditional area of Asakusa is the perfect way to visit. Our drivers were Yusuke, Tatsuki, and Motty, and they were both gracious and entertaining. You get to see the main sights in the area, and our drivers were kind enough to take plenty of pictures with our phones, to make sure we had some great souvenirs to take home.

Memorable Rickshaw Tour. We had a lovely 30mins ride with Kazuki Takuzumi (Our Rickshaw Person). Started with a warm welcome by keeping heated pads on our seats as it was very cold in Tokyo. Tucked us nicely in between the red flannel blankets and made sure after every 5 mins if we were comfortable or not. We chatted with him throughout our tour and got to know more about the place. He is an awesome photographer as well. Due to him we felt like celebrities in our pictures and ended our journey with lots of beautiful memories. Tried pancakes filled with sweet red bean paste which were freshly baked. Really thankful to Kazuki for introducing the japanese pancakes to us.

We loved it! Something for everyone!. There are many rickshaw companys in the area please ride with the right one! Our group met Kazuki at the curb outside the Asakusa Kannon Temple on an early April afternoon after a day in Akihabara. Being a group of 6 ranging from young adults, baby boomers to grandma, we had a wide range of expectations to satisfy. Since one of us had ever been on a rickshaw ride, we decided to go for it. Kazuki quickly rounded 2 of his English-speaking drivers Yoppy and Kouhei to, not simply 'drive' but truly provide us with a memorable experience!It was a chilly afternoon and they all placed seat warmers under us and gently tucked us in with warm blankets over our laps. Also, they put our minds to rest by securing all of our shopping bags to the rickshaws. With all this being taken care of, our minds were placed at ease and we were ready to get started. With 2 of us on each rickshaw, it was a wonderful personalized way to experience the Cherry Blossoms in bloom at Sumida Park. Kouhei, our driver, was extremely knowledgeable, polite and gracious. In excellent English, he explained the history and details of the area that we would have never thought to ask about. We felt that we were walking through Asakusa history. Even grandma said that she learn so much and had so much fun. We also were so grateful that they kindly took the time to take so many pictures with our iPhones with us in the rickshaws at a number of intruiging spots throughout out experience. Never thought that I would find myself in front of a geisha house! After the ride was over, we could not stop talking about how happy we were about our decision to take a ride with Kouhei, Kazuki and Yoppy.We have stayed at 5-diamond hotels but have never felt the sincere desire to provide a heartfelt quality experience. Kouhei, Kazuki and Yoppy exceeded all expectations! Their service delivered with a sincere love of people and what they do, they are true ambassadors for Japan. Our family spent almost 2 weeks traveling all over Japan and received great service throughout the trip. But as we reminisce, the rickshaw ride in Asakausa rises to the top! Thank you Kouhei, Kazuki and Yoppy for warm memorable experience on a chilly day!

Great experience. We visited Tokyo for our wedding anniversary and we headed to Asakusa as our first stop, since it was recommended as the top neighborhood and temple. We met Tetsu right out of the station who offered us a ride and we had a great experience with him!! We was extremely friendly and he showed us the area with great details on the area, took pictures of us and made us feel very special. I greatly admire these guys who have to be in great shape to pull us around on these awesome vehicles!!!

Fun and Informative Ride. This was a real highlight of the trip, we had been told to do this by a friend and we are so glad that we did. Our driver was fantastic, Kazuki was incredibly friendly, and he knows a lot about the area, I found out more from him than I would from walking around. You can't miss the rickshaw guys, they are all incredibly handsome with incredible legs wearing short shorts! We went during the sakura (Cherry blossom) season, the rickshaw driver will take you along the river under a sky of cherry blossom trees. Very picturesque! They offer different routes for different lengths of time and different prices to suit. We had a great time!

Awesome Ride!!. We decided last minute to try out the rickshaw tour and were so glad we did! We had two rickshaws for our party with Tetsu and Nana as our guides. They shared the history of the city, the traditions, and some of the current happens around the city. The tour was informative and educational. We even stopped to take pictures. Tetsu and Nana were very personable. It was like visiting with friends as they shared their city with us. I recommend this tour to everyone before jumping off and exploring on your own.
Great time do it. We had a great time the guy that pulled us was a tour guide and really cool spoke English tetsu was his name u get to sight see a little bit and learn some history and facts

Cool experience, but overpriced.. Our guide was very friendly but his english wasn't well enough for us to ask questions. He could sort of understand but not fully. He had information on the cool things to do the area and it was fun being on the richshaw. The guide took good pictures of us as well. A good experience for sure, but if you are on a budget it can break it! I prefer a walking tour which is usually more informative.

great tour of Asakusa. I highly recommend booking a rickshaw tour if you want to see a different side of Asakusa. Our guide Ikuma gave us an entertaining and enjoyable ride to places away from the major tourist areas.
