He explained the sites we visited very well so you leave with new knowledge of Japanese history and culture. He takes great photos too! We took the 1 hour tour and it was very much worth it.

Fun, relaxing way to see Asakusa. We had such a great time on the Ebisuya Rickshaw tour. Our driver Kazuki was great. He was very funny, and entertained us the whole time. The whole operation was very warm and friendly and gave us a huge dose of that famous Japanese hospitality. We did the 1 hour tour and I felt like that was just the right amount of time.

Treated like royalty!!. If you're looking for an unforgettable experience in Japan, you should definately try Ebisuya's rickshaw tour in Asakusa! Riding a rickshaw is more fun than you can imagine (you might feel it expensive at first, but imagine riding a magic carpet......priceless!!). These rickshaw guys at Ebisuya are probably the best in Asakusa from what I heard. They have strict tests on safety, manners, knowledge for every trainee before they take up customers to guarantee THE BEST for travelers. And I also loved the part to hear they clean up the streets of Asakusa every morning before starting tours. The Asakusa local's must love these guys at Ebisuya.My tour guide was Shin, a fluent English speaker with a natural talent for charm. He can give a tour in rich detail, so those of you who want to know the historic background of Asakusa in English, I'd recommend him.While riding a rickshaw, you're going to feel like one of those royal members who wave out to the people outside the carriage. Other tourists are going to give you an envious look and turn camera lenses to get a shot of an actual moving rickshaw- with you on it! Enjoy and wave to them like every royalty does!!

Great way to see Asakusa. My husband and I met our driver Kazuki before we entered the gate at Sensoji. We thought a rickshaw ride would be something different so we went for it. Kazuki and his tour did not disappoint. We opted for the 30 minute tour which felt like the perfect amount of time. He took us throughout the older sections of Asakusa and was a great guide; his English was very good and we were learned so much of the history. Kazuki also seemed to be a professional with the iPhone and we now have some great photos of us. Ebisuya Asakusa was a great way to start our day in Asakusa!

Perfect!. Me and my friend went to Asakusa to visit the Senso-ji temple and Nakamise for the day. As soon as we got out of the station we found these tour leaders that offered to take us around this beautiful town. We took the 1hour ride, Kazuki was out tour leader, he was extremely friendly and had good knowledge of everything around town, he also suggested few places that we should visit while there. He offered to take us pictures each time there was a good view. He came with us to the Matsuchiyama temple and explained & showed us the ritual one must do before getting inside the temple. I highly recommend this service and if possible ask for him too!

Parents visit. Thank you Taira, Tesuya, and Tasuya. Me and my parents really enjoyed the 30 minute tour. It was well worth the yen! We went early around 0800 and the streets weren't crowded, so the ride was continuous.

History and tradition. This tour is incredibly informative and traditional of Asakusa. Kengo, our driver, made the tour very enjoyable and interesting by sharing history of Senso-ji temple and Asakusa that I would have not known just by walking through. We laughed through the entire tour, sometimes capturing the attention of other visitors who would stop and snap a picture of us. This tour was a pleasure to do and I highly recommend it. Having a driver with a great personality and sense of humour made it that much more a pleasure.

Fun Ride. We had a fun time with our drivers Daiki, Imano and Jun. Easy to find these guys, just outside Asakusa station. They took us around to nearby areas and provided information about those places.

A nice little treat!. While we explored Asakusa we encountered the rickshaw tour workers and we decided to give a try. It was super nice! Our driver Hikaru was awesome, he took us to the most iconic parts of the place which in term helped us to see all the cool stuff without getting lost, and his English was perfect, we enjoyed his explanations of what we were seeing and his sense of humor. You should try it for sure!

An experience.. Unfortunately we do not know the name of the driver we only have it written in Japanese. However he was a very polite, interesting person, who made our ride very enjoyable. Telling us all about the areas we were visiting and he even took the time to take photos of my husband and I. It was a lovely experience and it helped to make our holiday in Tokyo a little more memorable. Would certainly recommend this ride.

Awesome time!. The 5 of us went for a ride in 3 rickshaws for an hour. The price was $100AUD a head. Yoppy, Tanaka & Minowa were just brilliant! While checking out the sights they gave spot on commentary, took many photos of us and made us laugh the whole way through. I'd highly recommend this if you can afford it. Shorter times are available for a lower price.

Had a blast!. Had a great time on the rickshaw with Yoppy. Yoppy was a great tour guide showing us the best of Asakusa during Sakura season. Along with his great muscles Yoppy provided a lot of humor, great photographaphy and a fun time. We went for an hour and a half costing 25000 Yen but man you have to experience this once in your life. Arigato ❤Yoppy❤

Marvellous experience!. Our driver Shintaro 礼央 is one of the funniest guys I've met, strong, handsome, talkative and always smiling. He took us some great photos that can hardly be taken by ourselves. The ride was very pleasant and a rather unique way to explore around Asakusa. Even better if you come during Sakura season. Highly recommend!

Excellent Experience. Our riders were Yoppy and Tokuzumi had the best time with these two they were very entertaining and kept us laughing the whole time. Loved the whole experience. Would highly recommend this.

Great experience. Rickshaw driver Leo gave us a pleasant experience in Asakusa.Its amazing that he can speak English, Mandarin and Japanese of course.We only tried quick one due to the schedule but it is still quite memorable.

Great 2 hour tour and driver/guide. Temples,Shrines, Cherry Blossoms, old streets and history. Learn about Geissa, Kabuki, Budda, Shinto. All of the staff were friendly and went out of their way, with smiles all around. Daisuke, the sound man who took me on this rickshaw tour, was fantastic. Some language bumps, but we understood each other. Not just a ride, but an educational adventure.

Traditional day. We are wearing rented kimono from a shop a friend worked at when we arrived in Asakusa. As we crossed the road, a friendly guide waved us over and explained how we could hire a rickshaw tour around the area. It seemed really reasonable and since it was difficult to walk in tabi and geta, we thought it might be fun. The local shops didn't open until 10am, so we had an hour tour.Our driver was Daisuke who spoke very good English and was strong and fast. He stopped at picturesque locations to take photos of us and even showed us the correct shrine etiquette. It was a great experience and Daisuke was really friendly which made it even better. He answered any questions we had and even recommended a sushi place for us to visit after. Daisuke said that there is also a branch in Kyoto, so we plan to do the rickshaw tour there as well.

Fun Rickshaw Ride through Asakusa. My friends and I were in Asakusa visiting Senso-ji temple and we saw the rickshaws out front and decided to give it a try. One of my friends were a little skeptical at first but by the end of the tour she was elated! The ride was very relaxing and enjoyable. We had Tetsuya-san and Ikuma-san as our guides and they were both very personable and interactive. They really enjoy what they do and it shows!

A feeling of the old Japan.. Absolute must in Asakusa. Experience the old Tokyo the back seat of a rickshaw ride. The guide was very friendly and made sure to make the tour very fitted to areas of my own personal interest. I went for 1 hour. I wouldn't recommend going for any less and perhaps even two hours will fly by. If you only do one thing in Tokyo, my recommendation would be this.

Great experience!. We had a great unforgettable experience! Our ride was with Kristi, she was very lovely and sweet, she speaks a fluent English! Plus She's very strong and fast!her point of views and opinions are very interesting! One of the most easy-going people I ever met! She was so kind enough to guide us to a shop that we wanted during her lunch break! Thank you so much Kristi! Hope that we ride with you again! And Ganbatte ne!!❤*"Taiyaki" lover(only Kristi will get that), from Qatar!✌
Dewy. Driver speak english very well and have a good service. If we have an oppertunity we will go back in other season.
Lovely experience. This was the highlight of our 2 day stay in Tokyo. We had a beautiful (female) rickshaw driver, Tomomi, take us on a personal tour of old Tokyo.

Be Spoilt!. Our group of 6, from 10 to 72 year-olds, had a great time on the rickshaws. It was a sunny winter's day when we went on our one hour tour of Asakusa. My apologies to the three young gentlemen who pulled our rickshaws for misplacing the card that had their names, or I would have mentioned them here. when we started off, they made sure we were snugly covered with a blanket and there were heat packs to keep our seats warm too. Along the way, they will stop, point out and explain things of interest to us. We all felt it beats walking aimlessly around the old town, unable to read Japanese and not being able to understand unique things about old Japan. It was money well spent for us, but hard earned for our rickshaw pullers. I would definitely recommend this tour to friends.
Ebisuya Asakusa. As we exited the subway we were approach for a ride and hesitantly accepted a 30 minute ride to the Temple. It was truly wonderful and a lot of fun.

Ride for life. We spent our honeymoon here and decided to ride a rickshaw. One of the best experience we had. Kazuki is fun and can really show you what you want to see. He is also good in english so you can talk to him.

Great ride and full of information. This was my first rickshaw ride and it was so fun. Our driver was Tatsuki, nicknamed Taz. He made the ride enjoyable and full of information. We stopped several times to get beautiful pictures. We'll worth the time and money

Delightful tour. We decided to take a rickshaw tour around the Asakusa area. Our rickshaw driver/ tour guide was Kristi, a delightful girl who spoke excellent English. She gave us a running history of the area as she pulled us around for 1/2 hour (she was also very strong!). It was a unique and fun experience.

A Must do!. We took the 45 minute tour with Tetsu. He made the entire experience a blast and spoke great English. He pointed out key areas and offered to take pictures. Great experience overall and fun way to see part of Tokyo.

Tomomi is the best!. My wife and I did not plan on doing a tour in this particular area. We planned to explore on our own. Tomomi ended up approaching us as we were headed to Senso-ji Temple. She helpfully explained the entire area to us in great english. We decided to go for a ride with her. The seats had small heating pads and the multiple layers of blankets kept us very warm. On the tour, Tomomi pointed out several local businesses and landmarks and explained the history behind each. In the end, we got a picture with Tomomi, she gave us some gifts (post cards and a sticker) and as a fellow dog lover she wrote our receipt out to our dog Murphy in Japanese characters. We bonded with Tomomi and highly recommend her and Ebisuya. Thank you for a great experience!

A nice way to see Asakusa :). Decided to take a rickshaw to see the highlights of Asakusa. It was a lovely experience made even more special by the excellent rickshaw driver called Kazuki. He provided a great behind the scenes tour, told interesting stories about Asakusa, took some wonderful pictures of us and recommended some great places to find souveniors and japanese street food. I would highly recommend taking a rickshaw with this company. Try to find Kazuki the rickshaw driver, he is very friendly, professional and speaks very good English. Jo and Yuki San ❤️

Best ride ever. It's our first time to Asakusa and we came early there only to be told that the shops opened at 10am. Kazuki, our rickshaw driver offered us for a rickshaw ride around the area. We were glad that we took it as we had an overview of the town before we explored ourselves. Kazuki was friendly and knowledgeable to share with us some of Asakusa's significant places. He even brought us to see fully bloomed sakura tree near a shrine while it's still winter. How lucky we were :)) Arigato Kazuki. You made our visit an enjoyable and memorable one. Hope to come to Asakusa and take another ride in a different season.
Very entertaining tour. Very good tour, hosts speaks good english and are very knowledgeable, is a great way to see asakusa, would recommend to give everyone to give it a go

Best part of our visit to Asakusa. Ebisuya was conveniently located near the Asakusa station and we had no idea how to get to the Tokyo skytree. So we decided to try the rickshaw without any expectations. We were skeptical about the price but boy, was it worth every penny. Our family took 2 rickshaws, Yoppy and Taira, they were a very pleasant duo, Yoppy was really hilarious and crazy while Taira was more informative and serious but they were all very nice. All in all it was an excellent and memorable ride, I recommend trying it to everyone if you go to Asakusa.

Excellent, friendly. Taikai Satou (better known as Ocean) was our rickshaw driver & he couldn't have been more polite, friendly & helpful. He tried to accommodate our budget range & our tight schedule since we were planning to see other sights that day as well. Great job Ocean & best of luck for your future!!!
Great ride. It was such a wonderful ride with KRISTIShe was so lovely and joyful and full of information about Tokyo - KRISTI thank you for the souvenirs

Great ride. Our ride with Tetsuya was the greatest. He brought us around the 30 min trip with great care. He made sure my pregnant wife had a smooth ride as to ensure her safety.Tetsuya had perfect English, and explained alot about Asakusa and places nearby.I would recommend him to other tourists and do place this ride as one of the best thing in Asakusa (as its quite packed to walk around).Regards

Our guides Sunabe and Konishi were great!. We took our 5 and 7 year olds for their first rickshaw ride and it was so much fun! Going through the modern city in our old rickshaw was amazing! Not to mention our two guides, Sunabe and Konishi, who pulled our weight with ease and was able to guide us around the old Asakusa area in English. Very Happy! Definitely an experience I would recommend.

SUSHI! Itsuki Yamamura best guide :). ITSUKI (Sushi) was our driver! He spoke very good English and gave us a wonderful tour around Asakusa. I felt he enjoyed being our guide and we enjoyed his company. I wished we could have stayed on the Rickshaw longer. It was my first time going on a Rickshaw. I highly RECOMMEND this rickshaw guide and you will be very lucky to have Itsuki as your guide

One of our trip's highlights! A fun, unique experience!. These guys were awesome! Our family of 6 did 3 rickshaws and 3 amazing guys! One of them was called Tiger, the other Ryo, and the other guy... I forgot his name (sorry!). But all of them spoke great English, were FUNNY, and always considerate about our comfort. They had good photo-taking skills too!Highly recommend this tour. A fun way to see Asakusa. We did the 1 hr our one, and every minute was worth it!

A great way to see Asakusa. I did a 2 hour tour with Ryo Shinoda. He was a great guide and showed me many things that I really enjoyed. What was important was that he discussed the itinerary with me first. I will definitely recommend this tour and guide, and this is the best way to get a feel of Asakusa.

Ebisuya Rickshaw Tour. This is a wonderful tour around Asakusa in a short amount of time. The rickshaw ride is very smooth, and despite riding in winter time, the seats were warm and we had a blanket to cover us from the waist down. Our driver, Tetsuya, made the experience even better because he was very knowledgeable and often offered to take our pictures around many landmarks. We were looking for a few places to buy japanese tea sets and Tetsuya showed them to us on the map. Saved us a lot of time!

Genki Rickshaw Ride!. The rickshaw ride was excellent and our driver Sakata was conversational with a great sense of humor. Sakata showed us great places around Asakusa as well as great recommendations of where to visit and eat. Also Sakata was able to gather his rickshaw colleagues and have them sing happy birthday during the ride by surprise. I had a great experience of riding the rickshaw and I highly recommend it to any visitors stopping by Asakusa.

Worth it!. I loved the rickshaw and getting to go around the older part of Tokyo. This was a great way to take in a lot in a short amount of time. Plus, Kazuki (our driver) was great! So much fun, energetic, informative, and good at English! Nice job. Glad we did this!

Hilarious ride with Yoppy and Ryo. I'm a teenager travelling to Japan with my family and we went on an unexpected ride with Ryo and Yoppy and they were the most hilarious guys ever 10/10 I loved every second of our ride and they both made us seem so welcome and it was the best experience of our trip so far. Personal shout out to Ryo who was my driver (my mum and dad had Yoppy) but Ryo was so lovely and easy to talk to and overall this trip was 1001100101-10 good job Ryo and Yoppy!! I'm still smiling hours afterwards
Review . Really good service, great english and really funny. Yoppy and Ryo make a great team and they have the best sense of humour. 10/10

Interesting Tour with Ocean. We had a 45 minute trip around Asakusa with Ocean who was extremely helpful in showing us the main buildings and streets as well as taking outstanding pictures for us.Definitely recommend as an introduction to the neighborhood, with a more detailed follow-up on the parts of your preference.
Good Job. Is great experience and thanks two handsome guys Yuta & Tetsu (悠太&哲）show us the interest place at Asakusa and thanks for taking photo for us Thanks guys, see you again!!!

ride with ❤️yoppy ❤️. My friend and i took an unexpected ride with yoppy-san today and it was really amazing! We chose the 30 minute course and it seemed longer! He showed us cool places in asakusa, took great photos of us, was super kind and super funny and interesting to talk with. YOPPY最高です！！！

Rickshaw Rides around Asakusa. A great way to take in the area while being transported around on a rickshaw combined with expert commentary. We had Ryo Shinoda as our driver - great guy with a real desire to tailor the ride to your interests - Ryo asked us several questions & then proceeded to take us on a tour pointing out things that we may be interested in in line with our tastes. Ryo had a terrific personality & a real love of the deep history of the area.. We opted for the 30 minute tour but there were many option sot pick - don't short change yourself & go for a quick 10 / 15 minutes - the longer the tour the more you see & learn. This was a highlight for our 9 y/o son - he is still talking about the ride.

Such a great experience! . We would have been so lost if it wasn't for our awesome guide (Leo the lion). He showed us around Asakusa and educated us not only about the history of the area but also helped us find great food, beautiful temples/gardens and market areas. He was even our own personal photographer! Would definitely recommend this tour.
❤️Yoppy❤️. It was AWESOME thank you very much 楽しかた〜元気なりました〜本当に面白いと楽しい〜we had fun and know new places thank you Yoppy san a good photographer too

Great experience with incredible guide. This is a once in a lifetime experience our driver (Ocean) Mr. Sato took us around Asakusa and gave us an explanation to every question that we had. Also he took pictures for us and recommended great places for food and places to visit. If you are coming to Tokyo and you have the chance to come to Asakusa, I would highly recommend that you go on this tour.

Carriage tour guide . Today we did a one hour tour around Asakusa towards senso-Ji temple. Our tour guide Leo (aka. Lion/Ninja) was the funniest most helpful guide we have ever come across. He explained the history of Asakusa in detail and even made extra stops to take photos of us next to the old historical buildings. He knew all the good angles and made us feel special. We highly recommend this service to anyone travelling the area. We are so pleased with Leo's customer service and bubbly personality ! Hopefully we bump into him again soon.

楽しい人力車の旅. .今日は母と浅草を歩き回りました。そしたら前私が乗った人力車がいっぱい走っていたのです。私はまた乗りたいという気持ちがありました。そしたら急に人力車のインフォメーション担当の方が声をかけてくれました。そして説明をいろいろしてくれたんです。説明をうけたあと乗ることになりました。とても嬉しかったです〜人力車を引っ張ってくれたのは 松本 礼央くんでした。彼はとてもかっこよくて明るい方でした。いろいろな場所に行くときも笑顔で説明をしてくれました。ときには"寒くないですか？"などと優しい言葉をかけてくれました。おまいりに行くときもとても優しく"これはこうであれはこうなんですよ"と説明をしてくれました。とても楽しい、素敵な経験をありがとうございました！❤︎Today I walked at Asakusa with my mom. Then I saw a human powered rickshaw that I rode before. I wanted to ride it again. Then a man that tells people about the rickshaw talked to us and we decided to ride it. I was so happy.The person that was pulling the rickshaw was Matsumoto Reo-kin. He was handsome and was a great person. When we went to places he would explain to us with a great smile on his face. Sometimes we would ask us if we were cold or not. Even when we went to the jinja he would explain to us. He was so polite. Thanks for the fun and amazing ride!

A 'must do' in Asakusa. After visiting Senso-Ji temple we decided to take a rickshaw tour around Asakusa because we were feeling tired, and what a great decision it was. Our 'driver' Tetsuya spoke good English and pointed out many interesting landmarks and the history behind them along the way. Very relaxing and well worth the price!
Sasiparatch Noppakulwong. I feel very good, to see nice place & warmest welcome. Driver's service, (Mr.Shuu)he had a good service minded and good take care.
Special thanks . Special thanks to Itsuki and Ryo for their personalized services and taking good care of us to the short journey with them.

Best Ride Ever!. It's our first time visiting Tokyo and we're kinda lost on our way to Sensoji Temple. We're recommended to take a rickshaw ride and met our passionate drivers, Itsuki and Tomomi. They gave us an amazing fun 15 min ride around Asakusa with a clear overview of the area which enable us to navigate around Asakusa.
Fantastic!. We did a one hour tour and LOVED it! Tour guides were informative and fun. Highly recommend! We had a fantastic time!

We're very satisfies the ride today especially our driver Yuta, he is professional tour guide. Thanks once again.. I will recommend my friend to take a ride even only 10 minutes but gain lot of fun and knowledge especially the history of Asakusa area for instance famous Japanese soft cake, desert or even tempura have been recommended by Yuta. Take care and we will come again in the near future. I will try to collect and complete the 4 set of yours sticker.BradsJi

30 mins nonstop of fantastic ride !!!. My wife and I have no other plan to do after visiting Sensoji temple until we met "Masa" or "Masato" at the front of Sensoji temple. He introduced and explained us about the tours and options for the rickshaw rides, then we chose 30 mins package.He took us to the historic Sensoji and Samurai area and made a few stops to take photos for us at Sensoji and Tokyo Skytree, we are so happy to do that.During the ride, people noticed Masa as a strong little guy pullng us around all the way to the finished point without trouble. Also his information about the area are very helpful and fun.Overall , for us , Rickshaw Rides is one of our memorable experiences, and we are so glad to do this great activity.Thanks to "MASA" for everything you did, well done :)APIRAK from Bangkok / Thailand

Rickshaw Rides. This experience was terrific!! I invited my friend over from Australia and booked a rickshaw ride. I can honestly say that we had a truly amazing time. It was so much fun! The guides were extremely informative and friendly (and spoke English). We were lucky enough to get a great guide (Ocean!!). I would recommend this to anyone who wants to see the sites of Asakusa with minimal walking, or anyone else who would like to have an amazing time on a rickshaw!!

Fun way to see the sights. There are many other rickshaw tours of Asakusa, but these guys are the best. This is a really efficient and fun way to see a lot of old downtown Tokyo (with an english speaking guide!) and it's especially nice for those with mobility issues. Our guide was very knowledgable about the area and its history and was happy to answer questions and stop along the way for photo ops. Very comfortable option to explore Asakusa.

Definitely a must do! Great Experience!. We ended up in Asakusa on our last day of our trip. We came across Ebisuya and were approached to try the rickshaw. We did the 30min ride and it did not disappoint. It was one of the most memorable part of our trip. We had Booked two rickshaws and our drivers were Yuta and Jun. Both were very good drivers and very friendly. The service we received was great. We enjoyed the experience. I just wanted to say Thank you Yuta for taking good care of my husband and me and to Jun for taking care of my other family members. どうも ありがとう ございました！

Must Do Experience!. My wife and I took a two hour rickshaw journey in October that turned out to be one of the highest points of a wonderful Japanese adventure! We were greeted with a welcome sign, as we stepped off a riverboat at the market meeting place. Then the company manager, Yasusei Fujiwara, and our "driver", Masaki Honjo introduced themselves. My wife had arranged all of this by email in advance of our travels... their responses were complete and very helpful. It was quickly evident, as we started our ride with Masaki that we were in for a treat. He is a very athletic young man who is completing college (financed by his earnings) with a thesis on bringing the rickshaw business into modern relevance. His English was super - as was his sense of humor, knowledge of Tokyo and its history, and his ability to explain temples, shrines, geishas, and current events to us in a riveting manor. We covered quite a large area in the two hours and never once felt concerned about sometimes being in major traffic with Masaki - he is a great and careful "driver" (runner). This experience early in our nineteen day trip gave us a wealth of background knowledge which made the rest of our travels that much more interesting and meaningful. For example, he explained and clarified the differences in shrines and temples as well as rituals the faithful perform in their visits to these fantastic places. This really is a "must do" experience for young and old alike... worth every yen!

Unique and great experience, feels like in the Old Edo times!. It was a wonderful expérience, its a must-do if you plan to go in Japan! The staff of Ebisuya Asakusa provided us an unexpected warm welcome and we feel touched by their kindness. They wrote on a board some nice words in french and they can say few words in french !! Thanks to Kazuki-san! He was such an enthusiatic and happy driver , i recommend him!!Antoine the go-pro touriste!Tcvb tour
Good experience . Try out to go round asakura and save time.ประหยัดเวลาในการเที่ยวชมในรอบบริเวณ asakusa คนลากจะบรรยายสถานที่เป็นภาษาญี่ปุ่น

Excellent service!. My husband and I had been to Tokyo countless times but this was our first time taking rickshaw at Asakusa. It was a great experience and we had lots of fun. The staff speaks good English and our guide, Namatame Taku was very friendly and informative. If you haven't take rickshaw ride in Japan before, I suggest you give it a try, you won't regret it!

Wonderful morning - excellent "driver". 10 of us booked 5 Rickshaws for a tour around the Asakusa area of Tokyo - Ebisuya company were most efficient - everything was ready and waiting for us. All five of our drivers were very informative and a lot of fun - our driver Akifumi Yamamoto was just super.An excellent way to get a feeling of old Tokyo - lots of fun.

Unique experience. Nice view. Grest service .. The team spoke good English. The diver, Kohei, was informative and friendly. Asakusa area has its charm and riding cart really just an icing on the cake.

If you do just 1 thing in Tokyo, let this be it!. Asakusa is the last bastion of ancient Edo you can experience in the bustling metropolis that is Tokyo. Having said that, it's a labyrinth. There is much to see, so you need someone who knows the area well to show you around. What better way to travel than in a traditional rickshaw, where your rickshaw puller is your guide! This immerses you right into antiquity.The moment I, my husband and children exited Asakusa Metro Station, we were greeted by Ryo, an affable Ebisuya rickshaw puller/guide, who explained in detail where he could take us and gave us options of timings and rates offered. We opted for the 1 1/2 hour trip so we could have good views of the Sky Tree, see the Asahi Beer Sculpture, experience the Samurai & Geisha Districts and visit 3 Major Shrines, including the Maneki Neko & Sensoji Temples, with a drop off at the traditional Nakamise shopping street.Ryo was joined by Tatsuki and off we went, in 2 rickshaws. Tatsuki was so much fun, regaling the kids with his antics, jokes and experimental photo taking. Ryo, who has studied in Canada, had an in depth knowledge of every place and area we visited.At the end of our tour we were reluctant to get off the rickshaws as the tour was more than what we had bargained for. An immersive, unforgettable, experience.Even though we have experienced this, we are definitely planning on doing another tour with Ebisuya Rickshaws on our next visit to Tokyo, specifically with Ryo and Tatsuki and for the longest possible time!- Felicia Variava Albert, Managing Director

Friendly and informative. My friend and I took this rickshaw ride with Shota Nishikawa (who asked us to call him Nishi).He was very friendly and had many stories about the sites around Sensoji temple. I highly recommend this ride. Nothing but goodness! And we got a free fall sticker and post cards too!

What an experience. Was very busy when we got there and I was specifically looking for these guys. Ryo approached me but I wasn't sure who he worked for, in the end I confirmed he was with Ebisuya. Ryo was great, in fact they were all very good - very professionally, friendly and made us feel comfortable. Thank you Ryo! This was a great way to explore parts of the nearby areas and also get local knowledge. We got taken to the shrines and learnt some of the history behind them. We also got a chance to go around the Geisha town. It was such a lovely and hot day as well, and we were cruising through the streets in open air as it got dark...magical. It was probably one of the most expensive trips during the visit but was definitely worth the experience. I would highly recommend these guys and budget for this!

Wonderful experience. Our driver was Yuta and he was the most likeable person we could ask for. He was very polite and has a very warm personality which my sister and I liked. He would always ask if we are doing okay and if the ride is going smoothly for us. We took the 30 minute ride under the drizzling weather. But Yuta made sure we were always comfortable. He spoke good English and was well informed and had great stories to tell along with the mandatory info. Thank you Yuta for the amazing tour!

Awesome experience. I went there with my friend and we had a blast. Itsuki was over guide, he was very nice, giving us good information and his English was very good as well. I'd recommend him and his service. Thank you "Sushi" ;)

Ride through Asakusa. Kazuki was our driver... Very fun ride...! Pleasant, knowledgable about the neighborhood..enthusiastic fellow! We love Asakusa... It was our second visit and as we were tired.... It was so nice to take the rickshaw... Which was comfy and nice.

Rickshaw ride in Asakusa. Fun way to learn about Asakusa and Tokyo, amazing half hour ride, thoroughly enjoyed the experience. K was very informative and friendly and took good pictures, thank you K. Definitely recommend it.

Fantastic way to sightsee!. A fun way to start your morning with the Ebisuya Asakusa Jinrikisha guys, Sawada and Takeda! We did the 30 minutes ride around and they customised the route according to where we wanted to end up. Shige knows English and was extremely funny, so my husband and I were entertained throughout the whole ride. If you want to really learn about the history of Asakusa and Tokyo, this is really quite an interesting way to do it. Also, they will take great photos for you if you have your phone! We were able to see real geishas having tea in the oldest 'kisa-ten'/ coffee shop, which apparently very rare!
Thank you Daisuke!!!. It was such an amazing experience...We love every second of the tour, it was very informative and enjoyable:) Looking forward to visit Geisha town next time...

Great Experience!!!. Thank you to Taku, Hiro, Kohei, for a wonderful experience through the streets of Asakusa...highly recommended if visiting the area. The guys were very friendly and the tour was informative as they certainly know the area well.Thanks again it was the highlight of the day!!

A highlight of our day!. We had so much fun riding with Keita!! He told us about the city and took us through more local, less touristy areas and to a beautiful, small, less well known temple that we had all to ourselves. The temple was rare in that it was for both Buddhists and Hindus. He helped us get our fortunes and read them to us, explained everything in the temple and showed us how to pray there. He was adorable, spoke english very well and was a highlight of our day!

It was good experience.. My girlfriend and I took Japanese traditional taxi(I'm not sure that name). And our driver was Kazuki. He is really kind and professional in photo! Thanks to him, we had good time. Find him in Tokyo.

Great experience!. I had no intention of doing this, but after a huge day sightseeing, I decided to take a ride! What a fantastic time! My guide, Akitaka, was excellent! He made the experience highly enjoyable! He was very knowledgeable and his English was excellent! I would highly recommended this, it's definitely worth it!

Good experience . Originally just wanted to find ways to Skytree from Sensoji on the map. After the driver Kazuki(德澄一輝) very sincere to introduce a 30-minute sightseeing trip, my husband and I are interested , Mr Kazuki very polite, clear descriptions of each attraction, he used many effects to take photo for us,very professional. GoTokyo many times, this time I was most memorable

Great view of asakusa, wonderful guide.. Me and a friend were interested as soon as we saw men carrying wagons around, but we didn't have much time. We talked to one of the advertisers standing in the street and agreed to take the shortest route (for 4000 yen), because we we had limited time. We met with a wonderful guide, Ryoma. He spoke very good english and talked to us during most of the trip, but gave us time to simply watch as well. He stopped some places where he knew we would get a nice view and told us the history of several of the places we stopped. He made jokes and answered our questions with ease, and he was generally really pleasant as a guide.Would reccommend this to everyone who wants a unique experience as well as a nice view of Asakusa, with some info about the main attractions :)

Highlight of my day. You must do this if you are a visitor to Tokyo. The rickshaw ride was on our list of things to do in Tokyo and it totally exceeded my expectations. Our guides were Kazuki Aki and Jun. They are very knowledgeable on the area and customs and are beautiful people. Next trip I will make sure I have more time for a longer ride. Thank you again it was the highlight of my birthday.

Excellent experience. We decided to take the 30min rickshaw tour on a whim and couldn't be happier.Our guide was Kazuki and he was amazing. Great personality, very good English and very helpful in taking photos of us and explaining local sights and history.I would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to Asakusa!かずきさん，ありがとうございました!!!

A Great Experience. I decided to go on the Rickshaw tour on a whim. It looked fun and interesting. My guide was Kengo-san. He was fun and inquisitive. Very friendly and informative. I learnt a lot on the tour. His English was really good and he was all smiles the whole time. I would recommend the Ebisuya Rickshaw rides to anyone looking for a fun and insightful experience.Thank you!!
Fun to do. . It's only 30 minutes but with every minute. The driver (runner) called Leo did a fabulous job showing us parts of the old town and took time for pictures. A must attraction in Tokyo.

Rickshaw tour. We took a rickshaw ride on Tuesday 13.10 and our guide was a young man who was studying Japanese history at uni. He was very knowledgable and gave us a great tour and explained the areas to us. He was very polite and was happy to take photos at various locations. Thankyou for a great and fun tour.

Wonderful experience . Had a great time enjoyed learning about asakusa and the geisha area from your amazing guide who is well suited to his chosen path of studying japanese history have some great photos sorry i cannot attach as on my camera thank you so much i will spread the word in sydney Australia

A very great experience. We were to Asakusa for to visit one of the greatest temple in Tokyo when we saw lots and lots of jinrikishas. I personally wanted to ride in one of them because I thought it will be awesome. Well, we rode for a 10 minutes walk with Ryoma, a very, very kind man, who drive one of those jinrikishas. His English was very, very good and he explained to us lots of things. It was a very, very, very great experience. I dind't imagine how much I would enjoy riding in jinrikishas. I'm very grateful to Ryoma. He was very kind, very nice and likeable. Ryoma, if you are reading this, arigato gozaimasu for your ride!! ¡Gracias por todo!*Best Couple*

Once in a life time experience! Awesome!. My husband, 10mon old baby and I had a fabulous time with Yuma who was our driver/tour guide. We went on a 30min tour, had an amazing experience and such a great time! I would highly recommend this 30min tour to go around Asakusa. (Not too long not too short). Yuma was flexible of our requests where we wanted to go. (Saw the best view of Sky Tree) He is funny and very knowledgable.

"Very cool experience with some nice eye candy". Myself and 3 of my co-worker, went on one of these rides and really enjoyed our self's. The young men Masa and Subaru were a joy to be around. We also enjoyed hearing the history of the area they took us to. I would recommend this to anyone. The only downer was it was not long enough and for the price, that was questionable, the price for the ride and the length of time we were on the ride didn't match, it was 2 quick.

Awesome town around Asakusa. Kazuki took us around Asakusa to the Asakusa temple. He is a friendly, energetic and entertaining tour guide. I would highly recommend this if you are near Asakusa and have an hour to spare.

Best experience in Tokyo. Wow is all I have to say. We took the time after seeing the 5 star reviews of this company to catch the train to see them. We were so lucky to be given Kristi as our driver who is Japanese/US. She gave us the experience of a lifetime with her great smile and knowledge of the geisha area and her tour of the temple and all the Japanese traditions and even translating our fortunes! Can not recommend highly enough

Fun Way to See Asakusa!. This was a neat way to visit the town, temples and back roads of Asakusa with a knowlegeable, English-speaking rickshaw guide! We went through the Asakusa geisha district, old neighborhoods and one of the oldest shrines in Tokyo. Our guide, Tatsuki Tsuji was so friendly and took photos of us at interesting stops. We'd recommend asking for "Tats" as your rickshaw guide!
Awesome . One of the coolest experience I ever had. Thank you A lot of them could speak English and some even knows Chinese. 知識が多くて、話を聞いていてとても面白くて素晴らしいです本に載ってない穴場のお店なんかも教えて下さってとても良かったです。

Thank you Kengo-san. Love the tour.. We had the 30 minutes tour and our rickshaw driver really makes it fun.. He speaks perfect English and he really explains all the history well to us.. Thank you for the experience!!!

A wonderful experience. We went on a 30 minute tour through the city today and it was bloody amazing! We learnt more from our guide in that 30 mins than we had for 3 days walking around on our own. Their English was very good and they were very entertaining. They were excellent to our 2 children and it was an experience that will be with us for a lifetime. Would highly recommend, was worth every cent!!! Masa and Ryoma- We thank you!

Lovely tour. I loved doing this rickshaw tour in Asakusa. It was so worth it and your learn a lot about the area. The tour I went on was to Geisha town which is a really nice and quiet area but not too far from the Asakusa Shrine and Sensoji Temple. I especially liked my rickshaw driver Masa. He was so kind, really knew the area well and an awesome photographer. If you are ever in Asakusa I definitely recommend taking the rickshaw!

Have a great tour with the rickshaw. Enjoying the rickshaw and the tour..specially my rickshaw driver, she is amazing..her name is Tomomi.She is very strong and very kind person...arigato gozaimasu Tomomi san

A brilliant way to see more of Asakusa. I did the rickshaw tour basically because all the boat trips were cancelled. It was the best decision. It was like a good friend shows you around, with lots of information and good explanations.I was so pleased with it, I had to do a longer, second tour during my tow weeks in Japan.The visit of the Imado Shrine was lovely and my rickshaw driver Tomomi told me how to make a wish. The two tours definately are in the top 5 of my favorit memories.I'd like to say again thank you to Tomomi for the great tour.
Renny and Jenny Japan trip. He is really handsome 好開心！a nice trip. We really enjoy the tripyou should come here.! You must come here to have such a wonderful experience !find 龍馬！he is a great guy

Great Rickshaw Tour in Asakusa. I was visiting the Senso-Ji Temple in Asakusa with my girlfriend and hadn't booked any tours and was planning to wing it. Before crossing over to the main gate one of the many rickshaw drivers(Ocean) in the area approached me about taking possible tour. I usually don't go for solicitations plus we are both bigger in size so I wasn't sure about the seating. But he had a good "sell" and assured our size/weight wouldn't be any issue. We could have "probably" squeezed into one rickshaw but Ocean offered a second for same price. Our Second driver (Yuma) came and away we went. It was really cool once we got going and I instantly knew it was good decision. We did short tour that was about 15mins but it was amazing and filled with information about the area and temple that we wouldn't have know by wondering around. We also got some terrific photos on our phones thanks to our drivers. I would highly recommend doing this tour and a Rickshaw ride in Japan will be one thing you can scratch off your bucket list.

A wonderful tour of Asakusa. This Rickshaw tour of Asakusa was recommended to me by a friend, and I am so glad I took his advice. My friend and I took a one hour tour and had the most delightful guide who spoke English very well. He pointed out the various sites along the route, explained the history, and was a wonderful photographer as well so we could have a proper memory of the day. I am just sorry I can't remember our guides name (started with a T') but I have attached a photo - he was truly patient with us and very entertaining and informative. I highly recommend this wondeful attraction.

A tour to remember . Visiting my son and this was one tour he took me on. I loved our driver Kristi! She was a wealth of information. I learned a great deal about the Japanese culture. She stopped and took time for photos numerous times. And spoke perfect English. Telling us the history of the different areas all the while pulling both of us in the hot sun, She made sure we were comfortable even giving us fans to keep! I would recommend her to anyone interested in taking this fun and fact filled tour.

Absolutely Amazing . Wish I could give this experience more than just 5 stars!!!! My mum and I went for the 2 hour rickshaw ride with Tatsuki! He was such a wonderful driver who was talkative, informative, funny and able to show us shrines and temples we would have never found ourselves!!!! I would highly recommend this activity as it is fun and you are able to experience the gorgeous Asakusa without all the hassle of figuring out where to go.

Great tour. We booked this on line before we left home and agree with the reviews - it is well worth doing - a unique experience not to be missed. Taka was our rickshaw driver and took great care, lots of great photos of us at different iconic spots and pointed out things we would not have seen or known about without a local guide. He went out of his way to end the tour at the Kappabashi Dogugai Street (kitchen street) that we wanted to visit, and allowed my husband to have a special photo opportunity.

Amazing experience. Coming from an island of Guam and first time visit to Japan. This ride was an eventful experience. Although my friends and I were hesitant, we thought lets just give it a shot. #YOLO you only live once. How we saw it? We were touring around asakusa as we came out from the train station. First thing was them, it caught our eyes and their customer service was great. They really did get us to ride this rickshaw. Shout out to Hikaru. Language barrier wasn't bad, our driver spoke broken English but it as good enough for us to understand. Tour guide about the places surrounding us was awesome. We got to visit after it was done. Overall, it was worth the ride. Kudos!!

Fun ride!. The two drivers, Lee & Nao, who took my family and me to a rickshaw tour were just great! They gave us an extensive explanation of the history of Asakusa throughout the one-hour tour and took us to the oldest temple in the area, which became one of the most memorable events in Japan for my eleven-year-old daughter. Although I am myself a Japanese, there were lots of things I could learn from the tour; my husband and daughter, who are Americans, were just fascinated by the new experiences (including being on the rickshaws). It was a very hot day in August, and yet, the two drivers did not show any sign of exhaustion. They were energetic and dedicated drivers/guides who tried to know what we were interested in and answer all the questions that we had. Of course, the ride is pricey, but for a great memory during the visit to Tokyo, it was worthwhile using this service.

Awesome trip. Went on a rickshaw for the first time today and it was really good. The driver, Hiro, was very good and spoke good enough English for me to understand. Did the shortest trip for 12 min and it felt longer as it didn't feel rushed at all and good information about the visited area was provided. All in all I'd recommend this attraction, big thumbs up for everybody working.

Rickshaw Ride. My wife and I had a wonderful experience. We booked thru Viator, was gotten in touch with immediately, sent easy directions from our hotel. When we arrived at the designated meeting place there was a young man with a large sign with our names on it. We were very warmly greeted, escorted to where the rickshaws were and introduced to our driver. He warmly greeted us, gave a quick synopsis and off we went. Our driver was great. He spoke English very well having spent a year in Wisconsin in college their. We stopped often and he took many pictures of us at various sights. The entire experience was just GREAT!

fun ride an great "driver"!. Visiting Tokyo, a rickshaw ride in Asakusa area is a must....Our driver Kasuki, spoke in excellent english, witty and talkative he made this tour very enjoyable and mostly interesting. Do book him on your visit!

Masaii, You're the Best! Thank you!. Our driver is amazing and fun! He shared with us his extensive knowledge of Asakusa and its history. But most importantly he pointed out all the great places to eat. After an hour of touring around this wonderful place, he dropped us off in front of a place where you can drink matcha beer! It was delicious and refreshing. Ask for Masaii when you're in Asakusa for a fun and enjoyable rickshaw ride!

Fun ride on a rickshaw. We were in the area to see a nearby temple when the kids spotted the rickshaws outside the station. They loved the ride and the guide was very nice, helpful and informative and seemed to get on really well children. The guide spoke decent English and offered quite a few facts about the various buildings and places along the route and even helped take a few photos at interesting spots. There was no rush, everything done to ensure a comfortable rude and I think pretty good value given the searing conditions these guys were working in. The kids give it a thumbs up!

Awesome trip !. Been a month in Japan . Just had time to have visit to Asakusa. Going back to Malaysia soon another 2 weeks. Really amazing and awesome place. Just arrived at station then walk to asakusa town been approached with one guy explain about rickshaw. Really good approached and good english. Because of the way his explained and promote the tour we decide to take the tour. We take 2 rickshaw because we have 4 people. His friend also very good in english. Both of them very friendly , helpful and have good knowledge about local area. I had good and awesome trip to asakusa. This both guys really make me want to come again. Thanks so much and thank for their had work ! Both of them really good. Good Job MASAKI and RYO. Both of you make my trip and friends memorable !

First rickshaw ride. My friend took me and her family, five rickshaws all in all, and we had fun. Our guides spoke English and were very helpful and friendly.My guide was a lady, that surprised me.She was very friendly, cute, and strong...My friends had a good time.

Awesome Rickshaw Ride!. The best way to explore Asakusa is to take a ride on the rickshaw ride. And i'm glad that we chose Ebisuya Asakusa. Our drivers are the most friendliest people that I've ever met. We took the half an hour ride. Our drivers were Kin and Yoppy. They brought us to all the highlight places in Asakusa and explained to us history of the place. They also help us to pics of us with the pretty background. They were very cheerful, funny and making our ride very enjoyable. We will definitely come and visit you all again!PS: Yoppy has gotta be the most funniest person I've ever met. I hope he will achieve his dream of becoming the No. 1 entertainer in Japan. LOL.

Rickshaw ride in Asakusa from Kazuki. My sister Sarah and I decided to give the rickshaw ride a try from Kazuki ( I hope I spelled your name right ). We decided to go with Kazuki as he came off very friendly and funny. We opted for the 30 minutes even though we had walked through most of the routes. Kazuki was awesome speaking Japanese and English ( knowing that we are visiting from California ). He showed us stores that I didn't know about and explained in detail about the area. We had an amazing experience and we both hope to come back and ride the rickshaw again as a tradition. ^_^

Definitely worth it. Wish I would've booked longer. . If you're on the fence about this, don't be. My brother, and I did a 1 hour ride and wish we booked the 2 hours. When we got go Asakusa station, the scene was pretty hectic, but luckily enough a coordinator at Ebisuya found us and prepped us for the trip. He introduced us to Yuma our English speaking driver and because we booked online we had a sign waiting for us with our names on it. Yuma had great stories and it felt more like a conversation with a friend than a tour which we loved. Yuma if you're reading this I tried to buy you an Asahi but I ran out of cash and no place took credit card in the area!

Very nice tour. Yesterday I visited Asakusa for the first time with my family, when I got there I didn't know what are the good places to see and where to start until I found these guys, Masa and Remi where our tour guides, they took us arround town, took some good pictures and told us some history back ground, they were really nice, my family and I had a wonderful time.

Amazing experience. Absolutely an amazing experience! We attended the 45 mins tour with Mr. Kazuki. Through he's guide, we've saw and knew more about Asakusa area. It's really great and we enjoy the trip a lot!

A truly amazing experience!. We had such a great time on our 30 minute rickshaw ride that we wished we'd booked ourselves on a longer tour. Our rickshaw runners, Keita and Tatuki, were informative, funny, friendly and skilled in their job. It was great seeing some well known sites in Asakusa and also some beautiful traditional side streets we wouldn't have ventured down on our own. It was pricey but well worth the money for such a unique and amazing experience
I had a lot of fun 😍. It was a wonderful experience in Tokyo , the best thing is the man how ride the bike he speak English well and he so kind , you should try it ❤️

Fabulous experience!!. I booked a 30 minute ride just before leaving Osaka, as we did not have much planned for the Tokyo leg of our trip to Japan. Well, this turned out to be one of the best last minute decisions ever. It was funny that the rickshaw guy we spoke to while we were trying to find the pick up point turned out to be one of Ebisuya's people, and he held up the huge welcome sign with my name on it. Very corny, but also very cute and funny.Our driver, Masaki, was excellent!! So friendly and knowledgeable, and always smiling. He kept us well entertained throughout the ride. He showed us places that we would not have seen if we had just wandered around Asakusa on our own. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our ride. Thank you, Masa, for a wonderful ride.

An unforgettable experience of the traditional side of Tokyo. This is not to be misses! There are many ways to see Asakusa area in Tokyo, but definitely taking a rickshaw ride is the best in my opinion. The sights that your driver will show you, the things that he will tell you about the area exceed any travel book, but instead stream from the native wisdom. (Here I want to thank to my driver, Reo, because his smile made my day beautiful.)As most of the people taking the ride are Japanese, this is certainly not just a touristic experience. Also, I recommend renting or purchasing a yukata from a nearby show and wearing it on the ride, thus making unforgettable memories as you have traveled back in time. Note! The driver will take the most amazing pictures of you on the rickshaw so definitely bring a camera with you.

MUST DO IT!. at first i didn't expect much about this BUT my friends and i were totally enjoyed this! we took only 45 minutes but it was really worth it! My guide was Masaki-san, who can speak really good english and extreamly friendly! he always smile even it was raining so much. His service was the best! thank you so much! i definitely come back and will try in other season for sure.
Ricksaw ride in tokyo. Nice trip to try ricksaw. We took a 30 minute ride in asakusa. Good attitude, fine itinerary and reasonable priceThanks driver , Masa

Great time. Hikaru was a great driver and tour guide! Do it. Feel like old Tokyo! He took time to explain the tourist things we including the Cherry Trees, without blossoms this time of year. Great time.
A great ride with Masa !. All those monuments were nice to see. Masa-kun explanation about the monuments and temples were really a plus.

Worth your time and money. Not to be missed!. Amazing experience! Our Guide's name was Ryo - such a friendly and talkative guy :) definitely one of my favourite experiences in Japan. Would totally do it again!

龍馬君あなたを苦労しました. Sorry for a bit late to update.We have a lot of joy with Ryoma kun at 17-7-15 ,this a amazing experience for a short ride to sensoji temple.He is a very friendly tour guide and knowledgeable in the area explain all questions we asked .Also he is very helpful to take lots of photo for us. (the photo looks so good !! )Absolutely no need to worry about the communication problem ,he talk fluent English.また会いしたい

An experience not to be missed. Went to visit Asakusa for a second day and decided to try a rickshaw ride. Takuto Tsuji was a wonderful guide. He was informative, humorous and made the trip entirely worthwhile. Thoroughly recommend the experience while in Asakusa.

Thanks to DAISUKU IMANO !. Daisuke Imano was a really good guy !and a very good Traveler guide , we enjoyed too much with him !Thanks for this Road , thanks for this wonderful visit , your Kindness , your Smile and your widsom .You putted smile on this Raining day , we will never forget you !Chloe&Yessine
good times is asakusa. We rode with Lee and he was very knowledgable and friendly to my friend and I. Loved every second of our tour. Would totally do it again.

Favourite experience! . My boyfriend and I went to Tokyo for 9 days, one of those days we spent in Asakusa. We had just gotten there and walked up the station steps when we were greeted by rickshaw drivers. They were so friendly, spoke great English (bonus for us), and gave us tour options. We had a driver called Aki (excuse my spelling if it's wrong) he was such a beautiful soul! He was funny, had great knowledge of the area and history, offered to take photos for us at various locations and you could tell he was so genuine and happy to be helping us explore. We had great conversations with him and I thought it was beautiful how much he enjoyed his job! Although there are many different rickshaw companies, every driver we passed was so friendly, it was such a great atmosphere! Deciding to do a rickshaw tour was definitely our favourite experience of the trip, Aki made our trip all the more wonderful and memorable and we hope to see him again next time for a new adventure! It was an unexpected little treasure and were leaving a piece of our heart in Asakusa x

Our Guide - Mr. Masa. In the bustling area at the main gate meeting point, you see many of the Ebisuya staff around. We went up to one and told them our names, and immediately they recognized us and pointed us in the right direction. We then found one of the coordinators who welcomed us with our names on poster board. We had a wonderful time with Mr. Masa as our guide in Asakusa, Tokyo. He spoke great English and had a wonderful personality. Very cheerful, positive, and wonderful energy. He says he loves his job and envisions he will do this for some time to come, which shows in his positive attitude, which I think matters a lot for these types of experiences. You want a guide who is happy doing what they are doing, and he is definitely that kind of guide. He shared with us his knowledge about the history and facts of all the different sites we saw. He stopped to take a lot of photos for us.We were able to visit a number of interesting sights during our two hour tour, including Asahi Beer Hall, a temple, geisha house, stopped for a famous local snack, saw a local bath house, traditional Tokyo comedy theater, Sky Tree, and back to the main temple where the tour started. Since our whole trip to Tokyo was very short, we wanted to cover as much ground as possible. It is very difficult to take in all of Japan in one weekend, you definitely need a week to properly give it justice, however, when time is tight, this gets the job done in a great way. You only have time to visit one temple to walk around, but the purpose of this is to see the area by rickshaw and revisit all those areas on your own. Or if you want to do a full day, Mr. Masa said he is happy to do that as well.I also enjoy the fact that this is a highly sustainable business, low carbon footprint and also feels great supporting local business. Would definitely recommend this to people visiting Tokyo for the first time.Thank you again for a great time, Mr. Masa. You were and are tremendous and appreciate your kind hospitality for our trip.
A ride that makes you see history.. A great ride, great service, a bit pricey but in the end the experience you will have is a well worth!

It's a wonderful trip. Sung and Yasu are very nice guys. They gave us a joyful tour and nice tour introduction. All our family members liked their valuable service and we look forward to see them in the near future.

Awesome tour!. We had Masaya as our guide. Very good English which was a welcome surprise. Very knowledgeable about anything we needed to know about the area and showed us things we wouldn't know about if we were to just walk around on our own like famous buildings and a whale restaurant. 100% would recommend to anyone visiting the area.
Great customer service!. Really impressed from the service, everyone was friendly and the places and explanations for the places were more than expected! Ask for Tatsuki, great friendly driver :D

A great experience!. My family and I had an amazing time during our little excursion with Taka, Reo, and Ryuma today. All 3 gentlemen were so friendly and gave us a great tour of Aasakusa. Their English is impeccable. And all 3 were very funny too! Asakusa is more than the Senso-ji temple and it's grounds. I highly recommend Ebisuya Asakusa to anyone visiting the area. Especially Taka, Reo, and Ryuma! Thank you guys for a great day!!

Unexpected Rickshaw ride. Riding on the rickshaw was not part of the plan, but it was one of the best things to do in Tokyo. Our driver Daiki Kin was very nice, he took great care of us, tho that day was raining, he worked so hard to show us around, answer our questions, took pictures for us. Couldn't have asked for a better rickshaw driver! Thank you Daiki (King)

热情、友善的Masaya先生. We love our driver Mr.Masaya very,very much!到达浅草后，许多工作人员非常热情的接待了我们～～我们非常喜欢我们的Driver Masaya先生，他非常热情、非常风趣，一路上为我们介绍了浅草的吃喝玩乐！还时不时停下来为我们拍照！我们的女儿Bella对Masaya先生尤其喜欢，不停的跟我们说：“下次来日本还要来找超级可爱的Masaya叔叔！”We hope to see Mr. Masaya again.Amazing experience! We love Asakusa!
You should try it!. The rickshaw driver was very sweet and polite. He did his best to show us around, and we very much enjoyed the experience. I highly recommend it.
Awesome city tour. We had the wonderful rickshaw ride. Our drivers were Tatsuki and Naoki. They are very friendly and fluent in English.

Asakusa Trip. I like the driver of our today's tripHis English ability is higher than the average of Japanese peopleAnd he is full of passionI think his name is 龍馬For a Taiwanese tourists,he speaks a little Chinese,which makes us really surprise.(And also there is a very handsome California Boy!)

Great experience! . We hadn't planned on taking a rickshaw ride, but we sure are glad that we did! We had just gotten off a Sumida River cruise and were figuring out how to get to Senso-ji when we were approached by one of our drivers, Shintaro Yoshida. He recruited another driver, Masaya Sato (who, upon hearing where we were from, promptly showed me his cell phone case, which was from our hometown fooball team back in the US where he had done a college foreign exchange!). Let me tell you - these guys were amazing! Funny, excellent English, and great tour guides. And amazingly athletic - after pulling us through the streets, talking loudly enough for us to hear the whole while, these guys weren't even winded! And my two teenage daughters loved the fact that all of the drivers they saw were "super cute and muscly". If you're ever in Asakusa, take ride. Ask for Masaya and Shintaro!

Relaxed rickshaw tour of the area. We stumbled upon this by accident. The guide was charming and funny, so we decided to give it a try and did not regret it. Taiki was our guide, and he was awesome. He was always smiling, not afraid to have a casual conversation and generally a nice guy. Spoke english well and made an otherwise OK tour amazing. Highly reccomended!

Fantastic experience !!. We had great time with Masa, he's very friendly, informative and fluent in English. And he's incredibly strong !!! We will definitely take another ride if we visit Tokyo next time ^_^

Excellent experience ever ^_^. Never had this kind wonderful experience with them n also provide excellent service by the guy name "Leon", we all family were so enjoy the tour around the city n also accompany with perfect weather!

Amazingly insane...!!!!. We four friends visited Tokyo and met these guys RYO And MASA. We took 45 min ride and we felt like top of the world. From starting , making us feel like KINGS and then were our drinks and the lovely streets of Tokyo. They showed us crazy places and made us feel special. I strongly recommend everyone to go for it once in Tokyo. Special thanks to the guys ryo and masa, U made our day....Regards

getting around of old city of Tokyo. It is my first time in Tokyo and it is one of my bucket list to do in Japan!I did for 45 minutes from in front of Asakusa Tourist Center all the way trough Samurai Village, Geisha Town and all the way back to the first place. The driver was TATSUKI TSUJI and he fluent in English and he is good at take pictures! Even he told me a lot of places to eat a very good and famous restaurants in Asakusa Area.  I would definitely recommend to get this amazing attraction and also to get him as your driver :)

Excellent tour of Asakusa. We did not plan on using any service, but met them at the exit from the train station. Great service, they had us headed off around the city in no time at all. We got photos at the sites, information about the city and a great overview of the history. They even made a first stop at a restroom, customer service first.Nanako Konishi was our driver and she was excellent. Thanks to her, we not only got a great tour, people were taking photos of us and our female driver. I would recommend getting her as your driver if possible. I recommend at least the 45 minute package to see the site. They take credit card, which is very helpful.

Transportation by #ninjas. Amazing experience! We stopped by Nakamise street and found the Rickshaws! It's a great way to experience Japanese culture and tradition. Our drivers were Tatsuki and Ryoma. They took us from the shopping street of Nakamise to Sky Tree. And along the way, they explained different sights around the city, they suggested where to go and visit and what other things we might find fun. They were very friendly and offered to stop anywhere to take pictures. They spoke English very well. Five stars for great service, and outstanding personalities and character. Arigato. We are definitely going to take a tour again with the rickshaws on our next trip.
Awesome tour. Day 2 in Tokyo. This is a best way from Asakusa to the Skytree. Driver with passion and fluently english. Highly recommend:)

Perfect!. We have good experience from riding Rickshaws at Kamakura. Akifumi Yamamoto take a good care of us. He's speaks very good in English. He showed us very good interesting places in Kamakura. Thank you very much Moti san.

Rickshaw Travel. We took a rickshaw ride around Asakusa. Our driver was Ryoma, although he spoke limited English, his tour was interesting, historical and fun. Recommend it to everyone. He took some great pictures of us in the carriage near interesting sites.

Ride with Ryosuke Ishii!. The ride with Ryosuke I took to the Tokyo sky tree was wonderful. He was very kind and very knowledgeable in the area and also in English! It was a wonderful experience I will never forget! Thanks Ryosuke! It was worth every bit of time and money!
Coolest rickshaw ride!. We had a fantastic ride with Masa on the rickshaw! Very friendly and informative service! Will definitely do it again!!

Rickshaw at Asakusa & Sanja Matsuri. Well, our ride on a rickshaw at Asakusa and the Sanja Matsuri festival was not scheduled, but fortunately it took place and it was awesome. We went through the festival, we were side by side with the people who participated with mikoshis, and it was wonderful. Mr. Taikai Saitou was very nice, explained the history of the festival and Asakusa, he was excellent! Congratulations and keep up the good work!A very very very good experience indeed!

Highlight of our Asakusa experience!. When we arrived at the train station I was surprised to see our names on a sign and two friendly faces waiting for us. Our driver, Masa, was really energetic and always had a smile which made the experience that much better. The tour was amazing! Masa really knew a lot about every place he showed and even took pictures of us in front of some of the most notable places. His added humor was a bonus! Once we head over to Kyoto, we're looking forward to ride with their service again! Thank you for the experience! :)

Great experience. We arrived Asakusa Station and were greeted by friendly staff explaining the service and price. It's a hot late spring day and we decided to take advantage of the ride service instead of sweating walk around the district. We requested English speaking "driver" and were introduced to Mr. Masaya Sato. Masaya is very fluent in English and took us to the spots where regular tourists may not reach and gave us the history of the Asakusa district. After our ride time we ended at Senso-Ji, the most popular attraction of Asakusa. During the ride, Masaya stopped at several places and took the photos for us. He is very careful driving us around to ensure the ride is safe and smooth. Like the States, anything involved with professional services aren't cheap, but I would recommend the ride to any tourist who enjoyed the cultural expedition since it worth every penny.

Excellent way to experience Asakusa and it's surrounding. Our family of 4 went on 2 rickshaws with Ocean and Yudai. Both of them speak excellent English and are very knowledgeable. They are both very friendly and managed to put our little ones at ease very quickly. Thanks for the discount card for subsequent rides, we are already planning our next ride in Kyoto.

Rickshaw ride with Yudai. Spoke English like a champ! Very entertaining and knew historical facts! He approached us as we walked by and really sold the rickshaw ride tour without pressure. We really enjoyed the ride and his enthusiasm! Ask for Yudai for a great rickshaw ride/tour guide!

Fun and entertaining way to sightsee old downtown Tokyo!. Booked the 2 hour tour for a family of four in two separate rickshaws. Requested for English speaking guides and to sightsee areas that would be interesting for kids. We had the best time! Our two guides were not only funny but very knowledgeable. Taught us not only about the history but traditional customs such as how to pray in a Shinto shrine vs a Buddhist temple. My favorite was the cat shrine, even saw a stubby tailed white cat wondering around! The 2 hour tour was very in depth so if you're looking for a general tour then the one hour would be sufficient. I think the 2 hour was definitely worth it because my 10 year old got to ask a lot questions and we didn't feel rushed. I want to say special thanks to our guides, Akifumi Yamamot and Tatsuki Tsuji who made our first trip to Tokyo so awesome. Make sure to ask for them if you need English speaking guides.

Above and beyond. My girlfriend and I recently took this tour on our first day in Tokyo and it surpassed our expectations.First they were expecting us with a sign with my name on it, we arrived early and they were accommodating as to start the tour early. Our guide/driver was Sato (“Ocean” on previous reviews) who had a great attitude and who not only pointed out key sites but also cultural idiosyncrasies. Additionally he went out of his way to take some great pictures of us with a camera and cellphone. I have nothing but good things to say about the whole experience!
wonderful experience, well worth it. I was hesitant about going, but our driver Lee was knowledgeable and so very pleasantWe had a wonderful time and I recommend this highlyAllen and Jane

Rickshaw Ride. My wife and I had a very enjoyable Rickshaw Ride around Asukusa with a very friendly and knowledgeable driver called Ocean. We opted for the 30 minute ride costing 9000 Yen .An informative ride around the streets with several stops to point out something interesting and a different photo opportunity, many of the photos were taken by the driver for us

Princess Treatment. Fantastic experience!! We learned so much about famous sites in Tokyo and had a great tour guide. Our guide, Kazuki, made it fun and educational! In addition we got some great pics around Tokyo!

Very Unique and Fantastic experience in Asakusa.. Our driver was Masaya, he's very gentle and nice, also speaking very good English. We only bought a 15 mins tour because of our 3 years-old daughter, since this is her first time, we were afraid she has no enough patience to sit for a longer period. Since this is very good experience, She was very excited and happy. We will be sure to have a longer tour to know Asakusa better.Thank you Masaya.

Money well spent!!!. If you are looking for an amazing, unique experience while travelling in Asakusa don't go past Ebisuya Rickshaws. They are extremely friendly, helpful and professional. We only did a 30 minute tour and in that time our driver, Takagai, did an incredible job. Lots of photo opportunities and information about the area, and in English too. This was a highlight of my time in Tokyo!

The best way to know Asakusa. Our driver(?) was Akifumi Yamamoto.He was very friendly even my boyfriend is almost 110kg hahaWe enjoyed the time in Asakusa because we had different experience in Rickshaws!

Fantastic attraction. There are many different rickshaws operating in asakusa. We choose ebisuya because they had been friendly but not pushy when approaching us on previous trips and the day before when we didn't ride with them. 9000 yen for 30minutes seems expensive however the ride was so wonderful we might go again later in our trip this time and will definitely ride again next time we visit Japan. They provide a wondeful service of taking photos at various locations around asakusa on our own camera (no exorbitant professional photo fees so common at attractions) our daughter had so much fun waving at the pedestrians. The strength of these men and women operating these rickshaws are amazing and in the heat as well. Very impressive. The option of paying with credit card was a nice surprise and I took them up on it to preserve our precious cash. We went over the allotted 30minutes time and I began to worry that I would be forced to pay extra, but this was not the case, we had agreed upon the course before leaving and we completed this despite traffic lights causing delays. No extra charge for our 4 year old sitting on our laps.Wonderful, completing delightful!

Asakusa from a different perspective!. On a sunny day in April I visited Asakusa with my father and decided to use the rickshaw service to explore parts around the Kaminari-mon area. The staff stationed in the area was very friendly, helpful and informative. After they found out that my father speaks more French than English, the staff and guide greeted him in French and when taking pictures, counted down in french ("un-deux-trois- cheese!") We were pleasantly surprised by the efforts!Our guide Ryoma was funny, entertaining and knowledgeable of the area and its history, drew our attention on specific buildings and figurines (thieves on roofs) in the alleys, explaining what they meant. we saw the area from a totally different perspective from the rickshaw, and realized that although we just walked there half an hour before, we seem to have not noticed small details and the real character of Asakusa.We really enjoyed the ride and strongly recommend the service.

Fantastic. In Asakusa, Our driver was Kazuki and he speak English very well.As our family with 2 kids, we have really great time with Kazuki as he guiding us around the time with amazing history about the place, the Japanes culture, Geisha places and story. really entertainning, Kids love his story and lough all the way long. Lisa&Luke from Sydney

Fantastic :). I was traveling Japan with a young child and wouldn't have been able to see the area walking around. My 'driver' Tsuji was great, very friendly and informative. I would definately recommend to anyone visiting the area. Loved it.

Worth the Ride. It was a rainy day when we got invited to try the rickshaw ride. Our drivers were very friendly and accommodating and they knew much of the sites' history and story. Along the ride, you'll see a lot of locals milling the busy streets in Tokyo as well as get to see a side of Tokyo that would usually be not in your way as a tourist. It's fun to watch locals prepare for another busy day as well as get a glimpse of the everyday life of the people. Moreover, the sites seen are the ones that are worth visiting and those that have historical value in Tokyo. Lastly, the part that I enjoyed the most was talking to my driver. I learned a lot of things from him, especially about Tokyo. Overall, it was a great way to spend my 20 minutes in Japan and I even got to ride something that I think can only be found here! I wish it was longer to be honest (there are longer tours don't worry). Great places.Great people.Great service. Definitely a unique experience and definitely worth it! :) Note: our drivers were Yoshinaka-kun (with me) and Takagai-kun (with my sister and mom) :) thank you so much for your great service!

An excellent way to explore the city in comfort. It was raining hard that day so instead of doing a walking tour, we decided to hop on a rickshaw. Excellent value for money!Our guide Takagai was very friendly and entertaining. We learned a lot from him and he took excellent photos.We saw similar rickshaws in Kyoto. They have branches in select areas in Japan. I highly recommend you try it at least once. I especially found the ones in Kyoto really cute: ladies who rented out kimonos on a rickshaw ride around Gion. Looked authentic.

Awesome experience !. I had never heard and experienced this awesome ride before. I could have a chance to try in Japan when I visited my best friend. Masaki who drove for us was extremely kind and funny. He explained to us some very informative history of Japan while he was driving. I strongly recommend this ride ! :)

Great ride. My family took a short ride with this service while we stepped out of the Asakusa station. It turned out a ride of joy and comfort. They were very considerate to cover our legs with blankets and a platic cover to keep us warm and dry.
