The driver was very friendly, talks us through some famous spots along the route, although language may be a challenge if your driver does not speak good English. I would love to ride a longer tour next time.

Central Tokyo as you cycle through it.. Had an amazing morning cycling through central Tokyo learning to negotiate the streets and footpaths with our very attentive guide and safety first all the way. Noel is a native English speaker who was very informative about the history, culture and a first hand insight on living in Japan. We booked the half day tour online which was simple. An email reply with exact directions on how to get to the meeting point from our hotel. At the end we got directions to a sushi bar where only the locals go and it completed the experience. Would recommend this tour. If you can ride a bike you can manage this tour. A different perspective as you explore the city.
Intresting tour. The tour is compleet.Safety during the tour is a guaranteed.Historical and culturele knowledge of the guide is very good.The lunch at the Ramen restaurants is very nice.

Difficult review to write.. A few items about this tour. Cons: 1. Noel is with you the entire time, rushing you to move you along the tour. Our issue was that it was difficult to take pictures or walk away from Noel without him asking you to stay with the group. We felt we missed many opportunities to take photos. 2. His famous phrase is not to make any sudden moves while biking, I understand that, but when he say's this all day long, it get's old. Our group consisted of pretty much all adults, no children, but we felt as he was addressing or talking to his children. Pros: 1. He has excellent knowledge and if you like history...this is the tour to take. 2. Keeping you super safe. While under my cons, I complained about this, if you're worried about safety, don't...he's good at making sure that he keeps you safe. I wouldn't take this tour again, but if you really like history and need someone to make you feel safe while riding in Tokyo...Noel your guy.

Best day in Tokyo !. We originally booked for a half day tour, but ended up amending it to a full day excursion because we didn't want the tour to end. Noel chose fantastic stops, his enthusiasm and in-depth knowledge kept us fully entertained. Noel was extremely particular about the safety of riders. A stop for lunch at Noel's favorite local Ramen restaurant was the cherry on the top for me, Ramen will never be the same !

Must Do Tour for Tokyo!. Like another reviewer, we were lucky enough to have Noel to ourselves on a beautiful Saturday in Tokyo. Noel greeted us right on time and had provided extremely easy directions on how to find him. He immediately treated us like long lost friends and made the day so much more easy going by doing so. Noel started with biking basics and some general rules for the day. Afterwards, we had a quick test ride to ensure the bikes were functional (and us as well). At first, it was intimidating to be riding bikes in an unknown city, but Noel's instructions prior to the trip reassured us and it was probably the safest biking I've done in my life. (Tokyo has laws that protect bikers and they are strictly followed)As we only did the half day tour, its hard to imagine how much more could be packed in to a full day tour (but don't get me wrong, I know it would be worth it). Noel visited various Tokyo locations and stopped at interesting places to deliver information about Tokyo's culture and history. His fluency in Japanese combined with his knowledge on Japanese culture and history made it more than just any other tour. He encouraged us to ask questions and was able to answer each one and expand on them in most cases. We visited one of the most famous bridges in Tokyo, the fish market, the Tokyo Station, the Imperial Palace, and a beautiful Japanese garden. Each location Noel made sure we got great pictures (he's an amateur videographer so the pictures were awesome). Without a doubt, this tour was absolutely worth the time and money. My only suggestion is to do the tour EARLY in your trip. If it rains, you may be able to reschedule, and if not, getting the information about Tokyo and Japan up front will make the rest of your trip more valuable. Oh, and make sure you have Noel point you to the best place for Ramen in the city, it's fantastic!!!

Great tour. We were fortunate to have Noel all to ourselves on our cycling trip. Even though it was raining Noel provided us with full wet weather gear and it was lovely to be cycling in the light rain. Noel's insight into the Japanese people and their culture was very informative and has been invaluable to us throughout Japan. He takes extreme care and caution while cycling along the Tokyo streets. we felt safe the whole way. Thank you Noel

Nice stops . Every city we visit, we take bike tours (New delhi, Bangkok, ...). The day starts with a good explanation of all the rules. But this was for me the downside of the whole tour and made me feel like being in kindergarten. Noël is a very experienced guide and is very protective but a little too much: keeps on pointing out that you can move 5 cm more to the Side walk, crossing the street is like crossing a war zone (two by two or one long line). What really set me off whas at the imperial palace: somebody appeoaching us wasnt paying attention and he bumped into HIM really hard deliberately telling he Should focus... All the spots we visited were nice and really good and Noël really knows the Japanse history and way of life. So, I think with kids this is a fantastic Tour and you will feel really protected but as some how experienced and mature people this really gets on your nerves

Brilliant day!!. I had a fantastic day with 3 friends on this bike tour. It was great to see Tokyo from this perspective. Noel did a great job as a tour guide and really looked after us all. I would thoroughly recommend this as a must-do while holidaying in Japan...

Super-fun!. One of our favorite parts of our trip! You're in good hands with Noel! We did the half day tour and it was great mix of sites to see and places to ride (back streets, paths, main streets). At the end, I wished we'd done the full day tour. By luck he was able to accommodate our last minute request and was very helpful. The 3-speed and 6-speed bikes were in good shape and comfortable and a safety lesson beforehand boosted our confidence. Noel tailored the tour to our ride speed. He is very knowledgable about Tokyo and had great recommendations.

A Highlight of the Trip. This is a great way to see Tokyo and I highly recommend this tour!!! Being on a bike allowed us to see and cover quite a lot of ground, not only this but we had so much fun just zipping around the backstreets and main streets of Tokyo. We did the Cultural and Historical Biking Tour. Noel our guide took us to some great places, some that as a tourist you would not be able to find yourself. We did the tour early in our trip to get an idea of the city, which worked well. I would also recommend it to people who do not have much time and want pack in as much as possible.We had not ridden a bike in a while and required a little bit of time to get back into it, Noel was great in helping us and very patient. My sister who was traveling with our group has Autism, Noel was also fanatic engaging with her and giving her an extra support she may have needed.Booking the tour was very easy and also meeting up on the day was extremely easy. Noel very kindly helped us with what train line etc. I would not recommend trying to get around Tokyo on a bike by alone, it’s not worth the stress. Book this tour you will not be disappointed It was great meeting you Noel - all the best!

Must do in Tokyo. If you want to get a good overview of Tokyo do take this tour! Noel is great guide, full of knowledge and fun to be around. The cycling is always safe and you don't need to be an athlete.
Highly recommended!

An excellent and safe way to see Tokyo by bike. Our family of four including two active teenage boys, first went along to the cultural tour of Tokyo and we enjoyed it so much, we went on the waterfront tour 2 days later.We were very impressed with Noel's attention to detail regarding safety and his in depth of knowledge of Japanese culture and history.Highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see a lot of Tokyo in a short period of time and keep active at the same time.

Great Vacation!. We did many things while vacationing in Tokyo, but the biking tour was the best part of our visit. Noel kept the tour group very safe and had a great knowledge of the many places we visited.

Discover Tokyo on a bike. My friend and I had a fantastic ride with Noel Curry today. This is my first biking tour in Tokyo, but it turned out to be a smart choice.Noel is certainly very knowledge about Tokyo's points of interests, Japanese Edo history, and very attentive to safety details. We like his sense of humors and the scenic biking routes.If you just have a day Tokyo, I would recommend take this tour to see the most amazing places in Tokyo in the most efficient and personal way!Noel, thank you :)

See the sights of Tokyo by bike!. Our group of 6 had an excellent day with Noel on the Cultural & History Tour of Tokyo. Noel is very safety conscious and made sure all riders were comfortable during the tour. The tour is a comfortable pace with a good amount of interesting stops and photo opportunities. It's a great way to feel part of the city and see the sights at the same time.

Great intro to Tokyo. On our first day in Tokyo we took the half day cultural tour with Noel. It was a great way to get acquainted with the city. We got lots of good information and great sites of the city. Biking in Tokyo was interesting. But with Noel in the lead we felt safe and didn't have any problems.

Tokyo by Bike - Great way to see city. We joined the half-day bike tour with Noel. It was a great way to explore the city. We covered a number of major landmarks including the fish market and the Imperial Palace. Would not hesitate to recommend this tour. Noel was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the Japanese culture. Only wish we'd managed to fit in a few other places of interest as the bike tour was pretty slow paced for the group's ability.

Tokyo by Bike / an amazing experience . Visiting Tokyo for the first time, we decided to explore the city on bicycles and booked a tour with Tokyo Biking Tours We meet up with our guide Noel, who carefully by mail had instructed us about the metro trains to the meeting pointNoel had the ability to let us feel like long time friends meeting up for a personal guide tour of Tokyo and we never felt we got a standard tour, but that we got Noels personal tour, something that requires a guide that not looks at this as just a job, but who is committed to the story of Japan and Tokyo and who likes to tell about it, skills that Noel have plenty of.Riding around Tokyo we saw both the must see attractions, but some of the things that made the biggest impact was the visits to Noel's personal favorites, either being a beautiful Japanese garden or a small local shrine, where we had the luck to see a traditional Japanese weeding couple, all just adding to a perfect tour of Tokyo Tokyo being one of the largest cities in the world, is a perfect place for a bike tour, as it is easy to ride a bike in and with a committed guide as Noel to guide us through the city we had a experiment that will last for a long time in our memories We can therefore only recommend that you prioritize time to see Tokyo by bike, it is something you I'll not regret

The best way to see Tokyo. We did this tour with a group of clients while in Tokyo on business and everyone loved it. In fact it was the highlight of the trip. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending Noel's tour!

Best tour of Tokyo you'll ever do. We originally did a one-day Cultural Historical tour which was a great way to see everything on our first day in Tokyo. Our tour guide was knowledgable and so much fun to talk to. We had such a great time the first day that we booked the Waterfront tour the next day. Our tour guide just knew so much about Japan and its history and culture and was such an interesting person to talk to. I would definitely say biking was the best way to explore Tokyo and I'd definitely recommend anyone visiting Tokyo for the first time to take one—if not both—the tours at the START of their trip.I'm a 19 year old college student who doesn't exercise all that regularly and is in decent shape. This bike tour I'd say works for a range of fitness types. It can be challenging if you want it to be but it definitely can also accommodate those who are in less than average shape. The pace is moderate, we take plenty of stops including a lunch break, and it gives everyone plenty of time to take in all the landmarks and history. This is definitely the kind of biking tour that everyone can enjoy.Tokyo is a huge city and there's honestly no other or better way to see everything than this biking tour.

Great way to see Tokyo. My wife and I decided to take this bike tour as a way to see the city and it did not disappoint. Noel was a great tour guide and made sure we got to see the sites of the city while not rushing around. He was very informative on all sorts of topics and made sure we were safe the entire time. He even ate lunch with us after the tour at a yummy noodle place. Well worth the time and money.

Best way to see the city!. I am a college student from the US and came for the cultural & historical tour with my sister (also a college student) and my mom. I wasn't too sure what to expect, but I was amazed by how much we got to see on the first day. Noel is a great tour guide, very experienced, observant, and concerned about our safety. I enjoyed hearing all of his stories and teaching us about Japanese history. I think this was an integral part to my understanding of Japan as I travel on vacation here. I learned more than I had expected! I recommend this tour because you won't get the full significance and understanding of the landmarks without getting an explanation. And biking the city is much much more efficient than taking the subway system. Totally worth every dollar. We loved the first day so much that we decided to stay on board for the waterfront tour the following day. There was no one else except for my family on the tour, which was nice. I'm also glad I did the second day because it covered pretty much everything else I wanted to see in Tokyo, and I wouldn't have had the time or expertise to do it on my own. *Recommend that you do the tour in the beginning of your stay in Tokyo. Noel is very helpful and can give many tips regarding traveling through this city. In addition, you can pinpoint places that you want to explore in more depth in the coming days. *I don't regularly exercise and I didn't find the bike tour difficult at all. I was tired at the end of each day, but certainly not exhausted. Easy ride!

Tokyo biking 101. On this trip you not only see the different parts of Tokyo, you learn about Japanese history and the culture of Japan. Noel gives his all to create an amazing experience for everyone on the tour. He says that he puts our safety first and there were no disappointments there. In addition to this, he keeps the locals in mind and ensures that us tourists aren't blocking the way on the sidewalk. Even if you aren't a confident biker you should definitely consider this as a sightseeing option in Tokyo because the tour is well paced for differing levels of biking prowess. There are things that you just can't learn from reading a book and this kind of knowledge that Noel has accumulated over the years is something that can't be taken for granted. I feel like I could bike in Tokyo now if needed.

Fantastic Tour!!. A fun and amazing way to get a tour of Tokyo, and see some sights that you wouldn't necessarily see by yourself. Tour Guide Noel is a great bloke as well. Really knowledgeable about the city, and always makes sure everyone is having a good time, and staying safe. Thanks Noel, you're a top bloke! Thanks Tokyo Biking Tours!

Best way to get in and around Tokyo to see the sights. This, without doubt, has to be the best way to navigate Tokyo and all of its smaller attractions while taking in the sheer size of the metropolis. The tour guide, Noel, is highly experienced, as well as being extremely friendly and more than happy to field questions. Although the traffic in Tokyo is a bit disconcerting, Noel ensured that we all stayed safe while still being able to feel the hustle and bustle of Tokyo. Even if you feel as if you are not a competent cycler, you have to give this a go - to miss out on this would be to miss out on the more down to earth parts of Tokyo as opposed to just seeing skyscrapers.

Haileybury Bike Tour of Tokyo. What a wonderful bike tour we had around Tokyo with Noel. Despite some reservations of taking 17 Senior School students bike riding around Tokyo we had nothing to worry about. It was a fantastic day and the students really had the best time. Noel was absolutely thorough in organising everything. His knowledge of Tokyo and it's history was brilliant. Everything about the tour was perfect and I would totally recommend this to other schools and also small groups as this is a super way to see Tokyo. Thank you Noel for everything it really was brilliant.

A great way to experience Tokyo at street level. This was an excellent way to become familiar with one of the world's most exciting cities. Tour guide Noel is extremely professional with his coaching and advice when facing the daunting task of hitting the streets of Tokyo on two wheels, and he is also very knowledgeable of the area the tour explores. This includes the well-known spots that attract thousands of visitors daily, and a few out-of-the-way locations that you may otherwise miss. Visiting cities usually means exploring the bits surrounding the main public transport hubs, but a guided bike ride joins up the dots and really gives you a feel for the place. No matter what your ability as a cyclist, this tour comes highly recommended.

Safe and enriching sightseeing by bike in Tokyo. I can strongly recommend going sightseeing in Tokyo with Tokyo Biking Tours. Not only does Neil guide you very safely through the traffic, he also shares a lot of facts and stories about the different stops on the tour. I had a terrific time and learnt so many things about Tokyo in only one day. I was in Tokyo on business and actually managed to impress my business partners with my new-found knowledge on Tokyo.Try to do the bike tour at the start of your visit. It provides a great overview and shows you that there is much more to Tokyo than skyscrapers.Don't worry - the bikes come with well-upholstered saddles. So you won't be too sore the day after.

Well organized with safety in mind. All booked and prepared for a day of cycling but due to my feeling insecure with the number of bikes cars and people, I found myself too anxious to take the chance. We had been given a well thought out safety check, great bikes, cycle helmets and rules to follow. We were encouraged to be true to our feelings and assured a full refund would be made if we changed our minds for any reason. I am pleased to say that that is exactly what has happened. I would recommend this tour to any person who is competent and confident as I believe Noel has your safety in mind and I'm sure it is a great day out

Best tour I have ever been on. This is the best value for money tour I have been on. I saw more of Tokyo in one day than I could have found under my own steam in a month. The equipment was great and our guide Noel was fabulous with a genuine interest in Japanese culture and modern history. Tokyo is a tricky place to get around despite the best efforts of the Japanese to help English speakers. This city is very bike friendly and surprisingly easy to negotiate. This tour was a great way to get orientated in big town and I cannot recommend it more highly.

Fun way to see Tokyo. Our full day bicycle tour with Noel was a wonderful way to see some of the highlights of Tokyo city. For anyone who is confident on a bike I would highly recommend this tour. Noel ensured everyone was well fitted to their bike and established safety rules before we began. The pace was quite leisurely and we stopped at a number of places of interest where Noel spoke about the history and local culture. His talks were interesting and easy to listen to as English is his first language. Noel took us to an authentic lunch spot where we all enjoyed low cost delicious ramen noodle soup. I felt safe throughout the ride and was leased to have signed up for the full day. Half day rides are also available for those short on time. It is not a cheap tour but is overall well worth the cost.

Tokyo Cultural Biking. Did the tour last Sunday. Only 4 on the tour. Unfortunately one of the party struggled to ride a bike (And was not picked up on our test ride)so this made the tour painfully slow so we missed out on a number of stops . Also website suggests that you go to a lot of places but really its only a ride by or take a photo from a distance. Have been on lots of " Bike tours" and this was disappointing

Great way to explore Tokyo. Highly recommend this tour. Our family enjoyed leisurely touring around Tokyo and stopping to see gardens/shrines/temples. You see sights along the way that you would never see on a bus tour. Noel was very knowledgeable about Tokyo and very helpful.

Fantastic way to see Tokyo. We really enjoyed our "Cultural and historical tour". The biking was great fun (and not too tiring or difficult, although you had to keep your wits about you), the places we stopped off were interesting, and Noel was very informative. It's a great way to get a sense of Tokyo in a small space of time.It was also very good of Noel to run the tour with just two of us - we had his undivided attention. It might be a slightly less enjoyable experience with a larger group.Overall we'd highly recommend it.

Great way to see a lot of highlights!. Noel was a great tour guide for us. He's very friendly and does an excellent job of making you feel comfortable on the bike in the city. You can ride on the sidewalks and streets in Tokyo so following him making the decision of when to ride where definitely helps get through crowded areas. We did a full day tour and saw way more than we would have ever seen otherwise. It's not hard biking, everything is relatively flat, but its a long ride for sure! Biking this much through the city gets you to see lots of main attractions but also just gives you a feel of how massive the city is and how it changes between neighborhoods. Other comments have said that you should do this on the first day. I agree. Coming from the states, you will be awake early trying to adjust anyway, might as well get on a bike and see the city. After that, you can decide what you'd like to re-visit or explore other areas.

A wonderful way to spend a day Tokyo.. We started off at about 9:30 in the morning and returned late in the afternoon. You would think cycling in the world's largest city would be a bit daunting but Noel made it seem easy. We saw so much. Noel took us to a great little restaurant where we had a bowl of ramen. Noel is very professional but at the same time friendly and approachable. This is a tour I strongly recommend.

All day ride- if you are needing an activity!. The biking tour was ok. It was expensive for the value. Noel was nice- but somewhat boring. He offered another tour, for an additional $85, but I wasn't interested. I take a bike tour in every city or country that I visit, and this one was just ok! We covered a lot of distance- somewhere around 19 miles- so if u are only booking to sitesee, it will be great! I booked last minute, at 2am before the 9:30 tour& he accepted me into the tour, which was perfect& a huge plus!

Great tour... Super Fun!. The weather was perfect for the tour. The places we saw and the info (historical and up to date) was great. I highly recommend this tour. If you like outdoors adventure, this bike tour is the way to go in Tokyo area.

Don't Miss This - Really!. This is hands down a don't miss activity in Tokyo - if you are happy riding on two wheels! I can't believe how many sites we saw and how the day just flew by. We stopped on bridges and discussed Tokyo history and politics, stopped for a Japanese lunch, saw current culture and historic culture. From the new fish market to an ancient temple, the City was revealed to us. Tokyo seemed so much more accessible and easy after our cycling trip. I didn't want to end.

A MUST do in Tokyo!!!!!! . We had an amazing time on the waterfront biking tour! Noel made biking through a highly populated city seem so easy and safe. There are a lot of stops so we were never tired. He let us choose the last few sites so we could visit areas we were most interested in. We went to the Kiyosumi Gardens and the Sumo wrestling stadium. These sites along with the fish market were highlights of the tour!! We lucked out because the stadium was open and we walked right into a match! We were able to sit up close and watch the sumo wrestlers in action!! Noel said this has never happened before, but every so often on a tour he gets lucky and sees something really awesome! I highly recommend this tour!!!

The BEST thing we did in Tokyo. Bike riding thru Tokyo was truly amazing. Noel, our guide, was a wealth of information. He took us all over: the fish market, over bridges, to Shinto Shrines, Buddhist Temples, on a ferry boat, lunch at a great food court....and on and on. He ALWAYS made sure we were safe; using hand signals and keeping us close together. We would stop at various points and he would enlighten us with information and we would ask many questions, always receiving informative answers. Most important: we had fun. We highly recommend Noel's tour.The Mesnick's

Amazing tour. The ride through Tokyo waterfront was an easy ride with a lot of sights to be seen. Noel is a great guide with a wealth of knowledge on Tokyo and its history. He is also very helpful. He showed me how to purchase a subway card and made sure everyone was able to get to their next destination. I would highly recommend this trip!

Amazing biking tour through Tokyo. Actually I was looking just for rental bikes in Tokyo and by chance I found Noels homepage and instead of renting a bike, I booked the Tokyo waterfront tour and believe me, I spent a wonderful day in Tokyo which I will never forget. Noel guided us safe through Tokyo and showed us very interesting spots like the old fish market, Tokyo tower, the emperial garden and many more. On each stop we had a very educated speech from Noel and he left no question unanswered. So if you have one day to spend in Tokyo I can highly recommend this tour to you, I will for sure come back and do the Cultrual and History tour as well. Andreas from Vienna, Austria

Cultural and Historic tour. My sister and traveled to Tokyo and joined Noel for his Cultural and Historic tour. He was very safety conscious and informative. The day we rode we had great weather and towards the end of the tour stopped at a temple and stumbled across a Japanese wedding!! That was exciting, we finished the tour with a wonderful stop at a Japanese garden so peaceful in the middle of Tokyo. Great day had by all on our tour.

Highly recommend: fun-packed bike tour!. I had so much fun of this bike tour with my boyfriend and 6 others - Noel was the perfect guide. Not only was he clear with instructions, safety and hand signals but he made sure to make the tour personalised if we wanted to see anything extra, etc! Lucky for our small group, we got to see the famous festival of the three shrines. Noel's tour lets you see the best parts of Tokyo in a day. My partner and I were only in Tokyo for 5 days. This was definitely one of the highlights. DON'T MISS OUT! BOOK YOUR TOUR NOW! YOU WON'T REGRET IT!

Loved the tour!. I can't agree more with the reviews by Javageno and Peter S. The Tokyo Waterfront Tour was interesting, fun, and relaxing. At first, I was a little nervous about riding a bike in such a busy city. But Noel's clear instructions, hand signals, and knowledge of the route kept us on-track and safe. Once the tour started, I was confident that we were in good hands and I was right. I would highly recommend this tour. If we go back to Japan, we'll take the Cultural and Historical Tour. I'm sure it's wonderful, too.

A great way to see Tokyo!. A wonderful way to see what Tokyo has to offer! Its bike friendly and we felt comfortable at all times! Noel was a great guide he was passionate about the history and culture of Japan not to mention he waited for our group after we got lost on the train!Great day out and great guide!Would definitely recommend its a lovely way to see the city and a nice flat ride!

Tokyo Waterfront and Central Tokyo. I agree with all the previous reviews of Noel led bicycle tours of Tokyo. Our group consisted of 7 cyclists and we did a 30 K route taking about 7 hours. Major Highpoints: Tsukiji Fish Market and ped/bike paths along the riverOver the Rainbow Bridge Onto to Odaiba Island and by the location of the new fish market, the 2020 Olympic site, by new high-rise construction on the island including the "George Jetson" Fuji TV Hdqtrs. building, lunch at a good value food court (lunch is on your own), and Tokyo Bay beachesA ferry ride across the bay, under the Rainbow Bridge to Hinoda PierCity riding to Zozoji Temple, Tokyo Tower, through beautiful Hibiya Park, and expansive Imperial Palace grounds, ending at Tokyo Station (train station)Safety is a high priority with Noel and prior to the start gave us instructions on hand-signals he uses and is a stickler about riding single-file on streets and sidewalks to be safe. He provides well maintained city bikes in addition to helmets.As many previous reviewers have commented, his knowledge of Japanese history and current political and societal perspectives added immeasurably to an excellent route.Noel's engaging and friendly personality made for an excellent day in the saddle.

Whirlwind day tour of Tokyo. Tokyo is more exhilarating than Manhattan but also more daunting. 36 million people! That's part of why Noel's tour was so terrific. He loves this town and he sincerely loves to show it off to us Westerners. A bike is absolutely the best way to cover ground and Noel makes it safe, fun & easy. This was the best day of our trip to the city. Don't miss it!

A fantastic day in Tokyo!. We stayed in Tokyo only 4 days and choosing to spend one day with Noel from Tokyo Biking tours. We couldn't have chosen better, even though you may think a city like Tokyo is not particularly bike friendly, it turned out the opposite. Noel was a great guide, very knowledgeable, and whats important, we felt safe in the roads all the time. We did the historical tour but I wish we had more time for the river one too.
Great way to see all of Tokyo. loved it. Noel was great. Reasonable price. Also the group was small, just the 4 of us plus the guide. He has everything planned out well.

Fun, informative and jam packed with sights. A bike tour is really the best way to see Tokyo. We fit so much into one day! Including areas that you wouldn't necessarily want to invest a couple hours visiting, e.g. the CBD - perfect to just cycle through!We enjoyed the first tour so much (the cultural tour) that we signed up for the second tour (waterfront).Both tours offered a good balance of sight seeing, stops and explanations of the history and the sights. They were jam packed days but totally doable for beginners as well.Noel was a great guide and was very diligent with our safety. He also went above and beyond with answering all of our questions and even follow up questions and recommendations we asked for by email after the tour was finished.I would definitely recommend Noel's tours for everyone - we had a diverse age group and people travelling alone, in couples and families.I would recommend both tours - the cultural tour was more interesting and packed in more tourist sights, while the waterfront tour had a more relaxed pace that allowed you to really enjoy the cycling.If in doubt, just do both!

If you only have a few days in Tokyo, this bike tour is a must!. My wife and I did the Waterfront Tour with Noel.Noel is detailed in his preparation, patient and a nice person.Our thoughts of the tour:Spectacular overview of TokyoSaw key landmarksBeautiful vistas biking over bridges and by ferryQuaint neighborhoodsabout 7 hour tourThat day just happen to be just my wife and I. Noel tries to keep the group size to 10 or less.Either way would have been good with us,Noel would discuss Japanese History.I also asked about Japan's current issues which Noel was very informative.Noel actually works in the IT industry and does the bike tour out of enjoyment.It was a well planned route that is very detailed to avoid traffic and yet see the sights and views of the city.Easy pace for sightseeing,many restroom locations along the route.Noel is accommodating for any of your needs.Couldn't believe someone could bike through Tokyo and see the sightsbut Noel figured it out.Biking is great like at the Imperial Palace, where walking would be tiresome on such a large estatebut biking the grounds is wonderful and pleasant.If you have only a short time in Tokyo,this bike tour will give you a wonderful upclose look at Tokyo.Afterwards my wife and I were able to adjust our Tokyo itinerary because of what we saw and learned on the bike tour. *Would recommend going on the tour early in your visit to Tokyo.Highly recommend!

Pedal power provides perfect way to experience Tokyo.... Navigating Tokyo's variety of sights can be a daunting task. Tokyo bike tours is a refreshing alternative to skipping the ever necessary system of subways and trains. Cabs can be a traffic nightmare and sightseeing from sitting in a car might be least desirable way to view anything in Toyko.... Stretch your legs and burn some calories....you will be happy Noel guided you through parts of Tokyo

A great way to see Tokyo. We joined Noel's waterfront tour and had a great time. Saw lots, learned lots, and met some fun people. Noel did a great job as our guide, Tokyo is a great city for biking (very flat) and this is a wonderful way to see it.

Fantastic way to see Tokyo. I joined Noel's bike tour with a great group of people, whilst my husband was working. It was a fantastic way to see so much of Tokyo ,covering quite a distance, but in a relaxed way with plenty of stops, including a great Ramen for lunch! Suitable for all. The bikes were very comfortable, quite new. I took loads of photos, shrines and temples, exquisite Japanese gardens, amateur sumo wrestlers in Ryogoku, the Tokyo Sky Tree and the Imperial Palace to name a few! A great Tokyo experience, thoroughly recommended.

Perfect way to see Tokyo. We spent the day cycling with Noel as part of the Waterfront tour. Cycling in Tokyo is very safe and easy and an excellent way to cover a lot of ground in a day. Noel was very accommodating and had excellent knowledge of all things Tokyo, particularly the history. The bikes were brand new and easy to ride. I would highly recommend Tokyo Biking Tours as a fun and interesting day out.

Perfect way to see Tokyo, highly recommended!. I had the pleasure of joining both of Noel's tours and cannot recommend them (both!) enough for the following reasons:1. If you have limited time in Tokyo to see the main sights, biking around with someone who has put a lot of thought into the itinerary and knows Tokyo well is probably the most efficient and fun way to do it. 2. The tour is safe - the bikes are well maintained, appropriate helmets are provided and Noel's priority is to keep everyone safe throughout.3. I did the cultural history tour and the waterfront tour - they are exactly as detailed on the website, are completely different and very complementary, I loved doing them on two consecutive days filled with adventures.4. Noel ensures all places on the itinerary are covered by smartly and diplomatically avoiding time wasting / lingering, yet allowing for plenty of photo/bathroom/cigarette/coffee etc stops as required.5. The size of the groups is very reasonable and the tour appears to attract nice interesting people - I joined one with 6 of us and the other with just 2 of us, and hope to stay in touch with several of them.6. Noel's character is ideally suited - he is knowledgeable about Japan and the sights, and is more than willing to share it all with the group. 7. The food stops are good.8. There is enough flexibility to accommodate reasonable requests which was much appreciated.Have fun and thanks again, Noel!

not to be missed. in tokyo for 36 hours - really overwhelmed - where to start...tokyo biking tours - amazing weather - cherry blossoms in full bloom and a lesson in japanese traditions and culture and much much more - noel was kind and considerate - he keeps his group small and intimate so that you feel like you are all on this days bike journey together - i could not imagine a better way to experience tokyo...thank you noel - for a perfect day!

Fantastic way to see Tokyo!. We had a fantastic time on Noel's bike tour. We were somewhat lucky that we had Noel all to ourselves as my boyfriend and I were the only ones on the tour, but we could see how the tour would be a success regardless! Noel was extremely knowledgeable about Japanese culture, history and tradition and we learned a lot in addition to getting to see so many beautiful Tokyo sights. Our highlight was riding through Ueno park and admiring the last of the cherry blossoms and meeting a Sumo wrestler!We initially contemplated hiring bikes and doing a tour on our own, but in the end we were thrilled we let a professional do the guiding while we just followed and enjoyed the day.I was a little worried at first about biking through such a busy city, but this was not an issue at all as the roads felt very safe and Noel made sure to instruct and keep an eye on all things safety related. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to see Tokyo in a fun and informative way!

Wonderful way to spend a day in Tokyo. We did the waterfront bicycle tour with Noel and had a fantastic day! We were the only ones on this tour so the pace and stopping points were up to us. Getting around Tokyo usually involves subway trains underground but this tour gives a great vantage point at street level and has many interesting stops along the way. Noel also has extensive knowledge about Tokyo and bicycling the city.

Great way to get a feel for Tokyo!. Let me start by saying I don’t usually do guided tours. I tend to do my own thing and explore at my own pace. If more tours are like this one, I have made one huge mistake. This tour is simply put… Amazing.Our guide was led by Noel. He was unbelievably nice, and extremely knowledgeable on what seemed like an infinite number of topics. The tour was set at a perfect pace, we never felt rushed or tired even though we were on it for nearly 9 hours. If you needed to stop for drinks, or bathroom, or smoking, there was always someplace close by. We had lunch at a typical salarayman restaurant. It wasn’t expensive at all and gave a nice glance into the culture. I really don’t have enough good things to say, and really don’t want to spoil the tour for anyone wanting to take it. Noel is fantastic and willing to answer any question you might have, personal or otherwise. I highly recommend the tour, you will not be disappointed.

The Best Way to see Tokyo. We, 3 mature Aussie lads (over 50) had a fantastic winters day with Noel. After a week of skiing in Niseko, this was the best way to spend a day in Tokyo. It was the highlight of our stay in Tokyo and it felt more like a bunch of young hearted guys just cruising around having fun, with some one (Noel) who knew exactly where to go and how. I booked the bike tour over the net, several weeks in advance from Sydney and the process and communication with Noel was excellent. Gloves, sun glasses and a warm jacket is a must in the winter time but the cold weather was not an issue, maybe we were enjoying ourselves too much to even notice. A full day bike tour of Tokyo with Noel is a must do.

Great day of exploring in Tokyo. The 2nd day of our trip in Tokyo we planned the waterfront tour with Tokyo biking tours. We had a great day even if we weren't completely compatible with the rest of our tour group, Noel did his best to make everyone happy and also kept his cool even if some people didn't know how to ride a bike properly:)! We had a great day and saw a lot of things we shouldn't have seen when exploring by ourselves. I highly recommend this tour.

Great day in Tokyo. My boyfriend and I did a tour with Noel, and it was fantastic. He took us to some great spots we wouldn't have otherwise found, helped us get oriented, took us to a great lunch spot and was totally responsible for our safety and well being. He's also a great guy, highly recommended!

Perfect Getaway to rejuvenate one's self in a genuine "Sento". What a perfect getaway to relax and unwind one's mind and soul, yet experiencing something new while in a tour !!! Thanks to TABICA who organized everything. I encountered this trip while we were in Tokyo. We visited the local bath called "Shimizu-yu" to relax in the Sento, a short travel from Tokyo and the experience was rejuvenating. Not only did it refresh our body but it revived our souls. A cool way to experience the Japanese atmosphere and indulge in the local food. The guide was knowledgeable person who apprised us of the history of sento. Had we not taken this tour, we would not have known such intriguing facts of Japan. My whole family enjoyed heartily. TABICA helped us with this enriching experience. Thank You!!!

Great fun at Noh Art theater. It was great experience visiting the Noh Art theater and learning about one of the oldest theatrical art in Japan. I love masks and I really enjoyed seeing and touching the Japanese traditional masks. Our hosts, the professional actors invited us to be part of some theater scenes and it was great FUN. The tour is recommended for traditional art lovers.

One of the best culture tours I've ever been!. I loved our trip to Japan because I find it really interesting to learn about the culture of different countries, and this one is the definitely one of the best.We had this day tour in Tokyo to learn how to make matcha! It was amazing to learn about the Japanese green tea and we even took a souvenir home. My friends and I love matcha, and this was one of the highlights of our trip. TABICA was really helpful for me and my friends because we visit countries for the actual experience of their tradition, not just for the photos. Highly recommended!

Traditional Culture of Tabica. Tabica is such an interesting place for those who love to feel the expereince about village and traditional culture. The moment is , you can get through dive into life of locals which is so exciting! There is an attractive place to explore various kind of activities here. One of it is enjoying Ryuseikan , the Bushido dojo Master where it is very accessible from major cities in Tokyo ( Shibuya ) andyou can have one-and-only experience. This is the spirit of Japan if you're looking for trip here!

it feel real, not like typical tourism. we had try and visit japan for real experience. we dont like to be a typical tourist. so we decide to follow a tour. we visit several place like paddy field, traditional music and also local food. it really nice, i will go again with my kids

Amazing Experience. As a nature lover sometimes is difficult to find activities that my wife and I enjoy in big cities, however, when we have someone who knows the place and knows how to identify exactly what you need, it is really helpful. TABICA will help you to know more about the local community, their habits, and daily activities in the organic farmers. Learned with them is splendid. TABICA will help you a lot, every penny spent is worth it.

An eye-opener for city folk like me.. My friends and I went for TABICA's Small Group Tour with Local Organic Farmers. It was amazing. Although I lived in a big city, I thought I knew all there is to know about living in a rural area and making a living off the land as my grandparents lived this type of life back home and I visited their village every year. Boy, was I wrong! The Japanese farm that I visited had a very efficient way of doing things. They had a great system and you would be surprised to see such structure in agriculture. For example, the farm can predict with great accuracy which of their vegetables can be ripe for harvesting on a certain day. The farm's owner and his family are smiling all the time and they all seemed so happy. They seemed to have a great life and makes me want to swap my life with them. You won't believe the size of the vegetables that we took to cook our lunch. They tasted yummy! And I learned a thing or two about how to cook healthily without sacrificing on taste.

Harvesting rice with real japanese farmers. A bit expensive, but every dollars spent worth it! Went there and back in taxi and had free meal and an awsome translator for the 4 hours we spent there. The hosts were very friendly and welcoming. I learned a lot this day. WOW! I would recommand this activity to anyone who want to discover real Japan!

Exciting Japan local life trip. As this was my first visit to Japan, I want to know inside Japanese local day to day activities and its nature near Tokyo. Really ejoyed every activities Tabica has to offer. My favorite activity was green tea making and tea drinking, really diferrent compared to where I come from. Everybody, the tutor and the guide seems nice and friendly to foreigner like me, the vibe, the nature, the city make me want to visit Japan again if I have the opprtunity. Thank you Tabica team for all of your help.

Mastering Soba-Making. I was always a fan of Japanese cuisine, so was delighted to find the soba noodle making course with an actual Japanese chef, and it became an experience I will never forget!We met quite early at the station then traveled by car to get to the location, where we met our chef, who was absolutely charming! After a short introduction he showed us how to prepare the noodles, it was amazing to watch and he made the whole thing from scratch! Then it was our turn, when we finally got the hang of it we could cook them, and the best thing, eat them right there! Overall I had an amazing time there, I can only recommend going and experiencing something different on your trip!

Great experience with TABICA. I love the nature and always prefer to see different and local stuff when I go travel. I tried TABICA last time and it was an amazingly fantastic experience to me. The blueberries I picked were great and juicy and I really enjoyed the moment in a farm where I feel peaceful. The time being with farmer was excellent too as I got to know more about the Japanese culture and traditions.

Very nice and iteresting tour. This place is amazing, friendly with beautiful sights! Me and my girlfriend have been here together and had a very good time. We decided to take Cooking class on Soba-Making. The Master of Soba making was so nice and funny. Really interesting for those who want to know something new, likes to taste new food, and make it when coming back home! We prepared and ate our own Soba noodles. He told us his own secrets of making Soba noodles more tasty and it works, We made 2 different receipts of noodles and saw the difference So we had a very nice, positive and beautifull tour. Now I am Soba master too! ;)

TABICA Helped me Explore Japan. Many many thanks to TABICA for all the arrangements to explore some places in Japan. Our group of four friends really enjoyed our trip to Tokyo and other beautiful places. We had thought that the trip would be tough for us but it was super and fantastic! I really appreciate TABICA for being such nice guide.

Green Tea Escape!!!. Thank you TABICA for a great time during our stay in Tokyo. We really enjoyed the activity and the organization was impeccable. I travelled with my two kids and our whole family is sort of a green tea fan. So we decided to try the macha making activity and wow the kids really loved it. I was really surprised by the amount of history and detail from the trainer that surrounds the green tea. The whole experience was short of enlightening. We had fun learning the tea culture, making a few different types of macha, and overall just the Japanese way of drinking tea. We had a lot of fun! Thank you TABICA for organizing such a wonderful trip for my family.

Perfect choice for solo traveller. This is a great choice for a solo traveller…..well organized, with wide choice of options, opportunity to meet great people… i was thinking between Monk experience and a Bamboo…decided to take Monk experience - great value for money, very interesting one - get a really insider view..

Bushido Experience, living culture at its best.. Ever wanted to brandish a Katana sword dressed as a true Samurai ? in this wonderful TABICA tour you will; but more important, you will be taught the principles of Bushido ethics ( which is more than a list of rules, is true nobility in a warrior ) from a Bushido master. Loyalty, Honor, Empowerment, Dignity. Actions based on those principles instead of fear. A way of life beyond death. This is living culture at its best, and is worth every minute of it.

Thrilling Atmosphere and Lovable people!. Tabica has got to be one of the best organisations I have come across travelling the world! They made us feel so at home! From easy lessons in Japanese to their service and friendliness! The name of the temple we visited was "Honkouji", about an hour's drive from Tokyo. We were about seven on the trip and it was very serene and peaceful. A huge contrast to a lot of other tours I had been on. Once we got there, there were real life monks (I was amazed) that acted as guides. They were so serene and quite open, almost eager, to share their everyday life with us. The meditation part for me was just tranquility. I hope to return to Japan soon with more people, to give them the pleasure of this tour! Thank you Tabica!

Exhilarating Machida. Tabica trip was superb. Perfect organization!If you look for a tranquil place to go, Machida maybe is your choice. Located nearby Tokyo, about an hour trip and you will find real fun there. Meeting nice people and enjoying the awesome green nature will be a memorable trip.

and title is: Explore a temple of Japan with a Monk as your guide.. It isn’t every day that you bump into a monk. Much less meet one face to face and have him explain the tradition and culture living inside a Japanese temple. First off, the temple itself was fascinating! Just the décor was enough to take my breath away, and I was fortunate enough to listen to a monk’s detailed explanation about the routines and hidden meanings of the life of a Japanese monk. Loved the tea ceremony and calligraphy session, truly brought to life my appreciation for tradition and fine art. The meditation session is an experience I would not forget. There is a subtle beauty in tuning out the world and looking inwardly once in a while. Very refreshing. The monk was amazing! In fact, everyone there was friendly and extremely welcoming. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour and highly recommend anyone coming to Tokyo to try out this experience organized by TABICA!

Totally Recomend it!. I think it has been one of the most interesting things done in Tokio, i took the Soba Making Master tour and the experience itself worth deal! To have the chance of learn the art of cooking this milienary buckwheat noddles and share with other travelers the experience of making our own. Totally recomend it and i long to have the chance of going back and take another tour with Tibeca team because they made me feel comfortable.

A Marvellous Experience with Monks in Japan. I am very grateful to TABICA for they made my trip in Japan “A trip of marvellous and enlightening experience”. The moment with the monks in the temple, Honkouji, I really enjoyed and learnt a lot about them; how they spend their daily life, culture etc. I had always longed for such trip to explore the treasure of Japan. I had no expertise of Japanese language but no worry there you will easily find an Interpreter. Don’t forget to take your shocks or they won’t let you enter the temple. It a really a worth visiting place for a traveller like me. Highly Recommended!

Machida, Wonderful Japan Experience. I did the Tabica trip near Machida and it was an awesome experience.Actually, Machida is the city near Tokyo, in the district of Shibuya, a unique combination of the nature trail and metropolitan culture . The trip was very well organized, we got a local guide and he was so kind to show us the unique beauty of japan nature.There are certain places you must visit which I find it very beautiful during my visit to Tokyo and Machida is one of them.

Wonderfull Japan experience. Trip to Japan is an adventure as it is) I decided to got deeper and ordered the Bushido tour.I should say - that was unforgettable! You are dressed like a Japan warrior with katana (Japan sword) learning how to handle with it) Sometimes it was funny)) Dress of the warrior is not so easy)But no one gives you a real katana from the start. Master learn with wooden sword and after training they gave me the metal one.Wonderful experience! Highly recommend!

Highly recommended - life of a monk!. While planning my trip to Japan, I knew I wanted much more than to be a mere tourist. Although several touristy places were on my list, I also wanted to explore other options which would help me feel the real Japan, meet locals and get a taste of life in Japan. During my search for these places, I stumbled upon TABICA tours on Tripadvisor. Having read rave reviews, I decided to give it a try. However, I found it immensely difficult to choose just one tour. Since I was a bit short on cash, I told myself I can afford one of these as a treat to myself (it’s not really expensive, it’s just that I am a student!). And then began the thinking and deciding and exploring which lasted for days. I was particularly torn between the Bushido one and the Monk one. Finally, I decided on the ‘A day in the life of a Monk’ as I was particularly interested to see their living style and habits. The timing of the tour (1pm) allowed me to visit a site in the morning which was perfect. Harajuku station is easy to access via subway and the tour office is only 10 minutes walk from there. Thereafter, the tour company took over and I relaxed. There were 8 of us in the group which made it easy to get to know everyone before we started for the tour. The car ride was comfortable and I enjoyed the city views on the hour long drive. I also got to know my Argentinean companion who accompanied me in the car.Around 2pm, we reached the Honkouji temple in Ichikawa. Due to its distance from Tokyo, it’s not crowded by tourists so the peace and serenity was felt immediately even before we got inside the temple. The temple has a lot of history and power spots. A monk was our guide for the day. A translator helped with what the monk said, which was such a relief after so many days of trying to understand Japanese. Thereafter, I watched them doing Japanese calligraphy which seemed so intricate and difficult. I tried my hand at it but I don’t think I was any good. Haha. Later, I witnessed Matcha making. I love Matcha and had come to love it during my stay in Japan which included Matcha ice-cream, so seeing how to make it was a pleasure although I don’t think I can make it. I tried a cup of it and it was delicious. Finally, we sat down with the monks to understand more about their lives and habits. I had tons of questions and I think I tired out the translator but both he and the monk were very patient and answered all my curious questions. It was enlightening to hear about their lives and principles.Finally, even though I wanted to stay on, I reluctantly got back into the car and reached Tokyo which seemed so farther away from what I had just seen.I would definitely recommend this tour for those who want to see much more than the city life of Japan. This was ethnic experience at its best. Highly recommended!

A day with a monk, awesome experience!. One of the most beautiful and awesome experience! Spending time with monks is something you definitely have to do if visiting Tabica. Not only, you´´ll have peaceful time but also learn about their day to day life by first hand as the guide is one of the monks. Don’t worry about language, as there’s an interpreter all the time long the visit lasts. One of the things I loved the most, was practicing Japanese calligraphy! And don’t forget to take your socks if going on this tour, if not you won’t be able to enter the Honkouji Temple. Strongly recommended!

One of the most beautiful place worldwide!. TABICA is an experience that you will remember forever! Tabica doesn’t provide you a quick, commercial tour but with an actual, awe-inspiring one! You get to delve into the actual day-to-day activities with real Japanese monks, learn about how they see the meaning of life and how simple their commute through it is. Allows you to experience the heart of Japanese culture that has been swallowed up by the rapid advancements. Tabica has a couple of options. You can spend your time to the art of Japanese Woodblock Printing, enjoy cooking activities with a master chef, make bamboo flutes, join the Japanese farmers in their daily activities in the outskirts of Japan, or even spend your day with a Japanese Bushido Master.A very cultured and zen atmosphere. For people who love hiking and commuting with nature or who believe in saving the environment and protecting endangered species in the wild.If you would like to travel new places, full of nature beauty, traditional food, unexpected activities, you have to visit Tabica! If authenticity is a key concept in tourism, TABICA has it spot on organizing tours where travellers get the chance to dive into the life of local people. Authentic and off the beaten track tours appeal to the modern, savvy traveller who wants to go a step further in getting to know their holiday destination.TABICA, as a frontrunner in this tourism niche, successfully offers an unparalleled behind-the-scenes glimpse into local lifestyles. For everyone who wants to experience authenticity, I highly recommend booking a tour with TABICA today!Five star rating from me to this amazing place, because it gave us many beautiful moments, and many happy pictures and photos. So five star rating to this place and it’s people for making this place extraordinary! Book a trip to Tabica and enjoy!

Strongly Recommend!. If you do not like reading long reviews, to cut it short, here is my short summary, “You will 100% love going on this tour!”I have always been interested in a spiritual life, esoterics and different unconventional practices all over the world. Having read a bunch of books about monks and their routine, I took an interest in this topic. My trip about Japan lasted for 2 weeks, the last point in my route was Tokyo, but then my Japanese friends recommended this tour. They said I would not regret it… and I never did! It was simply amazing. If you have a day or two, do not hesitate to go on the tour. When I arrived at my final destination, there was a guide (who was, actually, a real monk) who walked our group about the grounds of their settlement. The spirit of true calmness and genuine tranquility was in the air, it felt like I could become one of them after a week or two. When you are there, you are absorbed in this atmosphere and then when the tour is over you do not want to leave. I am sorry only about one thing, it is a pity I had just one day and there was no way for me to join other tours of this company.Talking about organization of the tour, everything was perfect, our host was nice, we could meet and actually communicate with monks, they introduced us to their routine and we could even try some of their activities. Before going on a tour, I was concerned about the number of people in the group, as some companies offered tours for 30+ people at the same time. Our group was not numerous at all, that was one more benefit for me.It is definitely a must see place!

Explore the Heart of Japan. Overcrowded streets, neon lights, and highly congested hotels are the first things that come to mind when you think of holidays in Japan. For most people, that is a huge turn off. Tabica, however, allows you to experience the very heart of Japanese culture that has been swallowed up by the rapid advancements. Tabica has a couple of options. You can devote your time to the art of Japanese Woodblock Printing, enjoy cooking activities with a master chef, make bamboo flutes, join the Japanese farmers in their daily activities in the outskirts of Japan, pray with a Buddhist Monk, or even spend your day with a Japanese Bushido Master.Although we tried to experience as many activities that Tabica had to offer, the most amazing time was that spent hiking on Japan’s Nature trails. This is particularly for the nature-hippies who believe in saving the flora and fauna, especially the endangered ones. The trail is in Machida City, situated in the north of Japan. It is in the midst of the forest that has just started recovering from the rapid advancements that had almost enveloped it. The tour group is restricted to eight people. It passes through a dense forest that supports multiple endangered species of animals that are slowly coming back to their natural habitats. Apart from all the positive aspects, you might get lost in translation once in a while. Most of the people that you meet in this exploratory journey do not speak English which can sometime pose difficulties in understanding them. However, Tabica provides you interpreters during the tours to resolve this problem.Conclusively, Tabica is a unique experience that must be attended by all travelers looking to see the Japanese culture. The fees are nominal and completely worth it. We enjoyed every moment of our time with Tabica and would highly recommend to all who plan on visiting Japan.

An Enthralling Tour. Spending time at Tabica is like getting access to Japan’s core engine. You think Shibuya, Tokyo and all what pops up in your mind are neon lights and large crowds, only until you visit Tabica that the entire picture gets turned upside down! We have had the pleasure of spending an entire day with a monk and we couldn’t be more honored to have him guide through the many faces of his pleasure-laden life! It has been an unexpectedly eye-opening experience that left us incredibly pleased and more than willing to try the different services this amazing and inspiring place can offer.Unlike most tourist-attractions in other countries, Tabica doesn’t provide you a quick, commercial tour but with an actual, awe-inspiring one! You get to delve into the actual day-to-day activities of Japanese monks, learn about how they see the meaning of life and how simple their commute through it is. We really enjoyed every moment, specially the time we tea time at the end of the day. The tour is restricted to eight people only so you can fully submerge yourself into the experience. Throughout the tour you’ll meet friendly native farmers that you will be able to interact with and it was quite lovely when we did. Overall, it is an unforgettable experience. The place is highly recommended for hardcore travelers who are looking to get deeply in touch with the core of the Japanese culture. If Japan is high on your bucket list then Tabica is a place that you can not miss!

Could not have asked for better!. Travelling has forever been my passion and for that reason I created a little bucket list for myself with Japan being pretty high on my top ten must visit places! Because of the long hours of travel and my not so fluent (read:non existent) Japanese I was very nervous for the trip. However, TABICA made my experience one that I will forever remember! My husband and I are quite the adventurers and lovers of culture so we did the Nature Trail near Tokyo and interrogated the monk (lol). I thought the price reasonable for the peace of mind that I was able to get from knowing I wouldn't have to do it all on my own. Thank you TABICA, you've made me a happy camper!! :)

Hidden gem. And to think I was going to see the lights, the tall buildings, immense traffic, and enough people to fill the sands on the beach but VOILA enter into tabica. A very cultured and zen atmosphere. when in tabica act like a monk, drink like a monk, and seat like one. Our host was a monk, the perfect person to show us around and explain every aspect of the culture that we don't get to appreciateon a daily. We sat down 'like the monks do' and he explained his daily routine to us. Had sumptuous tea as a group and listened to every word he had for us. Life here is awesomely different from what Japan had to offer. The ladies with their kimonos wore their respect on their shoulders. Envious to us who want to live in a culture where no phone is ringing, no technology is coming in between our daily lives. Then enviroment ozzed of zen and peace. so much so that 30 minutes is just not enough. One can never be too busy to visit Tabica. Very enjoyable experience that will leave you wanting to know more. It's a must visit if you can spare just 30 minutes of your time.

Surprise's around every Corner. When you think about travelling to Japan, what first comes to mind; is it crowded cities, technology, shrines and cherry blossom. You may be surprised all Japan has to offer the tourist, outside of the usual attractions, of visiting there world famous zoo, with its pandas, the numerous shrines and shopping areas.Become one of the new tourists, that visit Japan, it is like seeing a hidden gem or behind the scenes of your favourite movie. Japan has mini tours available, to cater for most people's hobbies or interests. You could embark on a tour of Japanese architecture, through the centuries, hosted by a graduate in architecture who speaks English and is able to answer all your questions. Visitors could spend the day with Monks; experiencing how they live a traditional life; or learn tae kwon do, from a "Bushido Master", for four hours learning their techniques, this tour is held in the "Dojo" in Tokyo.For people who enjoy hiking and commuting with nature, or who believe in saving the environment and protecting endangered species in the wild. Japan has a three to four hour tour, that they will find enthralling. The tour is called "Hike and Explore Japan's Nature Trails near Tokyo". In the city of Machida, which is located in the western portion of the Tokyo metropolis, is the oasis that we are talking about. Machida has become a commuter city and takes approximately 50 minutes to commute to Tokyo; Machida is about 40 kilometres from Tokyo. Machida in its history was a farming community; but with Tokyo sprawling towards it, most of the farming land was bought for building homes and shops.Machida city realised because of all the buildings and the destruction of a large portion of the forested area in the city; that a lot of native species of birds and animals, have disappeared from the region. To try and reverse the action of what was occurring. Machida city, decided to set aside, the northern part of the of the city, to encourage the regrowth of the topography in the Yato way. This was achieved by resorting to traditional land management and using traditional knowledge to restore the forested area. This area looks like a mosaic patchwork of forests on the slopes, farmlands and human settlement. The city has built twenty traditional Japanese houses in this unique landscape.The tour group is restricted to eight people, so every is able to enjoy this wonderful experience. You are able to walk through the forests, where native animals are slowly returning. You are able to ask the farmers about the rice paddies, through a interpreter, to learn more about growing rice or you might be interested in how they have encouraged the native bird life to return. You may have questions about how they keep warm or live in the traditional houses. The visitor is able to see inside the houses, how a family would live in a traditional manner.Your tour starts when you get of the train at Harajuka Station, and meet your guide at Yoyog Park. You are then transported by car to the hiking area, ten minutes from the station. The group is accompanied by a local resident of the area and also a translator, to assist with any questions. After the is completed you return to Tokyo by train.

Just a great place. I really enjoyed the temple tour. It was not just a simple half hour tour with many photos , it was long tour around the temple with many nice surprises. It was honor for me having a Monk from the temple as guide. He was very polite sharing his daily activities and explaining how interesting is his life. The tea ceremony was great fun for me as a foreigner.

Had fun crafting Japanese kaleidoscopes. After an amazing stay in Tokyo, my boyfriend and I decided to spend our last Friday afternoon there doing something fun. We opted for a 2 hour long tour in which we would have learnt how to craft kaleidoscopes. We took the train and hopped off at the Okachimachi Station, where a guide was waiting for us. After a short introduction about the history and tradition of kaleidoscopes, the guide taught us how to create one and explained all the tips and tricks of the mechanics behind it. Then, it was our turn to build one. We really had fun crafting our own 'mangekyo', and we also had the chance to keep them! Since it was very interesting, I would recommend this experience to anyone interested in science and crafts.

A Perfect Tour to know about Japanese Culture. I was in Tokyo for a business meeting and did not have enough time to experience the Japanese Culture. So, on a suggestion of a local friend I decided to go on this half day tour. Tour was very well organized and it offered me what I was looking for "A perfect Japaenese Culture experience." Those 3 hours spent at the dojo were the highlight of my tour to Japan.

Hiking near Tokyo. Tokyo is a cosmopolitan city, but I was surprised how green and beautiful is the nature around the city. Thanks to Tabica I did a very long trip near by Tokyo and I realized how lovely and nice is Japan. Don't miss this trip if you want to see more than skylines and crowded streets.

Half a day of peace and serenity with Monks. My wife and I went on a trip to Tokyo and Honolulu and stumbled across this quaint and serene temple in Shibuya. I have been to Thailand and have visited several Buddhist temples; however, nothing compares to the aura of this place. It is just an hour drive from Tokyo. Tabica arranged the trip for us and we were pleasantly surprised to be greeted by a monk who was our guide for the day. For a small fee, we got to spend time with the monks and it was an experience of a lifetime to observe their lives so closely. We got to learn about calligraphy, matcha-making, etc. and the monks also told us about Japanese culture. They were also kind enough to answer some of our questions, which made us reflect back on our lives. We do not speak or understand Japanese; however, the monks were kind enough to translate the conversation.

Spend half a day with a monk near Tokyo!. My boyfriend and I went for a trip to Tokyo in July and we managed to book a trip to Honkouji temple, where we could experience the life of monks. We were really impressed by the whole organization of the tour and even took part in some interesting activities, like Japanese calligraphy and matcha making.The guide was a monk and he told us so many things about his temple as well as the history behind the Japanese culture and religions.Next time when in Tokyo, definitely would book another tour through Tabica.

Great Bushido tour. During my trip to Tokyo I did the Bushido master tour. It was lovely experience. We (our group of six) went to a traditional Japanese training hall somewhere near to Tokyo and started practicing fight with wooden Samurai swords. The Bushido master coached us how to move and to fight using the sword. I felt like a Samurai, like an ancient worrier. Awesome!!!

Unique beauty. Just a one-hour trip from Tokyo and we went to Machida. Unique blend of Japanese culture and beautiful nature. We spent few hours speaking with locals and exploring the secrets of Japan. All locals were really friendly and thanks to our guide I realized how interesting could be the life outside Tokyo. I would like definitely to do it again one day.

The perfect tour. This year we had a target of a 10 days trip to Tokyo and we did it. We wanted to go around, to explore and connect with the local people. This trip covered all our expectations and made us happy. Our group was small and it gave us big advantage compering to some other trips that we did before. Actually we met a monk, our guide introduced us and we had an interesting conversation with him. He was really polite, a peaceful nature. One thing that remained to be satisfying was the guidance we received during the day tour. The tour guide conducted himself in a professional manner.

Had a fun! and a great experience. The overall is quite good! Actually I'm a Japanese guy but I've never done this experience.. I joined it alone this time, other participants(foreigners) are totally 4. The organizer bring us smoothly from the meeting spot to the event spot by train. and they rent us Suica( Japanese train useful IC card) so I felt their hospitality.(Thank you!) After arriving, we could rent a traditional cloth (Dougi) in there and practiced "Iai", learn how to take a sword, cut off. A Bushido Master and his staff members are very friendly and kindly(so nice!). So we really enjoyed it and be serious(IMPORTANT), haha. I hope join it again soon!

Feel the real life of Japanese people. It was my second time visiting Tokyo and I found this trip while I was looking for ways to connect with local Japanese people. I visited a temple with a translator and another participant. It was very private and nice because we got a chance to actually talk to a monk and get to know him. Sometimes, a big tour is a little too much, so this small-group trip was definitely more relaxing and fun!

Exploring the nature in Japan. Through the trip by tabica, I have seen the beautiful nature of Japan by hiking and exploring the countryside of Tokyo. I never knew that Japan has such nature as it is hard to imagine from the city life in Tokyo. I will definitely recommend this trip to my friends.

What a surprise!. My girlfriend and I went to the temple and visited a monk through tabica. At first, I thought I will just be doing activities like Japanese calligraphy and tea ceremony, but it was more than that. Our local guide was a monk and he told us so many things about his temple as well as the history behind the Japanese culture and religions. He also told us his life stories and I felt like I actually got to know him as a person. Our translator was very nice too, and this trip was more than what I expected. I would like to participate in other trips offered by tabica when i come back to japan in the future

Great time in an organic farm. I reserved for a farming experience at an organic farm because I was interested in agricultural industry and also organic food in general. The trip was very unique because I thought I will just be learning how to farm/harvest, but I got to turn the fresh vegetables into delicious tempuras for lunch!! We ate those tempuras with soba (buck wheat) noodles and it was delicious. Thank you for an amazing trip!
Fantastic experience. Eye opening!. Never thought i would be able to spend the day with a Bishido master. Truly amazing experience, staff friendly and helpful. 10/10. Would defiantly go again!

It will be your best experience in Japan!. I went to a trip "Dining at Farm" and had such an amazing experience there. The host was very open-minded, warm-hearted and cheerful, and they treated me as one of their family. I cooked Japanese curry with full of fresh vegetables that I just harvested at the farm. It was DELICIOUS! Through out of this trip, I learned a lot about local Japanese lifestyle which is very different from mine. Also, I met some nice people and then shared culture, values and of course great time with them. If I didn't join it this time, I think I couldn't have spent such a nice time in Japan. So, WHY NOT join this TABICA trip? Would be your life-changing trip!

Fun soumen activity!. Love soumen very much! I never eat Japanese noodle- soumen before. It was so fresh that I cannot stop eating it! It is quite hard for me to pick it up when noodles slided down because I am not good at using the chopsticks, but I still tried my best and ate a lot! Hope Tabica can hold more event like soumen event for us to experience more Japanese-style event!

Everything was new to us!. The nagashisoumen event was so awesome! We made it all by ourselves except the noodle! From cutting the bamboo in a bamboo forest, shaping and cleaning it to putting the noodle on the bamboo pipe and eat it; all the process are so fun and interesting! I never experience such kind of fun event before! Can’t wait for the next event to join!
nice trip. The event was so awesome! I cannot wait to join the next one! I would definitely recommend to participate in this to my friends.

Deep look into the temple. The monk I have met at the temple was very friendly. He taught us Japanese calligraphy as well as match tea making. Although we’ve only spent 3 hours at the temple, it was definitely worth the time!

Perfect way to discover japanese culture !. We joined the "day with a Monk" trip, and it was really amazing. We were accompagned by two very nice women (one japanese photographer and one guide) who could speak both english and japanese, which was very useful for communicating with the host. They explained us everything we had to know, and we could ask as much questions as we wanted.The monk was very nice and you feel very confortable around him ; he will make his best for you to have a good experience.We also had the chance to experiment a japanese tea ceremony and calligraphy, and we really enjoyed it.Finally, I don't know if we just had chance, but we were only three to attend to this trip, which was a very good point because it was more "private", we had all the time we wanted to talk with the host and the guides, we fell a bit more privilegedWe will sure join another trip next year !

The best way to discover the real beauty of Japan. I extremely love the nagashisoumen event! It was quite fun! We made the nagashisoumen by ourselves from cutting bamboos in a big bamboo forest, shaping it and then put the noodle on the bamboo to slide down! Although I went there alone, I never felt lonely at all! The locals were so friendly and kept saying konnichiwa to us with big smiles! Also, every participant was so energetic and friendly that we had a very nice nagashisoumen event! : ))))Cannot wait for joining the next event!

Great way to shake up things up when you come to Japan!.
