We were given iced tea and little sweets, and treated to a super special and unique experience by getting our names translated into unique kanji, which was then beautifully penned with a brush and ink onto rice paper, for us to take with us. Everyone was super sweet and thoughtful, and gave us a surprise escape from the heat and bustle outside.
Awesome..!!. Nice and friendly girls and great Kanji artwork. Thanks alot Kanji House. Well recommended for a visit while in Tokyo.

Heartwarming. It was a really sweet experience.The Kanji House is a very cozy and welcoming place.We sat comfortably and gave them our names and a few things about our personality.While waiting for them to finish their work they told us stories and taught us some origami which we really enjoyed.After it was finished, they explained what the kanji means and chatted a little bit.Above all, the girls were extremely friendly and sweet.The whole experience was surprisingly cheerful and relaxing.We wish them all the best and Kanji House great success!
Great job. They are really nice and friendly.They are made art which is impressive beautiful and will visit you again.

Sweet and interesting.. Taking some time to visit the place and bringing home a unique souvenir. The girls were fun and adorable, had a nice chat with them and it felt really heart warming as they are very welcoming and always cheerful.

Wonderful!. Going to the Kanji House was an amazing experience! My sister and I were "recruited" from the street to pay them a visit, and it was well worth it. Everyone who is interested in japanese culture, art or simply meeting a bunch of really nice people, please go to the Kanji House! Plus, having your name written in Kanji is really a kick, for every Japan-lover :)

Amazing experience :). On the way to the Sensoji temple we found these wonderful girls and they guide us to their workshop. They wrote our names in japanese and each syllable had a characteristic from our personality.In our time there, the girls offered to us tea and they teach us to do origami !They were cheerful and very welcoming !It was a great experience and made us feel part of the japanese culture!I totally recommend it to everyone!!p.s. they offered us great souvenirs !

fantastic souvenir, and a heart warming encounter. They made a fantastic job in hospitality and style, and they spoke good english. I'm very happy for the encounter of these nice and beautiful girls, very heart warming, made a very good souvenir thank you.

Amazing!!. We had great time with the Kanji house girls, three beautiful girl very polite and with good english skills, wrote our names in Kenji, definitly one of the best "souvenirs"that we bring back home!!!unique!I show it also to my Japanese friend and he was impressed too from such beautiful calligraphy!One of the best experience in Japan!Highly raccomended!

Great experience . The 2 lovely Japanese (English speaking) ladies lead you to the interior of a beautiful studio with titami mats to creat your name with traditional kanji characters based on your character. Something special to take home and show your friends. Highly recommend a visit.
Great Place!!. I had a great time at Kanji House. The three ladies that worked there were very nice and their work was beautiful. Would highly recommend!

Good experience. I was been in the kanji house. They are three beautiful girls, kind and hospitable. After a little interview where you describe yourself they choose your kanji name. It was a great experience, if I go back in Tokyo safely I return.

Experience the world of japanese cuisine. I think it is a great experience for all who have an interest in Japanese culture, history and cuisine.ABC cooking lesson was quite interesting (not hard but not so easy ;) Test of Sushi Rolls was great!Thank you.

Great tour!. Coredo is a complex of 3 newly constructed shopping centers and I signed up for this 1 1/2 hour Taste of Japan tour at a very reasonable cost of JPY 1,000 (roughly USD $10). Being of Japanese ancestry and living in Hawai'i, I am very familiar with Japanese foods but still felt this tour taught me a lot. It was very informative and I especially loved hearing about how each shop not only sold specialty food items, but went into great lengths to duplicate the shop's interior using materials (i.e. stone flooring from Castles, gold leaf, etc.) from the representing prefecture. Normally, I would not pay much attention to these details, but left with a great appreciation for the aesthetic value as well as the food. Just a warning though. This tour is by no means a "food tour", so it's not be confused with replacing a meal. It's more of a learning experience and highly recommended!
Perfect tour. The tour was well organized, starting point easy to find, nice English speaking guide, delicious food samples.

perfect activity :-). We enjoyed it very much! :-) Ladies were very nice and explained everything to us. The food and drink samples were delicious and encouraged us to explore more about local food, drink and art. Arigato! :-)
Good experience for my kids. We have had such a great time.You can learn about Coredo shopping park and even you will get a wonderful souvenir.

Nihonbashi area, Tokyo. Visit the Nihonbashi Information Center - very friendly, professional young ladies, dressed in yukata, excellent English, broad knowledge about traditions and places to visit. They offer Origami Workshop, Design Your Own Hanko, Gourmet tour, Cultural Tour ...
Amazing Yukatas. I enjoyed so much of this tour from chopsticks to an awesome day strolling around in a traditional summer yukata and drawing crazy attention.

good experience. very nice over all services, best location and best experience,every one were very cooperative,and explained things very extensively,this is our first experience.best of all.from our side

Gourmet Food Tasting in Japan. The only missing in this tour was they forgot to showcase how the baker moulds his red bean dessert by hand and how to make sushi (guests will have a hands on experience on this). I think that would be the highlight of the tour. But overall it is an experience tasting the food of Japan because of the wide variety and uniqueness in taste. It is so yummy!

Amazing experience. We had the kimono experience, taste of Japan and origami experience, which were all fantastic. The staff here were absolutely amazing and very informative. I thoroughly enjoyed my first day in Tokyo with this culture immersion experience and will definitely be returning to take part in more activities. Thank you to everyone at Omotenashi Nihonbashi in COREDO Muromachi, and Kaoru at metropolis!
Fun little Japanese taster experience. A good way to learn a bit of where some of the key Japanese foods come from. Don't expect to get full up on the taster samples though.

Whole Japan in one place. Totally recommended! A cultural and welcoming environment!! A lot of things was learnt in Nihonbashi! Delicious food and many different activities to do during the day. You might have the opportunity to meet new people if you have by yourself or to enjoy with family or couple.
Participated in mini event. My friend and I went to make hanko. The process was really quick and the staff were very helpful. I enjoyed myself and would recommend it to anyone! :)
Great tour. Great tour. Well explained and also different little snacks to try. I really liked the trivia that was given during the tour

Cheap tour and very friendly guide!. Me and my boyfriend stayed in Tokio for 5 days in November 2015. We had our hotel in nihombashi so our way to curedo was very short. The tour is good for people who want a short overview of the gourmet-story of Japan. The guides are explaining everything what you see and you can even try most of the stuff -sweets and so on. They were always friendly and spoke in a pleasant speed to us. We really enjoyed our time in the curedo mouromachi centre and are looking forward to visit the centre and the friendly ladies again :)!!

Detailed introduction. The guide introduced many food and Japanese culture. Some food taste and smell good, especially カツオ.It is really good to know the things outside Tokyo, because It's too far for me to go to other county (e.g. 北海道).Thanks for the introduction.
Fabulous Gourmet Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed this great value tour and our guides were very informative and helpful with any questions.
Nihonbashi visit. Good value for visitors to nihonbashi.Guides were friendly and very well informed.i would recommend this info centre to others

Highly recommended! Amazing tour!. Full of surprise for this short tour. I really enjoyed to listen each shop's explanation and really feel proud to be a Japanese! The stuffed fish for explanation in Ninben is worth to see! A lot of tasting and souvenir is included, and even green tea break with outlet for charger is really more than ¥1,000 yen!

Excellemt!. Anyone can give a tour. Walk around, talk, and point. These women who give tours for the Information Center do more than that. They are foreigners who can do all of that, but in different languages and explain the sights with the precision of a local expert, but with the excitement of a tourist! My wife enjoyed our two guides, as it wasn't stuffy at all. Jokes, history, and a tour. It was like friends walking around together. If reccomend any of their activities

Excellent service. The centre is next to the Misukoshimae 三越前 Station, on the basement level.The people working in the centre are very nice, and most of them can speak fluent English.I joined the cultural tour. They introduce the Japan food and other culture in English, I tried some simple hands-on experiences and some Japanese special foods.If you would like to have a visit of the centre, I suggest you make call at least 2 days in advance to reserve. They can help to reserve different courses, e.g. the cultural tours, 'Kimono rental & dressing' and 'The way of tea'.Besides of the cultural tours, remember to bring cash to pay for other courses which they help to reserve for you.

Great start to Japan trip. My daughter was travelling to Japan for the first time and I was looking for an interesting activity for our first day in Tokyo. We were able to do a combined tour covering the shopping areas and the shrine and it was the perfect introduction. We learned the correct ways to behave at a shrine, and a brief background of each of a few traditional industries or products. The guides were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. I'd recommend this to anyone with an afternoon to spare as it gave me new insights into various aspects of Japan, and set my daughter up with a good introduction to Japan.

Pleasant introduction to Japanese food products. My 23 year old daughter and I had a great time with the Information Center tour guides going around the Coredo food stalls. We were so confident about the food products we tried and talked about that we went around again shopping for them. I will definitely try the other tours.

Nice gastronomic glimpse of Japan . My son and I really loved our time at Nihonbashi Information Center Tours in Coredo Muromachi. We took the Gastronomic tour and had a nice glimpse of Japan, knowledgeable and tasty! Our hostesses fluent in English, as they were young people studying Japanese and working in Tokyo. Of course the tour is commercial, but this is the oldest House of merchants in Japan. I will highly recommend it, it's really good value as well as great fun. Next time I'm in Tokyo I surely will spend more time in Coredo Muromachi.

Totemo Omoshiroi (Very Interesting). By far one of the most interesting, and informative tours I have been on! I learned so many things I had not know even though I am a frequent traveler to Japan.Thank You!

well-prepared & charming guiding. About Japanese culture, such as Shinto-shrine, kitchen utensils, fish broth, lacquer-ware and Hashi, the guiding was pretty informative and the guides' conduct was considerate & professional. Complimentary gifts were all refined items and hard to choose. I bet everyone can enjoy this tour.

interesting and informative. in just one session we were able to learn a lot on the cultural heritage of Japan. what was more impressive was that we were able to have some hands on experiences as well..

Very interesting experience to discover old Tokyo. Great for non-Japanese speakers who wish to learn more about this district of Old Tokyo. It is usually difficult to find touristic tours in Tokyo, but this one is easy to join (online), cheap and qualitative thanks to a nice staff.

Beat of japan. Good adventure. Presenters though non Japanese have good knowledge of Japanese food and culture. Worth spend the 1.5 hours touring the 10 shops in the shopping centre led by knowledgable guides.

Best of Japan Gourmet Tour. Well organised and I can feel the sincerety to show us the good food of Japan. The food items are well chosen and take me to another level of understanding local diets. Love the experience. Special thanks to the 2 tour guides for their patience and care. Highly recommended.

Tour of upmarket food area in mid-Tokyo. The Nihombashi area was traditionally a place for local food - some suppliers have been here for generations. The old area has been replaced by a huge modern development, but the food stores and many eating places remain. The information centre provides tours with guides speaking our languages. We go to 10 different food shops and the type of food is explained, most with tasting (though not unfortunately a free oyster!) Really interesting.

Great way to see Tokyo. We did the Old Down Town tour and it was fantastic. Our tour guides were well prepared and deeply knowledgeable about the area. Definitely got to see parts on Tokyo I would never have stumbled across myself. I will definitely use this company again for another tour.

Great way to get a feel for Tokyo if time is short. Had a really fun afternoon with Soshi in Tokyo. Got to see things that make Tokyo unique at a good pace without rushing. Soshi was genuinely interested in our small group and listened patiently to all our comments and questions.

Best way to see Tokyo. I did the historical tour with Soshi which was an amazing guide. He was very knowledgeable about Tokyo and the history of Japan. Riding a bike through Tokyo is the best way of seeing the city. My favourite thing I did in Tokyo. Can definitely recommend it.

Excellent way to see the major sites and small side streets. Soshi was an amazing guide, and he runs an awesome operation with his bike tours. I liked seeing Tokyo this way because in between the sites, you get to see real life Tokyo, rather than just the inside of a subway car or the taxi cab. I highly recommend this tour!

A "must do" when in Tokyo. Really enjoyed biking all around Tokyo with our guide, Soshi. It was one of the highlights of my trip to Japan. Lunch spot was excellent! Definitely would do another tour with Tokyo Miracle Cycling on a return trip.

Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour. We have only stayed in Tokyo for three days. As soon as we have arrived from Sapporo, we have had a bike tour in a heart of Tokyo. It was great to have very considerable Soshi. It is one of the best ways to see Tokyo.

A great way to see Tokyo.. I went for a 3 weeks backpacking trip around Japan a few weeks ago and Tokyo was my first stop. It was the first thing I planned to do when I set foot in Tokyo and one of the highlights of my trip in Japan.The bike tour is a great way to see Tokyo, travelling around the city just like the locals. The office is easily accessible by both the subway and JR lines and then a short walk from the station. I was booked on to the Old Town tour, which was a whole day tour, and ended up having the whole tour to myself! Aki was my guide for the day and he was absolutely fantastic. He looked after me very well throughout the tour. He knows a lot about all the places we visited and introduced to me the fascinating Japanese cultures! We even visited some of the hidden places and neighbourhood areas which are not listed in the itinerary on the website, which made the tour extra special! I had a fantastic time on the tour and plan to join another tour when I visit Tokyo again in the future! I definitely recommend the bike tours for those who wants to see a little more of Tokyo!

Don't miss this. Best way for new visitors to see Tokyo . We had considered a bus tour but the reviews were not great, so thought we might try the Half-Day cycle tour instead. It was fantastic, even in the rain. Maybe that's why there were no other people on the tour, but don't let poor weather deter you. Soshi was our guide and gave us excellent rain gear, including shoe covers, in addition to good quality bikes with proper Shimano gears! We came back dry having seen a lot of Tokyo. It is all flat, so very easy and Soshi was an excellent leader giving very clear directions, where to turn and slow down, and he was very informative about not only the sights, but also the customs of Japan. Very safe too as cycling in Japan is allowed on most pavements (generally wide in Tokyo) and even one way smaller streets with few cars and interesting lanes to avoid the main thoroughfares. Thoroughly recommend it.

The best way to see Tokyo. After spending 4 days on the subway (which was an experience!) I decided to try a bike tour. Given Miracle Cycling Tour was a 3 minute walk from my hotel, it was perfect.I was met by Soshi and the administration was quick and efficient.What turned out to be a private tour was a great experience. Soshi was not only professional and friendly, but also knowledgeable and easy to chat with. In addition, he made it easy to follow with hand signals at all times.I enjoyed the 3 hours of riding on the morning tour. We saw a lot of sites including Ginza, the fish markets, the business and electronics districts and the Imperial Palace East Garden. There were also some interesting areas which would not normally be on the tourist agenda.Best part of my site seeing and so glad I made the decision to go.Thanks Soshi.

One of the finest city bike tours in the world. Do NOT miss this. Great way to see Tokyo.. I like touring a new city by bicycle and do it every chance I get. I have taken one day bike tours in New Orleans, Berlin, Sao Paulo, Rio, Paris, Munich, London, Amsterdam, New York, Chicago, Florence, Madrid, Toledo, Barcelona, and Victoria. Was not sure whether Tokyo would be a bike friendly city. Decided to find out. What a surprise! Tokyo is FANTASTIC for cycling! The trains are so good and parking so expensive that the streets are relatively empty and drivers are super courteous. Oddly, we street to ourselves. Also, the roads are immaculately maintained. They are clean, well-paved, and well-marked. Tokyo is pretty flat. A few hills, but this is not San Francisco (which is also a great biking town). The bikes are excellent. Miracle has a nice arrangement with Tokyo bikes for very nice, seemingly new bikes that work perfectly (very often the bikes you ride on day tours are heavy beasts in need of a friendly wrench. These were nice bikes with low end Japanese components, meaning that they ride better than Italian racing bikes did in 1980. Seriously.)Yu was our guide at Miracle. He speaks excellent English from having lived in the US, he is a Tokyo native and loves his city, he knows every side street and keeps you out of traffic. He rides safely, stops often, and does a fine job explaining things. He did a first rate job -- truly one of the best. We took the history tour that covered Hibiya Park, the overrated Imperial Palace, the underrated Old Hongo area, Tokyo University, Old Yanaka area, Ueno Park, Akihabara, and Ginza. Yu knows each of these areas well and gave wonderful history or stories related to each. The trip also included a visit to the Yasukuni shrine. Yu was articulate about the ambiguity of this place and understood the politics of it well. It is a complex topic, but the shrine is a Shinto memorial to 2,466,532 people plus some animals who have died in Japan's wars over the past two centuries. In the shrine's Book of Souls are 1,068 people convicted of war crimes during World War II. Fourteen of these were convicted of Class A war crimes including the brutal rape of Nanjing and other mass atrocities against civilians. It is the virtual enshrinement of these fourteen names that has made The Shrine has become a political symbol of the ultra-right in Japan. Many prime ministers, foreign heads of state, and even the Japanese emperor boycott the Yasukuni shrine for this reason. Personally, I thought it was a fitting memorial for a nation's war dead, but thought that the statue honoring kamikaze warriors was in poor taste and that the military museum on the grounds not only whitewashed atrocities but detracted from commemorating the war dead. That is the duality of Yakasuni). The tour was educational, fun, not too tiring, included an excellent lunch, and attracted a fantastic woman from Malaysia who we became friends with. Super highly recommended. We plan to do the night tour tomorrow.

Great way to discover another side of Tokyo. Although we had visited the main sites in Tokyo already, this was a very nice way to see the city from another side because you cycle from one area to another rather then taking the subway, as we did before. Our guide was very good, informative and adapted the pace of the tour to our group, which was very much appreciated. The bikes were very good & light, the perfect citybikes. A must do if you have the time and like to discover a city via bike.

Excellent equipment, knowledgeable guide, helpful office staff - can't say enough!. Our guide, Aki, was fantastic - good pace, great information, really good English. Then he and Yu spent gratuitous concierge time after our tour researching other trip plans including restaurant reservations, massage appointment, other tour sites. The bike was just perfect - well maintained and outfitted. I felt safe and we actually got some riding in, which I wanted since I am a cyclist back home. I did the halfday afternoon and we even ran over (after checking with us if okay) because we had so much Q&A and he stopped so I could grab some yakitoris and rice drink. Excellent service!!

Soshi the bike crusader. The highlight of our 5 star (first) trip to Tokyo Japan. All I have done since coming back to Perth Australia is recommend Tokyo Miracle Cycling tour to everyone. You get to see places that no one else will show you. The back alleys, the small tucked away temples, the fermented rice drink that has been brewed by the same family for 100 years. Soshi will take you there.

A great afternoon exploring Tokyo. We booked an afternoon tour, as we were the only couple we had a private tour.Our guide, Yu, was very friendly and showed us parts of the fantastic city that we had not seen. Following 5 previous days of sightseeing by foot and public transport, this bike tour was an excellent way to create a mental map of all the different areas of the city.We only wish that we had taken this tour on our first day in Tokyo, we will be back for sure on our next visit.

Perfect Way To See Tokyo!. I took the all day Historic Tokyo tour. It was six hours of mostly flat cycling with frequent stops for sightseeing and breaks. It was about 15 miles total riding. Our group was 7 tourists and 2 guides. Both guides spoke excellent English. They have figured out the easiest ways to get you into attractions and around Tokyo, I saw so much more than if I would have done this myself. There are several opportunities to purchase small items along the way, so make sure you have loose change. Lunch was a Bento box along the riverbank, and they provide one bottle of water for the ride and lunch. Really glad that I spent to Saturday doing this!

An absolute must if you want to have a back tour of Tokyo. This was one of our highlights of a recent trip to Tokyo. Akira was our tour guide and was an absolute delight. He provided a fantastic insight into the back streets of Tokyo and did so with a sense of humour. Highly recommend Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour!!!

Tokyo Day Ride. Did the historical day bike tour today with Sochi. What an absolute marvellous day. Sochi is a wonderful guide, his English is great, he showed us things and took us through parts of Tokyo we would never have found and at an easy pace.I can't recommend this Tour enough.
Great way to experience the city. Excellent way to get some exercise, see the city, and learn. The tour guides are funny and knowledgeable.

Tokyo - bike it!. THIS is the way to see Tokyo - and that may surprise you. This great, big confusing city is really lots of old and new villages around a palace. Instead of cramming on the trains - join guide Akira (who speaks excellent English) for a tour of Tokyo's famous and hidden sights. Good bikes, extras like rainwear, bags and helmets. You can bike on the roads or the pavements and the company makes sure you are safe. I took the Y6,000 half day tour and loved it.Famous places like Ginza/Nihonbashi/Akihabara/Sumo area/Imperial Palace - and then the real charm of the backstreets and old areas of the city - the 100 year old tofu shop, the laquer-maker, the geisha home, the pigeon who sat on my hand, a tropical big butterfly, dogs in bike baskets, maid cafe culture, food and ....and...and!REALLY fun. Not so hard work - 14 km, but mainly flat. Easy pace with stops.I've known Tokyo for years and this tour showed me places I hadn't visited, and gave me an understanding of how the different areas are linked.Going to go on a day tour next time :-) See you there!

Great way to celebrate a special day! All worth it! :). It was a last-minute decision to book the bike tour until my love of bikes and local culture persisted in my mind. It was the most memorable solo travel by far. This trip was very special to my heart coz I got the chance to visit Japan (my childhood dream play place) for the first time from a very busy corporate life and multiple business trips. It was made sweeter because I travelled there to celebrate my birthday - turns out international trip has been my preferred birthday ritual 3 years in a row now (AU,SG,JP). :) But there's more - the trip was made even more special as the staff of Tokyo Miracle Bike Tour made an extraordinary effort to celebrate my birthday with them in their humble office which was decorated by a very beautiful Pinatawith bunch of snacks and coke. Glad to have shared that precious moment with Soshi, Han, Lei, and Sarah! Apart from the amazing bike tour routes, the whole experience from end-to-end and ultimately gaining some genuine friends with very vibrant personalities along rocked the experience. It was crazy way beyond! Could not help but cry with much joy and happiness by the time. Never felt incomplete eventhough my family was not with me on my birthday. They made me feel so blessed and welcomed. :)This was also the very reason for being late sharing my review - I really just want to savour the moment and memories by myself (got a bit selfish there! haha). All the Best to the team of Tokyo Miracle Cycling tour and now my Friends - Soshi, Lei, and Han!!! :)Don't be tired touching lives of many travellers through your healthy and heart-warming local tours (The Real Tokyo Experience). More power!!! :) I will definitely see you all again soon. Keep in touch! :)Maraming Salamat (Doumo arigatou gozaimasu),RC :)

Fabulous day cycling through Tokyo. Highly recommended! We booked very late the day before but Miracle bikes fitted us in. There were four of us in total. The bikes were fine - even for my very tall son. We cycled around the city and into the suburbs in the morning. It was very relaxing and a good way to see parts of Tokyo we would never have discovered on our own, Aki made us all feel very safe. The middle of the day around the Tokyo Big Sight was a bit like touring a much bigger version of Melbourne Docklands....so /so, but the lunch was fantastic!! Aki filled us in the whole way on where we were, what we were seeing, why it was important and what to eat and how to eat it in Japanese fashion. We did try to book another day later in our stay but the dates didn't match up. It inspired us to also try cycling in other cities on our trip.

Fun way to see the city. I found this 3-hour bike tour to be strangely relaxing - which is a good thing! Taking a bike tour in a city as large as Tokyo can sometimes be intimidating, but Tokyoites are so courteous and orderly, that riding around the city streets is not dangerous or scary. I did the half-day, 3-hour tour with 2 other people and really enjoyed getting to experience the Tokyo neighborhoods and side streets. Our tour guide was friendly and provided some fun tips and information along the way.

Perfect way to see a city of 38 million!. Our family including 3 kids (13, 11 & 8) completed the night tour taking in several bridge crossings and visiting several areas of Tokyo including Ginza. Aki was a great host!!!

Wonderful way to see Tokyo. We went on the all day bike tour with four other travellers plus our guides, Yu and Arki. This was a wonderful way to see Tokyo winding our way along the very bike friendly streets and bike paths of Tokyo. As it was a Sunday the city was busy with lots of travellers but this did not impede our tour. This tour is the most difficult of the four tours according to Arki but it was not arduous for us (moderately fit 50 year olds). There were a few small hills around Ropongyi but the climbs were short. Yu and Arki were very friendly, caring and informative.

Outstanding guide and ride around Tokyo!. We had (my 67 year old wife and I) a 30 km and 6 hour ride around Tokyo.Excellent guide in every moment to share the road and show us where to go.Very safe ride, excellent historic comments about the city, interesting stops.We loved it and recommended the evening ride to some friends and they also loved it.We would do it again and again and again!

Soooooo good!! Definitely best way to see city . Couldn't recommended this highly enough! Such a great way to see the city. Guides were awesome, spoke really good English and gave us an awesome dinner recommendation too!!

Great day exploring a new city. We did the afternoon half day city tour with Soshi as our guide, there were 4 of us on the tour . We had just landed in Tokyo the morning of the tour found, it a great way to get our bearings around the city as it is our first time to Japan.The bikes are easy to ride, the roads and paths we rode on we're in perfect condition making the ride super easy with some stops along the (especially soya ice cream stop ) the 3 hrs went really quickly. We covered some areas you would never find if you were searching by foot.Never felt uneasy with the traffic, cars seam to understand. In all, a great afternoon may even do another tour if time permits on our time in Japan.

Super bike tour !. Did the evening tour with the company and it was super. The tour took us to many off the beaten paths, and also some famous spots. Well organized, a super host (Aki) , good bikes and most importantly fun! I have done many bike tours in various countries but this one stands out- imagine riding down the main street in Tokyo (Ginza ) on your bicycle; couldn't imagine this happening in other large metropolitans!

Cycling tour. Aki was our tour guild, he was amazing. His knowledge is second to none, his English exceptional & he made sure we were always safe. We will be back with our kids for the rugby World Cup and this will be one of our first stops! Thanks guys!!!!

super fun!. a must do in tokyo!!!! weve seen Tokyo before but its different on a bike!!! The tour can take you to places that would be difficult to do on foot given the time frame. Sochi, our guide, was amazing!!! will definitely do this again!
Bike tour. I highly recommend this bike tour. Our tour guide, Aki was knowledge, friendly, and accommodating. This by far is the best way to see the city.

Excellent evening bike tour. We met at the office and was greeted by our tour guide, Aki?, who was very kind and knowledgeable about the city. He spoke English well and was always mindful of our safety as we biked through downtown Tokyo. We had enough time to stop and take pictures.I definitely recommend taking a camera or at least having a good camera phone. There is a small storage bag on the bike. When we went it was very humid so I recommend wearing comfortable clothes and shoes. The bike tour itself is not very strenuous.
Such a great way to get to know a city. Awesome experience with a very friendly and knowledgable tour guide. We did the historical tour, can absolutely recommend that one...
Nice view of the city. Nice guide Aki! He showed us famous historic places but also some little spots of Tokyo. Even when it's raining a lot, it's still worth it!

Brilliant, easy riding, see all secret sites. This was a very easy ride. Lovely views of the river and city. You go places you probably would not walk. Have a 15 and 12 yo and they found cycling easy. Guide is polite, brilliant English and v v v helpful. Don't expect history tour of Tokyo. It's more a see and picture tour. See business districts and some beautiful residential sites. Well worth it. We did the night ride. It was very peaceful.

Fantastic evening ride around the streets of Tokyo. Four of us booked the late afternoon 3 hour cycle .. It was so much fun and our wonderful guide Aki was so knowledgable . We all had great bikes and it was an exhilarating way to get a true glimpse of the scale of Tokyo .We saw the palace gardens the surreal techs areas and the boulevards of Ginza .A real highlight was getting involved in a local street festival where the generous locals invited us to join the fun and insisted on giving us drinks and food .Aki made it a truly memorable evening and his magic wave that made all the lights turn green on cue and infectious smile will stay with us all as a lasting memory .An absolute must do

Wonderful tour with Aki. Aki took us on an afternoon bike tour for a group of four of us. It was a pleasant way to see the different districts that Tokyo had to offer - It was a pretty refreshing view from the bike. Made me want to rent a bike over the course of my next days in Tokyo and just travel that way. Aki was a wonderful host for us and he showed us some very interesting things. Took us for some cool local snacks - even grasshoppers in the older parts of town. It was a long and worthwhile experience and i'd highly recommend it for other travelers especially if they like to bike. Thanks so much Aki for taking care of us and for even helping us afterwards with reservations during the wonderful chat with had about the tour group and the city. Thanks for making it happen! The Kobe beef place you suggested was absolutely delightful. -Ted

If you have one day in Japan - do this!. July 2016I recently booked the Historical of Japan bike tour with Akira. first of all, I was only available with one day in Japan and I was so thankful that they continued the tour with just me. Wonderful. To start, the bike was wonderful. I cannot believe how great the brand Tokyo bikes is. Just wonderful - in fact, I am thinking of buying one. I especially love they have the extra seats so I did not need to wear my bike pants. Regarding the tour - just fantastic. Akira was my guide. First of all - so easy to find thanks to the wonderful directions (with pictures). Akira’s english was great and I love the stores. I could not have asked for a better experience. The bike ride was really easy - nice and flat and 6 hours went by too fast. I was surprised I got a beautiful lunch Akira ordered for me. Akira even made a few extra stops just for me. I highly recommend this company and Akira in particular. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Nice tour. My husband and I did the half morning on our first day in Tokyo, which we absolutely loved.We cycled for three hours throughout Ginza, Nihombashi, Sumida-Ryogoku, Akihabara and Marunouchi.We stopped at kilometer zero Tokyo, the sumo stadium, Akihabara area, a real geisha's house, the imperial gardens and whenever I needed some rest:) Our guide explained the route before and after the cycling, equipped us with all necessities, water, juice and some Tokyo tips. We really enjoyed this and would recommend it for those who want to see the town in a different way.

These guys go the extra mile !. Our guide was Yu. A well spoken polite and knowledgable young guy who was both patient and accommodating.The bikes were easy to ride and in great condition.We rode with rain forecast even though other companies would not do this. This was important to us as we only had one day left and wanted to ride no matter what. Absolutely fantastic. Christian

Amazing experience, best way to see the city, . Had a wonderful time with our tour host Yu! He was very patient, pleasant and carefully guided our group through the busy Tokyo streets. It helped that the tour was on a Sunday where most of the traffic comprised of pedestrians. The weather also cooperated with milder than normal temps for mid - July. We had ample time to enjoy all the stops and Yu had an in depth knowledge about each place. I took the 6hr tour, which for me (who's not biking that often) was a bit much towards the end when we had to climb one last hilly course. But overall a great experience, very happy I tried it!
Japan Vacation!. My husband and I did this tour today! It was a fantastic! Our guide was wonderful and the bike were in great shape! We definitely do it again!

Great experience!. One of the best experience during our trip in Tokyo. My two teenagers and I did a half day tour several days ago. We were the only ones in the tour. So, we had a wonderful private tour with our guide Yu. He was awesome and very friendly. His English is excellent. Yu took us to the areas that we would have not thought about visiting. He also pointed out to us where to explore later on. He is very knowledgeable. We would like to do that again next time for a full day tour when we come back to Tokyo. It was a great experience if you want to have a taste of biking in Tokyo.

The best way to see Tokyo. Probably the best thing my wife and I did on a short holiday in Tokyo. The half day tour of 3 hours covered 16 km, and brought us to parts of Tokyo we would never have seen if we were on the metro or bus. Our guide, Aki was fantastic - spoke great English and ever so patient with us! Next time we will be back with our kids in tow =)

Great tour, seeing Tokyo in the rain. We had a great time yesterday doing the tour with our guide, Yu. He had a great understanding of the places we toured, and he was very friendly and helpful. They were very well prepared with the equipment, supplying us with rain gear, since it was raining that day.We saw most of the worth-going-to places in Tokyo, so it's quite comprehensive. They also took us to a very traditional Japanese restaurant that was very value for money. We think that this is one of the best ways to see Tokyo if you prefer not to be cooped up in a car.

The weather was miserable, the tour awesome!. Unfortunately we took the tour in the height of rainy season, but we were not to be deterred! The show went on! We put on our provided rain gear and went on the tour with Sochi, our guide and owner of the tour company. Sochi is very knowledgeable, friendly and gave a great half day tour of Tokyo. His English is excellent as well.We visited sites I wouldn't have gone too ourselves like the Sumo wrestling arena and a shop that sells amasaki, an interesting drink made of fermented rice. The tour group was small ( just me, my husband, and another fellow). I felt safe biking through Tokyo and didn't feel at risk of getting hurt. Most of the ride took place on sidewalks, which is a common practice in Japan. After the tour we returned to the tour's office and had some refreshments and chatted. A couple weeks later we received a nice follow up email and group picture.Great customer service. Definitely recommend! It's a wonderful way to see Tokyo and get some exercise :)

Great ride through Tokyo!. My husband and I did the half day tour and had a lovely time. Our guide, Yu, was very kind and knowledgable. It was a great way to get acquainted with the sprawling city and see several different neighborhoods in one afternoon. I Recommend doing this on your first day in the city.

Fun especially when wallet is found. Took half day tour with Soshi. He obviously knows the city really well and conducted the tour in a very safe and entertaining way. Truly recommend this activity. Left my wallet in the bike pouch....panicked thinking it was lost. Fortunately was able to get it back thanks to Soshi who found it straight away after my urgent call. Cannot thank him enough for such an honest gesture.

Kid friendly tag a long bikes. This was probably the best thing we did in Tokyo. We were 2 adults and one 6 year old. I found this company on Trip Advisor and they answered emails quickly. They have a Tag a long bike and this meant we could do the tour with our child. We did a half day on a Sunday. It was very safe and easy for us. Our tour guide was lovely and we got to see a large part of Tokyo. We could never do this with a child walking. I really recommend this. I think they have two tag a long bikes.

Wonderful 1/2 day bicycle tour. We had a wonderful time and be at a bicycle tour. The owner was our guide. We went around the different areas of the city. We stopped at areas that were off the beaten track in addition to main sights. A nice way to see different parts of the city.

Fantastic Tours!. We booked a half day tour on a weekend, and we had the best time! Yu was a wonderful guide and clearly love his job. The idea of biking through busy Tokyo is a bit daunting, but we never felt at risk with Yu as our guide. We saw much, much more of Tokyo on this bike tour than is possible on foot in a weekend. The bikes are new and well cared for, and they supply helmets. Next time we're booking a night tour! You won't be disappointed!

Easy safe way to see Tokyo . Safe secure and fun. Cycling in Tokyo is very safe. We went on main roads thru Ginza, down side and back streets and into imperial palace park, so covered every type of terrain but always felt very safe everywhere. Tokyo is flat so it's a really easy cycle. Motorists are polite and it wasn't nearly as busy as IImagined. Our guide was very helpful and we covered a lot of the different areas stopping for photos along the way. Bikes are road bikes with thin wheels and easily adjusted seats. We were out for 3.5 hours which was a good time to get idea of where you'd like to go back to. Highly recommend to get overview.

Great way to see Tokyo. We love doing these city bike tours the first day we arrive in a city. It's a great overview of what to visit. Aki was a great guide and spoke excellent English. The bento box lunch was possibly my favorite part of the ride. It's an easy ride and just keep your head on a swivel in traffic.

Absolutely loved it!. It's our first time in Tokyo and figured the best way to get to know the city is by bike. We booked the half day tour on our first day. It was a good way to get our bearings and get insider info from a local. Soshi is awesome at his job. Despite us not having been on a bike in more than a decade, we felt very safe and Soshi was able to show us Tokyo in a way that he was able to balance tourist must-sees and local life. I've recommended him to some friends who happened to be in Japan at the same time and they loved the experience as well.

Fantastic . Thank you Yu for a fantastic day bike riding around Tokyo. My husband and I had the best day , we really enjoyed seeing the sights and having everything explained to us. Truly a great experience. A must do.

Best way to experience Tokyo!. My 12 yo and I did the morning half-day tour with the delightful Aki as our guide. We don't cycle much at home, but I felt confident about the 3 hour ride; in retrospect, we would've enjoyed the full day tour. We were well equipped with fitted cycles & helmets (optional). The Tokyo traffic was my only concern, but it was well navigated and we were in good hands with our competent guide. There was a family with 2 young children on the same tour and it seemed that everyone enjoyed themselves. We've been to Tokyo before, but this has been the absolute highlight of our trips. Two thumbs up!

Invigorating Half Day Cycling Tokyo Tour. First time to do a cycling tour in my travels and boy did I love it. Felt like a kid again! Went during Sakura season upon the recommendation of a friend. Fantastic and informative way to see Tokyo.

A really great way to see a lot of the city. We did two cycle tours - the early-bird and the old Downtown. Both very worthwhile. Good tour guides, you get to explore parts of the city you would not normally get to. Good fun, safety was well looked after.

Great tour + brilliant guides. We only had 4 days in Tokyo but are very pleased to have used one of them on this. A great experience. Aki and Yu are excellent guides with real enthusiasm, while the tour itself takes in a massive area and many sites that would take you half a day to get around using conventional means. City riding is easy with flat roads and considerate drivers. Thoroughly recommended!

Great day. What a great way to see the city. We lucked out and the other couple that had booked with us didn't show, so we had a private tour with Shoshi (I hope I spelled his name right). He was very knowledgable about the city and showed us some great spots along with speaking nearly perfect English. He even took us by the Tokyo stock exchange as it was not normally on the tour but something we wanted to see. We did the half day tour and really got a great feel for the city. My wife even wants to live there now. After our tour they recommended a great little Ramen restaurant down the street called Max Ramen, definitely try it after.Thanks for a great day.

Fantastic day! . I just finished the full day bike tour around Tokyo, which was absolutely great! Our guide was Yu, and he was extremely friendly, fluent in English and very knowledgable. It was my friends birthday and we mentioned it during the tour- when we had finished Yu had organised a cake for her! Such a personal touch, that made this tour even better. Thanks Yu and all staff highly recommend this to anyone who wants to see Tokyo

Very good cycling tour for Tokyo discovery. Very nice day during this cycling tour with Miracle team.This is for me the best way to visit a wide area in a single day. We choose the Old Down Town tour. I deeply recommand Miracle Cycling company, everything was well organised, the bikes very good and light and our guide, Yu, is very friendly, he can speak perfectly English and provides explainations and stories a along the tour. We’ve started the tour from Shimbashi area and visited different places like the Imperial Palace, the Hibiya park, Yasuki shrine anf Old Hongo area, the University, the Yamada cimetary, wnet across the Ueno park, Hakiharaba area and finally went through Ginza to reach the company at around 3.30pm. Lunch was also provided in a small traditional restaurant wellknow for the octopus dishes. Fortunatly Yu can order for us as the owners can’t speak english at all (even the menu was in Japanese). A great experience and one of the best day I had during my stay in Tokyo.

Great Half Day Tour of Tokyo. We had an excellent guide, Soshi, that took us through several spots of Tokyo. There were 3 of us including my 11 year old son. Soshi did a great job of leading us through the streets and the sidewalks - always feeling safe. He was very informational and even included taking us through a park that was celebrating Oktoberfest (in May). Great experience and a great way to see different parts of this fantastic city.

HALF DAY BIKE TOUR THROUGH TOKYO. Fabulous afternoon adventure travelling through the busy streets and districts of Tokyo. We really loved it, our guide was very considered and took time to stop and explain many sites/areas. A great way to get about and see things you wouldn't normally see -we went on roads paths backstreets and parks, and always felt very safe - being very flat makes it an easy ride for those not so fit! Thoroughly enjoyed and highly recommend!

Experience a different side of Tokyo. I’ve been to Japan a couple of times before, but this was my first time actually taking a bike tour. I made a last minute booking for a half day tour the day before after plans for something else fell through, and I’m really glad I did.My tour was led by Soshi and he did a great job explaining the various sights and locations we visited. He’s a very friendly and relaxed guy, and was patient with any questions the group had. Biking was pretty damn easy too with no steep hills or super narrow streets. Japan, unlike some other countries, allows bikes on the streets and the sidewalks. But the best thing is that you cover so much more ground on bike than you could ever by walking. And if you ride the subway, you’re just moving from point A to point B while missing everything in-between. Not so if you have a bike. It really felt liked I saw another side of Tokyo far away from the usual tourist spots.Looking back, this was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. It was a lot better than some of the other super crowded tourist traps *cough* Skytree *cough*. I definitely recommend putting this tour in your itinerary. It’s well worth the time and money.

Fantastic day of riding with the best guide, Aki. We loved our whole day tour with Aki...a friendly and most interesting guide. We saw so much of Tokyo and learnt so much history. The route was varied, paths, roads and parks, with some hills to make it interesting. We felt safe at all times, Aki directing us well, making us confident. Either a half or full day ride is a wonderful way to see the city. The team was also very hospitable, supplying a lovely bento box lunch and afternoon snack on our return. The day exceeded our expectations. Kerrie and Wayne , from Newcastle, Australia

Fantastic Day. We had a large group of children and adults doing the tour and it was such a great day. I could of rode the bikes all day, they were very easy to ride, our path was flat all the way, and we saw some amazing things. Sunday was a good day to ride,as a part of the road was closed to traffic,and open to runners & bikes. Thanks Soshi & Yu, you made our visit to Japan complete.

Tokyo from different angle. We often do I bike tour through a city. Always you see different places then on foot.Also you get background information and opportunity to ask questions.Also this tour was great again! Thanks Soshi, Yu and Lei :)

Fun and informative Tokyo tour. Had a wonder and fun morning doing the half day tour with Soshi-san in a group of six . A fun and informative way to see quite a bit of Tokyo. WE knew there were places we'd want to go back to. The riding is easy, the bikes are modern and well maintained and we saw lots of interesting places. I'd really recommend it. Soshi-san also gave us a recommendation for a fabulous Sushi restaurant close to the shop for after the tour! So good.

Enjoyable Bike Tour of Tokyo (Even in the Rain). We enjoyed the bike tour with Soshi through Tokyo. He made a special stop for us at the Tokyo Stock Exchange which I requested. We did enjoy the historical explanation of Nihombashi Bridge (which in Japan is ground zero for all road distance measurements). The other highlights were the Sumo wrestling stadium and the cherry blossoms near the Imperial Place. Although it was rainy, Soshi supplied excellent rain gear. The rain did not affect the quality of the tour. We got a real sense of Tokyo through the bike tour. We strongly recommend the tour rain or shine.

A Relaxing Way To See Tokyo. We had a group of around 23 people. Ages ranged from 8 year old to around 50. The staff we outstanding, going out of their way to ensure that we all enjoyed the trip. Some were a bit sceptical at first because they hadn't ridden a bike for a long time but the flat terrain made cycling a breeze. Yoshi took us to places that we never have seen without the bike tour and it was certainly another side of Tokyo. Where else can you see a pet duck on a leash with socks on! Highly recommend this to anyone visiting the city of Tokyo, you will not be disappointed.Dan T (Newcastle, Australia

Great tour. Great way to see a variety of things in Tokyo in a relatively short period of time. This was our first activity, and it helped get us oriented in the city. Would've liked a bit more information as we went along, but it was still great!

"Make this a Must on your "To Do" list". A group of 23 (adults & children) of us did the 3 hr tour. It was an awesome experience with Soshi & Yu. Not only were they entertaining but were very professional & experienced. We had a yummy morning tea stop. Thoroughly recommend this bike tour to anyone visiting Japan. They cater for all levels of fitness & make sure that no one is left behind. Do yourself a favour & book this cycling tour. A fun way to see the sites of Tokyo.
Had a great time. Very friendly tourguide and even when it's rainy, it's totally worth the money. A tour by bike is by far the best way to see a lot in just a few hours. Had a great time!

Wonderful Way to See Another Side of Tokyo. I did the Tokyo Old Down Town Tour in April. It was a day well spent. It was a great way to see the city from a different perspective. Besides visiting a few major attractions and shrines, we also visited some residential areas, which were very quiet and charming, something tourists would not do on their own. Tokyo is one of the largest, busiest cities in the world, but even in the heart of the city, never once did I feel in any danger on the roads. The Japanese respect cyclist. The bikes provided by Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour are very good quality and well maintained. The staff and guides are very enthusiastic and knowledgeable.

You have to do this!. My husband and I did the Tokyo Half Day Tour (9:30am-12:30pm) on a Saturday in April 2016. There was only one other person on our tour. Really easy to book online, and they send reminders and confirmations including exact directions on how to find the office. Our tour guide was Aki, and he was the nicest guy! Excellent English and generally really enthusiastic about teaching us about the history and traditions of Japan. The bike ride itself was easy - flat riding. We felt very safe - just follow the guides hand directions! Most of the cycling is on the footpath. There is some on-road cycling, but the drivers in Japan are respectful of cyclist, and will give way if needed. We stopped frequently to chat about the various sites and stopped to have a drink and bought yum fried tofu snacks. Cycling through Ginza was amazing - you get a different perspective on a bike as compared with walking. I highly recommend doing a tour with these guys!!!

Solid Fun. Last minute booking turned out to be a lot of fun on a "private" half day tour with the young, competent and conversational owner Soshi (OK, his nickname is quickly guessed). We were only the three of us, so we made a nice route at a slightly higher pace than in a big group, with the noteworthy hybrid bikes that had also big frame sizes to suit people of taller stature.A fun experience, I would repeat anytime with Soshi for another part of the city tour.

Ton of Fun. Tokyo is very flat and fairly compact and very bike-friendly. This was a great way to see Tokyo and both of our guides could not have been friendlier or more knowledgable. I have been to Tokyo many times but had never seen it like this. A true highlight of our trip!

Surviving Tokyo on a bike (use the road & the pavement/sidewalk) - great tour. This is a really good bike tour...our group was big so they split the group & ran two tours...only 4 of us on ours. The bikes were the best we encountered in Japan and our guide was happy, knowledgeable and made sure we were all safe. A really good way to see Tokyo and a niceconclusion....drinks and snacks back at base. A tip...if you have flown overnight from the UK, this is a great way to stay awake during the afternoon of your first day in Japan :-).

Miracle cycling tour a highlight of Tokyo!. Excellent way to see Tokyo! Can't speak highly enough of our friendly and informative guide Soshi. We had a small group of 6 and found the tour to be a great way to get our bearings in this amazing city - and later went back to visit some destinations we discovered on this tour. A must do for first timers in Tokyo.Thank you for a great time.

Amazing wat to see Tokyo . A cycling tour must be on your list to do when you are in Tokyo. We took the early bird tour and it was amazing as it was only 2 of us Aki our guide suggested some changes as it was a national holiday and it ment that the market would be closed. But in stead we saw the imperial palace and it surroundings. Aki was courteous and very friendly and he showed us a other face of this amazing city of the beaten track that normaly you would not see. For sure we will do a other tour when we are back...

Absolutely my favourite Tokyo experience! . Just got back to my hotel after a half day tour with Soshi. It was delightful from beginning to end. The taxi driver dropped me off in the wrong location, a fair way from the office so I called and Soshi happily came and met me. I'm pleased he did as I would not have found it from where I was without data on my phone to help with directions. A bike was all set up for me and waiting on my arrival. I was extraordinarily lucky to be the only one on the tour so it was completely personalized. We rode 16 km, covered many different districts and saw a huge variety of sights. From the sumo stadium and museum to the beautiful Imperial gardens. This is definitely the best thing I've done in Tokyo in the last 5 days and will leave a long lasting impression. As much for the actual tour as for the fact that Soshi was just so kind and lovely the whole way and provided excellent hand signals to give direction from ahead. He knew I really wanted to spend more time in the imperial gardens and so our tour was extended by about an extra 45 mins. A totally wonderful experience. Soshi and co. offer a not to be missed cycling opportunity. Thank you Soshi, I hope your business achieves much success. You deserve to be highly prosperous. Liz

Best way to experience Tokyo. We took a tour in January when Tokyo was in peak winter weather (apologies to soshi for the late review). We loved Tokyo and this was all round the highlight of our time there. Its a very easy city to get around on a bike so suitable for all age groups. We did a half day tour which was about right for us and were fortunate with the weather. Soshi and Co are absolutely brilliant, will definitely be back to do some of the other tours.

Great way to see Tokyo. We had a great time on our cycle tour through Tokyo. The tour took us through many neighborhoods that we would not have found on our own or on a tour bus. We got to see many points of interest up close and personal. It was a great introduction to Tokyo….my first visit.

A must activity for anyone travelling to Tokyo. Woke up late missed the morning tour was lucky to find a place in the afternoon session. Great views , excellent host and what a city .....Go ahead and take the tour

Best experience ever . I just completed my night cycle tour and I am currently on the train back to my hotel as I write this review. I am 24 Tokyo for business alone ,and I have 6 days here , currently on day 2. I feel like the next 4 days will be spent doing 4 more cycle tours with these guys. Yes! My tour was that amazing. I found the place with no problems at all the directions provide were clear and well written , they had a bike waiting for me that fit me perfectly. And my tour guide "Iba " (I hope I spelled that right )was the sweetest man I've ever meet , he answered all my questions even the ones that had nothing to do with the tour, he was so easy going and amazing . I could write a whole review on him alone. I mean if he was interested in me I'd marry him. We went to less traveled breath taking spots in Tokyo. I have amazing pictures to show for it. The pace of the tour was perfect not too fast but definitely a good little work out. About 8 miles in total. The Business district was my favorite, full of lights a many beautiful buildings . Did I mention I was the only one on the tour! Private tour !!!

A must when visiting Tokyo!!!. What a great way to see Tokyo! It was exciting and exhilarating cycling through places we would not have seen on our own. The best part was the picnic at the park. Meeting other visitors to Tokyo and sharing our experiences in this city will be a favorite memory. Yu and Aki were great guides :) We hope to take another tour with you on our next visit!

Fantastic Tour - Highly Recommend!. My wife and I did the full-day Tokyo Historical Ride with Aki and we had a great day!Aki is very friendly and knowledgeable, and spoke very good English.He introduced us to yummy Amazake and many, many different beautiful local places!I would highly recommend Tokyo Miracle Cycling - it's a fantastic and unique way to experience Tokyo!

Cycle through the streets of Tokyo!. Super experience. Plenty of bikes to choose from. Helmets provided and little bags for you essentials. Larger bags could be left in the office. The tour was well paced and we all felt really safe cycling around Tokyo. Amazingly, despite the numerous cars and people, the air was clean, the cars not invasive and the seat padding enhanced the ride. The 3 hour tour flew by and we were able to see far more of the city then we would have by walking or tube.

Great afternoon in Tokyo. I can't believe we were riding on the streets of Tokyo! What an incredible experience. My two sons aged 11 and 9 rode up the front with Soshi (I was too slow for them). Bike riding is a very important form of transport in Tokyo and it works really well - even with a population of over 13 million people! Soshi was an excellent guide, taking time to answer all our questions and showing us some interesting places in Tokyo. I highly recommend spending an afternoon with Soshi at Tokyo Miracle Cycling tours.

A Must Do in Tokyo!. If you're a cycling novice or a pro, you can't go to Tokyo without visiting Miracle Cycling Tours!The staff are ridiculously friendly, all of the equipment gets specially fitted and provided and the attractions you get to visit in a short space of time are amazing. Our group of 6 saw the top attractions of Tokyo in around two hours, so a great idea for those pushed for time, but also those who are keen to have a leisurely cycle around the city. I would highly recommend doing the tour early evening, as you get to see the city in the daylight but then also the city's beautiful bridges and towers lit up by night (including the Sky Tree and Tokyo Tower!).10/10 experience and would recommend to anyone travelling to Tokyo... We even had a beer and rice crackers with the staff team after they finished for the night as they printed out directions and menus for the best restaurants and take-aways near by! So lovely. Amazing service and amazing experience.
My daughters favorite activity in Tokyo. We loved the tour. We were introduced to places we would have never seen on our own.Soshi was a great tour guide.

Great tour. The bicycle tour allows you to see more than walking. Shosi and Ju are great tour guides, very nice, and knowledgable, and the local restaurant Soshi recommended was very good. Great experience!

Fabulous introduction to Tokyo. Peter and I enjoyed the 6 hour historic cycling tour of Tokyo. Acci was a happy, knowledgeable guide who led us through modern luxury Tokyo, geek city, historic shrines and palaces, cherry blossomed parks and tiny nostalgic alleyways with equal facility. Cycling allowed us fresh air, exercise and a more genuine interaction with real Tokyo. The tour is highly recommended.

Best way to see Tokyo!. We saw and learned so much about Tokyo in this tour. Our tour guide was so attentive and gave his 100%+ to ensure that we had a good day. I highly recommend this tour company. It was a highlight of our trip!

A highlight of Tokyo. We booked ahead and did the afternoon 3.5hr tour the day we arrived in Tokyo, after an overnight flight from Australia. Just the thing to keep us awake and energised.Instructions were good. Bikes were good. Soshi was our guide, and it was a group of 8. Our (10yo) was the only child, but the pace was fine for her. Although you ride on major roads a lot of the time, it never felt unsafe.Great introduction to Tokyo and just the right amount of information. I enjoyed stopping to try the amazake. I would highly recommend the tour. It was my husband's highlight of Tokyo.

Tokyo on a bike - 2 adults and a 10 year old. If we had known how great this ride was we would have booked for the day ride - we all loved it! Sochi was a guided us around with ease, very smooth riding, he was a great guide. We will recommend Miracle rides to anyone coming to Tokyo. The directions on the site to the office are spot on ...the key is to find the horse.

Great Tour!. We had a great afternoon tour, guided by the owner of Miracle tours. Soshi (hope I'm spelling it correctly) explained a lot and also thought us about some other typical Japanese things. It was really handy and informative! Would definitely recommend this tour!

Very nice ride. We did the 3 hours Tokyo half day tour with Soshi. We all learned so much about Japanese customs and history. The ride was very relaxed on a Saturday. We made frequent stops for photo opportunities as it was also "Hanami" season where Japanese people (and tourists) come to view the beautiful Sakura trees blossom. I would absolutely recommend this cycling tour to friends and colleagues and next time I'll definitely try one of the longer tours.

Great with teens. Great way to see Tokyo, it is an absolutely ideal way for children and adults to experience a big city. Our kids (ages 12 and 16) were very excited and we can highly recommend it to others. Thank you Soshi and Yu for a lovely afternoon.

A great time!. We did the afternoon biking tour and got a really good feel for the different parts of this beautiful city. Soshi is a great guide, very friendly and happy person. He knows the city inside out, and showed us really interesting spots. Highly recommend this tour!

A great way to see Tokyo with some wonderful hosts. We booked a three hour bike tour before we left Australia an the correspondence and instructions for finding the place were excellent. Their website is very comprehensive and user friendly. Soshi and Yu were wonderful tour guides and not once did we feel unsafe navigating the streets of Tokyo. The route was quite flat and we went though various are including the river, parks, busy shopping areas and monuments. After we did the three hour tour we had hoped to book a full day your for later in our trip but we simply ran our of time. These guys were so lovely, patient and had safety as their primary concern. This is a fabulous way to see parts of the city the way locals do, on a push bike. If we return to Tokyo, this will be the first tour we book so we can relive it all over again. Thank you Soshi and Yu for a great afternoon.

Great way to see Tokyo. Great tour! Thank you Aki! This was a great way to see Tokyo in a way that you will miss by simply walking around or without a guide. We enjoy bike tours and have taken many in our world travels. We were pleased with our ride and enjoyed the route as it took us to locations we would not have discovered otherwise. Fully recommend this company. Cheers!

Great Way to See Tokyo Sights. I was visiting Tokyo with my husband and kids (ages 11 and 8). We are avid bikers and found Miracle Cycling Tours thanks to a friend. We could not have been more pleased with our experience. Soshi - the owner of the company - was our guide. He spoke impeccable English, and was very knowledgeable on the sights we visited. We were biking on some major streets of Tokyo - he was very cautious and safe when guiding us, and we covered a lot of ground in a half-day tour. It was a great way to see the city!
Brilliant. We did 2 different tours and they were both excellent. A great way to see Tokyo. Would thoroughly recommend. We stopped at a lovely restaurant. Our guide was informative and attentive.

Nice way to see lots of the city. We went on the full-day Center of Tokyo Tour--it was the tour that was available on the only day we could do the tour. The guides were very friendly and the route of the tour took us through a huge portion of the city. Everything was planned very well and we enjoyed the bento box lunch that was provided. The only reason we wouldn't give the tour a higher rating is that it was a little slim in terms of information that we learned. We can't fault the tour company too much because the historical tour probably would have been more our taste but it didn't fit into our schedule. All in all, it was a nice experience and we would recommend it to anyone who wants to get a broad overview of the city and enjoy the company of the very pleasant guides.

One of our trip highlights, a different way to see tokyo!. We really enjoyed this tour because we were able to see a lot of attractions in a few hours as well as the experience of biking along the main road together with cars and trucks and the challenge of avoiding people! We got lost looking for their office but Yu picked us up near the station. He also ensured that we were comfy with the bikes that we were riding. Both him and Soshi were excellent tour guides. I highly recommend this tour!

One of our highlights of our trip to Japan. Definitely a must do! The tour guide Soshi, was very knowledgeable and professional! Don't miss out on this tour if you have the chance! We really enjoyed it! :D

A must do. Our cycle tour with Soshi was a highlight of our trip to Tokyo. It was an excellent way to orientate ourselves in this huge city and put into context all the places that we had been to already via the subway! The tour showed extreme contrasts of of Tokyo, big loud and colorful, versus small delicate and traditional streets.

a great active way to see much of Tokyo in a short space of time!. We had limited time in Tokyo and this early morning half day tour felt like a really good way to see Tokyo. Soshi was a great guide - he had a lot of information about Tokyo and Japan more generally which was fab!

Fun and Friendly. We took the morning Tokyo Half Day Tour on our first day in Tokyo and we all really, really enjoyed it. It is a great way to get a feel of the City. Very well organised business. Easy booking online, same day responce via email. Soshi our guide was fun and friendly, very attentive and patient (I change bikes 3 times before getting the right fit) and took the tour at our own pace (bit slow because we are a bit slow!). Best to do the tour on a weekend because there are fewer cars and pedestrians.

Just perfect. We booked a half day tour with our 3 and 5 year old. Although we most probably weren't easy customers the team and our guide were very relaxed and made everything run smooth. The tour is great and I had the feeling I got to see things not every tourist sees. Our guide Yu was fun and very friendly and could talk about many interesting topics. Highly recommended!

Biking in Tokyl. My family of five had the best ever fun experience with biking in Tokyo. Our guide Soshi took us around the streets of Tokyo and gave us a brief history of each of the areas we passed. We felt very safe and secure in this tour especially since we had our 8 year old son biking with us. We highly recommend this tour to families with kids.

Best way to see Tokyo!. We decided at the spare of the moment that we wanted to do this. Big bus tours aren't really our thing so this was our alternative. We booked online at 12pm, by 1:30pm we were at MCT and on our way to explore Tokyo. Soshi was our guide and he was amazing. He had so many cool and interesting things to share with us about Tokyo. We saw things we would simply never know to see on our own, things only locals know. Soshi was also very accomodating to our interests and quickly started sharing information about Tokyo that we would like to know. In 3 short hours we travelled to all the key areas of the city and got to know our way around Tokyo quickly. We left knowing exactly what places in Tokyo we wanted to explore more of on our own and those that we now didn't need to see. We even got some great further recommendations.Most importantly, we were completely at ease the entire time, we went at a comfortable pace and crossed all of those extremely busy intersections with no concerns, thanks to Soshi. We knew we were in safe hands.It was definitely the best way to get to know Tokyo and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting this awesome city.Thanks MCT!

Miracle of a day in Tokyo!!. We decided on a cycle tour of Tokyo on our first day and turned out you be one of the best days we have spent in a city anywhere in the world. There turned out to be only 3 of us on the all day your and our guide aki was fantastic. His English was excellent and the weather was great. We saw so many sights and the cycling was safe and easy. We would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Tokyo and make sure you do when you first arrive.

An unforgettable moment !. Cycling...definitely the best way to capture the spirit of Tokyo ! By adding his personal ''touch'' and instilling his passion for this fascinating city Soshi is a top notch guide who made this experience a real enchantment.

Fabulous way to see Tokyo & great for young kids. We signed up for this trip basically because of the great reviews it had on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. We did the half-day afternoon tour, having traveled 14 hours and arrived at Tokyo at 6.00am that morning; it was a great way to help adjust to the jet lag.We cycled with our 5 and 8 year old children, and as they were a bit tired and are not strong cyclists they used the trailers which were perfect. There was another family on the trip with a 4 and 7 year old and all the kids had a blast. The trip lasts about 3.5 hours and according to my Garmin it was just under 20k. The cycling isn’t fast or strenuous, you stop often at traffic lights and to see things.If you are expecting a high intensity cycle or a huge amount of info on Tokyo you will probably be disappointed, but if you want a gentle cycle and to pick up a few bits and pieces of information then you will be happy.We would highly recommend and it is a great activity to do with young children.

Great way to see Tokyo. Just completed the cycle tour round Tokyo, relaxed and great way to see Tokyo. Soshi, our guide, sorry if not correct spelling, stopped at interesting spots, and great to cycle through the back streets getting a feel for Tokyo. Plenty of time in the parks, so in the next month you will see the cherry blossom. Bikes in good condition, suitable for everyone.

Great intro to Tokyo. This tour was a great way to explore Tokyo and get a lay of the land on our first day. Soshi and Yu were our guides for the half day bike tour. Their English was very good and they were able to answer all of our questions. It was raining during our tour, and the company provided us with full rain gear. Our guides made me feel very safe riding on the sidewalks and streets of Tokyo, even as a novice rider. We had 4 people total in our group, which made the tour more personal. We even stopped to sip a hot fermented rice drink, which was amaaaazing! Would definitely recommend this tour!

definitely worth it!. Joining the half day morning tour was definitely one of our best experiences in Tokyo. It took us to areas and sights which would somehow be too tedious to explore by foot. Biking in the streets of Tokyo was awesome. The roads we passed were not hilly and the car drivers were very considerate of bikers. I must say , this bike tour rekindled my interest for biking!Soshi, our guide, was excellent! He was very easy to get along with and paced our ride very well.This tour is a must!.

Tokyo by bike!. Best way to cover a lot of ground and see Tokyo from a local perspective. Friendly and informative guides with and excellent English. We learnt a lot about Tokyo and Japan - culture, history and customs. Highly recommended.

Probably the best way to explore this amazing city. We booked the "Tokyo Historical Bike" Tour for our group of 11 swiss colleagues. Most of the group were afraid about riding a bike in such a metropolis. However, it was impressive how respectful we were treated by pedestrians as well as Car and Bus drivers. We saw a lot during this bike tour. A lot you would never be able to see during a Bus Tour or exploring the city as a walker. Aki our Guide was "the boss", very knowledgeable and entertaining with a good sense of humor. We had a Bentobox for lunch which we got to eat open-air in the park, just below the Cherry Trees. Amazing.Summarized, this trip was just perfect for our group who had very little time to explore the city.

Lovely intro to Tokyo. I signed up for the full day and it was the ‘Tokyo Old Down Town Tour’ on the day I wanted to ride. I had an absolutely super day out and can’t recommend a Tokyo bike tour enough. The office was easy to find for me as the location was correct in google maps.The Tokyo Bike bikes provided were modern and in good working order – you are also provided with a helmet, comfy seat pad, a little handlebar bag for your small items and a bottle of water. Aki spoke good English and was very knowledgeable and informative about Tokyo and Tokyo’s history, he was clearly passionate about the subject. He was friendly but also polite and professional and accommodating i.e. offering to take photographs etc.The actual route itself was about 20km and mainly on quiet roads, extremely quiet lovely back roads and on the pavement where roads were busier. Cycling in Tokyo felt very safe and Aki was considerate and a good ‘bike guide’ with his speed and the way he signalled direction and stopping etc. The route was interesting and varied and took in a surprising amount of Tokyo. Great as an overview of the area if you wanted to come back and explore more but also in-depth enough to feel you saw the best sights in the area if you are low on time. The included lunch was a great ‘authentic’ tasty lunch, and we stopped off for a snack in the morning as well. Overall a fantastic experience and a lovely day out. If I go back to Tokyo I would def sign up or one of the other tours (like the look of the waterfront one).

Fast, fun way to see the city. Really nice way to see Tokyo and I was so surprised at how easy it was to ride around on the roads and footpaths- everyone (including cars and buses) get out of your way. The main office was hard to find and we ended up lost but I kept the tour's phone number and they came and found us. They were very accommodating considering we were late. Highly recommend.

Tokyo on bikes. I was with my 17 year old son in Tokyo for two days so we signed up for the afternoon bike tour. We are both keen riders and we always try to do a bike tour when traveling and this was the best bike tour we've ever done. Soshi, our guide, was fantastic.
