He was incredibly friendly and very informative, taking us to some hidden gems of Tokyo that we would have never found ourselves. Highly recommended

Rolling Thru Tokyo. I had nothing much to do one afternoon so I signed up for a 3 hour afternoon tour with Tokyo Miracle Cycling. Best thing I have done in a long time. Soshi is a knowledgeable and friendly guide with excellent English skills and a great sense of humor. They provide quality equipment (12 speed bikes, helmets, seat pads (if you are so inclined)) -- all you will need and everything was clean and in great condition. We covered about 10 miles at a good pace so I felt like I got some exercise after a long haul flight and saw a lot of the city. Most importantly, after the tour I felt like I had acquired a decent "sense" of Tokyo so I rented a bike from our hotel the next two days and struck out all over Tokyo on self-guided tours -- just me and Apple Maps. Thanks to Soshi for a terrific time.

Unexpected Treasure. I was with friends for just one day. This tour was recommended to us by a work colleague. It was just SO great. Soshi, our guide, was a charming , professional young man and a delight to spend time with. We all felt so lucky to have chanced upon this truly great experience. I feel just grateful that I had this day as I may never get to Japan again. Lucky

Inner city seclusion. In Tokyo for a few days on my own, I did the night time tour aon a fresh and clear winters evening. Aki the guide was a legend, super friendly & knowlegable. It was amazing to go to so many quiet and beatiful spots in the middle of such a buzzing metropolis, I loved it, highly recommended.

Great way to see the city. This tour is a great introduction to the city. It's all fairly flat riding, so it's quite easy for all fitness levels.We got to visit various well known places such Ginza (luxury shopping strip), zero mile zone, sumo wrestling stadium and Akihabara. We also rode down the back street/alleys, so we got to see a quiet side of Tokyo. Our tour guide, Aki, was fantastic. He spoke English well, was very knowledgeable and was able to answer our questions. We all had a great time with him. I would recommend this tour!

A fun way to see Tokyo with the family. The half day bike tour with Soshi is fun for the whole family. I thought it might be a bit stressful with children as young as 8, but the traffic in Tokyo is as polite as the people! It is a great way to get the lie of the land and ride through such different areas, from modern, busy shopping districts, to older, quieter districts with temples and restaurants. Can't recommend it highly enough!

Top highlight in discovering Tokyo. Our half-day bike trip was such a fun, very informatieve, real varied and professionally guided by Soshi. Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour supplies light bikes of extreme good quality. This Tour is an absolute ' must ' and value for money.

A great way to see Tokyo. This bike tour is an excellent way to familiarise yourself with the city. The tour itself was interesting and our guide, Soshi, was friendly, informative and approachable. In terms of fitness level required, a great level of fitness is not required as it was mostly flat from memory. I am not an overly confident bike rider however felt fine/comfortable on this tour. I felt the half day bike tour was a good amount of time for the tour as well. I would, without question, recommend for anyone to do this tour.

Minato Miracle. I'm delighted I was able to take part in the heritage cycle ride last week. Having only a short stopover stay in Tokyo, this was by far the most effective way to take in a lot of the city sights in a short space of time. Half a day well spent with good views, food and lots of exercise to boot! Thouroughly recommended.

Must Do Bike Tour. This is a really good bike ride to do around Tokyo to get your bearings.It's safe, easy and fun.Soshi our guide was really informative and made sure the ride was fun.It's a great way to spend an afternoon and great value.

Not a bad way to spend half a day. Did a half day trip. Was a great day. Wasn't really that tired by the end of it as we did have some rest breaks. I felt there could have been more stops and explaining of Japanese culture and historical places. The bikes are comfortable and they provide padded seats and helmets. A beer at the end was nice as well. A good way to spend half a day in Tokyo.

A great way to orientate yourself with Tokyo. We thoroughly enjoyed our Half day tour with Soshi. Communication prior to the trip was very friendly and this continued on the tour itself. We were provided with detailed information on how to get to their office (which is useful in Japan). We were fitted out efficiently and the bicycles and equipment were in excellent condition. We were undecided as to whether we should do the half or full day tour, but were pleased that we opted for the half day as, while it was not strenuous - very flat terrain, we found 3 hours on a bike long enough. Soshi was fun and informative and a great host.If there is any room for improvement I would recommend having some time to stop for a longer time in more areas and get more detailed information at these stops (perhaps also some time for a drink or a quick walk in the shops). The only real stop that we had was at the sumo stadium.Would highly recommend this to anyone wanting to see Tokyo from a different perspective.
Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour with Soshi. Great way to see different aspects of Tokyo that you wouldn't normally see. Informative, Interesting, safe and fun!

Tokyo Highlight! Highly recommend cycling to get to know Tokyo. We were a group with children ages from 5 to 9. The 2 5-year-olds were in trailers. We had a terrific afternoon with Aki and Sochi, taking in Ginza, sumo stadium, Akihabara(Electric Town), and numerous scenic backstreets. The bikes were comfortable and wellmaintained, and the trailers easy to pull. It seemed crazy riding around the megalopolis with young kids.... But actually Tokyo drivers are tolerant and courteous, and our guides very safe! Riding down the main drag in Ginza was incredible!!Why catch a tour bus when you can cycle?(...and have a beer with your guides when you get back to the shop!)

Loved it!!. Our group of 8 - 4 adults and 4 children all loved this tour. Sochi was a great guide who provided excellent information in a very personable manner, he answered all the kids questions and thoroughly engaged them for the 3 hour tour.Saw more of Tokyo than we would have seen wandering around ourselves - bikes were in great condition - the ride was very easy - very flat and done at a very friendly pace.We were provided with very clear instructions on how to find the office and at the end of the ride Sochi provided us with lots of hints about other things to do and places to eat etc.Would definately recommend this tour to anyone visiting Tokyo - we will do a longer tour or the night tour when we next visit Tokyo.

Excellent. We did the half day tour, and went to places in the city that we would never have found on our own. It was so much fun cycling through the streets and very safe. We have 2 boys (11 and 9) and they loved it! Soshi was our guide and he was very friendly and knowledgeable. We absolutely loved it! Highly recommend the company and staff.

Awesome. Guide was great and got to see a lot more of you City then you would buy any other means
Very safe and lots of fun
Will do it again on next trip

Worth it. Soshi was our guide and he was great! It's a mellow bike ride but a great way to cover the city without staring at my gps constantly. It's worth the yen/dollars. Soshi also rec this great tempura restaurant for afterwards and it was one of the best local spots.

It's a Miracle we found the office!. But so glad we did because this was one of the best days we spent on an excellent holiday in Japan. We took the advice of another reviewer and took the bike tour on our first full free day in Tokyo. As expected, we covered a lot of ground, were able to orient ourselves in the city and get an idea about where we wanted to explore.We took the Historic Tokyo tour - 6 hours, maybe 24 kilometres - I think this tour may be the shortest of the day tours. It was just right for us, but next time we would take one of the other tours. Yes, we will be happy to go back next time we're in Tokyo.Soshi was the best tour leader - spoke great English, was interested in all his customers and very informative about the sights we were passing. We learnt a lot about Japan on this day and it came in very handy for the rest of our trip. We learned the approved routines for purification, how to pray at the temple, all about "maid cafes" - though we didn't visit one, tasted some local delicacies, the differences between various noodle varieties, plus a potted history of Tokyo.The bikes were excellent - the easiest gear changes I've encountered on a pushbike. The pace was easy enough - despite I don't know how many million people, the traffic in Tokyo never seems heavy, and we rode down side alleys most of the time. I was amazed how much ground we covered.My advice, apart from telling you to get on one of these tours, is to start early. We dawdled a little leaving our hotel and only arrived at Shimbashi station at 9.30, by which time we should have been at the office. It's at least 10 minutes walk to the Miracle bike tour office, which we covered in 15 minutes as we didn't know where we were going. When we arrived the tour had already left, but was stopped a couple of hundred yards up the road while we got fitted out and caught up. Thanks goodness for mobile phones, but would have been better if we'd been on time. The office isn't easy to find. Make sure you take careful note of the directions on the web site. We weren't able to print them so I wrote out stuff like McDonalds, turn left, locomotive, keep walking along the railway, red Shinto gates, turn left at JRA horseracing sign. And we made it. Miracle! Well worth the effort. This was a top day

Only way to see Tokyo!. Excellent half day bike tour that covered all the main sights and a great guide who was informative and interesting. Highlight of our trip to Tokyo and would recommend it to anyone!

Lots of Fun. Our guide Aki was lovely, very enthusiastic and tried to be as helpful and informative as possible. My husband and 17 yo daughter and I all had a great time. The route was really interesting especially as it was during New Years holidays and very busy on the streets. Choice of lunch was excellent. We would totally recommend this tour.

Fantastic way to see Tokyo . We travelled to Tokyo with a big group of 11 5 kids 8-13 years and adults. The cycling tour was a great way to get an overview of Tokyo. Sochi was fantastic and the kids loved the tour and enjoyed this way of seeing the city. I would recommend this trip as a great way to experience the city.

Best day in Tokyo. With Akira, our guide, we experienced maybe our best day in Tokyo getting a real overview of the city. We did the Tokyo Centre tour, all the day long. It was really an interesting and enriching experience, perfectly organized. We had lunch together in a very good restaurant near Omotesando and spent the day visiting lots of Tokyo's highlights and monuments.

Night Tour. Looking for a fun activity to do on my 3 days in Tokyo, I booked a night tour after reading a couple of the reviews on here.I had Akira with me and if he ends up being your guide you won't be disappointed. He is a charming, patient, sweet and easy going human being with a lovely sense of humour. I had a memorable time and enjoyed our conversations very much. He is great at his job, always looking out for cars, hazards and pedestrians and giving ample warning for the conditions ahead. The tour itself was rather pleasant - we zipped around the back streets, over bridges and along the river, marvelling at all the pretty lights and enjoying the quieter contrast to day-time Tokyo. You get a commentary and/or a pitstop whenever a point of interest comes along.Thank you so much, Akira! I had a wonderful experience! See you again next time in Tokyo!
Great cycle today!. Enjoyed a great half day cycling with these guys today! A super way to be introduced to Tokyo. Two thumbs up!! Thanks

Great to do!. We did the three hour bike tour in the morning and had a great time. We were two families with teenagers - ten in total. The guides Soshi and Lei were friendly and patient. Easy to ride around Tokyo and very safe. I would highly recommend doing this - you will see parts of Tokyo that you usually wouldn't see.

Fantastic Tour. Soshi was fantastic on our morning half day tour today. What a great way to see the city. The tour takes you to many tourist highlights, but also includes some back streets that are fascinating. I would defiantly go again. Not a hard ride at all.

Fantastic, relaxing way to see Tokyo without wearing out your feet. A must do activity if you're time restricted.. Soshi as a great guide who provides an Exemplary service and his "Engrish" ;) was very good.The ride was easy and safe via many back roads so you see the main attractions avoiding the traffic. I did the half day tour and you cover a lot of ground compared to walking. There were stops with a run down on the history and cultural aspects of the places visited including the rituals at the temples.We tasted the yummiest Amasaki. Sweet non alcoholic saki.A cold Asahi (or two) at the end of the day was also a pleasant way to unwind.Thanks Sohi :)

Best biking tour ever. My daughter and I joined many biking tours before in Greece, New Zealand, Vietnam, Tokyo and many other places. But, this is the absolute best, where the leader (Aki) is polite, respectful, hardworking and of high EQ. Even when in 1 of our visits, where there was a group of 17 and where a bike wheel of a guest got punctured, Aki relentlessly and efficiently changed wheels within 7-8 minutes to allow journey to go on.Aki scratched his fingers when mending the wheels per above journry, though Aki never thought about his bleeding finger and kept mending! He just wanna make sure all tourists have a great time! That was a great incredible service attitude and incredible. But, also incredible was that not many at all of the tour members felt anything about Ali's bleeding finger either! At that point, I realised that I have aged and the world has really changed. Our next day's biking with Aki met us with a nice normal family if 4 from Oz. Everyone was nice and helped Aki along. It was also another great trip and a great compassionate trip!Japan is an incredible county with polite people and Miracle Biking is a great replica of the politeness and nicety of what Japan is about!Sue

Must do in Tokyo!. If you want to go to a city and see lots of highlights whilst putting a bit of effort in, then this the full day tour is for you. Our guide Aki was excellent, patient (even though we had a 7 year old kid in our group of 17, which should not be forgotten), we had to wait a bit but mostly at the traffic lights so the others could catch up. We got to see some great places in Tokyo, some I would never have gone too. We also had lunch in the park which was a super cool Bento Box, which was catered for due to taste as I did not eat fish and my Fiancée did not eat meat nor fish. We also experienced the NYE procession at the temple and were told all about Japanese offerings and wishes which was really nice on the day. Highlight for sure is the grave of the Ronin warriors, amazing story and to see the graves of the Ronin was surly my highlight of the day. Please Note this cycle is 15 miles long and you may get a 'numb bum' if not used to cycling. Only a couple of hills but be prepared clothing wise as a few on the tour didn't come prepared i.e. no gloves so didn't enjoy it on a cold day.

Great tour even in the rain!. On our second day in Tokyo, the forecast called for rain and our bike tour with another company was canceled around 10pm. We searched and found Tokyo Miracle Cycle Tour and they said they would ride rain or shine. We put in an inquiry for a tour at 9 am the next day and within a half hour, we were booked! The next morning, Sashi was patient when we arrived just on time and then had rain clothes available for all of us.We then went on a tour with my husband, me, and one other person and Sashi was very flexible with taking pictures or stopping in somewhere a little longer (the other guy wanted to buy a gift for his kids so we stopped in a gift store and Sashi even carried them for him in his backpack). We saw a very nice assortment of neighborhoods in areas in Tokyo that I don't think we would have seen as tour buses or on large tours. He was interesting and the tour moved at a great pace. When we got back, he offered us coffee and tea and a sweet and directions. The only thing I would recommend is that when giving directions he ask if tourists have the JR Pass as the directions provided using the subway were actually more challenging and substantially longer (and we got painfully lost) than if we had just used our JR pass on the Yamanote line, but we were too new at the time to Tokyo to realize it. But obviously this has nothing to do with the tour itself and he was great.

Was OK. We did the full day tour. We had a big group with 17 riders and this seemed to slow everything down a tad. It was more like a bike ride than a guided tour. I was expecting must more guiding content and more than than a conga line of bikes. On balance, it was fine, but promised and could have easily been so much more.

Tokyo...up close and personal . We thoroughly enjoyed this cycling tour with an extremely attentive and courteous company. It takes you on an eclectic blend of new and old Tokyo. Our tour guide Aki, was most engaging, professional and knowledgable. Very cool experience.

Excellent Tour. Had a great time on the Tokyo Historical Ride bike tour. Our guide was Japanese. He was very nice and professional. Told us ahead of time when to slow down, when to stop etc...Very organized and professional. Highly recommended. We did a bike tour also with another company which was Osaka Cycle Tour. They were not as good and professional. Their bike seats was not comfy and not much cushion. The bike seats here were more comfy and had cushion.

Do this tour of you are in Tokyo!. Today I did the Tokyo Historic Tour with Akira as my guide. We went to a lot of places that tourists do not know about. He was very kind and spoke very good English and taught me Japanese language and manners. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a better experience of Tokyo

Half Day Tour. My partner and I went on the half day tour around Tokyo with Akira as our tour guide. It was definitely one of the best parts of our trip to Japan, and we are very glad we did it. Even though it was rainy and freezing cold, Akira made sure we enjoyed ourselves and that we were still in high spirits to continue. He was well prepared with raincoats etc. Akira was probably our favourite part about the tour, he was very friendly and kind, and you could tell he loves his job. His happy spirit was infectious, and he didn't mind answering all of our questions about Tokyo and the sights we were seeing.

Why you have to do a bike tour in Tokyo! (Early). We enjoyed this tour immensely (not only because of the great personalities behind it but) after exploring Tokyo by ourselves for a couple of days using the train where it was obviously hard to appreciate the city travelling to and from our destination. It was great being able to experience the many little back streets and local stores along the way (that you wouldn't normally know about or be able to access unless on a bike or on foot). A bike tour in Tokyo is a must to really experience the city. Miracle tours has a small number of guides (running a simple business) who are obviously passionate about great customer service and making sure you have a great time exploring Tokyo. I wish we'd done it earlier! Live and learn.. Please enjoy :)PS. They report that us tourists often book and don't turn up!!! For such a polite and genuine bunch of people, I encourage anyone who reads this to try harder to show respect to their hospitality. Arogatou Gozaimasu

Wonderful way to see the sights in a few hours!. I was in Tokyo for work in early December and had a morning to spare. I did the half day tour and thoroughly enjoyed it - the exercise, the explanation of sites, cruising through little alley ways and visiting temples in unexpected places. This is what makes Tokyo so interesting. Soshi is a great guide and very careful in directing when on the road. I would definitely come back and do other routes to explore more of this amazing city.

What a Great Ride!. This was definitely the highlight of my visit in Tokyo! Touring by foot is nice but you won't be able to see much. Touring by car is also nice but you'd go by too fast. By bike, by golly, is just the perfect way! Especially when you're guided by Soshi and his team. They understand hospitality and will make sure you have the most enjoyable and doable bike tour ever. If you enjoy a little exercise and feel a gentle breeze on your face while absorbing some interesting historical facts then this bike tour is simply a must. Highly recommended!Thank you, Soshi, from the bottom of my heart. You're always welcome in Seattle, friend.Daisy WongSeattle, Washington

Best way to see Tokyo. We did the half day city tour with Soshi and we're so pleased that we booked this as part of our 4 day stay in Tokyo. We haven't ridden bikes for a long time but found the pace comfortable and the opportunity to travel down some of the smaller side streets really interesting. This really is the best way to see a lot of Tokyo in a relatively short space of time and being lead by a knowledgeable guide with excellent English. Highly recommended.

Highlight of our time in Tokyo. We initially booked for a morning tour however weren't able to make in so Soshi and his team were nice enough to accommodate my husband and myself for the afternoon tour which was about 3 hours in length.We're so glad we did this. It's one of the best and most fun ways to see the different neighborhoods of Tokyo. Soshi was lovely and so informative.One of best memories for me was riding the bike down the 4 lane road (we went on a Sunday, when this particular road is closed to cars for a certain time of the day). Would highly recommend for anyone.

Superb!!!!. A truly great experience. Arki our host was professional and knowledgeable. Even when we slowed the tour by a bit of shopping. We did the three hour central Tokyo ride and would highly recommend it. We've been here for two days and it was good. Recommend you do it as soon as you get here.

Organised tour with freedom. Tokyo is the last place where I would have considered cycling!Quite the opposite in fact, our guide Sochi led us through back streets and very often on side walks where pedestrians did not seem to mind at all.Not only it is a good way to cover and visit a huge part of the city, it was also a good opportunity to keep throwing questions at our guide about all kind of cultural issues and codes that we Europeans sometimes don't understand at once.Since we were only two participants it even felt like a private guided tour !
Great to discover Tokyo. Very friendly staff, I had the chance to be the only customer in the group. It's a great way to discover the city in a gentle and nice pace.

Must do experience - half day cycling tour. I went on a half day tour during the month of August (It was warm and humid, so I was a bit anxious about cycling around Tokyo in the heat) yet it was a really pleasant experience as you catch a lot of the breeze while on a bike. The tour was at a relaxed pace so I got to see a lot of sights in Tokyo. Soshi had a lot of local knowledge and was ready to answer any impromptu questions. The language barrier was a common problem in Tokyo but this was not a problem with Soshi, as he spoke English really really well. This tour is highly recommended.

Excellent staff and a great way to see Tokyo!. Cycling tours are a great way to explore a new city but with wide sidewalks and bike friendly roads, it's an extra great way to see Tokyo!We met at 9:30 AM for a full day tour on the Tokyo Bay Side Tour. Aki was our guide and he really took the tour quality up a notch. We got to visit lots of popular and a few lesser known sites around Minato, Ginza, and Tokyo Bay. The ride was fairly easy with just a few tough hills. Overall, the terrain was generally flat and appropriate even for kids. The bike quality was good and I had zero issues with my bike.We had great weather on our tour day with lots of sunshine although sometimes the breeze got a tad chilly. We enjoyed hanging out with the family in our tour group. It was nice have just 7 people in our group including Aki.I would certainly recommend Miracle in your Tokyo itinerary. The staff speaks excellent English which makes it even easier for English-speaking tourists. We really got a great value from the experience and would take another one of their tours in the future.

Great way to experience Tokyo. Cycling gives a fresh perspective to the sights, and allows one to understand why so many locals commute by cycling- both cars and pedestrians accommodate cyclists! It was a fun family activity - the youngest (4y) sitting in trailer and the older 2 teens on their own bikes. Our guide, Soshi was friendly and slowed down our tour enough that even my hubby's cycling with the kid's trailer in-tow found it enjoyable.

Awesome Experience!. I have to say this was a very fun and memorable tour of Tokyo with our family. We took the full day tour (6hrs) with Aki as our tour guide. He was extremely friendly, knowledgable and careful with our safety and made sure we had a good time. I have to say this tour would not have been half as good without him. The bikes we used was decent and reliable, while most of the city tour was an easy ride, with the exception of 4 hills that was difficult for myself but not for the rest of my family. We hit a lot of sites that was beautiful and very interesting. This tour is definitely worth the money and time to do.

Amazing experience in Cycling Tour of Tokyo!. We had an amazing time cycling around Tokyo for about 2 1/2 hours! Our tour guide, Kuwata Soshi, showed us many interesting places to tour around Tokyo like: visiting great bakeries and restaurants, seeing beautiful temples around amazing town, and riding around the stunning parks near the Imperial Palace. It was a very fast-moving enjoyable ride. Kuwata Soshi showed great hospitality and explained all the culture of the city while speaking perfect english. My only criticism is that we did not stop at starbucks!!! ;)

Amazing half day tour!. Me and my wife booked this on recommendation from a Scottish friend who had visited 2 months ago and loved it.My wife was concerned about cycling as she hadn't done it in 15yrs but found the 3 hour trip super easy.Soshi was an excellent and knowledgeable guide, can't recommend him enough!Overall one of the highlights of our trip and if we came back we'd do one of the 6hrs tours! Highly recommended.Marc

Amazing must do. Aki is an awesome host, we did a full day tour with 2 children. His knowledge and English was fantastic, delicious lunch and such a fun way to see so many sites in one day. Thanks Aki :) We really enjoyed it.

Tokyo Cycling Tour. Wow what a fantastic way to see the sights of central Tokyo.Our guide "Arlie : was fabulous, ,his English was amazing as was his depth of knowledge regarding the history and culture of the city.Arlie was very caring and safe, constantly ensuring that the bike and riding pace was okay.It was soooo much fun riding down tiny alley ways, over bridges ,around the most beautiful parks and gardens.It was my third trip to Tokyo and I learnt so much on this tour.The bike was comfortable and the gears worked perfectly.Certainly a highlight of my trip, an absolute must activity.

Wonderful bike tour of Tokyo. This 3-hour cycling tour of Tokyo was a highlight of my four days in this fascinating city. The guide, Toshi, was great. He took us through both major thoroughfares and out-of-the way streets and pointed out many things of interest that I would have missed on my own. The moderate pace was perfect for sightseeing. I also recommend taking the tour on a Sunday, when there is much less automobile traffic. Overall, a top notch experience!

Tokyo Early Bird Tour. Since we only have limited time, we took the early bird tour (November 13th) and guide by Akira. It was a great way to see Tokyo. We had great time and a wonderful experience. Definitely will do another tour when back in Tokyo. I would highly recommend! Thank you so much.

Above and Beyond! . Had a Tokyo Central tour with the Mrs and I. Akira was our guide and he was so lovely and informative. Just before lunch we dropped our mobile phone and did not notice it was gone until we got to lunch. Akira kept us calm and when the tour was finished around 4:30, he took us to nearby police box and spoke to the police for us. Phone was found and handed in . We went and got it from another police box no problem :) Amazing!Akira was so great spending his break time between tours helping us because we were silly tourists! Thank you so much! It was truly a miracle! Here comes the emojis ✌

Tokyo by Bike. I went on a half day tour on Friday, October 30th with two friends. Bikes and helmets were provided and we went to a lot near by to ensure everyone felt comfortable riding. We rode at a comfortable pace and the route was flat. Our guide, Soshi, was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. We made a stop for a bathroom break and another stop for Japanese drink and snacks. The bike tour is a great alternative way to see Tokyo. I would highly recommend!

A great way to see the city. We took the 3 hour tour as we were only in Tokyo for a few days. It was a great way to see lots of the city and districts at street level in a short period. Soshi - our guide is a really nice guy and offers info and history at various stops. The bikes are new and well maintained and after a cold beer on return we decided it was one of the best things we had done ! Thanks team at Miracle you do a great job.

Best way to explore and experience Tokyo in a day. I have one free day in Tokyo after my conference and decide to look for some tour, however there is no walking tour that is available at such short notice. I found Tokyo Miracle Cycling tour on the internet and I submit the form and they quickly reply it through my email and said there is space. I joined the Tokyo Historical tour and surprisingly find out I am the only participant. It is definitely worth the money for a private tour for 10000 yen for 6 hours including lunch. The tour guide is Akira. he is very friendly and considerate , although his English need improvement, I can understand what he trying to say. It is safe to travel by bicycle in Tokyo because you are allowed to cycle on the pedestrians. We went to Skytree, Asakusa, Senso-ji, Ginza, Palace Garden, Nihonbashi etc. We had lunch in an authentic Japanese restaurant. He explained to me the dishes and teach me how to eat that grilled fish. He also said this cycling tour is quite new in Tokyo.He showed me a lot of local places in Tokyo where not many tourists will go and he explained really well about the intricate relationship between Buddhism and Shintoism in Japan.We have a great time, the terrain is quite flat and it's quite cool in November so I didn't sweat much.It's so good that I end up joining the Tokyo Night tour as well, it's an unforgettable experience and we build a true friendship. Highly recommended~

OK tour hurt by limited English of tour leader. This was one of the few companies that were doing half-day tours daily, so my brother and I signed up--we ended up being the only two on the tour. I definitely think a half day is the way to go--a full day would just be too long in the saddle. The tour route itself is pretty interesting. A personal highlight for me was the "geek city" where they have tons of video game and anime shops.Our tour guide Aki was super nice and did his best, but his English is just not quite good enough to be an effective tour leader. I feel bad saying that as I don't speak a lick of Japanese, but an English tour needs a leader who is completely fluent in English.

Best Bike Tour Ever!. When travelling I look for bike tours as I believe it's a great way to see and explore a new city. I found Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour on Trip Advisor. There were several other tours to choose from, many had no tour going on the day I had available so I called Tokyo Miracle. The young man I spoke with was very welcoming and in very short order the tour was booked. Note: the directions to the office on the Internet are excellent- I had no trouble finding it. My guide for the day was Akira (Aki for short) and as it turns out I was the only one booked for the day. So, I had my own personal guide on a 6 hour tour of Central Tokyo. The bike was an 8 speed road bike in excellent condition. We covered a lot of ground about 23 km to be precise. Aki telling me all about the places we visited and answering any questions I had. The tour included lunch in a terrific Japanese restaurant that I never would have found in a million years of looking. The food was excellent. Throughout the dayI learned a great deal and saw many attractions I may never have found or understood on my own. I give Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour 2 BIG thumbs up - highly recommended.

Urban fun. We took a half day trip around Tokyo city centre with our kids age 10 and 13. I've cycled in many parts of the world, but Tokyo is a bit different to most where cyclists go anywhere, pavements, zebra crossings, dual carriage ways, the wrong way down one way streets etc. all without the use of a bell or crashing into anyone. In polite Japanese society this somehow works, try it in London or New York and there'd be trouble! Our guide was great and got us round easily, our 10 year old (who is a confident cyclist) had no trouble negotiating the chaos of rush hour Tokyo.Teas, soft drinks and even beers are offered with a post cycle chat. Highly recommended.

Great way to see the city!. Great tour and great way to see the city. We did the 3 our morning tour which we felt was just good. Soshi (our tourguide) had nice local insights. We did it together and were joined by 4 others. Nice small group.

Great host - good way to see a lot of Tokyo in a short time. Soshi was a great host he made sure all of us were comfortable with riding before we left and managed our small group well. I was slightly apprehensive about riding in a such a busy city but it seems to be a way of life with cyclists and pedestrians mingling all the time. Highly recommended.

The best way to see Tokyo. I did the half day tour with Soshi. When I first arrived in Tokyo I was a bit overwhelmed and didn't really know where to start, but this tour helped me to get my bearings and showed me places I never would have seen otherwise. Tokyo is very bike friendly, and we were able to cover a lot of ground in a short space of time. Soshi was extremely friendly and knowledgable. I highly recommend this tour. I can't wait to go back and do a longer one!
Tokyo cycling - great fun for family. Fantastic way to see Tokyo for entire family. Quality bikes for adults and kids. Route was safe and manageable for novice biker. Soshi was a wonderful guide.

Lovely way to spend six hours in Tokyo!. Did the 6-hour Tokyo Historical Tour. Had a lovely time with Aki as the main guide and Lei as the assistant. Aki is a lovely young chap, full of energy and always smiling. Lei is also very nice, full of smiles and always eager to help. Access to the meeting point was easy, following the directions provided by the company. Our group was around 14 people and we all had good quality and well maintained bikes. The tour itself was really nice, with easy cycling to discover some beautiful landmarks of Tokyo. Lunch was included in the price, at a small restaurant and it was delicious!What I'm most happy with is the extra effort that Aki and Lei went through to return some traditional Japanese biscuits (ningyo yakis) that I had bought along the way during the tour but which I forgot to take with me at the end. Much to my surprise and appreciation, Aki cycled all the way to my hotel to return the biscuits! I would totally recommend the tour to anyone who has 6 hours to kill in Tokyo!!

Worth the money - great attention. We had a great tour - we were lucky enough for them to show flexibility on dates and ended up on a private tour. Great sightseeing. Truly a great way to see a lot of Tokyo. We are very happy we did it and Aki was a good tour guide.

What a great ride! . I took the early bird ride with Akira, it was a fantastic way to see the different parts of Tokyo. Akira is a great guide tour and has a lot of knowledge moreover he is a fun riding companion and you feel very safe riding with him on the streets of Tokyo!I had a wonderful memorable experience. I recommend booking with miracle cycling you won't be disappointed.

highlight of Tokyo . Thankyou so much Soshi for a wonderful afternoon. we really enjoyed our time onthe bikes and felt so safe on the Tokyo roads and under your guidance.you provided a brilliant informative and entertaining tour of areas of Tokyo we would not have got to visit and had experiences we otherwise wouldn't have had.I would highly recommend taking this half day tour or any other provided. Thankyou for the drink at the end. Campai and Arrigato!

Loved it. Had a great half day tour guided by Sashi. Though we had see some of Tokio already he showed us some places where we probably never got around to. The tour was good, bikes even suitable for long Dutch people, some complementary water and after the tour even a nice beer to end it with.Great way to see Tokio.

The best way to see Tokyo. We always do a bike tour when we visit a big city as is a great way to get a feel for the place. We were not disappointed with our heritage tour of Tokyo led by Aki who was a great guide and very knowledgeable. The bikes were good, helmets optional and water provided. We cycled about 23 km, mostly flat, and cycling on the roads was a joy...no pot holes or big lorries so it all felt very safe and easy.,would strongly recommend a bike tour. We had lunch provided a bento box as a picnic in the park. There were us two along with 4 Dutch air crew who were very nice and everyone chatted which was nice. Lots of good photo opportunities along the way also. Well worth the money.

Best cycling tour in all of Tokyo. I highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Japan for the first time. The staff and atmosphere of the place is happy extremely helpful and make this adventure one of the best experiences from day one arriving in Japan. Many thanks to Akira-San for being our tour guide and for making this experience the most enjoyable, he is an excellent guide and extremely helpful and I cant thank him enough. The path took us to the heart of old Tokyo visited Yoyogi Park, Shinto and and Buddhist temples, the restaurante for our meal break was impressive, Gonpachi, (This is a restaurant that is visited but many actors, entertainers and political figures alike. Ranging from Silvester Stallone to Aerosmith. This establishment is the base for Tarentinos film Kill Bill in its design. The route can bi just a slight bit tasking at times if your out of shape or havent used a bike for a long time like I have. But our guide was very accommodating and made sure to make frequent stops to ensure that everything fine. Over all this is the best way to view Tokyo and get to know the area.

A fantastic way to see Tokyo. If you like cycling or if you just want to get off your feet, this is a great activity for an afternoon. We did the half day tour. It was fun to ride around to the different areas and in and around everyone. Biking is so widely accepted and utilized that it made me feel very comfortable biking in traffic and on busy streets. Our guide was knowlegeable and his english was very good. I wish we had done the full day.

Awesome Half Day Tour. We recently did a half day cycling tour and it was awesome. Our guide Sashi was great. It was so good to go down all the back streets and see the real Japan. He stopped and explained things along the way and we had plenty of time to stop and take photos. Definetly recommend this tour.

Great way to see Tokyo. I had a free day during a business trip and booked the previous day for the Night View Tour. All communications were good including directions. The route was good and Aki provided lots of interesting information. A nice drink to finish. Highly recommended.

Interesting Cycling tour for city viewing !. The leader A-ki is very nice ! And he can speak english very fluently ( BTW, this is VERY rare in Japan). He guided us go through the large city, introduced many feature spots and great stories. It's worth to spend 3 hours to experience such a good time, and it will be one of the best memories in your trip.

Great guidance to see Tokyo on a bike. Today we had a great 3 hours bike ride with Akira as the guide, he showed us areas we wouldn't have seen otherwise. He very patiently answered our many questions, even the stranger ones😀
We strongly recommend this company to anyone who would like to see the hidden gems of Tokyo.

Night Cycling Tour. We took the night cycling tour around Tokyo which took around 2 hours for us.My wife is not an avid cyclist like I am but she was able to bike the route so this is great for beginners.Soshi our guide was great and he spoke very good English. He made sure to wait for me and my wife.He also made sure that we were following him in the right direction via proper hand signals and making sure we saw obstacles on the road.Soshi was also very knowledgeable about the sights we saw around the route. We cycled along the Sumida River and crossed several bridges and went to the Kirin Statue which is the starting point of roads in Japan. We also went to Tokyo Station and Ginza. He also gave a good description of the sights we saw around the route.After the ride he offered us some drinks (Including Beer ) and also guided us to a great Tonkatsu Restaurant. This tour is highly recommended.

Half day cycle tour. Soshi, our guide, was really friendly and knowledgeable about the sights of Tokyo. We would highly recommend this trip to anyone. Although the tour lasted three hours, the cycling was well paced and not at all strenuous. The route included the lesser known areas of the city and avoided any busy traffic.

Great way to see Tokyo. Booked the half day tour from the UK by email and they were great from the start. They sent me directions and a contact number in case I got lost, but I found it easily from their directions.On arrival I was offered water, a helmet, a well looked after bike and a soft seat. My guide explained where we would be going. He also took waterproofs for me which were needed as it did rain, but did not spoil it.Great tour, saw so much, I was the only one on my tour so my guide squeezed in a visit to Tokyo tower as well and we had a walk around the Imperial palace and some lovely gardens. He was happy to tell me everything he knew and his English was very good, he allowed plenty of stops for photos too. He looked after my safety the whole time so I could just enjoy and admire my surroundings.Great tour, highly recommended

Great option for a day of swift highlights. Great guide, well versed in English and Japanese. Never a problem to ask questions. All gear neatly provided from water to soft seats to a small snack and drink afterwards. Also a great way to check places to visit in more detail later on. Highly recommended.

Great Slice of Tokyo!. We did the half day tour and learned some great history about Tokyo from a local's perspective. Loved stopping at the rice sake shop and seeing sumo wrestlers!! Aki was very nice and accommodating, even stopping off for me to find a restroom:) small group, great conversation, great time!

Great experience. It was a great way to explore this metropolis. Shoshi, our guide was very friendly and helpful. We have visited many backstreets areas that I would have otherwise not known even existed. I can highly recommend this professional company.

Great city centre cycling tour with friendly and knowledgeable guide - Soshi. Really fun tour. Soshi was an excellent guide, very friendly and knowledgeable. Bikes in great condition, and riding quite easy 17 km. Cycling in the middle of such a big city felt very safe, although bizarre how bikes seem to be allowed to ride anywhere!

From a seven year old better than Disneyland. We did the afternoon tour with our three kids, the 7 year old who road and our 5 and 2 year old in the trailer behind my bike. Great bikes to ride and a beer at the end but what made this tour stand out was our tour guide Soshi who took our son under his wing and filled him with knowledge about Tokyo and Japan that he is still reminding us of weeks later. The tour we did had a great mixture of old and new Tokyo and was free flowing and very enjoyable. High recommend to anyone but particularly Families

Great holiday activity. For an activity with teenagers it was a great way to explore the city. Soshi was a fabulous guide and we ended up having the tour all to ourselves! Saw loads of different sites we were otherwise unaware of, so it was a real insight into the city of Tokyo. Would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys cycling!

Best way to see Tokyo. I did both the Tokyo Bay Side Tour and the Tokyo Old Down Town Tours, both of which were fantastic. It was a great way to get a feel for the layout of this vibrant city, and we visited many backstreets areas that I would have otherwise not known even existed. Our guide was fun friendly and knowledgeable and on both days the included lunch was excellent. I can highly recommend this professionally run company and I felt safe biking throughout the tours.

Great way to See the city. This was a great way to view the city. The tour guide was way fun and super informative. I think his name was Aki. The bikes are really nice and well maintained. We took the Tokyo Bay Side Tour. We stopped and got lunch and the ferry.

A great afternoon and a nice intro to downtown Tokyo from street level. I had 24 hours due to an unscheduled layover at Narita. Luckily the folks at Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour had space on their "Afternoon Tour," roughly 10 miles and 3 hours through highlights of central Tokyo. We rode across river bridges, checked out the Ginza, passed through the sumo wrestling neighborhood, and rode most of the way around the Imperial Palace. Soshi was a first-rate guide, friendly and funny with excellent guiding skills. The route takes you up on sidewalks (legal in Tokyo) and down some one-way streets the (seemingly) wrong way. The physical requirements of the ride are easy, the route is flat and the pace modest with lots of stops for pics and sightseeing. A great intro to Tokyo. (Lei does a great job with reservations and correspondence, too)

Great day seeing Tokyo. So much better seeing Tokyo by bike than by a bus tour. Akiro, our guide, was friendly, funny and knowledgable. Nice bikes - worked well and were comfortable. I'll definitely do another one of their tours when I'm back in Tokyo the next time.

One Word: Awesome. I took the full day historical tour and the entire experience was just great. The Miracle crew handled my last-minute reservation with ease (not an easy thing to do when the customer is in transit). They emailed me a custom street map that flawlessly guided me from my hotel to their office... a necessity for a newcomer navigating Tokyo streets!When I arrived at their office the paperwork was ready for me and I was promptly fitted for a bike. All the bicycles were clean and well maintained. I was also provided with a relatively new helmet and a strap for my pant leg.Our tour guide, Aki, was an absolute delight. Through the entire six hour ride he vigilantly watched out for our safety. We made many stops--each one was a fabulous tidbit of Tokyo's past. Aki--whose English was very good--handled the bilingual group with ease. Our Bento Box lunch was tasty and enough calories to fuel our return trip. Last, but not least, was sharing a complimentary brew with our awesome group at the end of the ride.Thank you Tokyo Miracle Cycling for an excellent tour of Tokyo and an excellent day.

Great biking tour. I took the night course and even though I am the only one they did the tour. Night course is easy, tour guide is lovely, scenery is spectacular and conditions of bikes are great. What else you could want; I definitely advice this tour.

The best way to kickstart a trip through Tokyo and Japan. I went to Japan for a 10 day solo trip in August. I kept my plans loose for the trip because I did not know what to expect and did not know if I would enjoy one region of Japan more than another. When I first arrived to Japan I was intimidated to be in a foreign country (I am from California). On my second day I decided I needed some guidance and searched for Tokyo tours. Tokyo Miracle Cycle Tours popped up and I was intrigued by the reviews. I also love biking around new cities because I believe it is the best way to experience a city or place in an efficient manner. I requested for an availability for a bike tour that day through their website and they responded promptly with an afternoon tour and they reserved a spot for me. The bike tour was one of the best decisions I made on my trip! The tour was about 3 to 4 hours. We covered a lot of ground during that time from the Imperial Palace to Sumida river. If I tried to do the same tour on foot by myself it would of taken me two days and that would be without the convenience of an English speaking tour guide. Soshi was the tour guide for the trip. He always kept safety the priority of our group and I never felt nervous biking around the busy streets of Tokyo behind him. He was also very insightful and I was able to learn a lot about the sights we were seeing. Through my conversations with him learned a lot about Japanese culture and Japanese people. I had a great time on the bike tour and bonded with the people I experienced it with. I had a fun time with Soshi and consider him a friend. The biking tour was a great way to experience Tokyo. I highly recommend it to anyone!!

Best way to see many facets of Tokyo!. Thanks to the great bike tour leader Aki, my friend and I had a phenomenal experience. Aki is very kind, warm, and excellent in directing around the city. It was great to maneuver around the paradoxically quiet city of Tokyo with juxtapositions of green nature and cutting edge building designs. We also got to try amazake which was delicious! Definitely go with Aki-will be back with other friends in the future!

A must for visiting any city. My wife and I have made it a habit of always doing a bike tour in a city we visit, weather permitting, and it has never been the wrong decision. Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour provided a wonderful tour around Tokyo with incredibly friendly staff and tour guides.A couple of words of warning however. First, the iPhone simply could not work out where this place was - either with the built in Maps or Google Maps. Both put us about 10 minutes away - but luckily they told us to stay where we were and came and found us. So just double check the location against the street address before you start walking from the train station.Second is that these bikes are more road style than tour style - you aren't sitting straight up like a townie but leaning over the handle bars. Makes for an easier ride up the hills (bridges) but isn't as comfortable a ride.

Cycling with Soshi!. My daughter and I had a delightful afternoon with Soshi as we toured Toyko on bicycles. It was a great half day tour, well planned, and at a good pace. There were four of us total (two blokes from Down Underand and the two of us ) and we all had a great time --our trip was in July --hot but very enjoyable. Recommend for all-- visitors from Colorado!

Great bike tour experience!. It was very hot weather and most of the tour was on flat terrain, however the pace was a little rushed at times. We toured around a lot of Japan briefly, such as Ginza, Tsukiji, Odaiba and Tokyo bay. The cruise was a nice short break and lunch was a cute picnic by the shores.

Great night tpur. Fantastic night tour. Highly recommended. I would not have had the nerve to ride in Tokyo let alone through Ginza. Aki was informative and very friendly. Time was taken to fit the bike (which is rare for bike tour). The bikes itself were in great condition. The best I have had on similar bike tour. The evening route was gentle and the pace was great (not too fast so those not confident can keep up).

A great tour, easy to see lots of sights of the city. It was a great tour - you could really see the sights by being "on the ground". The riding was easy, all flat terrain. Soshi the tour operator was very knowledgable and very considerate, when we were riding he made a point to stay in the shade where possible. I would definitely go back again with others.

Amazing! Highlight of our trip. We thoroughly enjoyed being led by Aki - so cheerful and friendly! The only thing to complain about was the heat (cycling for so long in 35 degrees heat took some getting used to!) and also for the fact the bicycles were unfortunately quite uncomfortable... nevertheless, would thoroughly recommend doing this!

A great day cycling in Tokyo . I really enjoyed this tour. It was incredibly hot but we found shade as often as we could. The pace was really good. Some nice long cycles, a little bit of challenge and lots to see along the way. I really liked the place we stopped for lunch. Great views of Tokyo and delicious food. A great day out. Highly recommended :-)

Cycle Tour in Tokyo with Miracle Cycling. Miracle Cycling Tours was brilliant! This was a great way to start my trip to Tokyo and I was able to get a real feel for the city and see some amazing sights too! Soshi was really friendly and helpful and gave the group an excellent tour with great information in all the areas. We even got to go inside the Ginza Sumo Stadium! There was a special event going on so we were extremely lucky to be able to do this. The bikes were really good and the route taken was super too! A great experience all round with some very nice people :)

Great way to see Tokyo. We took the Tokyo Historical Ride with Soshi as our guide. It was a fantastic experience and Soshi was excellent. He was full of information about all of the places we stopped.The ride wasn't hard, no uphills involved. I can't recommend this highly enough.

The best way to see Tokyo. Spent our last day in Tokyo with my 2 young adult children on a tour. Wife would have come too if they had electric bikes! Our guide was great - really informative, good English, very patient (tough gig as kids have special needs). Tour enabled us to see all the major sites of Tokyo. Recommend that you do this tour early in visit to Tokyo as our guide shared lots of useful advice on where to go and what to see.Couldn't have asked for anything better

Historic tour with Aki. Just returned from our tour with Aki! It was absolutely amazing! Tokyo is totally bike friendly and this specific tour was easy. No hills and easy to maneuver thru the city. Aki was easy to talk to and a very personable and knowledgable tour guide. We do bike tours whenever we travel to a new city and this tour was exceptional! Thank you Aki and Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tours!,

Great way to tour the city!. We emailed Miracle Bike tours the morning of the day we wanted to tour. I would suggest checking ahead, I feel like we got really lucky they had availability for the half-day afternoon tour. We got to the bike shop about 20 mins ahead of schedule, plenty of time to fill out simple paperwork and talk briefly about the tour. Our guide was Soshi, the owner of the company. His English was phenomenal and he was very conversational. The third person on our tour ended up not showing, so my wife and I got a private tour with Soshi! He explained the route he planned and asked us if there was anything in particular we have already seen or are especially interested in seeing. The tour was extremely accommodating. The tour included bottled water, small snack afterwards, helmet, bike and even extra padding for the seat. We set off on the tour after a short tutorial and were biking through the Tokyo streets with ease. Soshi was great at leading the way...constantly keeping our safety in mind, checking on us and traffic around us. Like other reviews said, there are frequent stops and my wife and I (both active 28 year olds) never once felt tired or that we couldn't keep up. The stops were planned in front of landmarks and doubled as rest and photo ops. Per our request, we stopped for some Amazake and mochi along the way.Overall, this was our best memory of Tokyo and if we ever make it back we plan to take the other tours Miracle Cycling tours offers! Soshi even emailed us a photo he took for us after the tour.Two thumbs way up for this activity/attraction/tour of Tokyo, I HIGHLY recommend.

Please don't miss this opportunity!. I had a half day in Tokyo to spare, so I booked this bike tour at the last minute - and so glad I did. From the confirmation email, to the snacks and drink at the end of the tour, it was a truly excellent experience. I did the Tokyo Half Day Tour in the morning (Ginza, Nihonbashi bridge, Old Ningyocho area, Ryogoku Sumo stadium, Akihabara, Imperial palace, Tokyo station, Hibiya park). The bikes were great quality and very easy to ride and change gears (even for an unfit, uncoordinated, middle-aged and infrequent cyclist like myself) and the gel seat and lovely cold bottle of water in the bottle holder was very much appreciated. Soshi, the owner of the business, was my guide and made sure that the tour was the best experience it could be; clear directions/hand signals in traffic; plenty of stops as desired for photos, attractions, food-drink, bathroom; personalising my tour (by taking me to a shrine for mothers and babies - perfect for a midwife); answering loads of questions and providing great information. Really great value for money and definitely a highlight of my trip. My only regret is that I didn't have time for a longer tour! Very highly recommended.
Great tour!. Miracle Bike tour is great to everyone who wants to really explore Tokyo. By bike yo don't only see the city but you feel it and become part of it. Highly recommended!

Exceeded all my expectations!. Best way ever to discover Tokyo! You get a great overview and feel of the different districts of the city.Took a half day tour on a Sunday afternoon, which I enjoyed a lot, since there was less traffic and some of the main streets were blocked for pedestrians which gave a nice calm to this bustling city!When I find something really worth recommending I really want to tell you why and this is what I enjoyed about my experience with Miracle Cycling Tours:1. Soshi (the owner) was the best of guides: experienced, attentive, flexible, focused, fun!Before coming I was wondering about the tempo, will it be too tough, how will they keep the group together, will it be stressful etc. But Soshi took all details for each participant (middle-aged, teens) into account and put together a great tour for all of us, giving us photo stops and interesting details about the city along the way!2. Soshi was very aware about security, from the bikes themselves (including you could add on a "cusioned"-seat for extra comfort :) to giving very distinct signals when on the road, to making sure we had enough water breaks and even provided water for us during and after the tour.3. Just having the possibility of covering so much more ground on a bike compared to walking around. We could see so much more of spectacular Tokyo than I would have on my own. Since I was here in the beginning av August with heat waves of >34´C and >70 in humidity, being on a bike was the best of ways to catch a cool breeze. Afterwards we sat down and looked at the map so we could see where we had been and get help with directions for the parts I wanted to re-visit.4. On the website, Soshi has included a visual "How-to-find-their-office"-guide and I just want to say that it was accurate. I very much appreciate when what is presented on the site is congruent to the service and experience you get. I had so much fun on my first tour that I returned for a second tour - an Evening Tour a couple of days later. If I come back, I'll do another bike tour, for sure. I can highly recommend this activity and Soshi and his team especially!!

Great Way For 1 Day. I had one day in Tokyo and wanted to see as much as I could. Soshi and Miracle Cycling was a great answer. Soshi was an excellent host, very patient, and very polite. The ride itself was also great. Very easy. I chose the historic Tokyo ride. We were able to see much of the city. I recommend this to anyone!

A Day Well Spent and Worth the Penny. Akira-san, my guide, is apparently a very attractive chick magnet, because random women kept joining us to chat with him along the tour. So, if you want a really good looking and charming tour guide, you should probably request him. LOLOn a more serious note, Akira really made this tour a history lesson that I enjoyed; and I thought I hated history. He was able to help me make connections with Japanese culture that I never even knew I had. For example, if you've ever watched "Spirited Away" or "Princess Mononoke," Akira bridged the gap for me on how those movies actually proved to be ingenuous simplified versions of Ancient Japanese customs. He also knows what's up when it comes to Japan do's and don'ts, so you'll be able to fit right with him despite being a tourist.Would go again, would request Akira, especially if I was looking to pick up women ;)...

The BEST way to see a city like Tokyo. What a pleasure it was to ride with Aki and our small group thorough the streets of Tokyo! The ride was not stressful or difficult, even though we rode on city streets most of the time. Drivers were very courteous. I would highly recommend the tour- maybe not in July, but any other Time when it's not so HOT!

Fabulous bike tour. I'm so glad I booked this half day bike tour as it was a fabulous morning (even for a middle-aged woman of low fitness!) The directions on the website were very helpful for locating the bike store. I was welcomed by two very pleasant and helpful people and equipped with a bike, gel seat, helmet, and bottle of water. We then headed off for a quick practice to familiarize me with the bike (which was very light, comfortable, and easy to ride) and then cycled through Ginza, old Ningyocho town, Ryogoku to see the sumo wrestling museum, a shrine where expectant mothers were praying for a good birth and new mothers giving thanks for their babies (perfect for a midwife), the colourful and busy electronic stores of Akihabara, and the beautiful Imperial palace and Tokyo station. The pace of the tour was just right with great directions and plenty of photo stops. After the tour I was kindly provided with a nice cold drink and snack and advised how to get back to my accommodation. It was a great way to see the sights, get a sense of the layout of the area, and find out more about Japan (as I had an excellent tour guide with great English). I highly recommend this tour and thought it was extremely good value for money.
Great way seeing Tokio. We did the half day morning tour and enjoyed it very much. The guide spoke very good english and gave us useful hints for Japan and Tokio. We definately recommend this Tour.

An excellent glimpse of the Tokyo Bay Side. The group was relatively small that day (just 2, including myself) and we had the tour on a very warm and sunny summer day. Aki, our guide, was able to answer our questions well. I also noticed the good relationship they (guide) have with the folks you meet during the stops. The tour started and ended on schedule so it's safe to plan more visits after this tour. As stated on the website, the bay side tour is a bit more challenging: uphill climbs for the bridges connecting the islands, and the final climb leading to the Tokyo Tower. I find the challenging route and the scenery very enjoyable. Highly recommended!

Three hour cycle tour of Tokyo. I and two of my children (12 and 18) went on this tour. I strongly recommend it. This is an excellent way of inexpensively visiting a number of contrasting parts of Tokyo in a relatively short space of time. There was no heavy traffic to cope with and the pace was entirely manageable for my children and the four other tour participants, who were of all different ages. We were able to stop at various points to savour the particular areas we were in and to take photographs. The bikes provided by Miracle Tours were light and in very good condition. Soshi was a charming and informative guide. All in all, a relaxing and enjoyable tour.

Best Ever Experience. Best experience ever with Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour. I chose the 6-hour central Tokyo trip. Cycling equipment was in excellent working order with eight gear ratio. The staff upon arrival was warm and welcoming. The facility had an area to sit and relax as you awaited equipment fitting. Aki, our tour guide was very professional, knowledgeable, and accommodating to all participants. Aki guided us safely through both busy and inner passageways of the streets of Tokyo. My favorite stops were the Gardens, Temples, Lunch (excellent authentic Japanese food), and relaxing upon our return with our group sharing conversation and refreshment before we all departed to our independent lodgings! I visit Tokyo often and will certainly be booking another excursion with Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour!

"Miracle" is an understatement. Miracle Cycling tour sounds like a mystical cycling adventure, a trip of your dreams. Well, in reality, "miracle" is an extreme understatement of how amazing this trip was. Not only was this tour a miracle, but it also was a life experience. Embark on this trip, and witness Tokyo from a perspective you will never be able to forget. Even though we only took the half-day trip, I'm sure that it was as fun and fulfilling as the full trip. Speaking of miracles, our group also got a real miracle. The weather was perfect, with the rain stopping right before the trip started. The clouds provided cover from the harsh summer sun, and the breeze cooled us down during the trip. It rained a little, but only slightly. The sun started to show itself just as we entered Hibiya Park, the end of our tour. The weather was a Miracle indeed. Part of me still wishes that I am still sitting on the chair of the red bicycle, cruising through the streets of Tokyo. The one thing, (more like people), that makes "Miracle" Cycling more than just a word is the friendly staff and tour guides. They possess expert knowledge of the city, while still being like a best friend. I would like to express my great thanks to Soshi and the rest of the crew, who make this Miracle far more than just a miracle.

Expensive, but enjoyable. For those of you on a tight budget or only visiting tokyo for 1-2 days, I wouldn't recommend this tour.(+) I met new tourists and heard about their travels & recommendations.(+) Aki, our tour guide, was verrryy helpful in talking about Japan and recommending things to do.(+) I haven't ridden a bike in a long time, but the tour was easy to do. (+) I went on the Historical ride, and we stopped at Ushijima shrine, Senso-ji temple, the imperial palace, and on the riverside for lunch.(+) Lunch is covered(-) We biked through Ginza, Hibiya Park, Akihabara, Kappabashi and more -- but couldn't stop at these districts. (-) The bike ride actually started around 10:15 am instead of 9:30(-) A little bit pricy, so if you are in Tokyo for 1-2 days, I recommend choosing a few districts and walking them on your own.

Great Experience even in the rain. We had a great time with Aki. My daughters and I took the night tour and it was fun and enjoyable even though it rained most of the time. They gave us rain coats and rain pants. Aki went over all the safety signals and let us ride around in an open area to get used to the bikes.Tokyo at night is amazing. You get to ride along the river, over bridges, thru the city. My daughters are 11 and 13 and they really enjoyed the tour.

Excellent way to see lots of Tokyo. We did the three hour afternoon tour and really enjoyed it. We felt very safe, even when riding on the road in traffic. Tokyo is very flat so it was an easy ride and we got to see lots that we otherwise wouldn't have seen. The guide had excellent English and was very helpful. We are really glad that we did this tour.

A surprising and fun tour. It was very surprising for me to see how well tokyo is designed for cycling. The track for the tour was awesome. The tour designers have put in a lot of effort. In Japanese culture I have observed people give attention to detail. Very balanced in terms of amount of effort you have to put in and also the views are amazing. You ride through a wide range of Tokyo scenery. I wanted to do another tour with them but there was rain throughout the next day. I would really recommend this tour.

The best way to see the real Tokyo. For first timers to Tokyo, we thoroughly enjoyed the Tokyo Miracle Cycling half day Tour. We were able to see different areas of Tokyo with our very efficient guide, Soshi, giving us an insight of each area. He answered all our questions and even went out of his way to allow us to shop and taste food from shops along the way.Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour provided very good bikes - well maintained and easy to ride. Our guide was very conversant and helpful. Soshi even helped us plot the rest of our day when we asked him for directions to Odaiba. Thank you for this wonderful adventure! I highly recommend this tour.

Couldn't have been better!. I decided at the last minute to do a cycling tour of Tokyo after hearing it's a great way to see a lot of the city through a unique experience. Miracle Cycling quickly accepted my booking with just a day's notice. In fact, what I didn't realize is that the owner--Soshi-came in just to give me my half day tour. He was incredibly informative, and accommodating. He even added a tour of the fish market when I said I'd like to go there. I felt safe on the roads following behind Soshi, and all at an easy pace. It was an amazing way to see a ton of the must-see sites in a short amount of time.

Whirlwind tour. As we only had a couple of days in Tokyo, we opted for this trip and it totally exceeded our expectations. The shop is easy to find with the directions on the website. We did a half day tour with Soshi. It was just our group of 3. Soshi made sure we could handle the bikes and off we went. Even in just 2.5 hours, we saw so much. He took us to a small local shrine which was popular with women praying for easy childbirth. It was fascinating to learn about the religion and rituals. We also saw Ginza, The Sumo stadium, the Imperial Palace and visited small shops for biscuits and non-alcoholic sake. The cycling felt safe and everywhere we went, Soshi highlighted points of interest. Very professional.Tip: if you have time before or after the cycling, eat in the basement foodcourt of the Shiodome City building. We had fantastic and cheap lunches there among the OLs and salarymen.Overall, we highly recommend Tokyo Miracle Cyling Tour.

Tokyo Bay Tour. Today we participated in the Tokyo Bay Tour and had a most enjoyable day. Our guide Aki was not only a wonderful informative guide with a wealth of interesting historical and cultural information about the sites we visited but he also was friendly and accommodating to the five guests. A wonderful tour, we thoroughly enjoyed the delicious picnic lunch and the Tokyo Bay cruise was an added bonus. We would wholeheartedly recommend this tour.

Nice way to explore Tokyo with friendl guides and good bikes. Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour was a nice alternative to learn about the city. The bike shop is pretty central and the team delivers a nice “how to find us” with good pictures and perfect description.Once we arrived the team explains quickly the route we were taking and after that we did the bike check. The bikes are cool retro-style city bikes and everything worked well. We started the tour (10 participants) with our three tour guides and they made sure that we don’t get lost or split in the city. Although Tokyo is one of the largest metropoles in the world, the traffic was quiet and not comparable to cities as Bangkok, Saigon or New York, where as a biker you’re exploit to a bunch of idiots in cars and buses.However, the tour was good. The speed could have been bit higher but I guess for most of the participants it was good. What we found good is that you see a lot of places you would probably not see on our own. Nice residential areas and temples, but also small areas full of cafés and restaurants. We had our lunch break at a nice Japanese restaurant where we got serve sashimi, tempura, miso soup and some other Japanese specialties. Lunch was included as well as some water during the tour.English skills of the tourguides are good and far better than many other Japanese tourguides we met. All of them were very friendly and they like their job, which in turn gives the tour a better quality.The only two things which could be improved are:- More information should be delivered during cycling. We were mostly in front and of course did not here what people discussed in the back and they way round. I think an idea to solve this would be the implementation of an one-ear headset were each tourguide can talk and everybody can hear the same. At least as an option for the people who want to get more information (we must admit that our expectations are probably much higher than the average).- Although we got a quick overview where we went, it was very hard for us to follow up. It would be great if one of the tam would record the track via GPS and upload the route to the website, maybe also with the indication of our stops. That makes it more simple to follow up and maybe visit some places on the own sometimes later.

Great private 1/2 day tour with Soshi - my 21-year old son and me. Tokyo has many sights that are spread out and not worth a single trip/hour to visit. This tour is the perfect solution. We could not believe, as novice cyclists, that we were pedaling through the crowded streets of Ginza or Tokyo Station or Akihabara. But all we had to do was to follow Soshi's hand signals. We got to see quiet neighborhoods, rode along the river, dashed through the Imperial Palace gardens and Hibiya park. All throughout, Soshi was very safety conscious and was well prepared to take care of us with helmets, rain gear, and water. The bikes were light, and rode easily over the flat terrain.We stopped for Japanese snacks that we wouldn't have known what to look for or where to find them - fish-shaped pastry filled with sweet bean paste and sweet rice wine drink. We went through an old-fashioned arcade parlor in Akihabara and spotted as sumo on a bicycle outside the stadium. When we got back to NY, Soshi sent a photo he took of us and asked how his katsu-don dinner recommendation was (great!) Don't expect an information-laden history lesson on this tour as you would get in Beijing or Florence. But if you want something a little different that lets you see a lot in a short amount of time - this is the tour!

Fabulous and fun way to see Tokyo. We went on a half day tour today with our 8 year old. Soshi our guide was fantastic, he paced the ride so our daughter could keep up, without being slow. He took us down streets and alleys we wouldn't have found on our own and was full of information. We were so impressed and had the best time. Don't take a bus, go with these guys.

Great half day experience with Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour. It was a great half day ride experience, the only time I could "squeezed" out from my business trip. Special thanks to the the experienced and patient tour guide Akira san, where I have a considerable good glimpse of Tokyo in such a short period.

A great way to see Tokyo in both breadth and depth. This was a highlight of my visit to Tokyo. I was on the Old Downtown Full-Day Tour, and loved the places that I got to see. I especially loved Yanaka (old town) area, where we had a chance to see the life of ordinary people in Tokyo while riding on narrow alleys. Our guide - Akira - was both very friendly and knowledgeable about the places that we were visiting. There were some occasions where we got on road and rode with some traffic, but I did not feel so dangerous as we were well-guided by our guide who gave hand signs of when to stop, slow down etc.

Wonderful people / wonderful way to see Tokyo. I could not recommend doing this more as a half-day (or full day if you’re up to it) activity if you are in the Tokyo area.My wife and I did the half day afternoon Tokyo tour as part of our honeymoon and got to see a host of great areas in Tokyo including (but not limited to) Ginza, Nihonbashi, Akihabara, and the Imperial Palace.Our tour guide, Soshi, was awesome. He knows the areas very well and does a good job of explaining each. He also guides you very safely and makes sure to point out the different points of interest as you go along. Last but not least he is incredibly friendly and he speaks very good English.Without spoiling the trip – there are several places that Soshi takes you to help you experience the local feel and culture of each district.The rest of the staff is also very nice and generous, and they even had a celebratory gift for us when we returned!5 star experience! Please go and check it out for yourself!

Great way to see lots in little time . Really great half day cycling trip! Easy way to see lots if you have limited time on the island. It isn't intensive cycling however I wouldn't have my 60 year old parents riding on the trip either. Enjoyed it immensely.

Well done!. At first, I was a bit concerned with the quality of the tour as I happened to be the only person on the tour. Aki totally blew me away with his professionalism, passion of Tokyo and friendliness. With him, I was able to see the truest side Tokyo as we cycled through various small alleys, parks and family run shops to see how commoners live. We had such a wonderful conversation during lunch, learning about Japanese customs (what to say when you leave the restaurant, how to eat noodles etc.) and also his experience traveling from south to North Japan! If you want to explore the city, have a great conversation with a local, then you should totally go for the Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour.

Cycling in Tokyo is truly Miracle-ously Fabulos. This is THE highlight of my mother/son bonding holiday. We both enjoyed it tremendously. Soshi our guide is young, fun, great company, speaks excellent English and showed us parts of Tokyo we would never have seen. We went on the Old City tour but there was plenty of "new city" to pass through as well. I finally visited Todai (Tokyo University, one of the best in the world and the top in Japan).
