Asked Soshi to let us stop for photo-op as this will be my only chance of being "in Todai". Hahaha.For those worried about cycling in a city, Tokyo is virtually flat and the cycling is done on the pavement which are very wide and shared only with pedestrians. We went at a comfortable pace and Soshi was always looking out for us to make sure we were following and safe.The best part for us foodies were the little shops that sold snacks. How we are still talking about the croquettes we ate with Soshi. And the cake shop that I asked Soshi to stop at in Yanaka, yummy x 3. It was so pretty we just had to have a break. Loved snake alley (no live snakes), and other little gems. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Best way to see Tokyo. After being advised to do a cycle tour of Tokyo, we stumbled upon Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour. We were met by Soshi, our guide, who was fabulous. We chose the Sunday morning 3 hour ride which covered approximately 16km's through the city. There was time to stop for a snack, a sip of (non-alcoholic) sake and plenty of photo opportunities. The ride was flat and suitable for anyone. The route taken was safe and avoided heavy traffic areas. To top of the morning Soshi has a great sense of humour which made the ride more fun with his little quips along the way.

Half day cycling tour of Tokyo. Went for the half day tour and was definitely one of the great ways to see Tokyo . The guide - Shoshi San - was fluent in English and was extremely well encouraging of our requests to even go off track a bit. His knowledge of each place as well as of the places to go, restaurants to visit, things to do in Tokyo and elsewhere in Japan was great as well.

Wonderful Day inTokyo. Aki expertly guided us through the streets of Tokyo and around the Bayside area of the city. Most of the cycling was on pavements or very quiet streets, however we did cycle along some roads with traffic. I am usually quite a nervous cyclist in traffic but felt quite safe with Aki and Tokyo drivers are very considerate to cyclists which they are not at home. We had a delicious lunch and a ferry ride back to the Tokyo Tower area. All in all excellent.

Fantastic Way to See Tokyo. A friend & I had booked onto the half day Tokyo cycling tour. We were fortunate to be the only ones on our tour & we had a great time. Lead by our affable and extremely knowledgeable guide Soshi, we had the opportunity to see whole parts of Tokyo that we would otherwise have missed. I was a little apprehensive prior to the tour as I hadn't cycled for a very long time - but it was absolutely fine - Tokyo is pretty flat and Soshi made sure that we went at a comfortable pace.Highly, highly recommended - it was one of the highlights of our holiday!Soshi also had excellent english and was able to give some great insights into life in Tokyo.

So much fun! Highly recommended!. We had a FANTASTIC time on a half day bike tour with our wonderful guide Reiko. We were lucky enough to have the tour to ourselves, and had so much fun! Reiko guided us expertly through the streets of Tokyo and we never once felt frightened or out of our depth. She was overly generous with explaining and teaching us all about the areas we visited, and made us several funky recommendations for lunch after the tour! She was funny, kind and lovely, and her english was excellent! We would highly recommend you go on this tour - and will definitely do another tour with her when we're next in Japan. Five stars!!!!

Awesome Bike Tour!. As a first timer to Tokyo, Japan and short length of stay, we wanted to get a good experience that was short, sweet yet be entertained with a wealth of information of the beautiful city, Tokyo. On tour day, there was potential rain in the forecast; however, Soshi reassured us that most likely there would be no rain during the tour. We are glad we did not cancel! We had an amazing 3 hour tour of the city as we stopped by each historical landmarks that was offered in the tour to embrace the beauty and information background lesson taught by Soshi. In addition, he took us through these various alley ways that contained local shops, bakeries and eateries which the typical tourist will not know. The best way to get a feel good of Tokyo is a bike tour in my opinion. You will not be disappointed! By the way, the weather ended up being absolutely amazing! Thanks again Soshi!

Great way to see the city. Very hospitable hosts on our half day trip around Tokyo. In such a busy city, safety is clearly of paramount importance but I never felt in any danger with our two daughters, aged 11 and 9.The pace was slow (due in part to another couple on the tour who hadn't been acquainted with a bike in the last 30 years!) So we could have gone faster but the easy pace allowed us to take in our surroundings. The guide, Sochi, was very knowledgeable about his city.I'm a big fan of using a bike to get to know a city....Tokyo is so big you can't see it all on foot and if you use the Metro you miss out on seeing lots of things....so book yourself on one of these trips would be my recommendation!

Saw most of tokyo in a different perspective. If you were In a bus tour, you'll be on the main road. If you're an independent traveler choosing to take the subway, you'll miss the sites above ground. By taking a biking tour, we took the roads less travelled. We saw small streets that showed another face of Tokyo. Here we saw people going about their daily lives. There were small shops, fruit and vegetable stores, noodle houses, etc.

Fun and personal night tour. I thoroughly enjoyed the night bicycle tour in Tokyo. Our guide was very friendly and put in extra effort to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. The tour was very informative and we were able to visit places that an everyday tourist wouldn't go to. The staff were very accommodating and gave us further advise for what to do while travelling in Tokyo. We also received a special birthday surprise at the conclusion of the tour! Thanks Miracle Cycling Tour!

Worth the entire ￥10000. I did the Tokyo Bayside Tour with Akira. Akira was a great guide that handled the tour in a easy to understand manner. By going on this tour, I was able to see many places I would not have visited on my own. This tour provided many great picture opportunities of various Tokyo landmarks, and gave me a great sense of exploration. Being able to meet people from other countries is also an added bonus, so I would recommend Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour to anyone looking to experience more of Tokyo.
Remarkable experience in enjoying the Tokyo city!!. Nice bike, friendly and helpful guide, of course handsome and pretty. I am glad to taste the city in a special angle..... memorable!

Tokyo Trip on Tokyo bike. I joined 3 of their 7 programs, Night View Tour, Half day Tour, and Center of Tokyo Tour, with Akira. I really enjoyed all 3 and wish I could join all 7 programs. I recommended to all my bike friends. If I visit Tokyo again, I will go with them again for sure!!

Fun afternoon.. We spent a Sunday afternoon cycling around central Tokyo. The tour was informative and we got to see streets and places we would have not seen otherwise. Our guide, Rieko, was congenial and informative and was sensitive to our needs. We originally had thought to do a whole day tour but our schedule prevented it. We are sorry now that that was the case.

Great way to see Tokyo!!. Did the 'Old Town Tokyo' tour with my 15 year old daughter, and we had a great day!Very easy to find, very nice tour leader and a great way to tour around the city without being stuck in a tour bus!The cycling isn't difficult at all, although afterwards you know you've done a fair bit of exercise, especially as it was a very warm day!Food at lunch was very nice!All staff spoke very good English and were very keen to help!Would definitely recommend this tour!
A must. Very nice experience to travel Tokyo by bicicle.A nice tour, lot of cool and interesting places and a very nice guide.

Great day and night tours!. I went on the night tour my first day in Tokyo with Akira and it was just lovely. A great way to see the city at night, Aki stopped to let me take pictures and explained different parts of the city. I actually like it so much I went on the inner Tokyo day tour the next day. That was fabulous! You get to go through parts of Tokyo you normally wouldn't, see it from a different perspective, have a great picnic in the park. Aki was keen to make sure we all stayed together and I never felt unsafe going in traffic. It was an all day tour but not a strenuous ride, very leisurely pace so you can enjoy the areas you are riding through. Highly recommend!!

Afternoon Bike Through Tokyo. Fantastic 3 hour bike tour through Tokyo. Our guide Soshi was well informed and as my daughter and Imyself were the only two on the tour, asked if we would like to tailor our ride to visit areas we requested. The ride was easy with little hills so would suit anyone with limited recent riding. We were able to stop at several place including Electric Street, Sumo Stadium and plenty other interesting back streets and alleys. Very memorable afternoon - thanks also for the beer and the chat afterwards Soshi !!

Good bike ride with little tour information. Four of us booked a tour with this company and were disappointed with the lack of information on the tour as to where we were and an explanation of what we were seeing. We often book a bike tour when we are traveling in new cities and this is the first time we have felt the tour of Tokyo was basically a bike ride with little tour information provided. Our tour guide did not speak very good English which I'm sure contributed to the lack of tour information.

Fantastic and FUN way to see Tokyo. I thought taking a bicycle tour would be a fantastic, fun and fast way to see Tokyo without getting lost, meeting new friends and exercising! Miracle cycling tours was a GREAT choice! We saw so MUCH of Tokyo in 6 hours, something that i would not have been able to do by myself. Aki and Reiko spoke great English and they had a very easy-going personality. Highly recommended, worth every cent.

Super fun even for experienced cyclists. If you don't have experience riding in a large city it may seem intimidating, but Tokyo is a super safe and bike friendly city. There is not as much traffic as you may think and the guide does a great job at signaling and directing you. It is much easier riding in Tokyo than a city like San Francisco.Three of us joined an afternoon half-day tour with Akira. Two of us commute by bicycle regularly in San Francisco, CA and the other in Sao Palo, Brazil. I had a slight concern that we would be moving at a slow pace, but our guide quickly assessed our skill level appropriately. We were soon jamming down Tokyo streets, cutting through alleys, and swiftly crossing major intersections with ease and confidence. It was so much fun!We rode a little over 12 miles in a little over 3 hours. We saw thebig sights but also rolled through small neighborhoods where we snacked on tasty Japanese Croquettes by the road side. We were going at a good pace, so our guide was able to take us on a detour to check out the Shrine Festival, which was very interesting to observe. Riding through quite Tokyo side streets is a lot of fun and bombing down the major streets is exhilarating.The bikes were very well maintained and performed pretty well. They are flat bar vintage styled 8 speed bikes. You will not hit many hills, so you won't be gear changing much, but gear shifting is smooth and the bikes ride well overall. Seeing Tokyo by bicycle really connects you to the city and I would highly recommend this outfit for all skill levels.

An amazing way to see Tokyo!. It has taken me way to long to writ this review! We went on the half day tour in April and it was the best guided tour I have ever been on, cycling really is a safe and awesome way to see the Tokyo sights! Aki was the best guide, he was very knowledgeable and interesting to talk to, he was always conscious of our safety and enjoyment. We saw all the major sites and he suggested good places for us to go afterwards and an awesome Ramen place round the corner from their offices to eat our lunch. I wish we had done the full day tour! The tour was everything we could have wanted and Aki was very sweet taking photos of us on our camera at some beautiful cherry blossom sights. When the tour ended we were a bit wet (it had drizzled nonstop the whole morning!) so Aki made us tea and let us dry off at the office, he was so friendly and we chatted about music for quite a while! It was lovely to be shown around by a local and with such a great service, if you only have time for one thing while in Tokyo make it this tour!

Awesome Bike Tour.. I took the 3 hour half day tour.I had a blast. We met at their office (Be sure to not arrive to early, because you will not find it since there are no signs and you might walk pass it looking for it like I did. They will put out their signs about 30 min before opening)where I met my co bicyclers and the tour guide Soshi. After he took our info and payment(You can pay with credit card) we could chose a bike that he adjusted for us, and off we went.We went slow enough to see all the sights, and stopped plenty of times to get info from Soshi about the parts of the city we were in.He is very knowledgeable.He was nice enough to stop so that we could taste Sake without alcohol, and dumplings (Not included in the price).We also met some Sumo wrestlers, but couldn't get tickets because they were sold out (Only two $300 tickets were left) The best part was that there was the Octoberfest at Hibya Park, so we stopped there and had a beer. I made some new friends I went out with that night.It was a perfect day. I'll do it again next year.

Excellent way to see Tolyo. I had to rebook twice due to flight delays and Soshi was wonderful and accommodating. I am glad I could make the bike ride through the city for the full day.Aki had his hands full with 9 women and he managed to keep us all entertained. He is very humble and switched from Japanese to English with ease.A great way to cover a lot of ground and see lots. Highly recommended

Learn more about Tokyo's history. The booking was easy: Called Aki on a Saturday night, and confirmed ride for Sunday morning. The location was easy to find, and the bicycles in excellent shape. Aki adjusted each bike individually, and insisted us in wearing helmets - which is positive! The speed of the ride was very suitable for us, not too slow. Our group of five people kept the pace throughout the tour. We saw a lot of the Tokyo highlights from former times which you would never find unless you really dig into the touristic guide - time we did not have on this Sunday between two busy business weeks. There is one proposal: Please wait until all members have gathered, and then explain about the attractions. It is hard to listen while riding one after another. Summary: Relaxing, informative, well-organised.

Great cycling tour of Tokyo. We did the 1/2 day Tokyo cycling tour with our 10yr and 13yr old children. Arki was a great guide and this was a fantastic way to see Tokyo. Our kids ride regularly and had no problem keeping up with the tour and the regular breaks helped as well. Would highly recommend this tour.

Ride your bike to explore the most of Tokyo!. It was April 2015 and I arrived to the tour office on a gloomy -rainy afternoon. The whether was quite disappointing but this tour saved my day !I have spent 3 hours with the tour guide, Mr Akira, a very friendly, humorous and most important of all , a lover of Tokyo ! If you want to know the city from whom who do understand and passion of it, this is is a perfect way to go

Informative and fun. We did a half day tour with Akira and had a fantastic time. Akira stopped to point out interesting things and stopped at a couple of cool spots when we said we were hungry!I was nervous about cycling around Tokyo but Aki made us feel safe and alternated between riding on the road and on the footpath, depending on the traffic. We covered so much ground, much more than we would have on our own.I can't recommend this tour enough!

Luxury private cycle tour in Tokyo. We as Dutchies who cycled our whole life from childhood and have cycled in Bangkok, Muscat, Brisbane were having an absolute great day in Tokyo yesterday. A joy to go through the 'old town' and a bit concerned cycling on the busy highways through town going back. What a great experience and fun thing to do.

Fantastic way to see the city!. My husband and I booked the Tokyo Old Downtown Tour for our first full day in Tokyo. Tokyo Miracle was easy to book, confirmed my reservation promptly, and its office was within walking distance of our Shiodome hotel. We were really impressed with how easy it was to bicycle through the busy streets and sidewalks of Tokyo! Our guides, Aki, Soshi, and Rei, did a great job of leading a large-ish group (9 of us, including one toddler) all around the eastern part of the city. We saw neighborhoods we never would've discovered on foot or by train, and even got to wander through a beautiful azalea festival at Nezu Shrine. Other highlights were the Imperial Palace and Yasukuni Shrine, Ueno Park, Akihabara, and historic Nezu and Yanaka areas. The lunch was also excellent. The tour packed a LOT in without feeling rushed or overly strenuous. Guides were friendly and informative, bikes were clearly well maintained, and the ride as a whole was a fun and active way to see a lot of sights in one day and get oriented to the city.

Great Tokyo Experience. Great way to discover different pockets of Tokyo on a bike. It was an easy ride on mostly flat roads.Our group overshot the time in the end by an hour because there was a wedding at Sensoji Temple and nearby a horseback archery festival. Akira and Yuri were very nice to give us ample time to witness these events and to take lots of pictures. It was also lovely to eat Bento lunch while taking our break along Sumida River. I was given to understand by friends before my trip that I would likely miss the cherry blossom season since I went to Tokyo only from third week of April. I was pleasantly surprised and happy that we could see numerous fully bloomed cherry blossom trees when Akira led us to Hibiya Park. Thank you, Akira and Yuri.

Great Day. We did the full day historical tour, and it was great ! Nice way to see the city, way better than walking/taking the subway. Aki was our guide, and he was great! Super friendly, and had lots of information for us. Was able to answer all of our questions, too. It was a very easy bike, don't let 6 hours discourage you. Hardly any hills, and when there were, they were very small. Biked on some busy streets, but always lots of room for bikers, always felt safe. The only small downside was the price is a little bit expensive (10,000 yen per person) Still, do not regret this trip at all, and would recommend to anyone new to the city.Thanks!

excellent bike tour!. highly recommend this bike tour. great way to start our your explorations of tokyo as it really helps you to see the must see areas in a high-yield/low time consumption way. that way you can see the specifics of each area that interests you later. Rei (?spelling) led our group and did so in a way that felt safe and really easy for any skill level biker. She chose routes that were bike friendly and provided information on the different parts of the city that if we just saw on our own, would not have learned nearly as much about this lovely city.A+++ highly recommend

Wonderful Tokyo experience. I took the 6 hours Center of Tokyo tour. An amazing experience! Absolutely recommended, for everyone really. No need to be super fit or a very good biker. Great guide, great company, good excercise, excellent sightseeing and lovely picnic lunch in a park. Best thing to do on a day off in Tokyo.

Fantastic day cycling around Tokyo. My husband and I booked a full day cycling tour. We were in a group with two other tourists form Singapore. Our guide, Nori-san, was really friendly and helpful. We enjoyed his commentary and explanations.I've blogged about the day in detail here: http://fatgirltoironman.co.uk/2015/04/03/tokyo-via-helsinki/The tour took in a wide variety of locations and helped to orient me in the city.

Fun tour and a great way to see Tokyo. Tokyo is a fantastic city to cycle round and we had great fun on the Bay tour with Nori. The bikes provided were of good quality and easy to adjust.The city is flat and you get to see a lot on the cycle tour. Nori was very informative and there were lots of breaks to discuss the sights.We had a great time and I'd recommend the tours.
Great trip. Really loved cycling right through Tokyo. Aki and Yuki were great guides and this was great leisurely way to cover all sorts of sights through the city.

Lovely tour on a rainy day. Thank you Nori for a great experience for my family and paying special attention to my little one. We truly enjoyed riding with you on an unforgettable rainy day in Tokyo. Will come again!

Absolutely Amazing - Center of Tokyo Tour!. My husband and I had a wonderful time on our 6 hour Center of Tokyo Tour with Aki at the end of March! This is the best way to get a feel for the city and see so much while having tons of fun!!!! Rendezvous point was within walking distance from our hotel (Park Hotel) and we were fortunate enough to be the only ones booked! Aki was a fantastic guide and very personable (thank you!!). He was easy to follow and has such a fun personality. We really enjoyed every moment and hearing all of his travel stories over lunch.Our 23km ride couldn't have been better and Tokyo is wonderful to bike! Only one challenging hill and a need to be attentive while flowing with street traffic. The cherry blossoms were in full bloom which made everything even more magical. We made stops at Sengakuji, Happoen, Mejijingu, and Zojoji, wove our way all through so many districts including Shibuya, Harajuku, and Roppongi. Lunch was at a delicious, tiny restaurant in Sibuya where we feasted on cold soba noodles and tuna with veggies and rice. Aki modified our tour slightly since it was only the two of us to ensure we saw tons and tons of blossoms (thank you!!!!).We would definitely take another tour in the future! This is a must do for everyone who enjoys biking :-)!!

Fastest and Easiest Way to See Tokyo. We only have a few days in Japan. In fact, six days all in all, which includes three days in Tokyo.Stumbled upon Miracle Cycling tours on my Google search. In fact, it is on the top of my search, and boy!, it was worth a shot.Registering for the Historical Tour is very easy, and the staff are very helpful. Getting to their office is also very easy because of the updated pictures and walkways posted on their website.Nori became our tour guide for the day, and in the group are two of my friends and three others from Adelaide, Australia. Nori is very knowledgeable on every part of the tour and even took us to his favorite shop in Asakusa. He even treated us with a very good bento box lunch picnic. Even though lunch is part of the package, the bento box seems to be carefully purchased. Not for the sake of getting it somewhere else. Nori is also open to questions not related to the cycle tour, such as where to go to Tokyo at night or the best places to shop for bargain items. What amazed me the most is that Nori take his work with so much pride and enthusiasm. He seemed to be in to biking, always smiling, eager to learn the culture of other countries, and showed us what Japanese hospitality is all about.The bikes from Miracle Cycling are also in very good condition and very lightweight, which make biking very easy.I will do this again if I get a chance to go back to Tokyo. I highly recommend the all-day bike tour especially if you want to cover a lot of ground in a very short time. It may seem very tiring since it's all day, but Nori did a fantastic job of keeping a very mild pace and ensuring that everyone's safe. Thank you very much Nori and the rest of Miracle Cycling Tour for an amazing experience. Thank you also for the photos you sent via email. I wish you well and more success in the future. I am looking forward to book another tour with you again.PS. To Debbie, John, and Crystal, we wish you safe travels on your next adventure.

Experience Tokyo from the saddle. Thank you to Nori and Reiko for your amazing enthusiasm showing my daughter and myself a wonderful selection of the sights of Tokyo. The hybrid bikes were excellent and it was good to wear helmets. We loved the picnic lunch (bento boxes) under the cherry blossom. Pace at times was fast requiring concentration - we rode a mixture of highway and pavements. The guides were knowledgeable and keen to share and interact with the group. Refreshments back at base at the end were much appreciated. A great introduction to the city!

Get a different Point of View for Tokyo. Dear Nori and ReiThat has been a great moment for me in Tokyo. We have enjoyed ourselves. The tour was great and a great way of getting a different point of view for Tokyo. The two of you have been great hosts. And I felt that you are also enjoy what you are doing. All in all great fun. Next visit Tokyo: I will come back to you guys. All the best and good luck for you.

An excellent way to see & feel Tokyo. Our mixed-age group (teens, twenties, 50's) of beginner bikers had a great time with tour guides Aki & Yuri. They shared so much of their culture and of the city in a very exciting way. Most of all they made sure everyone was safe and comfortable. looking forward to a full day cycling tour with Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tours in our next visit.

Excellent Way to See Tokyo. My family and I visited Japan for the first time, and we wanted to do something fun and memorable for our first full day in Tokyo. We were a family of 7 (two teens, two mid-twenties, and three over 50), and we had the half-day morning tour to ourselves. Our guides were Akira and Yuki. Despite our group essentially being newbies to biking (most of us not having time in a bike since elementary), Aki and Yuki were very patient and were able to teach us enough to get through Tokyo's busy streets. We expected to ride around a special bike path for the tour, but instead got a taste of riding through the heart of the city. Cycling through main roads, sidewalks, crossing busy intersections... That's just a little bit of what's in store. During the ride, our guides would talk about where we were, and any interesting points about the area. We rode through Ginza, Nihonbashi bridge, Ryokoggu, and Akihabara (we skipped Imperial Palace because we had a 2 o'clock). Again, all of us in the group don't bike back home, let alone bike around a busy city. But the Bike Tour was definitely the most fun and most memorable thing we've done so far. I cannot stress how grateful we are to Aki and Yuki being our guides. I highly recommend the Tokyo Miracle Cycling Tour for any group who is interested in some adventure. Admittedly, you'd need to be able to handle a bicycle, but as long as you can maintain your balance, and remember to brake, you will enjoy your time.

A great way to see the whole city, with excellent hosts. Whilst other options such as metro, foot and taxi can be used, seeing Tokyo on a bike seems now the only way to do it.We saw more than I expected to see and riding on the roads was not a problem - unlike in the UK the drivers show good respect for all other road users.The guides, Nori and Rei, were informative and very friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Lunch arrangements were agreed as a group and the bento box was excellent.The area covered was all flat so the 24km distance of the tour is actually easier on a bike than on foot. One comment I would make - that is NO criticism at all of the tour - is that it's not a trip I'd do with children under the age of 15 or 16; whilst the roads were okay, it did require me to have my wits about me on occasion (and I ride lots in the UK).Helmets were also supplied and the bikes were Tokyo Bikes (tokyobike.com) ... Obviously! Bikes were well services and clean.
Great day out inTokyo. Highly recommend Aki and the Miracle Cycling Tour to anyone wishing for a great day out on the bike to get to know some of the key sites in Tokyo.

Incredible tour!. Akira was an awesome guide! I did the full day historical tour of Tokyo and it ended up being just him and I. We had a blast! I really felt like I learned a ton about the city and that I saw more in those 6 hours than I could have ever done on my own.The bike was great and lunch was included. I would highly recommend this bike tour to anyone looking to be active and to see the sights!Daniel from Orlando, FL. USA.

Wonderful, friendly guides treated us like kings. Aki, Nori and Yuki were incredibly friendly, helpful, informative, and just plain fun, while safely guiding us through traffic. We got to see the many sides of Tokyo: some flashy modern districts like Ginza, some history like the Nihonbashi bridge, and everything in between.

A terrific way to see Tokyo. We booked an afternoon tour at short notice and our guides Aki and colleague Rako were very helpful - even managing to find us as we got a little lost locating the bike store. Cycling down the Ginza was a highlight, but we also got to see some smaller parts of Tokyo, and the tofu doughnuts in Ningyocho were a treat (even for non-tofu eaters!). We would highly recommend this tour company; the bikes were easy to manage and our guides very attentive. A fun experience and a great way to see Tokyo

Get on your bike in Tokyo. We took the afternoon tour (3 hours) and had a great time cycling in a big city like Tokyo, through some very interesting scenic side streets and also on the main avenues like Ginzha.Shoshi, our guide, was very helpful and knowledgeable.Highly recommended for people who want to do something different in a big city.

Japanese hospitality at its finest!!. I booked a half-day trip for my parents and myself on a Saturday morning, and it was unanimously agreed to be the best time we had in Tokyo! Thank you Sochi-san (our guide)! Sochi was warm, knowledgeable, personable, attentive and convivial. A gem of a guide!Firstly, we got lost (stupidly) trying to find our way to the location on foot. Sochi gave us a ring to check on us when we were late, and offered to walk us from the subway station. It was very kind of him, and we were grateful for the clear and patient walking directions he gave over the phone. Secondly, when I explained that my parents spoke no English and were illiterate, and that I would have to translate whatever he said as we went along, he was very understanding and clearly tailored the pace and content of his tour to whatever my parents were interested in. Finally, when he realised that my mother was taking pictures of the flowers along the way and was lamenting about not being able to catch any cherry blossoms (we were about a month too early for that), he very sweetly went out of the way to bring us to a temple where there were plum blossoms in bloom, and also to a lone blooming cherry blossom tree along one of the parks. It was such an unbelievably sweet gesture that I was quite lost for words. My mother was so thrilled and was going about like a child in a sweet shop - it was so lovely! I was also very pleased to get to try some okonomiyaki and takoyaki on his recommendation - my personal favourite Japanese snacks anyway! At the end of the trip, we were again treated to the wonderful Japanese hospitality as he kept us fed and warm with tea, coffee, rice crackers, and printed a map of some recommended lunch places, as he left us to go about our day. I was very humbled by the kindness, generosity, and warmth exhibited by Sochi, and my parents for days after, were still going on about it - Japanese hospitality at its best! We were absolutely spoilt rotten, and we're so grateful! Thank you for showing us the old town and so much more. Cheers Alexis

Fantastic. Akira was the best tour guide, my teenage girls had the best 6 hours in Tokyo they have had all week and that include shopping so that's a big wow. From the moment we arrived Akira greeted us with a big 'Welcome' and that made us comfortable with what the day was going to bring. After being sized up for bikes we were off to discover Tokyo like no other. From start to finish it was amazing to see temples, sky tree,imperial palace, ginza and not to mention meeting some locals and tasting there shop food which was a highlight for me.

Great way to see Tokyo. The best way to see Tokyo as a whole city. You get to loop around the city through different areas that are all really interesting. The cycling is easy and safe and the tour is not rushed. Thanks guys.

Great guide, Great service, Amazing way to explore Tokyo. (Even in the rain!). My day started on a wet and cold February morning and it's not surprising that I was the only customer that came.The staff then kindly asked me if I would like to do a walking tour instead, but I opted for the cycling tour as it was only drizzling at the time.So they gave me a nice bike with leather seats and grips, and provided me with a cool looking rain gear to start off the tour.The tour I've chosen was the tokyo old downtown tour, and my guide, Nori, was excellent. He was kind, friendly and knowledgable. He always tries his best to answer all of my questions and gives me information about the places we visited. Also, he gave me lots of suggestions for the rest of my tokyo trip.I have mainly chosen this route because I wanted to experience a tour that I can explore tokyo best through cycling. And I was pleasantly satisfied. We went through big and popular areas as well as small historical streets which normally isn't popular while traveling by train/foot. Nori also took me to traditional-style snack shops while exploring the streets. Lunch was also superb as Nori brought me to a local shop where I got to experience what locals eat.So overall, if you want to explore Tokyo in a fun and unique fashion, or if you just love exploring places with your bike at home, then I would totally recommend the bike tours they offer!

Great experience of old Tokyo. I took a day ride with Aki-san around old downtown Tokyo.He is not only knowledgeable on the history of the places and Tokyo ,he will introduce you some quirky places ..such as location where they do NHK broadcast and Sakura Blossom indicator tree..and to end it all,he brought me to Ueno for shopping when I told him I needed pair of shoes ...i would strongly recommend this tour if you would like to do some thing different and enjoyable in Tokyo.

Excellent experience!. Excellent experience! It was a sunny Friday, and luckily the "group" was just myself and the guide Nori. It was very fun as I was able to stop wherever I felt interested and Nori was very patient and fluent in English. As of the biking skills, the last time I cycled was like 4 years ago and I had no problem riding on Tokyo streets. Besides, Nori was very experienced and skilled cyclist and if you follow the signs the guide gives you, you will be fine, even with little cycling skills.

A perfect ride for those who love bike and Tokyo. If you are looking for a cycling tour around Tokyo, I strongly recommend this to you guys.I, together with 3 of my friends pick up Tokyo downtown ride. It's an all day course (6 hours). And here is the list of things I like:- Everyone is really friendly and polite, I feel really comfort while I was with them- If your group is the only group on that day, they will allow you to make a request- Their bikes are good, they're in a perfect condition and quite light which help you a lot when you need to ride on it all day long.- I'm not sure if I was mistaken or not, but it seems our guide decide to fix some schedules for us to make us most satisfied. For example, he decide to bring us to several food stall once he knew that we enjoy eating so much.- Their English is good, especially if you compare to other Japanese. They might not be as fluent as native speakers but they tried their best to make sure that we understand everything.- Though I've mentioned above that it's a 6 hours course, but it actually took above 7 hours because we spent quite a lot of time in each stop. And our guide never tried to rush us.Of course it's not a perfect trip but I can guarantee that you guys won't be disappointed with this. Good job!

Great private tour . I really enjoyed the time! I did the Tour to Odaiba and saw many nice places. The guide gives me several hints to enjoy Tokyo by night and also introduced me into using chopsticks :) Thank you for the great trip!

Great experience!!. I was in Tokyo on business for 3 days with limited time off.I took the afternoon half-day tour.I was very surprised to discover when arrived to the office that I am the only one and that I am getting a personal tour (For the same price).I had a lot of fun with nice information and stories I could get only from a local.Thank you guys for providing me this great experience.Would come again next time I have time off in Tokyo.

Night tour. Just finished a night tour with Nori. I was the only booking so it was essentially a private tour. The sights were interesting and Nori's happy to share all his insights about Tokyo. He also took care of me during the ride and I felt safe at all times. Thumbs up :)

Worth the effort. I love bike tours and this one was no exception.We took the full day tour with Akiro with just four of us total. Of course we saw a number of sight that no guide book would show us; that's what it's really all about.Sorry, but bento box lunches are not my thing, especially when a bowl of udon noodles can be found just about anywhere. I'm glad I tried it though.

Beautiful and educational tour of Tokyo. I have to say this was the BEST activity that my sister and I did on our trip. We has the handsome and fun loving Nori-san as our tour guide and he took us EVERYWHERE! what I really loved about this trip was that we were able to stop and take a lot of pictures and videos while on the tour. My sister and I felt very safe on the tour as Nori knew the roads very well and constantly checked up on us to make sure we were keeping up :) Thank you Miracle Cycling Tour!

Great Night Tour through Tokyo.... Can't say enough about Aki and Nori, who took us on a personal night tour of Tokyo and went out of their way to ensure an unforgettable experience. Both were extremely friendly, and excited to show you around Tokyo's and it's great sites at night. This a great way to see so many parts of the city in so little time, and we found ourselves working back towards some of the places we saw later in the trip. Would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Tokyo, and would suggest doing it towards the beginning of the trip as you'll find some new places to visit while there. These guys will make sure you enjoy, so be sure to give them a try.

Great way to see the city. Saw the tour on trip advisor and did the early morning ride. Great way to see the city. Friendly and knowledgable guide. Excellent communication in booking on email the day before, including perfect directions to find them. Even offered suggestions for my afternoon. Highly recommend.

What a Fun Experience!. We did the three hour morning tour and had a great time. We felt as if we were seeing Tokyo from a local's perspective, not the typical city bus tour. It was so fun weaving through the streets and neighborhoods and we felt perfectly safe the entire ride. Our guides Akira and Nori kept us together by riding in front and back of us so noone had to worry about getting left behind. It was so fun to venture "out of the box" and see Tokyo from a totally different perspective. We highly recommend this tour.
Bike tour. Such a great way to see different places around Tokyo. Our tour guide nori was great. The bikes are good quality and they also kept safety in mind. Had a great time

Bayside Tour was great fun!. We had a great time touring the bayside area. There was so much to see and our guide was so patient with our questions, taking photos and of course watching out for us. The whole crew at Miracle was great! One of the guys even rode out to catch up with us and bring bottles of water that we left behind. I would highly recommend taking a tour with the guys at Tokyo Miracle Cycling.

Best way to see Tokyo. I booked a half day tour last minute and the Team accomodated very easily. After explaining the itinerary off we went to discover Tokyo. The tour was easy since Tokyo is very flat. My guide (sorry I forgot his name) showed me the main attractions with a fair bit of historical explanation. We stopped many times to watch, admire and appreciate the sites. We even took a break to eat a delicious smoked tea ice cream and drink some soy milk. The level of English is way above average and we could definitely have a conversation. One little wish: bikes are in great condition but not necessarily practical to look around and sit on (more mountain bike style). I think I would have preferred a traditional Japanese bike with a more upright position and a wide saddle.I definitely recommend this organization.

Great Way to See Tokyo Sights. Soshi and his team do a great job providing an excellent, tailor made experience. Nori was my guide and made the day enjoyable. Took the day long Bay tour which takes about 6 hours and is about 13 miles. Easy to moderate biking with plenty of stops for any ability level.Great way to see sights not on typical tours and of course some of the key attractions. Guides are well prepared and we enjoyed the day even thought the weather was not good. A relatively frequent traveler to Tokyo, Nori showed me many sights I have never (or would ever) see. Good history primer andd gave me ideas for things to see in more depth next visit.Met the staff at Apre-Bike time and enjoyed an Asahi beer!

Great bike tour. We(with my wife and 2 kids) did the Tokyo Holy city tour on the second day of our arrival in Tokyo late July 2014 and provided us a good orientation of the great city. The tour was excellent covering temples, gardens as well as trendy parts of Tokyo city. Nori was an excellent guide, even though he is not fluent in English, he made all effort to explain the background and history of all the places visited. It was a hot and humid day but the pace was such that we never felt exhausted in spite of covering almost 25+KM. The bikes were all in excellent condition and Nori took care of safety while riding on the busy streets of Tokyo. We were all very satisfied with the tour and arrangements by Miracle Cycling tour. Would highly recommend that you do this tour at the beginning of your stay in Tokyo.

Bike Tour review. We have just finished the tour with Akira and Nori who were 2 relaxed and cool young guys. We had them to ourselves for the day and were blessed with sunshine, no wind and a really good day for riding. The sights were plentiful on the all day tour and we arrived back just before 4.30pm as they allowed my wife to venture into some shops on the way. Furthermore they took us a to an authentic Japanese restaurant for lunch and being Australian we seemed to be a hit with the locals. There was a lot of the old Tokyo on the tour with the small lane ways which certainly added to the experience. We don't feel that we have to take any other tour whilst we are in Tokyo so thank you boys!!

Wonderful Intro to Tokyo. I did the Panoramic Tokyo tour with Akira and Nori (Kochi). This was a great 23km bike tour around the city headed by two great tour guides. They were extremely helpful and friendly and took the time to explain details in English.You will get a great idea of the spots to hit in the city and some good exercise. The city is mostly flat so its really easy to tour around. You will be cycling from 9:30 to 3:30 (plus or minus), so you will be ready for a nap before dinner.Akira also empressed us with his guitar stylings at the end. Really wonderful musician. Thanks guys for wonderful memories!

Excellent way to see Tokyo close up. Soshi was very knowledgeable of Tokyo and it's culture. He is very funny and easy to understand. The picnic lunch and ferry ride just added to the uniqueness of the tour. Will definitely do another one, if I am ever in Tokyo again. Debbie from Texas

A fun and unique way to experience a fascinating city. We had a fantastic time on our Tokyo Bay tour; it was absolutely the highlight of our visit. Our tour guide, Soshi, especially, should be complimented. The tour was both fun and informational. It was fast enough that we were able to cover a large area, but with enough stops to allow us to enjoy the fascinating Tokyo scenery. The bike route was easy enough to accomplish, even for us occasional bikers, and gave a cool look at the tempo of everyday life in Tokyo, something very few tours are able to do. Soshi was extremely good about answering any questions we had – and we had a lot!-- and tended to our small group's needs. He even brought us out of the scheduled tour program to check out the Imperial Palace at our request! We highly recommend this trip to anyone who is looking for a fun and unique way to experience the city. Definitely would book a trip again the next time we are in town!
Great way to see the city. Traveled with my 10yo son and had a great bike tour of the city. I would highly recommend it. Covered most of the city. A must if you have time.

A must if you are in Tokyo. This is a great way to see the bay area of Tokyo. Our guides were extremely patient and helpful and took us to a wide variety of sights throughout the area. We saw the mix of modern and traditional throughout the city and learned about traditions, etiquette and culture that we would have never known if we were on our own.The tour took about 6 hours and there are hills and times when you have to weave around pedestrians on the sidewalk. The guides made sure that everyone stays together and that no one is left behind. You stop for lunch midway and then have coffee at the end. It is a great time to talk to the guides and learn more about the city and the culture. Our guides seemed to really enjoy the opportunity to chat with us and learn more about us too.

Best cycling tour in Tokyo!. I have done many cycling tours with different operators in Tokyo, Soshi is the best! The route he took me on the 6hrs cycling tour was beautiful and spectacular! We cycled the Old Tokyo area during Autumn! Highly recommend!

Fantastic Private Tokyo Tour. We were a group of two couples for the private day tour of Japan. The company was very accommodating in personalizing the tour for our specific interests, and went above and beyond by assisting with other arrangements outside the tour. Our guide, Kazu, was so friendly and helpful and knowledgeable. He really went out of his way to ensure that we had a great experience (not only on the tour, but for all of our time in Japan), and introduced us to some shops and restaurants we probably wouldn't have found on our own. Highly recommended for someone who wants their sightseeing with a bit of context and explanation.

Sunamachi Shopping Street Food Tour. This tour was even better than expected. It focused on a street with traditional food stalls that we would have never found on our own. Our tour guide, Hiroko, was wonderful and provided great details, friendly service and tailored info based on our questions. It gave us an intimate look at what shopping and eating looks like from a Tokyo perspective. Some info: very easy walking, good for food newbies and experts alike, small group (limited to 8), and everything covered in cost.

Fantastic day!!. We booked a custom private all day food tour where we combined the Tsukiji Fish Market tour along with the Sunamachi Ginza Street Food tour! OMG! It was the highlight of our trip to Japan. Tae was a fantastic guide and helped us experience so many wonderful culinary delights as well as really giving a "taste" of how the locals live! I cannot recommend this company highly enough. Worth every yen and more! We covered much of the city via subway and local bus and even fit some fun shopping in! Great great day!

Amazing Tsukiji Fish market Food Tour + Asakusa with Noriko. We had a great pleasure to do a small group half day Tsukiji Fish market Food tour + Asakusa with Noriko. She was very knowledgeable, kind and was navigating us through the maze of Tsukiji Fish market with grace. She even took us to a parking roof top so we can get a great view on the market and surrounding area (she did the same in Asakusa, before leading us to Sensoji temple). We had such an amazing time tasting all the Japanese delicacies and there are plenty! From Japanese omelette, sashimi, fresh oysters, seaweed, dried bonito, sweets, sushi... Oishii!

Delicious food with an excellent guide!. I did the Tsukiji market tour with Yuki.There were initially 2 other people in the group, but due to unforeseen circumstances they could not make it and I was very lucky to have a one on one your with Yuki! Yuki speaks excellent english and is very friendly and informative. I did not have breakfast that morning and was very glad I didn't - I was extremely full by the end. You have several snacks at different places (the oyster was absolutely amazing) and then you end at a stand up sushi bar - which was just delicious! When in the inside market, Yuki was able to guide me to places where I could take photos which was extremely helpful. It was a terrific experience to be shown around the market by a Tokyo local who could fill me in on what was going on around me.I would highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to visit the tsukiji fish market. I would not have got as much out of visiting the market if I had gone alone. Thank you Yuki for your terrific tour!

Joseph steinbok. We had five days of private tours and transfers with Japan wonder travelThe entire experience exceeded our expectations.The guides were excellent, all the arrangements were professionally done and we saw and enjoyed places we would never had seen on our own.Having the guides select the restaurants and join us for lunch was a great idea.We ate in places we never had gone to and the guides helped us order the specialties while choosing what suited our taste.We loved Japan thanks to all of the people at Japan wonder travel.

Unique and fantastic trip of Tsukiji Market. Our guides were really great. They led us to interesting spots in both the Outer and Inner market. They helped guide us with information and answer any questions that we had. They also sent us pictures at the end!

Best way to see Tokyo like a local!. Nori (our guide) and the tour were amazing! We loved sampling flavors from the fish market, and Nori showed us many things we would have walked right by on our own. He was always happy to answer all of our questions regarding the market and Japan in general & made sure we got the most out of everything. The sushi making experience was also really fun with great people helping us. They even accommodated for my husband's fish allergy on the spot (I should have notified them ahead of time) by having him make/eat vegetarian sashimi. Overall a great and highly recommended experience as part of your trip to Tokyo.

Tsukiji Market Tour. Our tour of Tsukiji market with Kazu was fantastic - we highly recommend it to anyone that considers themselves a foodie and/or is planning to visit Tsukiji Market. During the first part of the tour, Kazu took us around the outer market, where we tried anything and everything that we wished. As a local, Kazu was able to guide us to the best items within the market while also providing background and history to the location. At around 10am, Kazu took us inside the inner market and showed us around the hundreds of stalls, which are filled with highly impressive seafood. After about an hour there, we were taken to the nearby vegetable market, which was surprising as we had no idea it existed within Tsukiji. After this, we had an enjoyable and delicious sushi lunch with Kazu and the rest of the group. All throughout the the tour, Kazu was extremely eager and friendly to do whatever we as visitors to his city desired. He even prepared fresh wasabi for us and took many pictures, which were emailed to us following the tour. Thank you for a great time!

Tasty Cultural Experience For Food Enthusiasts. The Tsukiji Fish Market Tour was very good with our guide Michiko providing our group with very useful information, taking us to various interesting areas of the market during the 3 hour and allowing us to sample all the food items described on the schedule. It was definitely a great way to spend time there with a knowledgeable guide without wasting too much time. I also enjoyed going on the the Nighttime Local Food and Drink Tour in Asakusa with Yu. It was a great way to be part of the local culture going to izakaya's and sitting with local people eating various local foods and sampling a good selection of beer and sake. Definitely a great way to experience local nightlife and not just a average tourist attraction.
Enjoyed it!. Was hesitant on doing this tour at first but glad we did it. Very organized and knowledgeable staff.

From newbie to local in 3000 steps. You are going to walk a lot.This tour takes you through Tsukiji market in a way that as a tourist it would have been impossible for us.In a place with so many interesting foods, it would be very easy to get lost. The guides make sure you get to know most of the local habits and most unique foods.It includes eating and tasting some of them. The guides were very attentive and very knowledgeable of the little shops.They were also very accommodating, considering that my wife was 15 months pregnant, the went above and beyond to replace the tastings with foods suitable to her.Highly recommended.

Tsukiji Fish Market + Sushi experience. It was great to have someone guide and show us the fish market and the sushi experience was fantastic. So much food! I recommend this trip if you don't have much time to explore these by yourself.

If you're a "foodie," you're in heaven!. This tour and our guide, Kato Kazu, was amazing and informative. If you are a foodie you will be in heaven. We went to the fish market area in the morning and started with seeing an assembly line making omelets for a number of small stalls. Then we progressed to seeing and tasting a whole array of foods - sea urchins, squid, eel, various mushrooms, shark, tuna slicing, oysters, clams, king crab, candied fruit, etc. before we finally went into the inner sanctum of the fish market. This is allowed only after 10 am when the actual bidding and purchasing of fish has finished. The amount of tuna alone was staggering to comprehend. Outside this area I noticed a building about 9 stories high and asked what that was and was told that was the refrigeration building! Purchasers store their fish in there before distributing it. Then we proceeded to the outer ring of the market where the fruits and vegetables are sold. It was incredible to see such a large variety of produce offered. Then we went for lunch and more touring before finishing at a "sweets" place with dessert and tea. Well worth the time and money, especially with our guide, Kato Kazu.The tour is long on walking and one has to be observant when all the little trucks and things are whizzing about in the fish market....time is money......

Tsukiji fish market tour. Although you can visit the market on your own I strongly recommend you choose this tour instead. The crowds can be overwhelming and having someone lead you to the best places to eat is really helpful. Our tour also included the temple in Asakusa. The tour is a really good value. Lots of food. Naoko was a gracious and delightful guide.

Wonderful Tour!. This tour is definitely suited to travellers like myself who don't want to go through too much trouble with the planning and would rather concentrate on the eating!Yuriko-San was very helpful and thoughtful throughout the tour and was very clear on the explanations that she gave. Definitely recommended for all.

Amazing tour!. Amazing place and very well informed and english spoken tour guide which led us around Tsukiji market. Got to try various local street food and ended the tour with an amazing sushi lunch!

Local Delicatessen Street "Sunamachi". A very big thank you to our wonderful guide, Yoshika, for introducing us to the many food and drink delights in a part of Tokyo we would never have visited on our own. There was only one other couple on our tour. We took 4 food and drink tours with different companies during our time in Tokyo and this tour stood out as one of the best! The local people we met on the tour were so welcoming and generous with their time. The food was delicious, the Tempura especially was a stand out and the best we had during our 5 weeks in Japan. We didn't see any other tourists while on this tour - it is very special to get an insight into the lives of local people going about their working day and the local shoppers who buy from them. Yoshika took photos while we were on the tour, with our permission and kindly emailed them to us. Would highly recommend this tour!

Tsukiji Fish Market and Outer Markets. This was a great way to experience the outer markets and the fish market. We were able to try many different foods and ask many questions as we explored the outer markets. The group size was small. In fact they had several people but split them up into small groups so that it was more personable and manageable. Yuko was very helpful and patient when we wanted to look at something or take photos. We also did the Asakusa Tour. As a bonus the guide even sent us photos from the tour.

Must Do!. Wife and I did the Tsukiji market tour with Kumi, which was a fantastic guide. The group ended up being just us so it was like a personal tour. Tsukiji market was incredible. Kumi was very informative and took us thru the outer and inner parts of the market while sampling food along the way. It was such a great experience and well worth the money.

So worth it!. It was an amazing experience to walk through and taste the Tsukiji market with Sumiko. There were only 3 people total in my tour and we all had a chance to taste so many things over the 4 hours! You could walk through the market yourself, but I found that I tried many more things with the help of a professional guide. Sumiko explained so much about Japanese culture along the way, taught us key words and phrases, and took many photos for us. She even helped a couple of us buy knives and pointed out some rain boots for me since it poured throughout our tour! The tour ended with a wonderful sushi lunch inside a restaurant where you stand at a counter. I was so full afterwards!I was traveling through Japan with a vegetarian so did this tour on my own. It was really easy to find the group and everything started right on time! I highly recommend this for any adventurous foodie (and if you're not too adventurous, they will find easy substitutes for you). You won't regret it!

A Food Tour You Don't Want To Miss . My wife and I took the Sunamachi Local Shopping Street tour with Yoko on September 27, 2016. It is one of the many many streets in Tokyo that have souvenir shops, food shops, clothing stores, etc., etc., etc. The big, and I mean really big, difference is that this is where the "commoners" go to shop. The prices are significantly lower than the more well known tourist shops and the quality is higher. Our guide, Yoko, was better than excellent. She filled us in on the shop's history, explained the various differences in the available selections, introduced us to the proprietor, and made the entire adventure enjoyable and educational. The tempura and yakatori were especially delicious; much better than what we had previously at a high end (expensive) Japanese dinner in the "better" part of town. Besides providing insight into the area, Yoko explained the reasons behind Japanese ways of life. Such as why the Japanese walk on the left; because a Shogun made it the law. The sword of the Samurai was placed on the left hip and extended out to the left, when walking on the left the swords of oncoming Samurai would not hit. All in all this tour was very enjoyable and worth the price. Arigato gozaimas.

Lovely tour, well worth the time and money.. Be adventurous and try all the different types of things offered. Our guide stopped at many, many venders, so go hungry (or bring crackers if you're squeamish!)

Excellent experience with Kumi. My friends and I had the pleasure of having this experience with the most wonderful tour guide Kumi. She was very nice & pleasant! She even waited for us as we were late to arrive since we got a little lost in the morning. She took us through the Tsukiji Fish market in and out & tried delicious foods. I highly recommend her to anyone interested in doing this tour. Thank you again!!

Amazing tour discovering Tokyo street food!. The Sunamachi food tour was perfect for street food lovers such as ourselves. Together with our guide Nori we went to a tiny backstreet that we would have never found otherwise, and spent close to 4 hours tasting delicious food, with no tourists in sight! A couple of the scheduled shops were closed because of rain, but Nori was great at finding some alternatives - everything considered, an amazing day out!

Great tsukiji food tour with my boyfriend . I've been to Japan 3 times prior to this and been to tsukiji myself 2 years ago and although i remember having a lovely time and having a great lunch, I knew there were a lot more to the fish market that I wouldn't know about since I didn't go with an expert. Glad we chose to go with Japan Wonder Travel because they were professional, met us on time, and provided us an in depth and informative 3-4 hour morning around the inner and outer market of tsukiji. We got to sample green tea, plums and pickles and dried fruits, had 2 giant amazing raw oysters, we paid additionally to try the fresh King crab at the oyster place (very fresh!), watched someone make yummy tamago and enjoyed 2 skewers, and had a lovely sushi lunch at a standing sushi bar which we opted to pay additional for beer and more sushi pieces (try the alphonsino!) Yuko was kind and lovely to be around. She was easy to talk to and also brought us to have two cups of cold sake in which we were able to take home two cedar wood sake cups as souvenirs. We bought dried fruit, fresh green tea and plum on the trip with Yuko. Very filling morning since we sampled so much food we had to start declining to try food because we were getting too full. Yuko was a great photographer too and took many pictures for us. This tour is highly recommended and I would go again and try their different tour options next time!

Oishii! Fantastic Tour!. My husband and I did the morning Tsujiki market food tour. They break you up into smaller groups which is great. So our group only had 4 people. Our guide Noriko was fantastic. She was so knowledgeable about the market and the different foods we tried. Everything we ate was fresh and delicious. The sushi lunch at the end was amazing. We heard the market will be relocated later this year so I'm so glad that we got to do this! We fell in love with Tokyo and I think this food tour played a huge part in this :) Thanks Noriko!

Great Night Tour of Asakusa. We did the Asakusa street food and local drink with Yu and we thoroughly enjoyed our evening. He was very passionate and interesting. He showed us places that we would never have discovered on our own and we were able to try lots of local food and drinks. The highlights for us were definitely the Hoppy drink and the Tokyo "pancake"! As we lived nearby we were able to come back and sample some more of these on our own like locals! (Well almost!). I would definitely recommend this trip to anyone that wants to discover more about the neighbourhood of where Japanese people go out. Good value for money.

Extremely memorable and value for money. My 13 year old daughter and I went on this trip to Tokyo that I had been promising her since she was FIVE! ... she LOVES sushi. I didn't know what to expect when I booked it but I can emphatically say that it surpassed all our expectations. Our guide, Kazu, was so thoughtful and interesting, first of all taking us round the market into all the shops where we could try the tasters, then round the fish market was fascinating. The sushi class was the highpoint. The website description does not do it justice. It is in a top class restaurant in a private dining room, hosted by a very accomplished and, no doubt local celebrity chef. It was great fun and educational and I would recommend it to anyone with even a vague interest in Japanese food as it was extremely memorable and value for money.
Wonderful tour..... Wonderful tour and excellent guide! Fantastic experience, the guide was very insightful and friendly ...

Craft Beer, Sake, amazing food and great people!. We met at 5 in Asakusa. The directions provided were excellent, and despite us running late, communication was great and we were put at ease that it wasn't a problem! Our first stop on a hot and humid August day was for beer - which was just what was needed. We quickly got chatting with our enthusiastic guides and felt the pace was just right for people who had already been on their feet all day. We got to try Sake (lovely!) and have the brewing process explained in depth before trying lots of lovely local food & beer. The guides are more than just food guides, they ensure they point out and discuss any nearby landmarks or tourist spots and provide you with the opportunity to have 3 hours asking questions of locals. We ate food we definitely wouldn't have otherwise even seen, never mind tried! We liked the Tokyo tour so much, we booked another in Kyoto. Really recommend Yu and his team.
Great tour, despite the heat!. Hiroko was a great guide and the tour was interesting and lots of fun. Totally worth it even though it was a hot and humid August morning!

Great time touring Tsukiji Market. We went on the Foodrinks Tour of Tsukiji Market last week with Tae and had the most fantastic time. She expertly guided us through the outer section of the market, picking out so many tasty things for us to try and giving explanations of things we didn't know. Then she took us through the inside of the market, during the hour that it is open to the public, to see the fresh-caught fish being prepared for the day, as well as the abundant and beautiful vegetables and fruits.We learned a ton about the market itself and about the foods that are available around the area. We tried a lot of different things - from the beautifully prepared tamagoyaki (omelet) to the last bite of fresh-as-you-can-get sushi we had at the end. It was a perfect tour for adventurous eaters who want to experience and taste and be excited by all the products. I can't give enough praise for Tae. She was so nice and friendly, and seemed genuinely happy to have us on the tour, which made us feel so welcomed. Be prepared for lots of walking and lots of eating! I would highly recommend this tour!

Good Guide for Fish Market but Beware Not an Inner Market (Before Public Hours) Tour. Yuriko was our guide for our family of 5. Similar to what others have said, this is a fine tour for walking the outer market and seeing the inner market AFTER 10 am both things you can do without a guide. Basically that means you get in with the public after the real party is over. You wont see the whole pre-cut tuna in all their glory moving throughout the inner market after auction, nor will you experience the fanatical pace of activity and buzz you see before 9 am. This was a huge disappointment and the reason we bought this tour. To me, its simply misleading and not worth the ridiculous price of $140 pp. The sushi making was fun and worth the extra price, and our guide Yuriko was terrific. None of this is a reflection on her. The issue is more expectations - don't think you are getting in early or seeing the real buzz of the inner market w this tour. You are just like everyone else in the public, less $700 you paid (for 5) !!

One of the best tours I have ever had!!!. We has one day to visit Tokyo and chose Japan Wonder Travel and they did not disappoint. Noriko was our guide and was very polite, respectful and professional. Before the tour she was great in communicating with us regarding schedule and places to see and was able to fit in everything within reason. She was on-time to our scheduled departure from our hotel. We had 2 young boys with us and she was great in connecting with them too. We had lots of questions about Tokyo and Japan and she was very good at answering them. The price was good for the tour and a very good value. What was unique was this tour was all on foot and not in a van, so we got to see Tokyo on public transportation, which was very easy to use. We would like to return to Tokyo again someday and I will definitely look to hire Noriko and Japan Wonder Travel.

Fantastic experience! . We've done food tours in major cities all over the world, and this one didn't disappoint. We did two tours, the Tsukiji market tour and the Sunamachi food tour. Both were fantastic. Michiko was our guide both times, and she was a lovely host. Sunamachi is a quaint and fascinating street filled with lovely artisanal speciality shops- we visited a family run tempura store where the tempura has been made by hand by Grandma for the last 40 years, and mom and daughter work in the store too! It was wonderful to see a truly authentic local shopping street. Tsukiji was a delight as well- Michiko wove us in and out of the maze of the inner market with deft expertise in a way we could never have managed on our own. Arigato for a fantastic experience!
Food walking and sightseeing tour of fish market. We had an amazing experience and the main component was the access and professionalism provided by our tour guide; Kazu Kato.

Amazing tour of the fish market!. It was my first morning in Tokyo and I couldn't have spent in any better. My tour guide, Sachimi, made my tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market very enjoyable! She was knowledgeable and made the experience really unique and fun. I would happily take another tour the next time I am in Tokyo! Thanks Sachimi for a great morning at the market.

Just go and do it . I think what holds people back is price. It's honestly worth it. You have a wonderful licensed guide (Hiroko is the best ^^), who is knowledgeable and will do their best to make sure you have a great time. If you go by yourself you'll only see the outer market and not get to experience the inner market, where you get to meet the local vendors, and avoid the short tempered ones, where your awesome guide comes in handy ;)Also the food you eat along the way is super delicious. Be careful of the free wasabi flavoured seaweed they hand out for you to try. Thanks Hiroko for making Tsukiji Market a highlight of our trip :D We had an awesome time with you.

Tsukiji Fish Market and Sushi Making. Having gone on several food-related tours in various cities, this was, by far, one of the best. The tour guide, Ms. Kumagai,was extremely personable and informative as she showed us both the in- and out-door market at Tsukiji. The sushi making portion of the tour was great fun for the parents and our teenage daughter. Without hesitation, I would highly recommend this tour. This will clearly be one of the highlights of our trip to Japan.

I can't imagine not doing the Fish Market Tour. We were on the fence on whether to do this tour or not. Was it worth the price, would it really be better than just doing some self exploring instead. I have to say it was WORTH IT!! There was no way we would have seen as much of the fish market on our own. It was great, I'd absolutely do it again.Yoko was a great tour guide!!

The Best Anywhere. They went far beyond expectations. They were friendly, knowledgeable, patient, and accommodating. Yu and Tae were so good they ensured we had a marvelous time in Japan. Highly recommended without any question. Just a delight to deal with them and be with them!

Fish Market Tour. We had a terrific tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market with Noriko. She was a terrific guide, very nice and informative and very thoughtful. She embodied the Japanese values of respect and kindness. The tour was also great because there were only six people on it so it was easy to walk together and we could all hear and be close to Noriko. We saw many other big groups walking around which seemed much more unwieldy. She stopped at all sorts of delicious stalls outside the market and ended our tour at a fun and good sushi restaurant. It was a highlight of our stay in Tokyo.

Tokyo FooDrink Tour - Tsukiji Market and Asakusa. The fishmarket tour was just great! Lots to see and lots to taste :) I'm very happy I took the tour instead of going by myself. Much more informative and get to see parts I otherwise would not have seen. The tour finale was in a standing sushi restaurant where two chefs make sushi by order just in front of you. Again a cool experience and delicious food.I also chose the Asakusa extra. We had local deserts as I was interested in the traditional Japanese deserts. We then walked around the landmarks and streets of Asakusa with commentary on history, culture and everyday life.

[MUST!] The best way to get around the Tsukiji Market!!. The tour was one of the best experiences we had during our trip. You need this if you plan on going to the Tsukiji Market, there is no other way to get around (unless you are a local). Tae, the tour guide, was extremely nice as she took the time to explain what was going on at every part of the tour, she spoke very fluent English, she introduced us to very nice people and she even told us some interesting stories about the history of Tokyo. Don't miss this opportunity.

Yuriko-San made our private tour so enjoyable. First of all, we considered this tour based on Tripadvisor ratings and we were not disappointed. The folks at Japan Wonder Travel were so responsive to my questions, and tailored a one day private tour of Tsukiji market, Asakusa and Sunamachi street. They assigned Yuriko to us and she was excellent! She was punctual, organized and very informative. My teenage son enjoyed her commentary of Japanese life. Highlight of the day was the fish market, which Yuriko helped us navigate through the market. She knows most of the traders there and knew where to bring us around. We loved Asakusa but my hubby didn't really enjoy the Sunamachi snack street, so we asked for Yuriko to bring us to Shibuya instead. She went out of her way to help book our restaurant for dinner. What a great experience!

Tokyo FooDrink Tour - Tsukiji Market and Asakusa. The tour was fantastic! My guide Yeonmi was very knowledgable and great company. I got much more information about the Tsukiji Market and Asakusa than I would I had if I visited these places on my own. This tour was one of the highlights of my trip to Japan. Great experience! I definitely recommend it!

Tsukiji Market . I really enjoyed going through this market. You can definitely see the intensity of market as you walk around and you witness all the activities. Hiro, or guide, did a good job describing what was happening within the two markets.

Wonderful tour with Noriko. My husband and I booked this tour upon recommendation of our friends. We loved it! Noriko is fabulous and such a wonderful guide! In our small group we were able to get a great feel of the Fish Market and try things we would never have been able to on our own. Noriko asked if we could take pictures at specific vendors in the market and we got to see and understand so much about sushi and fish in Japan.We recommend this tour to anyone visiting Tokyo!!!

Fantastic Tour!. Our tour guide was Nori and including us there were 5 people and it was a good size. We managed to go into the inner markets and saw people there at work and the fresh fish and produce that goes through the market. Nori also introduced us to food and snacks that were delicious! The wasabi peanuts and fishcake were my favourite!After 4 hours it felt like we really had a good understanding and tour of the markets. It was a really good and useful tour! Highly recommended!

Delicious Tour of Tsukiji Market. I went on the Tsukiji Food Drink Tour, and had a great time. I originally thought that the price was expensive, but this includes all the tasty food you will eat during the tour and a sushi lunch. With that in mind, the tour price is very reasonable! I also got to see many things within the market, and I am sure that I would have gotten lost if I had gone on my own. Yeonmi is a wonderful, friendly guide and I would recommend her to anyone!

Wonderful way to explore the fish markets - and Make sushi with a master!. Just finished a wonderful morning with Ichi as the guide around the markets and onto the sushi lesson. This is a great way to see parts of the market you wont get access to otherwise and Ichi had a great knowledge about the products that were new to our group, and also kept us entertained! It was an incredibly wet day but to be honest didn't matter! The fish markets are simply outstanding in size and variety and should be on your agenda with a Tokyo visit. After that we went for a Sushi Culture class with a sushi mater and had a couple of hours learning about the basics of making sushi before having a go and then eating the products of our labour! A really wonderful experience for anyone interested in the intricacies of this cuisine.Thanks again Ichi!

Fantastic tour!. I took two tours with this company while I was in Tokyo, the night time tour in Asakusa as well as the tour of Tsukiji market- both of which I would highly recommend. The Asakusa tour allows you the opportunity to eat and drink like a local which was very fun and the market tour guides you through a maze that I would never have been able to navigate on my own (I had thought I had seen most of the market before the tour - I was wrong!). The food is interesting and the guides are willing to substitute food for allergies so just let them know!

Wonderful personal tour!. We did private food tours both in Kyoto and Tokyo. Our guide, Yu conducted wonderful tours acquainting us with the area and the food of Japan. Yu also took many pictures creating wonderful memories of our time with him. My husband and I highly recommend anyone visiting Tokyo or Kyoto to avail themselves of these wonderful tours done by this tour company.

Wonderful tour!. This tour was easily our favorite tour of the trip! We had Ichi as our guide and he was extremely knowledgable and great to talk to. We lucked out and ended up just having us and Ichi on the tour. We started our tour trying different kinds of Asahi beer. Then we walked over to a small little sake/liquor shop that was run by one of the sake masters of Japan. While there we ended up running into the sake master (he usually isn't there due to his scheduling) and got to taste some delicious sake. We ended up purchasing a bottle that the sake master had brewed himself. From there, Ichi gave us a guided tour of the Senso-ji temple area. Although we had gone to see the temple the day before, this tour was nice cause Ichi was willing to take all the photos of me and my husband that we didn't get the day before.
