Then he took us to get food at one of his favorite places. Ichi did all the ordering for us after learning the kind of things we were willing to try. I can't remember everything that we had but I do remember eating some beef intestine soup, some fried tofu, chicken skewers and some fried ham. From there we ended up going to a little place for some savory pancakes (okonomiyaki). There are different kinds from different regions and they are made up of what you want to put in them (usually cabbage, onion, egg, seaweed, some kind of meat etc). Ichi walked us back to our subway line and we ended up walking by some Sumo wrestlers who were out eating for the night. We were very pleased with the experience provided by Ichi and Japan Wonder travel and would suggest the tour to everyone!

Tsukiji wow. If you are going to Tokyo you absolutely must do the Tokyo FooDrink tour. It was a true highlight of our 3 weeks in Japan. The tour guide was very friendly and was able to answer all of our questions. The food we sampled on the way round the markets was great. The things we saw were amazing. It is one of the busiest markets I have ever been to with lots of fabulous things to see. You must do this tour.

Tsukiji fish market tour. We went on an excellent tour of the Tsukiji market, Yoko was a great tour guide, she was very friendly and was very knowledgeable in all aspects of the markets and its surroundings! Would recommend!

trip to Tsukiji fish market. Really a great way to see the market. Small group and an excellent guide made it a great experience. The menu was great (snacks) but the SUSHI was SUPERB! We covered a lot of ground and saw a working market, great experience. Communication was first class and our guide spoke excellent english. Thank You.

Nori was an excellent guide for Tsukiji Market. I was tossing up whether to do a tour or just explore the fish market by myself. I am so glad I chose to do the tour - I would not have been able to navigate my way through this vast market - or I would have spent hours trying to work out which way to go. Nori was a great guide, good English, good knowledge of the workings of the market, and a pleasant guy. Good value!

Interesting and wonderfully intense visit. Noriko was very sweet, and quick to answer any questions we may have had.The trip to the fish market was so intense, in the best possible way. Weaning through all the vendors and witnessing all the craziness that happens there on a daily basis is something I will never forget.

A unique and Exciting Tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market!. I booked the tour through Japan Wonder and our guide was Yeonmi. The tour was so much fun but at the same time very informative. Tsukiji market is probably the busiest place I have ever seen next to Shinjuku train station. It was crazy busy when we were touring. I was thankful that we booked a tour guide or else we would have been so overwhelmed and not to mention the delivery tri-cars don't yield to pedestrian/shoppers. Our group was small (4 people) and we were together with a very nice Indonesian couple.Yeonmi was professional and very funny. She made the tour more exciting. It was our first time eating at this amazing standing sushi bar. I was never a sushi fan but enjoyed every last piece of the meal. My only regret was not shopping more during the tour because those shops that we visited were selling delicious delicacies. Again, my big thanks to Yeonmi and to the staff of Japan Wonder Travel.

Tsukiji Fish Market Tour. The Tsukiji Fish Market was amazing to see. Our guide, Nori, spoke excellent English. He did a great job leading our way through the market and telling us interesting facts. He spoke excellent English and was able to answer all of our questions. The small group size made it easy to navigate and ensured everyone could hear and spend time seeing the things they wanted to see. Also, the food sample were amazing.

Wonderful experience. Michiko Muranaka was our guide. She is fluent in English and was very patient and accommodating to our requests and adjustments to our private tour. We first explored the Tsukiji market, then the Asakusa area with the Tourist Center, the Sensoji Temple and the Shrine. After which we were treated to a traditional Japanese bento lunch with Shamisen musicians entertaining the lunch crowd. Then we headed over to Akihabara to end our tour. It gave my kids (2 teens and a preteen) a quick taste of Tokyo - the old and new.

Ichi-san did a great job.. Our tour guide, Ichi-san, gave a great tour of the fish and outer markets. The sushi-making class was fun and tasty, too. Ichi was knowledgeable and enthusiastic, and went well beyond the requirements by also providing us insights to the Buddhist and Shinto traditions, and making us feel very welcome in Tokyo. Outstanding.

Tsukiji fish market tour. Our guide, Ichi, navigated us through the inner and outer market expertly. The small group size made it easy to ask questions and learn more from the guide.Come prepared to eat great sushi at the end after seeing where the fish probably passed through.

Amazing market tour with Yuriko!. I loved this tour and I am not so much one for a tour. It was educational and so fun. Great tour guide who was sweet and knowledgable. Yuriko really helped navigate the entire market complex on a busy Saturday!! The food was so tasty and so much to taste. The tour was long and thorough, a must for any foodie! I know anyone can go to the market but you would be missing so much if you went solo, Yuriko really managed so much of the experience!!!! Tip: You want really good walking shoes. You are walking at times through a smelly fish market and there is a lot of walking.

Awesome guide for the Tsukiji Fish Market!. We booked a private tour as our group had 6 members—my parents, my husband and I, and my sisters. Our guides were Naoko and Yu and they were excellent! Naoko was very informative especially about different types of food. You can tell she loves to cook. Yu was funny and energetic. Both guides had a great rapport with the sellers in the market. The food we sampled was fresh and delicious.Our tour was on a special, market-wide sale day where certain products were up to 50% off. There were SO many people shopping in the outer market. It was very difficult to get around. I've lived in Japan for three years and this was one of the most crowded places I've been. Even so, Naoko did a good job of keeping our tour group together. And we were still able to sample all of the products we were promised. If possible, I would recommend taking the tour on a weekday to avoid these crowds.The last stop on the tour was a lovely, quiet, well-air conditioned sushi restaurant. This was the perfect ending to the tour as we could relax and enjoy our sushi lunch.Thank you Naoko and Yu for an excellent time!

An Absolute Must. We booked our Tsukiji fish market tour after looking at the reviews on tripadvisor and what an experience. The current site of the market is scheduled to close later this year and move to new premises - We arrived at our meeting point and were greeted and introduced to our guide Yuko. We and another couple were escorted around the inner and outer market with Yuko advising us on the history of the market as well as the customs associated with visiting local shrines and temples - this was absolutely fascinating - as we wandered around we were able to sample local japanese foods, and the sushi at the end was just divine. The tour gave you an appreciation of the workings of the market and all the amazing produce which would not have been possible had we tried to navigate around ourselves.We had a great experience and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to visit the market.

Tsukiji Fish Market Food Tour. Naoko was a wonderful tour guide, and this was such a helpful tour, as I really don't know what my husband and I would have done trying to navigate the market by ourselves. Naoko knew the market's etiquette and introduced us to some lovely vendors that she have befriended as well as some fun nooks and crannies. All the snacks were great, Naoko gave us some great recommendations for purchasing green tea, and the tour culminated with "the best sushi I ever had" (everyone seems to say that when they eat sushi near Tsukiji, but it's oh-so-true). The beauty was that the sushi spot we went to was full of locals and we didn't have to wait in line for 3 hrs at 3am a la Sushi Dai or Daiwa. I highly recommend this tour.

Fantastic tour of a fascinating market. We thoroughly enjoyed every part of our tour around Tsujiki Fish Market with Japan Wonder Travel. Our guide, Yuko, was absolutely lovely and very knowledgeable. She took the time not only to tell us all about the history of Tsujiki and about the market today, but also taught us some Japanese phrases and told us all about Japanese culture, temples, shrines etc. She was brilliant! The tour of the market itself was fascinating and gave us a real insight that we wouldn't have had if we'd just wandered around on our own. The quantity and quality of the sushi we ate afterwards was also very impressive. A fantastic morning well spent!

Loved it. Our tour of Tsukiji Fish Market was one of the best things we did on our 2 week trip of Japan. It felt really personal as there were only 3 of us on the tour. Our guide Sayoko was fantastic and her English was EXCELLENT. A few highlights from the trip were the GIANT oysters, the sake stop in which we got to keep our cedar wood sake cups and the sushi meal at the end was out of this world.The fish market can be an intimidating place (it's huge and very fast paced) and I would fully recommend one of these tours for anyone who wants to learn more about the market and eat taste some amazing food.

Tokyo fish market tour. great tour, very informativeour host Yuki Deleon was excellent, she knew a lot about the market and took us to a couple of local establishments that we wouldn't have gotten to.
Fabulous Tour. Loved every stop of our tour. The food was great and the tour guide was even better. She really went the extra mile. I would repeat this tour just as soon as I'm in Tokyo.

Awesome tour. This was the highlight of our trip to Tokyo. Yuriko was extremely sweet, helpful, and knowledgeable. We got way more out of our visit to the fish market than we would have if we had just gone by ourselves. Would highly recommend this tour!!

Fantastic tour and great tour guide. A great way to see the outer and inner fish market. Whilst you could probably do the outer on your own the inner requires expert knowledge of where to go, how to navigate, which market operators are 'friendly' etc. Our guide Noriko was perfect - excellent English and knowledge of the markets and enables us to cover off a huge amount of the market in a short time (amazing considering we had a 2 year old in our group). Would highly recommend!

Fantastic and enjoyable with enthusiastic and knowledgable guides. What we found appealing was the fact that this tour covers the Meiji Shrine and Takeshita St. Our favourite part was probably walking through Takeshita St and seeing so many eateries and popular shops while trying to navigate through a sea of people (we went during Golden Week, so everywhere will generally be more crowded due to this national holiday). Visiting Meiji Shrine was great too, very peaceful and zen. It doesn't feel like you are actually in a city full of hustle and bustle.Our host, Yu, was excellent. He was enthusiastic and answered all our questions. He was very friendly and easy to talk to. In addition, at this time we also had a lolita, Ai, guide us along the tour and gave us an insight into the world of lolitas, the lifestyle and fashion.The care they showed us was fantastic. At one point, on the way to Shibuya (walking to the train station) A few of the people in our group couldn't go on anymore due to walking all day the previous day and today and had blisters etc. So a taxi was organised to take to Shibuya instead of us having to take the train. Very convenient!Afterwards they brought us to a kawaii cafe that was Alice In Wonderland themed and we enjoyed some sweets. Visiting Harajuku and Shibuya and wonderful experiences that a visit to Japan would not be complete without. We would like to thank Yu and Ai for their hospitality. We thoroughly enjoyed this one!

Asakusa Food Tour!. We had a fabulous time with our guide Natsu on this food tour. We started at the Asahi brewery and continued on to a sake shop. At each stop Natsu gave us lots of information on Japanese traditions, the area, and the food! Our favorite part was probably visiting a small restaurant to try two different kinds of monjayaki! I would highly recommend this tour company!

The Best Way to Experience the Fish Market!. My parents (in their 60s) and I loved this tour! I wasn't sure if we would really need a tour for exploring Tsukiji Fish Market, but I'm SO glad we opted for one! The Market has tight spaces, people hard at work, and few things labeled- all of which make it difficult for the individual tourist to understand what's going on. We loved having our guide, Yu, explain things to us and help us navigate! We didn't feel like intruding tourists but rather like welcome friends.

Amazing!. My girlfriend and I loved our tour of the fish market (One of the highlights from our trip). If you're lucky enough to get Yoko, she is amazing!! At the end of our tour, she even went out of her way to help us find the perfect chef knife. If you're on the fence about booking the tour, just do it...and thank me later!

Fantastic FooDrink Tour of Tsukiji Fish Market. Highly recommend the Tokyo FooDrink Tour @ Tsukiji Fish Market. Great way to see the market. Our guide Fumito was friendly, knowledgeable and made the massive market accessible and navigable. (He also helped us identify - and sample! - the myriad foods we had never seen before.) Overall a really fun and educational tour -- would do it again.

A MUST in TOKYO. our guides, Miyuki and Fumito, made everything so easy and comfortable for us. I highly recommend this tour to every tourist visiting TOKYO. The guides were very patient with us and made sure that we are having a great time on our tour, especially because we were travelling with a 1 year old baby :) all the food & drinks we tried were very delicious! They also happily took our photos during the tour, a big PLUS for tourists like us! They brought us to places inside Tsukiji that a normal tourist would not be able to go on his/her own :) Thank you MIYUKI AND FUMITO! You made us very happy ;) -Vea, Jonathan and Anielle
Asakusa tour. Really enjoyed the Asakusa tour. The food and drinks were delicious and the tour guides were friendly.

Excellent tours. Since I was visiting Tokyo for a limited time, I wanted to optimize my touring experience. The Tsukiji Fish Market and Asakusa Street Food and Local Drink Tours helped me to accomplish this goal. My guide on both excursions was Ichi and he was excellent. Under his guidance, we explored the inner and outer markets at Tsukiji and sampled many tasty treats. I was the only client with Ichi for the Asakusa Street Food and Local Drink Tour, and he not only made certain I sampled the best beer, sake and food Asakusa had to offer, but he also answered my many questions about religion and customs in Japan. He deferred my questions about sake to the sake master we meet during the tour. All in all, two excellent tours and two memorable experiences!

Food and Drink in Tokyo. Took the food and drink tour, it was just myself and the guide Ichi, we started with beer tasting and then Sake and finished with more beer......the guide was excellent, plenty of great information and happy to talk about beer and food, at the Sake tasting it was great to meet the maker of his own brand of Sake, all in all a great tour and a great night.

Fish Market Wonders. Great insightful tour that guided me through the hundreds of shops inside Tsukiji Fish Markets including getting a great view from a nearby elevated position. Very enjoyable experience! :)

Excellent Tour!. My husband and I have been looking forward to visiting Tokyo for many years and we are so glad that we decided to take the Tsukiji + Asakusa tour with the Tokyo FooDrink Tour! Our guide Yuriko was very friendly and professional. She was able to lead us through the market and showed us some behind-the-scenes look of both the inner and outer market. She was also very accommodating, modifying the tour for us when she sensed that we were getting tired from all the walking. It was also great that we took the tour on our first day there, and Yuriko was able to help us understand how to take the train and provide some pointers to how to navigate around the city. For the tour itself, we had an amazing time sampling foods from the market and was able to purchase food/souvenirs along the way. A wonderful experience, will definitely recommend to those traveling to Tokyo for the first time!

Don't miss out on a visit to Tsukiji!. Thank you Ichi and Japan Wonder Travel for a fun memorable morning at Tsukiji. We so enjoyed the sights, sounds and flavors of the fish market with our able and informative guide, Ichi. A visit to Tokyo is not complete without a trip to Tsukiji.

Exploring the Tsukiji fish Market - A must. One can be easy overwhelmed by the vast expanse of the Tsukiji market. There are the wholesale markets (which aren't always very receptive to tourists), the outdoor markets and the fruit and veg markets to explore. Thanks to Ichi and the tour I took I got an insiders view of the world of the Tsukiji market - exploring parts that I would have never found on my own.It is a fascinating place and I cannot do justice to the sights and smells you discover there - I can only encourage that you visit the market when you are in Tokyo and to do so with a tour or guide.Ichi and I spent a terrific 3.5 hours exploring the market and eating on the way. He showed me the fruit stand where 1 mango cost 9000Yen. He guided me through the wholesale area where outsiders are not particularly welcomed. Ichi took me to several merchants with specialties in bonito flakes, sake and green tea - with taste sampling.The highlight was lunch at a sushi bar/lunch place - a few blocks away from the market - fish as fresh as the expensive places within the market but about half the price. The food was sublime. And only locals go there so you had a glimpse of the real Tokyo. I highly recommend this tour. Ichi was informative and very flexible to make sure your interests were part of the itinerary. As a vegetarian, he made sure I had the appropriate food. The only downside was it was pouring rain during the whole time, but Ichi apologised and said he could not control that - if only he could.Highly recommended.

Special Fish Market Experience.. I'm glad I had the opportunity to tour the Tsukiji Fish Market before it moves to a new location in November. Naoko is an exceptional guide. She's very knowledgeable, speaks great English and took us to places regular tours don't usually go. We experienced the hustle and bustle of the market and enjoyed many different types of food as well. Our sushi lunch was delicious and served at a restaurant also not visited by tourist, so the wait was shorter and the atmosphere better. Asakusa Temple is also a must see site. Naoko was able to navigate the very crowded temple grounds and also brought me to a nice café that served a fantastic Japanese dessert. If you're in Japan and want to see the fish market or Asakusa, take the tour and ask for Naoko to guide you!

Fish Market. Tour was great. Yuriko looked after us well. Showed us through the markets and then through the outer market where there was free tastings of some food. It was so good, and knowing where to go, we went back ourselves to taste more of the food the next day.

The Awesome Tsukiji Market. I have always believe that to know a country/city/town/area properly, one needs to hit the market place. And, when in Tokyo, no one should miss the awesome Tsukiji Market. It was such a great 4 hours with Hiro-san & Yu-san, who know the inner and outer markets so well! Yummy yummy food aside, I have learnt so much from Hiro & Yu about the Japanese culture, how to eat the sushi the right way, the proper manners at a Japanese Shrine and etc. Moments like these always make our journey richer and memorable. If you happen to be in Tokyo before Tsukiji Inner Market shifts to its new location in early Nov 2016, wait no more and do this Tsukiji Market Walking Tour.

Another 5-star experience!. Our Tsukiji tour was definitely the highlight of the trip! We were deciding between going on a tour (they are pricy!) vs going through the market by ourselves for free and are so happy we went with the tour. Our guide was Yeonmi and she was super informative and also hilarious!Things I never would have done without Yeonmi:-Asking vendors questions - we even got to sample some mango this way!-Walking in with confidence - we would have never explored the vegetable market by ourselves because it was kind of empty and intimidating-The melon auction - this was fascinating and I would have no idea what was going on if our guide didn't explain it-See the view of the entire market from the top of the parking structureThe list goes on!

Great way to see the Tsukuji market. We took the Tsjukiji market tour and found this a great way to see the market which is massive.. Our tour guide Yuko was very informative and friendly and the little food stops we made as part of the tour were all excellent. There was no pressure to buy anything extra but we also bought some additional delicious king crab and really good quality japanese tea from a couple of the stops we made.

Excellent. Great tour. Great mix of history, culture and the food and drink were all fantastic. My guides were fun people and I felt more like I was with friends than guides. Great way to get the feel of Tokyo.

Remarkable tour!. I first have to say how incredible my guide, Yeonmi, was on the day of our tour. I got dreadfully turned around on the metro, did not yet have my SIM card having just arrived the previous night and consequently arrived 30 minutes late to the tour. I should probably stipulate that I have never arrived late for a tour. Ever. I felt terrible, but Yeonmi handled herself with grace and didn't allow my horrific tardiness to damper the mood of the morning in the slightest (as I've seen other guides do.) She is a true professional and incredibly well versed on Tokyo foods and lifestyle.On the morning in question, I went on the fish market tour and couldn't recommend it more highly. Attempting to visit when not on a tour would be a futile adventure so I was most thankful for Yeonmi's guidance. Note: food is included in the tour, but any additional products you want to try are naturally your own responsibility

totally the best. mr seaweed was the bomb in explaining all the goings on at the markets, he was accommodating and the loveliest guide. happy to stop when we found something of interest. would highly recommenced this company

Highly recommend . Tour guide Yuko was very friendly and did everything she could to make sure we had an excellent experience. The market is enormous and we wouldn't have been able to navigate the market without Yukos help. I highly recommend this tour.

Just book it - it sets you up for the rest of your trip. Hiro was our guide, so friendly and engaging - a delight to spend 5 hours with. This tour set us up for the rest of the trip, we knew were we wanted to explore the follow day and gained a lot of confidence in navigating this amazing city. Retracing the tour steps the following day we went back to the great places that Hiro showed us and snacked our way through the day. I recommend going to the Asakusa- again it's a fast track to discovering the city, there is so much to see so you don't have time to waste exploring it by yourself, also great communication from the tour team via email.
Had some nice beer, sake and delicious food. Great tour guide - was able to accommodate a couple of vegetarians - we appreciated it and had a great time!

Local food at its best!. Local food at its best! So simple, but with every bite you can taste the effort and passion put into the preparation. Many thanks to our friendly and attentive guide, Yu. He has built up a good relationship with the store-owners, it felt like he was bringing us to his home town for a meal. This tour made my day!
Amazing tour. We loved the tour. The guide Yuko was excellent. Awesome food. Definitely recomend it. Perfect way to see this unique market.

Nervous about what to eat or how to eat in Japan? Just book!. If you're looking at the Asakusa Dine Out or the Tsukiji Fish Market don't hesitate. Both are great value and super enjoyable. We did both experiences in a small group of four and five people. Yu is an amazing guide--professional, helpful and fun--and if you are at all uncertain about what to eat, or how to eat in Japan he provides a great introduction to things to try, what to say and good etiquette. It left me feeling much less intimidated about trying new things over the remainder of our holiday, making these experiences a great way to start. Heads up too: accessibility of some of the fish market to visitors long term is uncertain, so take advantage of the opportunity to visit it as it is now, soonest!

Tsukiji fish market tour done right!. When dear friends asked us to show them our favorite vacation spot -- Japan -- we knew it had to include a tour of Tsukiji fish market. And that also meant they had to experience Tsukiji via a trusted tour guide to really see the market. In short, we couldn't have been more pleased with our tour that was led by Yuko. From start to finish we were mesmerized by the wonders of the world's largest fish market. Yuko clearly set our expectations and never once were we disappointed. From tastes throughout the market -- the hot tamago yaki on a stick was the perfect start to a cold and rainy day -- to seeing an almost limitless variety of fish, seafood, and seasonal vegetables and fruits, we were transfixed. We had conversations with the vendors who willingly took time out of their busy morning to help us better understand their products and even shared some favorite recipes. The outer market tour was an equal delight as we continued tasting our way through the market and making purchases. Our tour concluded with a terrific lunch at a small, nearby sushi restaurant that was an oasis of calm after being in such a busy market. We highly recommend Tokyo FooDrink Tours without reservation.

We recommend this Tsukiji Fish Market tour. Yuriko was an excellent guide and we enjoyed the tour very much. There were only 4 of us on the tour and we liked that. Following Yuriko through the crowded market was easy. We took the tour on our first full day in Tokyo and we are very glad that we did. We got a good introduction to the city and the importance of fish! We saw a huge variety of fish, as well as fruits and vegetables (very expensive fruits and vegetables). We were offered many food samples and that was fun. Of the food on the tour, the oysters and the sushi were the best. At the tea shop, Yuriko helped us to select the matcha that we ultimately bought. She also described how to make it which was very helpful. We walked for at least 4 hours; wow that was a lot of walking. We recommend the tour (although it is expensive).

Best way to explore Tsukiji Fish Market. One of the highlights of my trip to Tokyo! I usually avoid booking guided tours when I can just explore myself, but this tour was great! The fish market is a chaotic place and, especially if you don't speak Japanese or have relationships with the vendors, it's hard to really experience it (other than superficially - as a chaotic place full of raw fish). Yoko was an excellent tour guide. She had answers for all the questions we came up with (and plenty of answers to questions we never thought to ask). We covered a huge amount of ground, saw some really interesting things, and ate some great food.I can't recommend this tour strongly enough.

great "Sake & Streetfood" Tour. We had the chance to be introduced to the Master Sake Brewer of the only sake brewery inside central Tokyo. The visit of the brewery itself is not extensive as visitors are not supposed to enter the installations, but the master's explanation and the material provided were all we needed to begin to appreciate what nihonshu is all about. We were given several different sakes to taste while the enthusiast sake master answered all our questions and gave us interesting insider tips.The no-frills street food area we were then taken to is completely off-charts for tourists! We tried oden, a kind of food you would not get to taste without the knowledge of a local guide. I won't reveal what specialities we tried, but they were delicious. While eating and sipping some (more) sake, we even had a nice chat with regular customers of that food-stand.Then we were accompanied to a small dessert-shop that has a speciality that is only sold in that part of the city. Oïshi! Many thanks to our guide,Yu, who made that experience worthwhile! (We'll comme back and have that future beer micro-brewery tour next time ;) ).

Tsukiji Fish Market tour. The highlight of my trip was taking this tour! Our tour guide Yuko gave us an interactive experience that exceeded all of my expectations. We walked, ate, laughed, and learned all with Yuko's guidance. If you ever visit the Fish market, definitely consider signing up for this tour! Yuko you are the best!!!

This tour is essential for experiencing Tsukiji. If a tour of the renowned Tsukiji Fish Market is on your 'to do' list when visiting Tokyo, this tour is a a must. Everything is as described when booked. Clear instructions on when and how to meet, and the group is quite small which is necessary when you see how crowded it is. Our guide Yuriko was exceptional in guiding our group on a comprehensive experience of the outer and inner markets, was highly conscientious about safety, extremely knowledgeable, and warmly welcomed by various of the vendors in the massive marketplace. She even went out of her way after the group disbanded to help my husband and I buy some famed japanese kitchen tools to bring home. I can't seeing doing this sight without a local guide.

Highlight of the trip!!!!. This was an outstanding tour and worth every penny. Yu is a knowledgeable, courteous and friendly host. His knowledge of all things Japanese made for excellent conversation throughout the evening. Although the sightseeing was great, the beer was tasty and the Izakya food excellent, the highlight was the Sake tasting. Yu did a fantastic job and I would recommend this tour to anybody visiting Japan!!!

Tsukiji fish market tour excellent start to holiday . Our tour was a small group of 3 with Yoko, who was an excellent guide. This was an excellent way to see the markets, going to areas you wouldn't if alone, tempers and an excellent sushi lunch to end. Yoko was a great guide, very accommodating and knowledgeable. Would highly recommend, particularly before the markets relocate.

The Tsukiji Tour Was One of Our Favorite!. My apologies to Tokyo FooDrink and to Noriko-san -- this review is coming about six months late! I only remembered because my wife and I are planning another trip to Tokyo with friends, and I'm hoping Noriko-san will be available...!My wife and I celebrated our honeymoon in Tokyo last October, and one of our favorite memories was our tour with Noriko-san. She was extremely professional, courteous, knowledgable and respectful -- Noriko-san deeply cares about Japanese culture and wants to share that appreciation with you. We started with a few of the temples on the outskirts of the market and then Noriko-san led us through the byzantine market itself. This tour is quite a bit of walking, so bring your walking shoes! Not to be missed.

Tsukiji Fish Market Food Tour. This tour was well worth it. Our tour guide, Yoko, was awesome. We learned so much from her, things we would not have known or learned if we went solo. The food tasting was great, even made a few extra stops. Highly recommend this tour if you visit Tokyo. We enjoyed it and had so much fun. Thank you Yoko!

Excellent Tsukiji Tour value and experience with a caring and knowledgeable guide!. I signed up for the Sushi Making and Tsukiji market tour. It had to be modified as the sushi making class filled up, so we ended up still eating sushi and other items and also had a tour of Asakusa added to the tour. Naoko, our guide, was extremely knowledgeable and accommodating, answering any questions that we had and made it a point to conduct the tour from a local's standpoint, including great viewing spots of Tsukiji and eating quality sushi at an affordable price. Thank you Naoko for a wonderful experience and guided tour- it was an experience I would never have gotten on my own and it exceeded my expectations!
Easy Way to See Tsukiji. This was a stress-less way to see this huge and complex operation. The tour hit all the highlights with a few surprise stops. This is a solid, high quality tour.

Tsukiji Market Tour - excellent!!. It was the highlight of our trip to Tokyo. Our guide Yoko-san was fantastic - she explained things to us and guided us through the very busy market, and looked after us very well despite the rainy weather! The food is delicious and fresh. I would highly recommend this tour. Thank you Yoko-san :)

Asakusa FooDrink Tour Awesome!. Excellent tour. Yu was a fantastic guide and every place you visit is a little Gem. Yu's advice and Japanese lessons were great and so helpful for the rest of our Tokyo adventure. Do this tour, I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Beso and friendly way to know this huge fish market . The place itself is amaizing. It would have been imposible to understand and appreciate the market work culture without Noriko, our tour guide. She really knew the place, the people, how and where to go...etc.The food testing was awesome and she provided us a lot of tips to really enjoy the variety of flavors you have in japanese food.Thanks for this amaizing experience.

Fabulous tour with an excellent guide!. The fish market is an amazing place and Yuriko (hope we spelled her name right) was very knowledgeable and took us to places that one would not expect the public would go. Crazily busy and a massive variety of seafood. We'll always remember how to tell the difference between a male and female octopus (you'll have to do the tour to find out :) )We enjoyed the various food tasting stopping points, culminating in a wonderful sushi lunch. Yuriko even helped us identify some items we wanted to buy in the supermarket at the end of the tour.Overall this tour - and our guide (did you know you need to pass an exam to be a tour guide in Japan?) - exceeded our expectations.You need to take this tour soon - the market moves in November 2016.

Tsukiji Fish Market Tour - Awesome!. We had a fantastic small group tour (3 of us) of the Tsukiji Fish Market in Tokyo, Japan. Our tour guide Nori was so friendly with excellent English and knowledge and all in all we had a really fun tour, highly recommend! He also took us to a stand up Sushi Bar for lunch which ended up being the best sushi we have ever had so almost 2 weeks later when we were back in Tokyo we went again!!!

Great Insights!. What a great experience! We had a wonderful tour guide, Yeonmi Song, who led us through the inner and outer markets of Tsukiji. She was extremely friendly, polite, and very informative. Throughout our 3.5 hour tour she gave us a running dialog of the history of the markets, took us to a nearby temple and shrine, and explained how the fish is bought and sold. Additionally, she took us to several shops to sample the market foods and explained how everything was prepared.I had journeyed through the fish market on my own once before, and the experience could not compare to having a guide. I left with a great appreciation for the market, its history, and its food.

Great experience. Excellent tour to see the local side of Tokyo.
Very informative and fun. Would definitely recommend trying everything!

Very Informative and Fun. My husband and I went on the Tsukiji Fish Market tour with Yoshika on the first morning of our trip to Tokyo and had a wonderful time!! We love Japanese food and Tsukiji was top on our places to see but we hesitated over whether or not to do a formal tour. I'm so glad we did! Yoshika took us through the outer and inner markets, the ladder of which we definitely would not have explored otherwise given their complexity. She deftly guided us through the rows of the market, telling us which places were fine with having pictures taken and which not. She answered all the questions we had, and showed us extra sights like temples along the way. We tried Japanese omelet, sake, green tea, oysters, fish cake and sushi along with many other little samples. It was very informative and fun! I highly recommend.

Great DiverseTokyo West Walking Tour. Great tour that shows the huge diversity of Tokyo West, from Harajuku girls, fashion and candy, to beautifull shrines and a tranquil park. Yu, my guide, answered all my questions and is a really nice guy to talk to. I really enjoyed it and it is one of my high lights of this trip.Brenda from the Netherlands

Fantastic way to see the Markets. Yumi and Yu were fantastic hosts. Very knowledgeable and went the extra mile to ensure we had a great time! We really enjoyed our tour with them. Would definitely recommend this tour!

Great Tsukiji Tour!. Yuriko was a great guide! She was highly knowledgeable of the Tsujiki market and deftly navigated us through the different areas of the market. We saw beautiful produce from the fruit & vegetable market to the world famous fish market. We spoke with several vendors and sampled their delicious produce. She was great with my daughters and gave them advice for other places/things to see/do while in Tokyo. It was a highly educational tour and we highly recommend it!!

Great exeperience in Tsukiji. I have been living in Tokyo for a while and I have been to Tsukiji market plenty of times but definitly this tour made me able to see this market with an other angle and discover things I never expected to see. Definitly a great tour that I will recommend to anybody who would like to enjoy Tsukiji and discover Japanese culture at same time.
Much better than just wondering around the markets. good to have a lot of the produce and processes explained. Also good to be able to ask lots of questions. Our guide was attentive and informative.

Amazing! Tsukiji is a "must-do". This was my first time in Tokyo, and I booked this tour because I had heard so many great things about the Tsukiji fish market. I happened to be the only person who signed up for the tour on the Friday morning I went, so it was like a personalized tour just for me :)My guide was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful, and she made sure I had a great experience. She knew the places to stop and see, the things to eat, and all about the the fish and fruits/veggies we saw. My favorite part was the end of the tour at the sushi restaurant. Hands down the best sushi I've ever eaten. I could definitely tell the fish was fresh! This was the last tour I booked during my stay in Tokyo, and I'm absolutely glad I did it. Highly recommended!!

Excellent, easy way to see the markets. Great way to see the markets and get some really fresh seafood and other japanese delicacies. Definitely got value for money and our guides were really knowledgeable. Easy to locate from the train station. Recommend for solo, couples and even families

A must-join tour in Tokyo!. I believe that there are places that we should visit with a help from someone who knows well about the place, and Tsukiji Fish Market is one of those places. This place is huge and, for anyone who visit the place for the first time (or second time like myself), it is like a maze! So I was very glad that I joined this tour. Thanks to our guide, Kumie-san, who was very informative, super helpful and had a really good sense of humor, I got to learn a lot about the market and the foods dealt there. I joined the tour solo, but meeting new people from around the world and sharing the same fun experience was a big plus too. Of course, everything we got to try during the tour was incredibly fresh and delicious!! I highly recommend this tour to anyone planning to visit the market!

Tsukiji Fish Market Tour. My husband and I did the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour and would absolutely recommend it. Our guide, Yeonmi, was wonderful and her English was strong. There only ended up being three of us on the tour, which was nice. The tour was well thought out. We really enjoyed learning about the different fruits, vegetables and seafood. We also liked having a guide to talk to rather than just wandering around on our own - we learned a lot more about the area and the culture that way.

Amazing and authentic food and drink tour in Asakusa.. My tour guide Yu-san was really friendly and informative. I had a really great time and experienced a very authentic peek into the Japanese food and drinking culture. Totally recommend this!

Fun, informative, and delicious!. I had a fantastic time with the Tsukiji Market Tour. Eriko, our guide, was a great host and provided an informative history on this amazing fish market. She guided us through all the nooks and crannies this gigantic market, and showed us a few areas that I would never find myself just as a tourist.The tour seemed pricey at first, but the amount of food that is included with the meal made it completely worth it. Highly recommended!

Tsukiji Fish Market food tour. This tour was great! Michiko walked us through the area so smoothly. We would have gotten lost in the maze without her. She stopped along the way to tell us information about each spot. Michiko also took pictures for us with her phone and shared the images with us though email so we didn't have to worry about that. The food we ate during the tour was delicious. I'm still craving that warm tamagoyaki. The lunch Michiko took us to was amazing.The sushi was so fresh. I was a little sad she couldn't enjoy the food with us, hopefully the budget can accommodate that in the future.

A definite must do!. This was my favorite Tokyo experience! I loved having someone who was knowledgeable and fun--and funny!--guide us through. The insights were great and the food was phenomenal. I ended up hanging out at the market for 2 more hours after it was over, went back to some of the shops she'd shown us and bought all of my food gifts for friends.

Delightful Tour. My wife and I had a wonderful experience touring the Tsukiji fish market. Yuko was an excellent guide. She not only showed us all the intimate workings of the market, but she also taught us a lot about Japanese culture along the way. The food during the tour was delicious - especially the sushi! The tour was a lot of fun and we definitely recommend it for anyone visiting Tokyo.

Nice morning in the Fish Market. As others have said, this is a well run, professional tour company. After booking, received confirmation emails with a picture of where to meet. I found it with no problems, and tour commenced on time. Kumie was our group guide for the morning, and she was very easy to talk to and answered our many questions. She certainly knew her way around both the inner market and the outer market. The tastings were good, and we sampled many products that are sold to locals. You are also given choices as to the types of seafood you would like to try, so if there's one you don't care for, you certainly have other options. The tour ended with a lunch at a nice sushi restaurant a block or so outside the outer market area. The sushi was delicious, though it was a "standing bar" meaning no seats, and after 3+ hours of walking around, it would have been nice to have a chance to sit and rest. To those considering this tour, yes, you could see many of the sights on your own. But a guide was of great help in identifying many of the Japanese seafood and produce for sale, as well as having someone to tell you about how it all fits into Japanese culture. I'd say the services of a guide were well worth the price, and you will take away a greater understanding of what you've seen. Highly recommended!

Excellent guides made visiting the Tsukiji fish market much more interesting and easier to navigate. I would not have wanted to visit the fish market any other way. The guides were professional and helpful every step of the way. We were traveling with our two small children, and the guides were so attentive to our needs, without bothering the others in our group. I've done many food tours, and they set a standard for me.

great tsukiji tour. booked this last minute and the company was helpful and accommodating in organising it. Nori our guide was nice and ready to answer any questions and showed us around the inner market which would likely be difficult to do otherwise. The tour is quite expensive but when you consider the food you get, it's not bad as the food and drink you get is excellent, I would say it's the only way to see the market

A wonderful insight into Japanese food culture. Our guide Yoriko gave us a fantastic insight into the reverence the Japanese people have for their seafood on our FooDrink tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market. Squeezing between crates of every variety of fish and seafood you could imagine, and dodging fast-moving trolleys, Yoriko managed to explain to us how her grandmother used to prepare bonito flakes by hand , but now modern Japanese women buy them in the supermarket. We got to try an amazing range of seafood, also green tea and sake. Thanks Yoriko for a fabulous tour!

Interactive Tour w/ Excellent Guide. Tours are always hit or miss for me; thankfully, this one was a hit ;) I did the Tsukiji Market & Food tour with Nori. The Market itself was a completely new experience - I've been to markets before, but none like this one; fish isn't the only thing you will see. For example, on our tour we saw a fruit auction, and we . We also got lucky and saw a large tuna being masterfully cut in one of the side stalls. The food selection for the tour is diverse; my favorite were the fresh, warm omelette, the sake tasting, and the tea sampling - all from stalls I might not have found if not on the tour. I highly recommend; especially if this is your first time to Tokyo, or have never been to Tsukiji.

Excellent Tsukiji Market Tour. We had an excellent tour of Tsukiji Market with Natsu. It was a small tour (4 people total) so we had lots of personal attention to ask questions and stop for pictures. Natsu was enthusiastic and knowledgeable; she answered our questions about the market and life in Japan in general. The tour involves tasting food, so come hungry! I highly recommend this tour, make sure you reserve in advance as they do fill up. My only regret is not taking more walking tours while we were in Japan.

Fun evening with great guide. We did the Asakusa Street Food Tour with Yu. Yu was great fun and we had a very interesting tour. The highlight was probably the monja at the last stop - something completely different that we hadn't tasted or even seen before, as well as being yummy! It was also great to have a local with us to push us out of our comfort zone a bit on the menu. Asakusa is an older part of town so there is lots of character in the streets you walk through. The non-food/drink stops (view from the top of the tourist centre and temple) were also interesting.

A must do for food lovers visiting Tokyo. We did the Tsukiji Fish Market tour, and our guide Noriko and Yu.I can't say enough how super pleased we were with our tour with We had an absolutely marvelous time. We learned so much about Japanese food and culture, which we love even more now! I'm impressed with the reminders sent prior to the trip, and the lovely pictures sent to us after. They were both so professional and pleasant. We couldn't have asked for a better guides! This is probably one of the BEST food tours I've ever taken. Bravo!!!!

Worth the tour for anyone that does not know too much about Japan's largest fish market!. Naoko, our tour guide was very knowledgeable and was able to give a very good in depth tour of the site as wel as a bit of history on how the sight started. Giving us and insight into the wonderful food as wel as getting to taste what was on offer was enough to satisfy my hunger for Japan's insatiable and fresh seafood

Tsukiji Fish Market and Sunamachi Food Tour. I highly recommend these tours, especially if it's your first time in Tokyo. We had a wonderful time on both these tours. There are a lot of things to learn, see and taste. My family and I were especially grateful that these tours were fun and informal. Our tour guides were a plus, they were informative and super helpful, especially when my daughter needed to find a restroom. Thank you Yoko and Tae, you two were awesome!Also, wear comfortable shoes as there's lots of walking.

Tsukiji Market Food and Drink Tour with Eriko. I loved my tour. Eriko is so nice and patient and FUNNY! Tsukiji Market is a fascinating, exciting, place. However, I really think that it cannot truly be navigated and explored without help. Eriko certainly provided this and more! Add to that the food that I tasted was fantastic, especially the to-die-for oyster and delicious sushi.

Very good to see the inner markets. Yu (Yuki) was our tour guide. I was also in contact with her for the online booking which went very fast and convenient.The tour is very good if you're interested in the inner market (fish market & veg market). You sure could go there by yourself, but I would not recommend it for a (western) tourist. It really is not a tourist place to stroll around, but more of a business place for wholesalers etc. Yu guided us perfectly through it, exactly knowing how to behave without bothering the working people, knowing the right people where we could stop and talk.I used to work as a chef, so I had some quite specific questions about the foid, processes, roles etc. - they all were answered to my satisfaction. I also liked the view on the whole markets from the parking deck - you sure must know where to go to find that spot!In my opinion, for the outer markets you don't really need a guide. Those stands are very easily to be detected by oneself. However, Yu showed us some interestings shops and a nice temple, too.I would definitely recommend this tour for someone who is interested in the inner markets!

Wonderful experience !!! Highly Recommend fish Market tour!!!. We were so glad we booked a private fish market private tour with TOkyo FooDrink Tour. We had a amazing tour guide Michiko. She was friendly and kind, she first picked us up @ our hotel . She taught us how to use the transit system and we arrived at the fish market by train. ( our second day @ Tokyo) . We walked thru various part of fish market and she took us to special places that we definitely cannot find on our own. We had fun snacks thru out the tour and Michiko explained everything thru the tour. Finally she took us to this unique and super yummy sushi place , we definitely enjoy it !!! Thank you Michiko for the follow email and pictures !

Excellent guided tours of Tokyo. I visited Tokyo for 10 days and I ended up taking 3 different tours with Tokyo Food Drink. Firstly, to the temple district of Asakusa an area with a lot of history, we had some excellent snacks and a visit to a traditional Japanese tearoom. Secondly, to Tsukiji fish market where we had some excellent sushi made with really fresh fish. Thirdly, to the food street in East Tokyo. This was probably the best trip of all 3, because there is such an amazing variety of food shops and we got to talk with some of the locals.I recommend all 3 tours as the guides are very professional, friendly and amusing. They are very good value as all the food and drink consumed is free.
Brilliant your with Natsu.. Natsu gave an excellent tour going above and beyond for the group. She is so knowledgable and approachable. The tour was interesting snd fun. Highly recommend.

Enjoyable trip to the fish market . We were very lucky as we book for the tour very last minute. Appreciate that they manage to accommodate us. It was a very fun and enriching experience as well as an eye opener for both myself and my daughter as we seldom go to a fish market. Saw many unique fish and fruits. My daughter was fascinated by the size of some of the fish. Also manged to try delicious local food and snacks. The guides, Kumie and Fumito, were knowledge and friendly. They were also helpful and patient in explaining the Japanese custom and culture. We were very glad that we have joined this tour and would definitely try out other tours that the company conduct when we come back to Tokyo. We would recommend this tour to anyone who like to have a guided tour to the fish market.
Great experience . Nori was a fantastic, friendly and informative guide for us around the market. The food was all delicious and we enjoyed all the sights, sounds and smells of the market. Thank you!

Tsukiji Market Tour. Eriko was our guide and was very friendly and very helpful in taking care our needs ( we brought a stroller and she arranged a place to store it for us while we visiting the inner tuskiji market). The guide speaks good English if anyone had doubt in the language barrier, dont be! During the tour, eriko gave us many information on japanese food culture, their way of preparing, buying foods etc. We learned a lot from this tour about the local dining habit as well. She also waited us patiently while we wanted to buy things in the market and giving us recommendation from time to time.Overall, this is a very good experience. Join this tour while you still can! (the inner tsukiji market will be relocated some time next year)Thanks again eriko-san for taking care of my family and make our trip memorable!

Really informative and well paced tours.. We went on 2 tours with this company while in Tokyo - the street food and fish market. We enjoyed the street food tour so much we booked for the fish market. Both were very well run - knowledgable guides with reasonable English. There were some unexpected activities on the street food tour such as trying on a kimono and checking out a local supermarket/department store. My son enjoyed learning how to make a pot of tea (even if he has not developed a taste for drinking it). I learnt a great deal about life in the city, how to tackle eating some of the foods and a bit of history of the areas. Amazingly fresh sushi on the fish market tour. Well worth doing!

Tsukiji Market Foodie Tour. We were lucky and went on this tour with lovely Yuko and co-founder of the tour company Yu. It is a MUST-DO, especially if you are visiting Tokyo for the first time, as we are. The fish market is a world unto itself, fascinating, and the tour also includes the fruit and vegetable market - have never seen white strawberries before. Yuko gave us market information but the cultural tips as well that add so much to the experience.The tour introduced us to the Japanese omelet, delicious, to shrimp and scallop cakes, huge oysters, stand up sushi and superb sake. So it was a feast for the body as well as the senses and we highly recommend it. Thank you again, Yuko and Yu.

Good little tour : friendly and knowledgeable. We had Yuki as our guide and was very friendly and helpful with answering questions. She knew a few vendors and was lucky to meet one of the fish mongers and watched raw tuna carving with Japanese tools. Recommended.

Awesome tour. Thanks Noriko for a wonderful morning at the fish market - great experience. I still cant believe how big those oysters were and that Sushi was unbelievably good. Foodrink tours run a terrific operation and their guides are first rate. We also did the Sunamachi Street food tours and it was equally as good.

An excellent tour by Noriko of Tokyo FooDrink Tour!. Noriko was an excellent guide! Despite the rain, Noriko was cheerful and very patient. It is a good way to get to know about the Tsukiji market, both inner and outer markets. The tour was very informative and Noriko shared about the Japanese culture too! Thank you, Noriko!

Great Tour! Highly Recommended!. Our large group of 14 people really had a good time on this tour! In case you're wondering how they managed to accommodate such a large group of people, the tour company sent out 4 tour guides then split us into 4 smaller walking groups.Then we went and walked around the inner and outer fish market. If you've never come to Japan before, and want to get a close and in depth look at the Tsukuji Fish Market, this is definitely a great way to do so. And what makes the tour even better is that there is food included.There is also a good amount of flexibility built into the tour. For instance, although there were only 7 tastings included, we also had the option to explore a little and try other foods (which we bought ourselves) that we saw along our tour.All an all, a very good experience. My only wish was that there were more tastings at the beginning of the tour, as we hadn't eaten breakfast prior. But by the end of the tour, I was definitely very full!

We had a great experience and Michiko was the best!. We wanted to get a tour of the Tokyo fish market by a pro and Michiko was an excellent guide! We couldn't have seen every detail of the fish market by ourselves, and I would highly recommend a tour so that you can truly appreciate what the fish market is about. This tour included 7 food/drink combos as well, and lots of walking over 3 1/2 hours, so wear comfortable, easily washable shoes. Highly recommended!

TokyoFooDrink Tour Tsukiji. The experience we had on the TokyoFooDrink tour at Tsukiji market was excellent. Noriko was well versed and knowledgeable. She made the experience even better. We got to see a lot of the market and the food samples were excellent. I would highly recommend this company to everyone.Mahalo, Keith Letman

BEST EXPERIENCE IN TOKYO. We did both the Tsukiji Fish Market Tour and the Asakusa Street Food Tours. In both instances, we were treated to the bedt of Japanese culture and hospitality. For people who would like yo expetience Japanese culture up close and unadulterated, going on Fumito-san's tours would be highly recommended.The Tsukiji Tour was a small group tour and it really was, with only my family of 3 and an American lady Marla. We had close perdonal attention and were able to safely navigate the complex (and chaotic) maze that is the Inner Market. Importantly, we were able to better understand the workings of the place due yo the information and access provided by our experienced guides.The Food Tour was a private tour with Yu-san. He brought us to the places a local would patronise and we were extremely privileged to be exposed to food and drink that we as tourists would not have an opportunity to partake.I would be truing out this comoany's other tours the next time I come bavk to Tokyo. Ichi ban!

Great Tsukiji Tour. The Tsukiji Tour was fun and interesting. Natsu-san, our nice and pleasant guide, was very knowledgeable about the place and brought us to areas in the market where only the locals would know. While we were not able to watch the famous fish auction, it was an experience watching the melon auction though. The outside market was crowded with tourists. However, every food stall offers a sample of their products. But be sure to try the wasabi and mayo peanuts. Delicious! I was able to buy some to bring back home. I was also amazed at how they made the omelet; it takes some serious skill to prepare that. Natsu-san also brought us to this sushi restaurant for lunch about ten minutes away from the market where everything we tried was delicious and reasonable priced at that. She mentioned that this restaurant, although quite new, is very popular with the locals.
Highly recommended!. The worlds largest fish market is worth a visit, preferrably with a guided tour such as the Tokyo FooDrink Tour. We had 3,5 very interesting hours with our friendly guide Nori.

Good insight into the market. Instead of walking around the market myself, I decided to sign up for the tour after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. It was really good. Our guide Nori was knowledgeable and helpful and explained everything we saw and ate. Groups are also kept small so that you get a more personalised experience. Good company, good food, good tea, good sake, what more can you ask for?

Last chance to see the fish market and produce market. It was a very memorable tour for us first time Japan visitors and for others who are lucky enough to visit before the market is moved to new quarters in a year. The site will be used for the 2020 Olympics media center. The stone floors and worn wooden cutting boards will surely be replaced by modern materials. Our guide Nori was very knowledgeable and warned us to be safe among the many trucks. It was not very touristy since people were obviously doing business. We appreciated their welcoming manner especially because they must get nosy tourists bumbling through all the time. The food was great.

Tuna Auction Tour. My guide had excellent knowledges about Tsukiji Fish Market & I especially recommend Tuna Auction Tour. You will learn a lot from the guide and also give us a trick about the auction, too. After we finish watching the auction, the guide brought me intermediate wholesalers area and recommended which sushi restaurant is good. Unfortunately 11/30 was the last day of the auction this year. But it will reopen in the middle of January. If you want to see the auction and get a trick about it, you should join the tour. It totally worth it.

A must-do tour!. This was a fascinating morning in the amazing world of Tokyo's fish market, all brilliantly portrayed by our FooDrink guide Michio. She kept us on the move throughout and ensured we were well fed and well informed.Not everybody in the fish market is delighted to see tourists so it is essential to join one of the tours, and the one we were on has a maximum of four people with each guide.You do need to keep your wits about you as the small motorised forklifts whizz by but that apart this is an unforgettable insight into probably the world's biggest market, it sells £12m worth of fish and veg every day - one of Michiko's many facts and figures, I hope I've relayed it correctly.Along the way we got to taste omelette on a stick, scallops, oysters, sake and sushi - in fact the whole tour had an impact on all our senses. Highly recommended, take plenty of photos, but always ask permission before snapping the market staff. Michiko was normally capable of getting them to smile!

Excellent tour of Tsukiji Fish Market. Yu was an excellent tour guide -- super enthusiastic and pumped when meeting up with us at 3am in the morning! Yu spoke English well and was very knowledgable about the fish market. I was worried that the 2 hours of waiting before the market opens (that everyone has to sit through between getting in line and the tuna market) feeling really long, but Yu kept us company and shared many travel stories.His back story of why he started this tour company made clear his love for travel and givingback to the travel community.As for the tour itself, there was less structure to it than I thought there would be. It wasn't a linear narration but instead we just asked all the questions we had until we had no more. He knew everything and it's possible we never gave him time to get back on track after we barraged him questions,.After the tuna auction (which he gave really good explanations for), he was able to sneak us into parts of the outer market normally restricted until 9am or later. It was amazing to see the tuna broken down during these early hours when other tourists aren't allowed in.He also joined us for some great breakfast in the end and got us to our next subway stop. All in all, Yu was a great tour guide and I'd recommend him to anyone who wants to see the fish market.

Eat like a local. Craft beer, sake taste, salaryman food experience as the every day Japanese man or woman would do after work. It was both a tasting delight as well as a glimpse into living in Toyko as would any local. Plus he's a fun guy.
Best for serious foodies. We were able to maximize our time at Tsukiji with the help of our tour guide Nori and his boss Fumito. Excellent, thoughtful service!

Excellent tour. One of the highlights of my trip. What a fun tour through an area tourists would never discover on their own. I was the only westerner I saw in the whole area. The food was great and I was stuffed by the time we were done. Yu was a good guy, fun to talk to, and his English was excellent. I really cannot recommend this tour enough!

Excellent experience to learn about the biggest fish market in the world. We took the tour in Oct 2015 - our guide Mr. Nori was an excellent guide who have lot of knowledge about the market and very useful information when we walk around the market. His knowledge do not limit to only market or foods that available in and around Tsukiji market. He also told us where else in Tokyo that we should visit. In short this tour is Excellent and Highly recommend for anyone who interest on Japanese foods and Japanese culture around foods also way of life in and around Tsukiji market.

Food Tour Of Tsukigi Market. This tour is a necessity if your traveling to Tsukiji Market. Our guide, Yoko, was amazing and showed us every inch of the place and introduced us to some of the locals doing business there. She was also very helpful with translating just about everything so we can purchase some items. We didn't think the market would be so dense and complex, which makes it even more important to have a reliable tour. What really made it special was our guide. Yoko kept in touch with us even after the tour was over and gave recommendation for other parts of Japan. Her knowledge and company alone makes this tour nearly priceless. Thank you Yoko!

The best food tour company!. Taking two tours with this company was the best decision my college daughter and I made for our first visit to Tokyo. The tours were extremely personalized, with it being a very small group. Our guides knew their city very well, and were open about sharing their experiences and favorites in their home. We not only learned about the food and tourist economy, but also what it is like to live in Tokyo. The fish market tour was a must do. We were able to talk with vendors only available because of or tour guide. Come hungry, since there are many food samples. And each sample is more than a few bites. And all the foods are delicious. Try everything, even that which is unfamiliar. Memorable foods were the Japanese omelette (different, but delicious), the dried bonito (we brought some home), the large oysters (terrific if you like oysters).Our second tour was of the Asakusa neighborhood. Again, lots of delicious food with a great guide. The sweet potato ice cream was also delicious. The variety of salts was surprising. I think we were the first guests to buy salt and a salt cellar.This company could not have done more to accommodate our schedule, last minute booking and personal interests. We give them our highest recommendation.

Awesome experience!. Took this tour in May 2015 - our guide Yoshika was wonderful and hugely knowledgeable about the market. We sampled a huge variety of foods (even more than was listed on the ticket) and drank delicious sake. Everything we tried was unique, fresh, and extremely delicious. The sushi place we ended the tour at is some of the best sushi I've ever had (including some quite fancy sushi restaurants in NY). I would recommend this tour to anyone that was visiting Tokyo for a great, authentic way to access to the Tsukiji market.

Extensive tour of the vegetable and fish market of Tsukiji. Me and my friend enjoyed this tour. I did some research and this was one of the few tours that began at a humane time (08:30 am). The Inner Fish Market doesn't open till 09:00, so if you ain't waking up @ 02:00 am for the auction this one is convenient.We saw an auction going on at the vegetable market and got to see so many different varieties of fish in the Inner Market. Visiting the Outer Market was fun too - with a lot of sampling of street food.Sally & Yu our tour guides were very kind and accommodating. Definitely recommended!

Excellent tour. Our lovely guide Yuriko gave us an excellent tour of the fish market and offered not only explanations about the market and its trade but also gave us insights into Japanese culture. And that is the best way to enjoy and appreciate the country and its people. As for the tour itself, the organization is excellent and its hosts are very considered and hospitable people. For example, one member of our group was a bit tardy for the tour, so Fumito, the owner of the company, waited for her and she caught up with the group at the very beginning. The food, offered with the tour as part of authentic experience, is excellent. We sampled some foods at the market, including sake which, btw, was excellent and of very high quality and not cheap. The tour culminated in the nearby sushi place where we've been served very good sushi in generous quantities. I would recommend this tour to everyone for fun, good food, and unparalleled experience of Japan.

highly recommend this tour. You get to walk throughout all the produce and fish market stalls, and this is a very interesting tour. Recommend buying some cheap rain boots that you can buy for just a few thousand yen at Tokyo street vendors. Lots of wet pavement and workers cleaning areas. Not a big deal if you don't have rain boots though. Some pictures not allowed so I wish I had only brought my cell phone to use as a camera instead of bringing my larger camera. Nori was a great tour guide. Very glad I saw this market before it moves at end of 2016 to another location.

Wonderful tour of Tsukiji market!. Yoshika was a great guide for us, providing interesting information and answering all of our questions. What an amazing place the Tsukiji market is! We highly recommend this tour with Tokyo FooDrink. Well worth it for all ages. :)

Fantastic peek behind the scenes. The reviewers who have suggested this tour as a way to begin your time in Tokyo are right. Yuriko was our guide, and she did an excellent job explaining both the market and the polite way to conduct ourselves when shopping (and window-shopping) in Japan. She was responsive to our interests and our energy levels. We feel lucky to have heard about this tour!

Fish Market Tour in Tokyo. As a food lover and a first timer to Tokyo, I could resist the Fish Market tour. This tour exceeded my expectations. Yumi, our guide, was pleasant and informative. She answered questions, gave insightful commentary, was patient with our wandering and picture taking, and truly showed us the highlights.

Fantastic experience. This was the perfect start to our Japan holiday. Our guide, Yuri, was knowledgable and incredibly friendly and helpful. The fish market is an essential part of life in Tokyo and is a must see, but it is busy and hectic and you would miss out on so much without a guide to explain and put things in context. The food we sampled was all excellent, including the most ginormous oysters we'd ever seen. Can't recommend this tour enough.

Excellent tour of Tsukiji fish market and nearby!. We loved this tour of the famous fish market! Going with a local guide gave us an excellent perspective of the area and each of the many foods we tried. This was a great deal for the time and food included. Thank you!

Had an Awesome time Great tour!!. We booked the Tokyo Foodrink tour and i'm glad we did it was awesome and so was our tour guide Naoko she was great! She answered any questions we had, told us about the many different foods,took pics gave us some of the history. The tour was off the regular tourist path which was great to see and the food was so good everything we tried i loved and the sake we tried was of course yum..and on a side note we missed our initial location where to meet for the tour but Naoko emailed me where to go and we took a taxi to meet up with the tour which i thought was very Awesome not many other tours would do this so once again great tour!!

Great tour!. Fun tour. The market is huge! It is truly impressive to see. It's really more of a tour than a tasting (it has to be) but there is food. They provided an omelette when we arrived. Small samplings and lunch. The guide, Nori, was very nice and spoke English well. It's really a Tokyo must do.

Best way to see Tsukiji fish market. an absolute must for anyone going to fish market .you see areas that would be all to easy to miss ! Our guide was knowledgeable , friendly and interested in our questions . A great opportunity to eat food from the many stalls in and around the market .It was also a very small group of 4 which was excellent

Highlight of my Japan Trip. I have always wanted to go to Tsukiji market because I am a foodie. The place is legendary! I felt I needed to visit before it moves to a new location in 2016, it did not disappoint me. The 3.5 hour at Tsukiji with Yuriko from Tokyo FooDrink was amazing. The place is, to me, a temple of Japanese ways of living and traditions. I learned many new things and met wonderful people. I would like to thank the team for coming up with this brillant programme.

Great way to start off our stay in Tokyo!. We scheduled this tour on our first full day in Tokyo. I think was a great introduction to the city, the food and the culture.Our guide was very helpful in explaining everything as we walked through the market. It was a nice intimate group and we definitely weren't left hungry. I loved the cedar sake cups we were able to keep a souvenirs.
We really loved it!!!. It was excellent!!! We really liked the guide and all her info about the food and the market. We were all surprised about its history. Thanks for everything!!

Fantastic tour through Tsukiji Fish Market with great guide. We went on a fantastic tour with excellent guidning by Nori. We enjoyed it very much, Nori was a pleasure to get to know and was very helpful in all ways. The fruit/fish market is like a maze, so we were very happy to have someone guiding us. We also visited the street market outside, which was a lot of fun. Tasting included Japanese omelette, sake, crab cake, green tea and a giant oyster, quite a challenge! The tour ended with a sushi lunch at a very nice restaurant. I recommend this tour whole-heartedly and would like to thank Nori for being such a nice guy and answering all our questions without hesitation. We had a great stay in Tokyo and this tour was one of the highlights.

A visit to the Tsukiji Fish Market with a fantastic guide - Nori!. I can really recommend this tour to anyone visiting Tokyo, even if you are not interested in food. It was very interesting to see all the fishes, all the fruits and to taste different food and beverages. Our guide Nori was excellent. He made this tour into something really special!

Interesting tour, definitely a must in Tokyo!. We took the tour with Nori as a quick break during our business trip and it was definitely worth it! He is very gentle, friendly and offers an excellent immersion in the local culture, food, and fish market! Also, it is very convenient to take this tour since Nori has good connections with the local traders in the fish market, so you can get a very good impression even without waking up at 2 AM to see the tuna auction... we saw a melon auction and still interesting:) Definitely recommend!

We had an amazing time!. My son and I recently moved to Tokyo and hadn't quite had a "tourist" experience yet, so we signed up for the food tour when a friend came to town for a visit. It was excellent! Yu was funny and very knowledgable about the areas and he made it entertaining for my 8 year old son. We tasted an array of traditional Japanese foods and snack and even had a complete sushi lunch. My son was a bit taken back from the wasabi, but he was still able to enjoy himself. I would definitely recommend this tour for anyone wanting to know more about the amazing seafood that Tokyo has to offer. Next time we have friends in town, we will definitely go on this tour again.

Foodie tour through the Tsukiji Fish Market--excellent!!!. The three of us (myself, my hubby, and my dad) had a great time navigating though the Tsukiji fish market with our guides from Tokyo FooDrink Tours, Yu and Satoe. Without them, we would have had a tough time finding our way around, communicating with the different vendors, and understanding the auctions going on. Lots of food stops combined with info about the market, how it operates, and it's history. I have many food restrictions, and they worked tirelessly during the tour to ensure I had food to nibble on too....totally unnecessary but great service and much appreciated. Thanks for the excellent experience, Tokyo FooDrink Tours! We hope to come back soon for another tour! Definitely recommended as they give lots of personal attention to their guests and the groups are small making the whole experience pleasant.

Private Tour around Asakusa. We went on a private evening tour round Asakusa with Yu. Not having been to Tokyo before Asakusa is a great place to start, although quite touristy in many respects, it’s vibrant with a lot to see and eat and drink. We went to a wide variety of food and drink places, starting with the Asahi brewery. There’s a much wider variety of beers than we realised! One of the stops we really enjoyed was for Monja – a kind of omlette, you have a hot plate in front of you and you cook yourself. We would never have attempted to go into a place like this ourselves not speaking any Japanese at all.We also really enjoyed the stop at the Sake shop, not just sampling different varieties, but the owners were absolutely lovely and full of interesting information about sake.Yu was really good company for the evening, and it was great to have him to ourselves so we could ask many questions about Tokyo as well as how best to spend our time during our short stay. One of our favourite food tours out of about 6 or so that we've done in various countries recently.

Nori is No Weed!. My wife and I and our 2 teenage kids did a Tsukiji Fish Market Tour with Nori.We had a great morning wandering around the fish & vegetable market and the surrounding shopping areas. Nori was extremely knowledgable and an entertaining guide. I thought our kids may have got a bored but Nori was able to grab their attention for the full tour. The fact that he was constantly pushing food at them probably helped!!We all enjoyed the tour and the food options were plentiful and interesting. As well as the street food options (including the biggest oyster you have ever seen) we finished at a local sushi restaurant which was excellent.We tried many foods that we probably wouldn't have tried without Nori's guidance. Culturally and language wise Japan poses some challenges.We would highly recommend Nori & Tokyo FooDrink Tour.

Saw things I would not have seen on my own. Although not cheap, this tour was worth the 90,000 JPY.
