We got to see inside of fish market, melon auction, got to take pictures with tuna sword, and got sky view of Tsukiji and Tokyo bay. Food was generally interesting, whereas sushi was very tasty. I would recommend this to family and friends.

Fantastic way to spend a morning!. Overall the Tokyo Foodrink Tour of the Tsukiji Fish/Veg Market was fantastic. It was a great opportunity to try a number of different local street food dishes and have help to navigate the very busy market. The food we tried along the way was delicious, I particularly liked the japanese omelete on a stick. The sushi restaurant at the end was absolutely divine and probably my favourie sushi place of my Japan trip. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable and spoke very good English. Would definitely recommend.
Fantastic tour in Asakusa. We did the Asakusa food tour with Yu, who was very friendly and knowledgeable about Japan. A very enjoyable tour!

A must do while in Tokyo. As I approached the meeting area, I was met by Yu and his enthusiastic smile. Right then I knew the tour would be a happy experience. Yu didn't disappoint. I enjoyed an informative tour of the fish and veg markets. I was impressed with the variation of fish and the beauty and care taken with all food products by all of the good hard working at the markets. The cleanliness of each market along with our stroll down the three foodie streets were equally impressive. Yu knows his stuff and delivers interesting facts and without hesitation answers all questions. He his a good conversationalist and whole heartedly wants one to have an enjoyable time and sample loads of local foods - which we did - Yum! The length of the tour was spot on - three hours which allows one to visit yet another interesting and exciting area of Tokyo in the afternoon. Lastly, the tours was very good value for the price. Go!

Very enjoyable tour!. Yu san was an excellent guide :) This tour took me through enormous fish market making it fun and informative experience. Moreover I got to taste lots of different kind of food (there was even optional grasshopper for more adventurous ;)) I definitely recommend this tour :)

Informative Tokyo Food Introduction. This tour took us through the Tsukiji market. We wish we had taken this tour the first day we arrived because it offered a great introduction to the Tokyo food scene and our tour guide, Nori, was great! He even took time to take us through the market and helped us find unique products to purchase.

Excellent Tour with Great Food, People, and Fun!. This was my favorite tour in Tokyo! I loved this area. I was part of a small group of three with two guide, Yu-san and Yoko-san. They started the tour at the Tsukiji Hongan-Ji. Our guides started the tour right away, giving us information about anything and everything we asked on our way to the Market and during our walk through it. We went into the interior part of the market, which is not really allowed for the public, but our guide had connections that made it okay. There were vendors after vendors who were still hard at work. The large tuna fish was definitely a sight to see. The variety and quality of fish, fruits and vegetables was amazing and colorful!We also toured the outer market that is open to the public. Our guides walked us around, allowing us to stop and shop when we wanted, and took us to certain shops to try different foods. We had tamagoyaki that was so fluffy and delicious. We also had freshly made fish cakes, the freshest and largest raw oysters from Hokkaido, little samples of dried bonito, marinated clams, seaweed, tea, and sake. It was quite a fun and tasty experience. We ended the tour we a sushi lunch at a nearby place. It was all included in the tour. Overall, I had such a great time. I enjoyed talking to everyone on the tour. The guides Yu-san and Yoko-san were very friendly and informational. I'd probably do the tour again! I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking to explore the Tsukiji market. It's an excellent experience!

Great fun. Really enjoyed the long visit to the fish market with tastings as well as the optional visit to the nearby gardens. Having a guide made what could have been an overwhelming experience, great (we took our tour during a holiday in Japan). We were able to get permission to take pictures in the inner market which was a treat for me.

True Tokyo Experience. Had a great experience with our tour guide Yu. Taking this tour took you right into the heart of Tokyo's vibrant commerce. The fish market was a great experience. The amazing varieties of fish and produce was fascinating. Watching the different vendors sell their products was an education and very fun. We enjoyed food that we may not have tried on our own. Yu did a great job giving us the history of the area which included Shrines and Temples. We had a very fun time and ate wonderful local food. We left with a new understanding and appreciation of this lovely country and their traditions.

A must do!. This was a great tour! Without a guide we wouldn't have seen anywhere near as much as we saw and we got to go places we couldn't have gone on our own. We tasted different Japanese foods and saw different areas of the markets. A must do if visiting Japan!

Asuska Street food and drink tour. We booked the Asuska Street food and drink tour on short notice, and loved it. Our guide was Yu, a friendly and energetic guide who takes pride in showing off what locals eat and drink. We started with a beer tasting, and then a sake tasting. Then we hit the busy area around the Sensoji temple, and sampled food from a couple of small places. Yu took us to places we might never have tried, and we were very happy with the experience.

Exceeds my Expectation. It was an enjoyable morning from 8:30am to 12:30pm. I had learned so much from Noriko, not only about Japanese food and drink, but also about the special taste Umami. The walk was fun and educational. I loved everything that we had tasted and particularly the huge oyster. My mouth still waters as I think of it. DELICIOUS!! Noriko had also taught us to appreciate the differences in Shrines and temples in Japan. Now, when I look at pictures of a Japanese shrine or temple, I can tell if it is a Shinto shrine or a Buddhist temple. I can do the tour again with Noriko after the Tsukiji market moves to the new site. It is totally worthwhile.

Tsukiji fish market and locals street food tour. My wife and I stumbled upon this Food and drink tour while reading what to do in Tokyo. We read the description of both tours and decided that it was something fun to do since we didn't come with a tour. To our surprise, both the fish market and the local food tour were an amazing experience! Our tour guides Tae and Noriko were top notch in terms of showing us around and giving us the back ground and history of various locations. We definitely enjoyed the tour, but most of all the local food. Definitely a must, when visiting Tokyo.

Great tour (fish market). Even though we had visited the fish market by ourselves a year or two before, this was interesting. Went behind the scenes and the market tour was really great (so much amazing food).

Great insight to one of Tokyo's most exciting spots. My guide Yoshiko did a wonderful job pointing out all the different types of fish and produce at the market. I definitely don't think I would have tried as many foods and been as adventurous as I was without her there explaining what everything was. The tour was wonderful and one of the highlights of my trips!

Great Food Tour of the Famous Tsukiji Market. This tour was excellent. Our guide did a wonderful job of explaining how the market and local businesses functioned, while giving us some interesting history behind the formation and development of the market. The food choices and stops were also excelent with the stand-up sushi resteraunt being a particular favorite of the tour. Thank you Tokyo FooDrink Tour!

Fish Market Tour. Very cool experience and only in Japan. Our guide went above and beyond to make sure we had a great time. Tried a bunch of weird food and ate some of the best sushi I've had in Tokyo.

Great Introduction to Japan. My fiance and I were on our first trip to Japan and selected this tour group for our first day based on the great TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. We actually did 2 tours with this company.1. We signed up for the fish auction at Tsukiji Fish Market and it was just my fiance and myself met by Yu, one of the owners. As it was just the two of us, we received all of the attention! Yu is an excellent guide. He knew exactly how to get into the best part of the auction, where to eat immediately afterwards (we had some amazing sushi), and gave us a full tour of the inner market. We really got to see things we would have never seen on our own and the explanations were excellent. We also got an extra explanation of a Shinto shrine we passed by and got to learn some things about the religion and its practices I never would have picked up on.2. Later that day, we had another tour scheduled that was run by Yu and another guide, Tae. We had signed up for the Asuska Street Sweets tour and it was again, another private tour. Tae was as great of a guide as Yu so having both of them made this an awesome experience. We really saw so much in Asuska and learned so much about the area. We didn't just try food, we learned about the history or stories around some of them. Since it was just us, we were never pressured or rushed to do anything. Yu and Tae really went above and beyond to make sure we had an awesome day and stayed with us much longer than had been advertised.As if the awesome tours weren't enough, Yu remained in contact with me throughout my time in Japan. He was happy to give me restaurant suggestions (which led us to an excellent tempura restaurant) and if you really want to have an awesome few hours in Tokyo, definitely book a tour with Tokyo FooDrink!

Wonderful Start to Tokyo. My wife and I both love sushi in the states and knew that we had to find our way to Tsukiji while in Tokyo.Our guide, and co-owner, was Umito. We found him to be very warm and friendly and he did a great job breaking the ice with the group (there was a total of four of us). We found that starting our first trip to Japan with a guided tour was extremely helpful in learning some basics of the customs and culture and greatly aided in our ability to wander around by ourselves for the rest of the trip. Highly recommend this tour for the experience itself as well as interacting with a very friendly and knowledgeable local in Umito.

A great day. My husband and I went in the street food tour with Naoko and Yu. It was a group of 5 with made it fun. We visited a traditional street where food is made and purchased by local families. The street was 1.6kms long and we would never had found this. Great information and heaps of food. All very yummy. This tour comes highly recommended

excellent tour of Tsukiji fish market. This was a fun and educational tour with great tasting samples and excellent guide, Yuriko. Great way to spend a morning. Interesting for foodies and people interested in learning more about this important part of Japan economy and culture. Fun for both adults and kids.

A Great Way to Taste Japan!. An exceptional experience! This is an excellent way to taste Japan with a personal touch. I was happily in food heaven the entire tour. Great staff. Great food. A fun way to meet new people that appreciate the wonderful things Japan has to offer. Well done FooDrink Tour! Kudos to Nori for a wonderful experience. Much much love <3

No Better Way to Experience the Food and Atmosphere of the Fish Market!. We arrived in Tokyo knowing that we needed to explore the Tsukiji Fish Market. Thankfully, we opted for this tour rather than trying to tackle it on our own. Yu and Fumiko gracefully guided us through the bustling and noisy market filled with incredible sounds, smells and sights! We learned the inner workings of the fish market; how it is run, the amount of people and fish that make their way through it, and what the future of the fish market holds. We saw sea creatures (big and small) from all over the world, and were impressed with how many of the fish vendors Yu had relationships with! The most impressive though were the massive tuna. The first half of the tour filled our minds with information, and the second half filled our bellies with delicious treats! We ate eggs, fish balls, oysters, bonito and just about every snack that lined the shops of the outer market. Yu was so knowledgeable about all of the offerings of the outer market, and where to go to get the best things to eat. We enjoyed the sake tasting and the special traditional souvenir sake cups! The perfect ending to the tour was the full meal of sushi. We devoured the fresh and tender pieces of raw fish at a nearby sushi restaurant. Everything about this tour was perfectly executed. From the meeting place, to the tastings, to the information, to the secret view of the market. A trip to Tokyo would not be complete without a FooDrink Tour.

Great morning activity. Was lucky enough to be part of a very small tour group - just one other couple with me and my husband. We had lots of personal interaction with our guides, and had a great time navigating the fish market, visiting a temple and a shrine along the way, and eating lunch together once we were done. A bit expensive but lots of taste tests included, and lunch is also covered as part of the experience. Highly recommended!

Fantastic tour!. This is a must-do in Tokyo, especially if it is your first time to Tsukiji market. Michiko was a wonderful guide, so knowledgeable and kind. My husband and I were the only two people on the tour and we really enjoyed our time with her! We learned so much about the market, and got to try some great food along the way. The sushi lunch at the end of the tour was fabulous!! You can stop looking, just book with this company :)

Fish market tour. A great way to first meet a city.Would recommend going on the first few days in Japan since that knowing the things they show and teach you will make the remainder of your trip better.

A very FUN and AMAZING Tsukiji Market Tour. The tour was organized, filled with great information regarding the Japanese culture and amazing food samples! Our guide, Noriko-san, was very friendly and so much fun! She took great care of our group and ensure that everything was okay with us. She even walked us back when we didn't know where to go. I would really recommend the tour to my friends who are visiting Tokyo in the future. Thank you and keep up the good work!

Heritage with taste. Our trip went smoothly with a great guide who took us to great shops excelling in their Japanese food.It was nice to discover how families prepare and eat their meals.There was enough to eat to call it a meal and enough variety to make it a delight.

Highly recommended for food lovers!. Our guide, Eriko, did a great job taking us on this tour. The marked would have been very difficult for foreigners to really experience (non-japanese speakers). You will learn a lot from this tour, and Eriko is very experienced.

AMAZING!. Noriko was an amazing and knowledgable tour guide. She was informative at almost every turn! She made the fish market tour a real highlight of our trip, and we found ourselves missing her when it was over :) I highly recommend doing this tour, it's absolutely worth the money. We will definitely see her again the next time we visit Tokyo! Domo arigato gozaimasu, Noriko :)

Very interesting and organised day out.. The day was really well organised - the communication beforehand was good and it was easy to find the meeting point. The host spoke excellent English and throughout the whole trip told us many interesting things about Japan and its cuisine.After a short bus trip we toured a traditional shopping street, stopping several times to sample the offerings, including a tea tasting and talk. All of the foods were very nice, but the key part of the day out is it is an opportunity to find more about the food and how they are used and be able to shop in a way that would be difficult without any Japanese language skills.We were also told about and shown around places near to the street that were not immediately about the food.Best done at the start of a holiday to give you an introduction to Japanese food and to give you a bit of confidence when ordering in the future. It was all done excellently. We left with full tummies and full brains, and eager to try more Japanese foods.

Highly recommended. Naoko was our tour guide and everything was absolutely fantastic. We did the Sunamachi food tour, an excellent journey into a little-known part of Tokyo, and ate some of the best foods I have eaten in Japan. A great value for the price, and we will be back to do the Tsukiji fish market tour.

Tsukiji Tour. Eriko was an awesome guide! Very knowledgeable about the entire area. We were about 20 minutes late and was surprised to see her still waiting for us at the meeting spot. She was very patient with us and took us into both the inner and outer market. She would also help us to order foods that we saw along the way. I think the tour could be improved by changing the menu. The fish cake and sushi were not that good. This is just my own opinion however. It may be better to find another sushi shop, even if they must charge a slightly higher price. Overall a great way to spend a morning in Tokyo.

A Must-Do Tour for any Foodie. Nori was our food guide and we had a fabulous personal tour by him of the world-famous Tsukiji Fish Market inner and outer markets. Our group size was just three and apparently maximum tour group size is five. When one sees the narrow walkways and aisles in the Inner Market, it makes a lot of sense to limit group size. Nori showed us areas of the market we never would have found on our own. We really enjoyed seeing a 70 kg tuna being expertly carved up for an auction winner from just maybe 5 feet away. We also saw an auction for melons (yes, they auction for those pricey melons too). Nori shared interesting insights like the rock-hard hardness of a dried bonito fish (process takes 6 months) and the cost of one of the large tuna sword like knife (1.5 million yen). Besides the wife and I, we were hooked up with a pleasant young man from Duesseldorf, Germany. It was a very interesting 3.5 hour walking tour with a full and very good sushi lunch at end of the tour. Note that the rest of the food menu are more or less street food samplings (omelet, dried bonito, oyster, fish cake, fried octopus, green tea, and sake), so be prepared to not have a regular meal until about 12:30pm if tour starts at 8:30am. All in all, a very good tour and value for the price and we are very glad we had a free day from our Japan group tour to do this "on our own".

Great way to see the market. Helpful guide Nori took us around the market today. Group consisted of guide, trainee, and two other visitors to Tokyo. Nori helped us to understand the workings of the inner market and then we sampled the goods of the outer market (including sake!). I have been to Tsukiji before without a tour guide but this was much more meaningful. The sushi lunch at the finish was delicious! Would highly recommend this tour (well worth your time and money) and will check out their other tours the next time we are in Japan.

Great way to spend the day. Nori, our guide was extremely friendly and knowledgable. We had a great time experiencing Tsukiji market amongst many other parts around town. Very much recommend booking it for your next trip to Tokyo

Wonderful tour with wonderful guide. We went on the fish market tour and the street food tour. Both Yu and Nariko were fantastic - very warm, enthusiastic and knowledgeable. We almost cancelled the street food tour because it didn't seem to be a "must do" in Tokyo. But it was the most fun thing we did on our trip! Do it!

Really gets you deep into the market!. My fiancé and I really enjoyed our tour with Fumito- she was so friendly and was always pointing out interest in things/ explaining traditional Japanese foods to us.We got quite deep into the centre of the market and was also able to take some cool photos as Fumito asked permission for us (lots of the stalls say no!)Grab a snack before you go as the food tasting is more towards the end.Fumito also sent us some extra pictures after the tour that she had taken of us. We would definitely recommend!
Tokyo Foodrink tour. Had a great time on our tour. We loved exploring the inner fish market and our guide Eriko answered all our questions promptly.

Excellent trip. I highly recommend this tour. Be prepared we walked about 4 miles in the three and a half hours without a rest. But, the tour was fascinating, our guide was personable, informative and helpful.

Cultural fun!. A great way to taste and view the local culture of the 80 year old Tokyo Fish Market. FRESH, very fresh seafood, oysters, sushi. And so much more! Our guide Nori was very sweet, fun, and knowledgeable.

Very complete and delicious tour of the world's largest fish market. A comprehensive tour of Tsukiji, including the fish market, the vegetable market, and neighboring shops. Adding the various taste sensations really brings the experience together. So glad we went and let Tokyo FooDrink Tour show us and explain things we would never have seen.

Great walking tour of Tsukiji markets. I am so pleased that I joined this walking tour - we ventured into parts of the fish market that I would not have done on my own and had a wonderful guide who provided a very personalised tour with just 3 of us in the group. Really terrific, interesting tour with an excellent Sushi lunch to finish.

Excellent, fun experience. Our tour guide, Nori, was fun, well versed and a pleasure to spend time with. He guided is as we explored the entire fish market, learned about all the fish and how things work. The tour of the market followed by a tour of the shopping district. So good to have a chance to learn in English what is in the market and then he capped the tour with a world class sushi luncheon. Best part of my time in Tokyo!

Insights into Tsukiji Fish Market. Awesome tour of the fish market. Noriko was a great guide offering insights and interesting facts about the fish market and its operation. Whilst we weren't keen on getting up early enough for the Tuna auction we still got to see an auction and she explained what sort of crazy prices some things were going for! There is no way we would have found parts of the market or understood the intricacies without Noriko. We also got to try some amazing and some interesting food!

Tsukiji Fish Market Tour. I liked the tour because- The market is quite busy and large. A tour guide knows where she is going and about the working of the market. Our tour guide Noriko brought us through the inner (for workers) and outer (for buying food) market. -It's easy to miss streets and stalls. Going with the tour ensured that we had the full Tsukiji experience. - Our guide was knowledgeable and provided local insight such as things a Japanese family or housewife would eat or do with items in the market.-Our guide was thoughtful and friendly. When my boyfriend mentioned that he didn't eat oysters, she was able to help us find another food option without trouble. She answered all of our questions and even took the time to email our photos to us :) We had a great time and recommend this tour.

Tour of Fish Market. The tour of the fish market was a great experience! I would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Tokyo. My guide not only gave a tour of the fish market itself, but also the nearby temple and outer market. It was a great learning experience!

Tsukiji Fish Market Tour. We had an amazing guided tour with Michiko on 8/28/15. She met us near the market to give us an overview of the tour we would be getting that morning, then she led us on a 4 hour journey through the inner and outer markets of Tsukiji. We were able to try many different foods, and if we wished, she would assist us in buying souvenirs and snacks from local vendors. She was very knowledgeable and fun to be around. At the end we had a sushi lunch in a local restaurant that we would have never found without Michiko. She took some pictures during the tour and sent them to us later in the day. Highly recommend this tour, and Michiko as your guide. Tsukiji is definitely a must see in Tokyo!!!

Tokyo fish market tour. . We had a brilliant time with Musami our guide. A walking talking 4hours with little tastes along the way. Finished with amazing sushi lunch in our small group. Great value too.

Tsukiji fish market tour. We had a fabulous guided tour of the inner and outer market with Nori. We had an opportunity to sample a variety of foods, learned about the market and enjoyed and amazing sushi lunch. This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Japan. Highly recommended!

Lovely tour; tour guide was great. Nori, our guide, was awesome. Friendly, well informed, patient, and willing to help. We asked him for dinner reservations and he even called the restaurant and made reservations for us. My friend loves ramen and udon - Nori did not remember names of the restaurants but promised to send a list via email. And as promised, he sent a detailed email with recommendations. Fantastic service. As far as the tour is concerned, it was great. This is not something I recommend you do by yourself ( the market is huge and you would lose out on some of the background provided by the tour guide). Given that it's the largest fish and vegetable market in terms of size and daily trade volumes, it's worth a visit. The sushi lunch at the end of the tour was fantastic. We were lucky to be seated in the back room and be served by the head chef. That was definitely the highlight of the tour for me. We had a great conversation with the chef and the sushi was excellent. Thank you Nori!!

The Foodie's Food Tour!. My daughter and I stumbled on Tokyo FooDrink Tour the night before our flight left for Japan. We we lucky to be able to book the Sunamachi Food Tour on such short notice! We were very excited to try all of the different foods that were listed on the menu and let me tell you that it did NOT disappoint!! There is no better way to experience culture than through food that these specialty vendors have been making for over 40 years!! Everything was absolutely delicious and made with such dedication and pride. Our guide Yu hand picks each vendor so you know you are trying the BEST of BEST. He was so friendly, accommodating and a wealth of information. If you are looking for any tours in Tokyo, no need to look any further, book them, you won't be sorry!!☺️

Three Cheers!. We took three tours (on different days) with Tokyo FooDrink Tours: Tsukiji Fish Market with Hamarikyu Garden, Asakusa & Kitchen Goods Street Food, and Sunamachi Local Shopping Street. This was a great way to experience a wide variety of Japanese food and drink. All three tours were well-paced with plenty of time to take photos and ask questions. The Tsukiji Fish Market Tour with Eriko was an exploration of the inner and outer market with stops for trying foods like Japanese omelet, fresh oyster, fish cakes, and more, before taking in a view of the whole market. We then had lunch at a stand-up sushi place before heading over to Hamarikyu Garden for matcha and a sweet. The Asakusa & Kitchen Goods Street Foods Tour with Yoshiko and Fumito started at a craft beer place next to Asahi Beer Hall and then moved on to Senosji Temple and the area around it for treats such as sweet potato ice cream (superlative), miso, rice cakes, and more, before meandering through ‘kitchen town’, stopping on ‘pub street’ for some burdock fries and ending with ordering ramen from a vending machine (super yummy). The Sunamachi Local Shopping Street with Noriko and Yu, was a true off-the-radar experience on a narrow street filled with shops and food stalls. Here we experienced tempura, yakitori, sake, minced cutlet (yummy), learned to make green tea, had some sort of rice with clams at a very busy stall…We were glad we took these tours; Tokyo is very confusing and most places have little if any information in English or staff who speak English. After these tours we felt orientated enough to go out on our own. Oh, and great way for teens to experience Tokyo— who doesn't love food!

Great fun. We really enjoyed the tour. We were joined with 2 other people so we were 4 in total. We met up at 8.15 and with a bit of introduction then the tour started. Our lovely tour guide is Noako. She kept us entertain and making sure we are ok and happy throughout the tour.The tour started with introduction of the area before we proceed inside the market ... fist stop was the famous Japanese omelet on a stick ... sweet omelet so definitely a unique taste. In the same area there are several of Japanese restaurants serving fresh sushi/ sashimi ... you better be prepared to wait and wait and wait to get your turn though!Next we proceed through vegetables market ....high quality vegetables then see the melons auction.We then proceed through the main fish market ... amazing place to experience. Definitely the biggest fish market in the world. Throughout the tour Naoko provided us with the information and knowledge which was great.Then we proceed to a vantage point and have a nice overview of the market and you could see how big the place is.We then start walking through small streets outside the market ... tasting "dried bonito" ... "Japanese tea" ... fresh oyster .... fried fish cake .... sake. Then we finish off the tour with a nice sushi meal in one of the restaurant just outside the market.This is the last year the fish market will be there ... next year the whole place will be moved and the space will be occupied by new media center for the up coming Olympics!!The tour definitely was great fun and it's definitely worth it.Once again, thanks to Naoko for the fun time.

an adventure outside the beaten path. We enjoyed it very much to get a special look into the Japanese street kitchens. No tourists but many locals. Our guide has a great knowledge and was very nice. We had lots of fun! A very good way to discover something special in Tokyo. The tour price is fair! Thank you so much!

Amazing tour of Tsukiji Market and Shibuya. We had a fantastic time on the Tskuiji Fish Market and Food tour! Our guide, Eriko, was very informative, friendly and passionate about showing us around Tsukiji Market and the Shibuya area.All the food was excellent! I'm glad we didn't eat breakfast beforehand since there was plenty to eat. With our guide we were able to see many things we never would have discovered, meet many of the local merchants, and take photos where nobody else was allowed. We also learned so much about the local culture.Even though our plans changed at the last minute, they were extremely accommodating!We wish we had had more time to see more tours with Tokyo FooDrink. I highly recommend!

Fish-tastic tour. Indepth tour of the fish market, especially behind the scenes and history. We wanted to get a concise tour as we had time constraints and this suited our requirements. Our tour guide Yuriko was informative, courteous and highlighted the various foods amidst the market. She has a good rapport with the local people enabling us to look around.

Very good tour. Took this tour as we were worried we would be lost on our own at the fish market.. We were right! I felt very happy as we were taken care of soooo well from our guide. Sayoko met us in front of a temple and had a bottle of water for us as it was hot that day. She took us through the fish market and some shrines explaining it all. We tried some very good food and Sayoko went above and beyond the call of duty to makes us feel happy. The sushi at the end was delicious as well. Thank you!

Fantastic tour of Tsukiji Market and surrounding area!. This tour was outstanding. It was our first day in Tokyo and was a fantastic start to a 4-day visit. Great orientation to the area. Lots of excellent food - a good variety finished off with a great sushi lunch at an authentic, fresh stand-up sushi bar near the outer market. Tried fresh oyster, fish cake, maguro tuna, sake and other surprises along the way. Yu and Fumiko were excellent guides. Very attentive and worked very hard to ensure we didn't miss anything and no question went unanswered. Fumiko took the extra time to ensure we got onto the right train to go visit our next stop Asakusa... I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the inner workings of the Tsukiji Market and to get some good inside knowledge from some very nice locals.
Great insights into the heart of the fish market!. Took a Tsukiji Fish market tour with Nori. His insights and knowledge about the place made this a truly recommandable and enjoyable experience!

Fresh seafood at its best!. We had a wonderful time exploring the fish market, getting to know many interesting facts about seafood and other food in Tokyo. I would highly recommend to take a guided tour at Tsukiji fishmarket, because it is a little crowded and you wouldn`t know where to go. Our tourguide Nori was very friendly and open to our wishes and took good care of us, he speaks English fluently. We were looking for Maguro Yaki (fish shaped pie with icecream and red bean paste) which was not on the menu, Nori took us to the outer market where we could buy it. The food that has been offered was really fresh and tasty, the sushi was prepared right in front of our eyes. After the tour, Nori sent us some pictures he took during the tour and he also gave us advice about how to get to Mt. Fuji.

Excellent tour in Tokyo. This was truly a great experience - I booked two consecutive tours: the fish market tour and the Tsukiji food tour. Yu was a knowledgeable guide who spoke English very well and knew many local places that you would normally miss as a tourist. I really enjoyed the fish auction tour as well as the food tour - highly recommended!

No visit to Tokyo is complete until you experience this!. The highlight of our family trip to Japan was by far the Fish Market Tour with Tokyo FooDrink Tour. Naoko and co-owner Fumito was so kind enough to take the 5 of us through the hustle and bustle of this very famous market. After the first stop at Daisada for smooth egg omlette we could see the passion in Naoko. The Fish Market is her bread and butter and both Fumito and Naoko showed us to all of their favourite vendors both within the main markets and outside in the public areas. Highlights were seeing the queues line up for the famous sushi shops, Yamato and Sushi Dai and also seeing Mr Sasaki San work his magic preparing the freshest and finest seafood. If you had one tour to choose from in all of Japan, this would have to it! Thank you again Naoko and Fumito for such a memorable day.

Terrific tour of Tsukiji and tasting experience!. If you want to see Tsukiji and taste all manner of local delicacies, book this tour! Yu and Toyo were terrific guides and navigated us through the maze of the markets, stopping to introduce certain foods and vendors and explain the whole system. They were very hands on and informative and friendly and brought us to great stalls, some out of the way you wouldn't find yourself. All in all, a great way to see the market. Highly recommended!Thanks Yu and Toyo!!!!

It was a great evening entertainment!!!. M friend and me loved this tour. Yoshika and Yuu really welcomed us very warmly. We got a bit more an idea of the culture. They showed us also to make a wish at the Sensoji Shrine. When we had questions and were looking for something particular they were also very helpful and flexibel. We had a wonderful time and the food and drinks were reall good. THANKS

A great tour in and around Asakusa!!. I loved it!This is the best of my best experiences of touring a city with a local guide. Yu is a fun person to be with and he was very kind and friendly. He knows the place very well and he certainly has studied and done researches by reading and going around himself before. He did answer most of my questions. It was a very informative tour, very personal and very entertaining. Informative: I think it is the best way to get to know a city for the first time(s). Because Tokyo is just huge! An experienced local guide would be a great start.Personal: Yu has been living in this city, around Asakusa, for 25 years. He goes to Temples and Shrines, drinks beer cycling around. It would be a good friend to have in everyday life. He loves sweets (I think so.... ;)... )Entertaining: Japanese are not traditionally funny, except on the TV. But he does have a sense of humour while being very friendly and humble. He knows some fun routes, which I personal enjoy, for example, the cute Kappa street and Kitchen goods street. This will stay in my memory about Tokyo! And thank you very much for joining me for an Asahi beer at the end!!Best,Li

Very interesting. We saw more than we would have seen by ourselves! Great to have a private guide through the fish market and around all of the local food "trucks" around the town. Very knowledgable guide and worth it!

Great way to see the market. We spent the day with Michiko and Yu, two great guides that makes a good team. We are all beginners of japaneese food and tought this was a great way to try some different types of food. Tour of the fish market was great, but a lot of the food tasting is free samples as snacks, nuts, dried fish etc. Included in the tour is japaneese omelette, sake, tea, oyster (not for the faint hearted) and sushi lunch in the end of the tour. The oyster came a it as a chock, its crazy huge and raw and Im afraid the guide had to help us eat them all up. In the end of the tour we all went to a great sushi resturant, but it was crowded and we had to eat while my parents where waiting outside. So the highlight of the tour, as my parent where having sushi for the first time was a bit caotic, when they finally got two seats it was in the far end of the resturant and we where not able to talk to each other. (It would probably be a good idea that the tour makes table reservations for the group in advance)Overall this is a great way to spend a day, but remember if you are a "first timer" on japanese food to be very clear with the guides that you might not be able to eat everything that is served.

Great tour and friendly guides.. The tour was taken by a Japanese guide named Inari. He was very friendly and his English was good.Unfortunately two of our group got lost on the way and came late (we had already started). The owner of the tours came and collected these two and helped them catch up, therefore we didn't have to stop and wait. We all caught up at the end of walking through the vegetable and fish markets. I thought this was great of the tour group so that everyone got the experience they were expecting without needing to wait/skip things.I read a previous review about the amount of food, well we had the opposite (an American guy mentioned 4/5 times he was annoyed he'd eaten breakfast). I think I would eat something small before this tour but if you are hungry / thirsty / need to go to the toilet I suggest you ask the leader as we did a few times and they will cater for you. We had a couple of unexpected stops due to people in the group asking for things.It's tough at these types of markets to get past your preconceived thoughts of what the quality of food might be like based on the look of it or the shop selling it (this is where a guide comes in handy). I am not the best with stomaching things at the best of times, I ate everything on this tour and had no issues. The highlight was the LARGEST oyster I have ever seen and it was simply delicious!!! Get a second even if you need to pay.The sushi restaurant at the end was amazing. There was no 3 hour line like the shops we saw in the market and I have no doubt we were eating the same / very similar food.The tour was great, I highly recommend this and the guides were both very friendly. Enjoy.

Eat First! It's Not a Food Tour.. We thought this was truly a food tour and every other food tour we have been on, you eat from start to end, learning about the place as you go from food to food. We started the tour with the Japanese omelet and it was very tasty. But after that the food ended... for hours. Since we were expecting this to be a usual food tour, we didn't eat breakfast. Huge mistake! The fish market was incredible and we really enjoyed it. So glad we went. But, by the time we finished looking through the market, we were so hungry that I actually felt shaky from the heat and lack of food. We thought that after the market was over the real eating would begin... not so much. There is a good amount of taste testing FREE samples, but not much to fill very hungry bellies. I'm sure I would have enjoyed this portion of the tour if we all weren't getting cranky from being so hungry.Then Finally! We got to the food. The sushi place at the end was delicious! But don't take the tour thinking that it is a food tour. It's not. Lunch at the end doesn't make something a food tour. And several things listed on the "menu" are free samples. Yes there are a few snacks in between, but that still doesn't make it a food tour.Did I enjoy the tour? Yes. Would I do it again? Yes, if I ate first.

Best thing we did in Tokyo . We were only in Tokyo for a few days but I was told that the fish markets were a must. We decided to book a tour late the night before but the company replied within a short period confirming our booking. We met with our guide Nori (seaweed in english which he told us we could call him) outside a temple near the markets we were a bit early so he told us to wait in the air conditioned temple to get out of the heat while he waited for the other couple on the tour, which was extremely thoughtful of him.Nori was great. He was really friendly and had a lot of knowledge of the markets. The markets were huge and without Nori I imagine we would have just wondered round aimlessly and missed most of the sights. He also provided heaps of interesting information that we would never have known. The markets themselves are a sight to behold. They are huge and there are so many people going about their daily business. I felt like I was getting in the way a bit but the locals seemed to tolerate the tourists and Nori did his best to keep us out of the way. It really was an amazing sight seeing these markets in full flight. After the markets we wondered the stalls in the outer markets and tried so many different things, like fresh oysters, fried fish cakes, sake, dried bento and cooked and raw tuna. This was an experiential in itself and really interesting. The tour ended with some sushi at a local sushi store. This included much more than I expected and on top of all the other foods we had tried we didn't bother with lunch after this. I'm not a huge raw fish fan but this was delicious and a great way to end the tour. In all I thought this was a great way to experience the fish markets. They are an amazing place and Nori did a great job of ensuring that we made the most of the experience. I couldn't recommend this company enough.
Great. The tour guide was very friendly and spoke great English! Tour was very informative, would recommend to anyone

Fish Market Tour - up close and personal with our future sushi. We did the morning fish market tour. It was a very fun tour where we ventured into the heart of the fish market and saw all the workings of the fish industry in Japan. This tour is not for the faint of heart, as you will see fish in ways you have never seen them before. We then sampled lots of street food samples (grasshopper included) and had several dishes (omelet, oyster, sushi, and sake). There is a surprise after the sake, which was really cool (I wont spoil it for others). The tour guides were owners of the company. You could tell they were owners because they were very passionate and excited about the tour. They took good care of us and planned a nice structured itinerary, with water and a bathroom break. The tour met about 30 minutes from our hotel via the metro and we got lost on the metro on our way out there. We arrived a half-hour late to the tour and we emailed the tour company telling them we got lost. They responded immediately and dispatched a second tour guide, Yu, to rush over on bike and meet us. That was really really nice of the tour company. Overall, a very up close and personal tour of the fish market from very passionate tour guides, with interesting food and a nice surprise souvenir at the end. I don’t think you can truly experience and understand this massive fish market without a tour like this!
Yummy tour. No better way to collide history culture and great food. I had a great time with the tour guide really seeing how the food and economy of Japan work.

Food tour. This tour started with the tour at the Tsukiji hongwanji where we met our guides Noriko and Yu; with whom I visited the Tsukiji fish market and Asakusa Area. The tour is excellent with personalized interactions (small group 4 people) and we tasted the japanese omelet, dried bonito, sake, fresh sushi, fried fish cake and "the freshest oyster" I ever had in my life. The guides are very friendly, knowledgable, patient, respectful and helpful. If you are in holidays or in business trip and you want to have a flavor of the Japanese culture; this is the choice

Fun & Food!. It was great walking into Tsukiji market, seeing peculiar things--such as the auction of melons. Who would have thought they could be so intense about it? We of course ate all sorts of things, including free samples from the shops. We had a grand time. And Yumi was a wonderful guide.

Best way to see Tsukiji Market. Yu and his team are the absolute best. Friendly, knowledgeable and gracious.We had a lot of luggage with us, Yu went out of his way to find us storage lockers and get us change for the lockers. He asked questions all along the way to see what things we might have special interest in and put special emphasis on those things. You could tell people around the market liked him. When we came across shops/stalls that my friends and I really liked, Yu was very patient with us.Tsukiji market is actually really big and maze-like. The local shopkeepers don't seem to really like the tourists so going with this Tour is really your best choice, especially for first timers. Highly recommend.

Excellent Food Tour. “This may be your last chance to see the markets in this location”, our guide, Nori told us today. After about eighty years at Tsukiji, the Tokyo Metropolitan Central Wholesale Market is moving at the end of next year to make way for a venue for the Olympic Games, being held in Tokyo in 2020.Although it’s often said one of the “must do” things about Tokyo is to get up early (three or four in the morning) and to line-up to witness the excitement of the seafood auction at the market, that’s not really “my kind of thing”. But I do love food, and I love learning about the culture of a country through food, and so I booked to take part in the Tsukiji Fish Market Food Tourhttp://tomodachitravel.com/tsukiji-fish-market-food-tourOver the course of three and a half hours (starting at 8.30am), we wandered around the markets, and tasted dried bonito, Japanese tea, fresh oysters, fried fish cake, sake, and also witnessed the art involved in making Japanese omelettes. And I learned so much on this tour. I never knew, for example, fish with bigger eyes were the ones which you’re most likely to found in deeper water (though of course it makes total sense). I’d also never seen the wasabi plant before, and noted when I shared the photograph earlier today on social media, many others hadn’t either. The tour ended with sushi at a stand-up restaurant called Chiyoda Sushi.http://www.chiyoda-sushi.co.jp/There are quite a few of them around Tokyo, and Nori described them as places where you can obtain good sushi at reasonable prices. I thought it was probably the best sushi I’ve had in my life, to be honest.Nori was a really great guide: knowledgeable, friendly, and with a sense of humour. He told us he also worked as a part-time primary school teacher, and was a member of the Japanese defence force, and so he was also very good at keeping us on track, and stopped us from getting run over in the hustle and bustle of the market. I also think it helped our group was small: only four people, a Chinese woman, a stay at home mum who home-schools from Singapore with a real passion for Japanese food; and a young couple from the United States, with a young child, and with a passion for travel and food also.At 9,000 yen (about $90 AUD), I thought the tour was excellent value and would highly recommend it to you.I have shared some photographs on my blog. http://jamesobrien.id.au/2015/07/22/tsukiji-and-sunset/

So much fun and information. Naoko was a fabulous tour guide. With her guidance we saw areas not open to the public, tasted many new and yummy things.....Japanese omelet is so delicious. We were even able to watch it be prepared. Loved her advice as to where to eat like the locals. And even though we already enjoyed sushi she brought us new knowledge and proper techniques. Well worth the $$ and time spent.
Well worth the time.. Enjoyed the Tsukiji fish market tour. It was well organized, eye opening and a good start into Japanese culture. Yu is very friendly and easy to work with. Well worth the time.

Insightful visit to Tokyo's Tsukiji market - Do not miss. The Tokyo Food and Drink Tsukiji tour was extremely illustrative and allowed us to experience first hand the different things that Tsukiji has to offer. This is a very interesting and ample market although it is hard to understand what to do, where to go and what to get if you do not go with some who speaks japanese and understand the nuances of the market. Had me and my wife gone on our we wouldn't have been able to get such level of depth in our 3.5 hour visit. At the end we had a sushi course menu which was the best sushi I have ever had. Yoshika did an excellent job managing the tour. She spoke good English and was very respectful and professional. I highly recommend this tour.

Personalized service at its best. I was late and actually missed my tour of Tsukiji market. Yu, the guide and owner, was extremely courteous in trying to contact me to see what happened and even gave me another tour which ended up being a private tour. I think this is beyond the standard even for Japan. I think the company really tries to be hospitable to foreigners and take great pride in making their tours phenomenal. The private tour of Shinjuku was interesting and educational and I think I would have rated the Tsukiji tour equally high.

Tsukiji and Sunamachi Tours. My wife and I did the Tsukiji and Sunamachi tour and we couldn't be happier with the decision to do this tour!First was the Tsukiji tour with Nori-san and Yu-san. We wanted to get a true feeling of the market, the vendors, and the general layout of the place, and these two guides really helped us understand Tsukiji in a way that you wouldn't if you were to go by yourself. It can be a VERY intimidating place on your own, but having Nori-san and Yu-san guide us around was fantastic! You can tell that Yu-san, which is the owner of the company, takes a lot of consideration to the places you visit and the vendors you meet. It's clear that they've established relationships with some of the vendors to allow us to take the time to talk with the vendors and appreciate what they do. The bits of food at every stop was delicious, which included Tamago (egg omelette), fresh oyster, sake, and sushi.Next, we went to the Sunamachi shopping street (one of the biggest in Tokyo). It's a very local area that would probably be missed by many tourists if you weren't directly told about it. The market is frequented by locals that are looking to grab a meal, groceries, snacks, or general shopping, so it really gives you a feel of the life of an average resident. It's also a really nice break from the crowds of central Tokyo since it's farther out from the center and you don't see many tourists there at all.However, what really made this tour memorable was how flexible Yu-san was to the detours we wanted to take. We walked by a Kimono/Yukata store in Sunamachi and my wife wanted to buy a yukata. Yu-san was kind enough to help with the translation, and stick around for extra time while the shop owner tailored the yukata for my wife which took around 45 minutes. Thank you very much Yu-san!Tips for the tours: Don't feel shy to go into the shops, try some food that isn't part of their planned itinerary, and pick up souvenirs and whatnot along the way. The guides are more than happy to help out. Also, when visiting Tsukiji, wear closed toe shoes. There are lots of heavy machinery and water flying everywhere, so protect your feet with actual shoes.I highly recommend going on these tours!

Amazing Tour. We visited Tokyo for the first time and enjoyed the atmosphere of what we thought was Tokyo. Yu and Michiko showed us around Tsukiji and the history about it. We were extremely satisfied with their knowledge and hospitality. I highly recommend everyone to take a tour with Tokyo FooDrink. It was the highlight of our trip.

More than I expected. The directions to the meeting place were dead on. I didn't know if I was going to be alone or with a large group but ended up with the guide and two couples. I was happy with the numbers. Our guide Eriko San was very sweet. Her English quite fluent allowing me to have a good understanding of what was going on. She was very knowledgable of the area and could explain what we were seeing. She was attentive and explained things as we went along. Her patience impressed me as I tend to want to stay and try different things, which I was able to do as I pleased. She walked is through Tsukiji fish market which is chaotic and dangerous for someone not familiar-definitely don't wear sandals or flip flops to that place. We made it out safely, explored the fruit market, visited some shops ( I bought a fantastic all purpose kitchen knife with my name engraved in Kanji) and ended up in this unpretentious looking sushi place not far from the market. The place is standing room only and very small which can be challenging after walking so much beforehand but i'm always game for something knew. Well it didn't disappoint. We had some head chefs and trainee (this location if i remember correctly serves as training locale for young sushi chefs) who graciously allowed us to take pictures. I've had sushi before but this exceed my expectations ...... Exactly what I was hoping for, eating sushi in Japan. Everything was good and I wanted more but was surprisingly full after the plate I had. This place gets busy fast and is very popular so don't expect to sit and chat afterwards as more customer are waiting to be seated.After this, we went to Hamarikyu garden where we had macha cold tea ( it was ridiculously hot) and some traditional sweets, sitting on tatami mats. We also walked along the perimeter and I pleasantly chatted with Eriko San who explained the history behind the garden. She made sure I was keeping hydrated as it was a scorcher that day.I had a very pleasant day overall and would do it again.If you are looking for something low key to do, book this tour-it's worth it and very affordable.

A wonderful trip at Tsukiji!. I have already been to Tsukuji in Tokyo several times, but this is the first time that I went there with professional tour guide. Since most of the travel guidebooks introduce similar schedule recommendations, I was really surprised by some mysterious places where I’ve never been before during the trip with Tokyo FooDrink Tour. I think one of the specialties of their tour would be the small group; one tour guide takes only 4 people. While walking along the streets, the tour guide explained lots of interesting Japanese culture to us, and he also answered any of our questions. In addition, just as the tour name, we tried a variety of traditional Japanese food and drinks. My friends and I really impressed by the tour plan and the hospitality of the tour guide a lot! I strongly recommend you to travel with Tokyo FooDrink Tour people, and I believe that you will have an amazing trip with them, too.

Great Experience. We met the founder of the company upon arrival and he was extremely warm, nice, and welcoming. He was very organized as well. Our guide spoke great English and we went on the tour with one other couple from the U.S., both very nice and interested in Japan culture and of course, food. We had been to Japan a few times before for business, but never had a chance to explore. I have to say, the tour was fantastic. We covered so much ground we feel like experts of the fish market now, only having gone that first time with FooDrink. We went again two days later to eat more food on our own, because the food there is so diverse and so good, you can't really just go once. I think if this is your first time to Tokyo or even just your first time to the fish market, having a guide like FooDrink is an absolute must. It is a crazy and hectic place to explore the fish market and you definitely need a guide, regardless if you are fluent in Japanese or not. You would otherwise get lost, waste time, and not get the most of the market without a proper guide. FooDrink were great and we would have been lost without them. Thanks so much, we definitely recommend this.

Explore more Tsukiji. In Tsukiji, what a visitor can do is not just spending time to line up and finish a meal. There is a lot of things should be done to explore this world biggest seafood market. This was my third time going to Tsukiji market. By joining this food tour, I really visited interesting places I've never been to, and had a fresh morning!
Insider's view of Japanese food. The staff couldn't be friendlier and more knowledgeable. My friend and I tried tons of things and asked lots of questions and had an amazing experience. Thank you!!!

Amazing, Informative and FUN!. The Tokyo FooDrink Tour was exceptional!You get to taste the most authentic, tasty, yummy foods in a place where real Japanese shop and get to interact with a variety of foods you probably never ate.Yu, the guide is very friendly, knowledgeable and knows all the local vendors and stories- a true gem.This is a must tour for the foodies in you- but do come hungry : )

Insider's Market View + Hefty Tastings. The food and drink tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market gave me an insider's view of the market, replete with fresh fish and seafood. There's also a large fruit and vegetable market (I got to see melons being auctioned). There are many shops for the public (not just wholesalers and restauranteurs) that sell food and drink, both fresh and packaged, as well as other goods. We stopped at several for tastings that were available to the public, and at others where my Tokyo FooDrink Tour ticket covered the cost of some substantial tastings. I definitely didn't need lunch after the morning tour. My guide was one of the company's founders and it was very pleasant to walk and talk with him (my language is English). He taught me several things, including the proper way to approach a Shinto shrine. Definitely dress casually, wear walking shoes (not sandals!!), and bring your camera and an appetite. I was glad to have money on hand to purchase some packages from shops where we stopped for tastings. It was an all-sensory and great learning experience.

A Great Day!. We had only three days in Tokyo so we (my wife and I, two daughters 9 & 11) splurged on a private food tour. We chose TokyoFooDrink based on TA recs. They were organized, flexible and very responsive to our wishes. Watching the Udon noodles being made by a master was a real highlight. They easily earned a 5-star review.

Amazing Sukiji Tour. This was just what I was looking for, 4h over the biggest fish market and surrounding shops. Tons of stuff I wouldn't have done or tried by myself, tons of food, drinks, sampling and shoppings. The boys are doing an amazing job, groups never go larger than 4 people + guide at one. For any foodie, this is it.

You just can't miss this one! Awesome experience. I enjoyed this tour a lot. I was looking for such an experience which can show me a preview of normal Japanese life. The kind of street the we walked through in this tour are now very few in Tokyo. It is a local shopping street with food stalls and small shops. You can experience the daily routine stuff like meso shops, meat shops, tea shops, snack shops.The food during the tour is included in the price. The food was very good and lots of different things to try. During the tour you can buy local stuff too like green tea and snacks.The tour guide, Nori-san is a very interesting person. He is very travelled and intellectual person. We talked about a lot of different topics about India and Japan. When I will go to Tokyo again, I will definitely take their tour again.

Great tour!. You will get a lot of insights of the fish market and even Japanese culture! Tae is very friendly and helpful and would love to answer all my questions (even the stupid ones LOL).We were running late on the tour day due to unexpected peak hour rush of tokyo subway (it's crazy! I mean, we do have rush hours on trains in Melbourne too but it's nothing compared to what it was like in Tokyo!). When we arrived at the meeting point, Tae and the other guest have already left. But after some arrangement, we were able to meet the group ealier at second meeting point, which was great as we didn't miss much of the tour! Thanks a lot guys! It's definitly one of the highlights of our honeymoon trip ;)

Thoughtful and Well-Planned with a Friendly and Helpful Guide. Yumiko was our guide for the day and she was such a friendly and cheerful lady. She was careful to brief us on the expected behaviours so that we do not get ourselves in the way of the hardworking folks in the market; which was very helpful in making sure we did not put ourselves in harm's way. It is a busy place!She was able to describe the inner workings of the market, introduce us to a few friendly vendors who were happy to welcome us tourists to their playground. We even sampled fresh tuna sashimi! There was also a melon auction to be witnessed (sorry spoilers).I understand that the manager of this company took the time to plot out the best route for both eating through Tsukiji as well as experiencing its colour and life. Thank you for your effort, it was well worth the time as well as great value for the fee of the tour.
Really enjoyable look around the markets. A great way to get to know Tokyo a little better. Good food, some fun personalities and the group size wasn't too large either.

Fantastic tour made outstanding by our guide!. Incredibly well run, interesting and entertaining tour with the added bonus of great food! We couldn't have asked for more! The highlight was the service because our guide Eriko was the real difference for this tour as she went out of her way to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves as much as possible with her knowledgeable, genuine and personal approach. This is a great way to see this cultural icon and I would highly recommended this company to do it with!
Great tour - worth the time. A great opportunity to get a glimpse in to the real Tokyo, see the market, taste the local foods, drink some sake and talk to a local

Amazing Tour & Way to Experience Tokyo!. The Tokyo FooDrink Tour was a great end to my time in Tokyo. The Tsukiji Market is a special and historical place in the city, and it's great to experience it with knowledgable tour guides such as Sayoko and Yu. They were friendly and catered the tour to the group's interests and needs. They felt more like friends than guides! The food that we enjoyed were highlights and "hidden gems" in the sometimes overwhelming market. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wishing to experience true Japanese culture. Thank you for the wonderful experience!

great tour. would recommend this tour to anybody who wants to see tsukiji market and learning about japanese food. both fumito and sayoko were great in showing us all the different places within tsukiji market. thank you.

Did both the Sunamachi and Tsukiji market tours in may - great experience !. We stayed in Tokyo a few days in May (our first time in Japan). Did both the Sunamachi and the Tsukijii market tours.Both tours were great. Very different and complementing.The Sunamachi tour gave us an introduction to a local market where the locals shop for food. Great experience.The Tsuikjii market tour took us inside this very busy and touristic market - showing us and explaining the behind the scenes of the market. The guides were great! The food was excellent! A highly recommended experience when visiting Tokyo.

Best Tour in Tokyo - don't miss it!. This was one of the best things we did in our 3 week vacation in Japan. Tskuiji Fish Market is a bustling market and having this tour was great because Yu and Eriko were very informative and knew many of the vendors. We got to try different types of food, drinks, and pick up great souveniors to bring home. The tour starts off at a temple in front of the market, lasts about 3 hours, and ends at a standing sushi restaurant. I would highly recommend this tour - don't miss out!

What a Great way to experience the Japanese Food Culture!!. My brother and I, was in Japan recently.. And we went on this Tsjukiji Market Tour with Yu and Yuriko. They were both really nice guides. We were so amazed about all the food and all the facts we got to know along the way!! A very interesting tour. You will not regret signing up on this tour..it lasts about 3,5 h.. The time will fly away with these two lovely guides :) thank you guys again, for this wonderful tour!!

Excellent Family Tour of Fish Market!. We had the most excellent tour of the Tsukiji Fish Market with Noriko and Yu. Our family of four showed up and it tired out we were given a personalized tour with Noriko and Yu - so it felt very special. Both Noriko and Yu were very kind, informative, and fun. They made our daughters (ages 9 and 13) truly enjoy the experience.We were able to get a real close up look at the markets (both vegetable and fish), speak with a number of market stall owners, and munch and shop our way through the public "outside" market areas. We had so much food good - We especially loved the stops for Sushi and Saki (the girls had juice….). There were also stops at three local temples - Also quite interesting for everyone.We had an excellent time and would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Tokyo with their family.Thank you Noriko and Yu!

Best tour of Tsukiji Market. Can’t say enough about these guys – we had such a fantastic morning exploring the incredible (and overwhelming) Tsukiji Market with Yoshika and Yu. Honestly, without a guide in the market, you wouldn’t know pretty much anything about what you are looking at and they, obviously, knew all the best spots and stops for photos etc (note – always ask before taking pictures here, many merchants don’t want photos taken). Did I mention the food? Tried everything from egg on a stick to fresh bonito flakes and sushi. So delicious. You also get a bonus aerial view of the market from their secret look out spot ;) Great viewpoint to see the busy marketplace in action and get a proper sense of the impressive size. Highly recommend!

Fantastic tour / don't miss out on this experience. I had a fabulous time. It was a fantastically personalised tour as it was 3 people to one guide. The tour guide Tai was absolutely fantastic. She explained everything superbly well. She answered all questions asked and introduced a fascinating side of Japan. At the indoor market we even experienced a melon auction and then we had a wonderfully delicious time sampling food in the outer market. She even let us stop and shop at a fascinating (and cheap!) ceramic store. At the gardens she explained the history and art of the tea ceremony. I even got to see a picture of her beautiful daughters in kimonos. In one day I learnt a little bit of everything, history, culture, art, religion and food. She even took me to my hotel at the end of the tour. She recommended places to go to and things to see. There's so much we did and all I can say is, it's something you can't miss. Thank you so much for a wonderful time.

Fantastic Food Tour!. I had a fantastic time on the Tskuiji Fish Market and Food tour. Yumi was an excellent guide, very informative and obviously very passionate about showing visitors the market and foods. The whole process of booking, paying and meeting up was very simple with quick emails from the company with clear instructions.The food was very delicious, I was glad I didn't eat breakfast beforehand. This was the best way to see the markets rather than alone because it's obvious Tokyo FooDrink Tour have relationships with the workers who allowed us to take photos and look closer.I wish I had had more time to sample their other tours available!

Great Way to Spend a Morning. Shin San did a great job of navigating us through the extremely busy Tsujiki fish market. It is a huge place, and having a knowledgeable guide makes it accessible. Everything that we sampled was very tasty, especially the sushi, oyster and the saki. You cannot go wrong with this tour!

Delicious start to the day!. Wonderful tour of the tsukiji fish market! Yoshika was very informative and gave us awesome insight in to the inner and outer markets! We loved trying all the street food the markets had to offer! I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to have a great experience at the fish market!
Excellent!. I had a great time. Yoshika was an excellent guide. She had perfect English and we learned about all the little details that make an experience so enriching. Thank you!

Early morning Market mayhem!!. Great tour! I would hate to tour Tsujiki on our own. It was great fun having Yuri guide us through and explain what we were seeing. It was shocking to see the prices paid for such fruits as melon and mango earlier at the auction. We got to taste a lot of local dishes and then finished the fun morning with a standup sushi bar. The Chef preparing our sushi was a lot of fun, talking us all into trying the horse mackerel sushi which was great! Thank you Yuri, fun morning and great eats.

Best Tour in Tokyo!! Loved it!. This was by far the best tour we took while visiting Tokyo. Eriko and Yu were so knowledgeable and hospitable. The price is very reasonable for all that you get to sample on the tour. We loved every part of the tour and highly recommend it to anyone that is interested in visiting the Tsukiji Market. I wish we would have signed up for more tours with Tokyo FooDrink.

Great tour. Wonderful tour that was very comprehensive. We got to sample many things that were for sale in the outer market which was a lot of fun. The inner market was a bustling bee hive of activity. The tour guide was excellent and we really got a feel for the workings of the market. Unfortunately they market is moving to a new location next year, and who knows if it will be the same. Take this tour while you can.

Best tour I had in Tokyo! Highly recommended! . I did the Tsukiji Market Tour with Tokyo FooDrink yesterday and it was every penny well spent. I had originally booked with another company for Tsukiji tour with kimono experience however was told about 3 days before that they cannot confirm the tour for me as I am alone and the tour needs minimum 2 to start. I scrambled to look for a replacement and found Tokyo FooDrink. On the day itself, I was pleasantly surprised that I am the only guest so this turns out to be a private tour. It was much appreciated that they didn't cancel on me. My guide was Fumito san and he was great! It was a very detailed tour that brings you to the inner and outer market to see various activities with explanation including a melon auction (similar to tuna auction but smaller scale). The tour also included visit to 2 temples which I would have missed if I go by myself. Being a foodie, the highlight of tour is the delicious food I get to sample. Tokyo FooDrink will bring you to the shops that provide quality food. Japanese omelet, dried bonito, fresh oyster, fried fish cake, Japanese green tea and sake are what I've tried. Thanks to Fumito san, I even tasted fresh sea urchin for the first time. The tour ended with a sushi lunch at nearby restaurant and Fumito san was helpful in getting me in the right direction for my next destination. P.S. You will also get to go to a secret spot in the market and also walk away with a unique souvenir.

Amazing hosts, wonderful taste of daily life, food and culture in Japan. Had a great time on both the Tsukiji and Sunamachi tours. Got to taste some really good food like big oyster, fried fish cake and sushi on Tsukiji fish market tour, mixed tempura and yakitori on the Sunamachi local shopping street tour. Discovered interesting things like how dried bonito was made, the history of the fish market, and learning about the ingredients that go into Japanese cooking.The hosts were wonderful, lovely people who were happy to answer your questions and provide any helpful information you need even for after the tour.

Excellent tour of the Tsukiji Market. We had a great time on this tour. Nori and Fumito were very friendly and knowledgeable guides and took us through the main sections of the market. The market itself was very fascinating, with many things to look at and eat. Overall we are very impressed by this tour and highly recommend it! Al and Ryan Note: The market is moving from Tsukiji to another location soon, so if you want to see it in Tsukiji, you should do it soon.

Amazing host, lots of hidden secrets.. We had a brilliant tour, saw the inner secrets of both the food and fish markets, and ate and drank at some hidden gems. There's no way you could experience the same without the tour, it grants you access into public-free spaces, and takes the confusion and craziness out of it. You won't leave hungry, as you get to enjoy beautiful sushi, amongst the rest of the amazing menu. A wonderful experience, with a memorable host.

Perfect impressions from the Fishmarket in Tokyo. Great guide and many interesting information about the fishmarket and the whole district, including shrines and other "most see places" in that area. The food was really good, and the group size was also just perfect. We had a really good time and it is definitely worth the money!

Perfect way to kick off our Tokyo trip. We arrived in Tokyo late Friday night. On Saturday morning, we went straight to the Tsukiji Market for a tour with FooDrink. My husband and I were traveling with another couple, and the four of us had a private tour. It was great to have someone help us navigate the market. We enjoyed all of the snacks and got a kick out of watching the melon auction. If you're not interested in the very early tuna auction, I suggest this as a great way to get a feel for the market and try some extremely fresh seafood. Our guide answered all of our questions and took a detour to help us find the best, freshest uni. Thanks, Tae!

Great food, great guides, great tour. Very nice tour with Michiko and Yu around fish and local marketWe were only 3 and 2 at the end and they took a very good care of us explaining all the local habitsMany thanks again !

Wow!. At the last minute we decided to book this tour and I'm so glad we did! Yoshika was our friendly and informative guide and we saw so much on this tour! It was great! I definitely would not have seen (or known what I was looking at) as much if not for this tour. Yoshika was able to answer questions about names of things we saw and allowed us to take some neat pictures in the market. We even saw an auction of cantaloupe! Booking this tour was the best way to enjoy the Tsukiji Market, especially since it will be moving soon!

Great tour of Tsukiji Market. We had a great morning tour of Tsukiji Market with Michiko. She was very knowledgable about the market. It is a maze and would have been difficult to navigate without experienced guidance. So interesting to walk around the inner, outer and fruit and vegetable sections. The food selections were excellent and delicious--biggest and best oyster I ever ate! Very easy to book online and to meet at indicated meeting place. I highly recommend this tour with FooDrink!

Fantastic tour - like having a local friend show you around!. We knew we wanted to see Tsujiki Fish Market whilst in Tokyo and my husband did lots of research before booking with Yu and Nori. It paid off - these guys were so friendly and enthusiastic, but also informative. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour. They spent nearly 4 hours with us, showing us corners of the market we would never have found, letting us sample all kinds of food, even taking us for a sushi lunch at the end. They taught us how to eat like a local, useful words, showed me a good place to buy ceramics when I expressed an interest, and we had a laugh as well. Great value for money too. A definite must do whilst you are in Tokyo.

Great!. I recently decided to choose both the fish market tour and Sunamachi tour after looking for alternatives to other seemingly average food tours on other sites, and this one being high rated on TripAdvisor. My wife and I had Tae for the fish market and Tae and Yu for the Sunamachi tour. I did ponder over whether we could have just done the fish market on our own but we're glad we booked in for this tour, as we explored parts of the market that we probably wouldn't have navigated ourselves, or even thought that we would be allowed to enter. The Sunamachi tour was a nice surprise as it's actually a traditionally non-touristy street and with great street food that seemed cheaper than the main areas, in fact we didn't see any other tourists at all! Go on an empty stomach as we seemed to get many extra freebies from the stall owners that loved the fact that tourists were coming to visit. Both Yu and Tae were very knowledgable, friendly, and courteous, and even helped us with advice for some other plans that we had for the rest of the trip. In summary, if you're a foodie (or even if you aren't), i recommend doing these tours!

Highly recommended for a Tsukiji or private tour. Last week we enjoyed a Tsukiji Market tour with Yu-san and we had lots of fun! We tried a lot of food, including oysters and fresh sushi at a local sushi bar. The tour took us through the shops in the outer market and the wholesale inner market, a very nice experience!A few days earlier, we had spent our first day in Tokyo together with Yu-san on a private tour. It was my boyfriends birthday, and I asked Yu-san for a custom tour. Having told him that he worked as a chef, Yu-san took us on a tour through the Kitchen Street and serveral other foodie hotspots in Asakusa. He also got my boyfriend a very nice gift in one of the kitchen shops, which was greatly appreciated and well chosen. At the end of the tour, he took us to a very authentic izakaya, where we tried a lot of truly Japanese dishes.
