A few of his colleagues stopped by to meet us and make a toast to my boyfriend's birthday. We had a lot of fun and they made our day into a very special one. Having Yu-san explain a bit of the culture and customs in Tokyo made our trip a lot more valuable. I cannot express my gratitude enough.If you're new to Tokyo, don't hesitate to book a tour with Tokyo Foodrink. You will love it!

Awesome Fish Market Tour. I wouldn't have been able to see everything in the maze that is Tsujiki Fish Market without the great guide service of Yu and Nori. They did an exceptional job and are very energetic. The language barrier in Japan is significant, and both Yu and Nori speak great English. They have a good relationship with a lot of the vendors which goes a long ways in the market. We were able to closely observe tuna butchers in action and mingle with many of the workers. Hard to believe but we watched a muskmelon auction that was pretty intense and one of the highlights of the tour. The food tasting was great and both guides knew a lot about the history of Japanese cuisine. The sake tasting came with a square cedar sake box cup which was a nice souvenir included in the price of the tour. A pleasant surprise was the inclusion of the Tsujiki Hongan-ji Buddhist Temple and the Namiyoke Inari Shrine. Yu and Nori provided a lot of background information about the history and significance of the locations as well as detailing the customs locals adhere to. I'd recommend this tour to my friends and family as a way to get a more in depth look at and smoothly navigate around Tsujiki Market.

Best advice I was given was to take this tour.. I had originally planned on navigating the fish market alone but two of my friends told me that they highly recommended the FooDrink tour. Yu was a very energetic guide and showed us parts of the area that most tourists don't know of. All of the samples were amazing. Can't recommend enough.

good, but still needs to be improved.. both tour guides are wonderfull people but the tour still needs to be improved.maybe a little bit of history about the market and some explanation about the fish that can be found, were are they caught, etc. Food there's plenty to try, (included for free) drinks I had only one: sake.

Best part of the trip so far. Was initially cautious about booking because of the rice, but was so glad we did. Best part of our trip in Tokyo and we really enjoyed it, We started off with some delicious omeltte and then a tour of the inner market stopping off at some stalls who our guide Yu knew. We got to taste some Tuna and see them preparing the fish. We then had a tour of the outer market and Yu was very helpful in helping us talk to shop owners and helping us buy gifts (which we did for over an hour). We had some delicious fish cake and sake then some even more delicious sushi. Our guide Yu was super friendly and a great tour guide for the market and giving us tips on Tokyo itself. Can't recommend enough

Terrific Tsukiji Tour Experience. The Tokyo FooDrink tour was fantastic. We got to see and learn many interesting things while on the tour and the food we had was delicious. One of the highlights for my husband and I were the large raw oysters. The one my husband had on the tour was the best he's ever had and we are from an area that is known for fresh seafood. I wasn't able to enjoy the raw oysters as I was pregnant on the tour but Yu and Yoshika were terrific about providing alternatives for me.Yoshika and Yu were nice, attentive, helpful, and informative. I'd definitely recommend touring the Tsukiji Market with them .
Great Tsukiji Tour. Had a wonderful tour with Yu. He gives you an up close look at the fish market with plenty of delicious snacks along the way. Highly recommended.

Just Excellent. The only reason not to do this - you are a picky eater and/or don't like or are allergic to seafood. Otherwise, this is a must! You basically eat your way through the market. Tae, the tour guide, is very knowledgeable and guides you around effortlessly through the throngs of people and stalls. You'll get free samples galore and also there are chances to buy more to take home. A sake toast and delicious sushi lunch (about 7 pieces on the platter) cap a wonderful morning (tour finishes around 12:30-1pm).

A True "Must Do". Yu and Yuri are incredibly nice people and a necessity to get the most out of your visit to the market. This place is huge. We went a couple of days before the tour and were just overwhelmed. But with Yuri leading the way you are in good hands. We were able to chat with several vendors and really get a chance to understand how the market works. Finally, the food is amazing. Do the tour, then go back the next day to stroll around, buy unique items and eat as much as possible. Also, this is a great way to meet other people visiting Japan.

Very friendly & helpful guides. Small group tours, there were 2 of us & we were joined by another family of 2 adults and 2 very young children.Interesting tour where you get to see all different types of seafood and huge tunas, beautiful vegtables & fruits. They will even bring you to see a live fruit auction.The 1st stop is a visit to a temple as that was the assemble point. Then we went on to taste a 6 inches tamago per person. It was warm & really yummy, so, dont worry if you didn't get breakfast before the tour. Then there will be a brief tour of the surrounding markets before going into the inner market where its only meant for wholesale clients and where the main attractions are. After the inner market will be touring the outter markets where you get to taste some green tea, sake, almonds, bonito flakes & fish cake (full size). This is where you get a chance to buy some local produce. In between there will be a visit to a Shrine.The tour finish off by lunch at a sushi restaurant outside of the market area.Overall a very enjoyable morning tour. Take note that strollers for children and wheelchairs are not allowed within the inner market area. For those travelling with little children, they will need to walk quite a distance through the tour and at some point wet and slightly cramp space.Special thanks to Yumi and Fumito, our wonderful tour guides and Yu, Nori as well.We had a great time and highly recommend this tour to anyone interested to see where all the fresh Japanese produce come from.

Fun tour with an awesome tour guide!. Being this is our first time in Tokyo we wanted to do a tour. We opened up good ol tripadvisor and Yu's had one of the highest rated reviews, so I knew we were in for a good tour.The Sunamachi Market tour itself was very good - Yu showed us around, we ate great food, and learned about the various vendors. What really made this tour special is Yu himself. He has such as an awesome personality, he's so warm and welcoming that after chatting with him for a few, I felt like I was talking to a long time pal. He truly is passionate about his work as I can see the relationships he has with the various vendors - he knows their food, their history, but more importantly he knows how it impacts the local culture.I can't recommend him enough, next time we're back in Tokyo we're booking another with Yu!

Tsukiji Market Food Tour. Coolest tour guides you can to explore tsukiji market! Fumito-san and Yu-san are two bright individuals who are ready to take you for an amazing tour of the biggest seafood market in the world! Highly recommended!

An amazing morning. Yu showed my partner and I around the Tsukiji fish and fruit & veg markets. We found him to be energetic, knowledgeable, attentive, and clearly liked by all the stall keepers we laid a visit to.The treats we had along the way were delicious!O and J

In capable hands of people who know what's best. I was in Japan for two days as a fly-by from business, so I decided to take in a some sights and this tour. I arrived early at the meet point, keeping time on my side to allow for any unknown delay, and to my surprise Michiko and Yu were already there to meet me. First impressions were of warmth and happiness - i was greeted with smiles and welcomes, affirmations a great day lied ahead. The tour was simply fantastic, at every turn and new experience for me, I was led through wonderfully relevant explanations and details about the surroundings encountered. The narrative and knowledge during the tour really made it worthwhile. I could see other (non tour tourists) around at times looking lost, or being swayed by the crowds, but Michiko and Yu had a great sense of knowing when to push effortlessly though the crowds or stay in a location that was well worth enjoyment. There were many food experiences on the tour that were so very enjoyable. Omelet, variety of dried seafood, succulent fresh oyster, saki (with memorable wood square cup) and of course sushi. I finished the tour with Michiko and Yu waving goodbye to me at the subway entrance and I have to say, they really made my day. It was an awesome experience for me, and I am very thankful for the wonderfully attentive tour they provided. My wife even said i could not stop talking about it for day's after I returned.

Highlight. Our tour around the markets was one of the highlights of our Tokyo trip. We saw and learnt so much from our kind and entertaining guides. You get to see a lot more then if you went on your own.We got to try a lot of great food, I was so full at the end of it. Yu and Yoko, Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Fantastic morning!. We had a wonderful time in Tokyo and Yu's tour of the Tsukiji market was definitely a highlight of our trip! He and his tour partner Michiko were both extremely kind, knowledgeable, and funny. We saw the biggest tuna we have ever seen and so many different types of seafood - it was crazy! Even with so much fish, the market does not smell and is kept very clean (in case you were worried!) We tried a bunch of different food on the tour and Yu knows all the best spots!! Had the best tuna sashimi of our lives at a small stall at the outdoor market where we would have never stopped at on our own. We ended the tour with delicious sushi in an authentic (not touristy) sushi restaurant that we also would never have found on our own. This tour is a definite must for an enjoyable and interesting (and yummy!) morning! Thank you so much Yu and Michiko!!

Fantastic tour and guides. The highlight of our stay in Tokyo. Really well planned with lots of variety. If you are interested in Japanese food and culture then this is a must do, and with the Tsujiki fish market being moved soon then your only chance to see it is now. The guide Yu-san is excellent. Informative, courteous, entertaining and allowing you to experience as much of what is on offer as possible. The food is fantastic and can be as challenging as you want it to be. There is no pressure to buy anything but the opportunity is there if you wish. The sushi at the end of the tour is outstanding. I cant recommend this tour highly enough. Thank you Yu-san and Kaori-san.

Highlight of my Tokyo trip. Me and my friend arrived about 15 minutes early for the tour and found Yu and Kaori already there. They were really friendly and immediately put us at ease. With the extra few minutes we had, we had a quick look in the temple where me met before heading over to the market.The tour through the inner market is fascinating, being in amongst the hustle and bustle and watching the workers preparing tuna.The outer market with all of the various foods to try is one of the food highlights of my life. I've never known tuna sashimi to melt in my mouth like it did. The oyster I had was leagues above every other oyster I have tried and the various dried fish we tried were amazing.The sushi we finished with was again on another level to anything I have ever tried.Yu and Kaori were informative, fun, engaging and all you could hope for from a tour guide.If you love fish and are in Tokyo, this tour is an absolute must.

An Insider Tsukiji Tour Experience. If you are looking to feel like an insider and have an interactive experience, you must book this tour. Yu, my guide, was very knowledgeable and patient. The inner market tour highlights the wholesale section and you may even get to see an auction (I got to see a melon auction). Trying different foods through the outer market is fantastic and Yu's guidance on the shops and foods is very helpful. The tour ends at a sushi standing restaurant nearby. It was delicious and service was superb!

Tsukiji tour - thumb up!. Yu and his partner (Tae - hope I spelt the name correctly) were our guides that day. There was a miscommunication on the date and time. I was grateful that Yu managed to connect with me and picked me up at Tsukiji Shijo station. The tour was informative and interesting. It touched on various areas of the market which I wouldn't probably have done it myself. I got to taste the local food along the way. The guides were knowledgable, patient and thoughtful. We were running late for the tour ('cos I joined in late), they didn't rush through it and they would ask if we need toilet break.The best highlight of the tour was the sushi at a sushi restaurant nearby Tsukiji market - the sushi was really yummy and what's best is it didn't require long queue (: Thanks Yu (and Tae)!

A Truely Worthwhile Experience. If you are trying to choose a Tokyo experience that has all the box's ticked, this is the one.Yu is experienced, friendly and accommodating. We had a late change in our itinery due to unforseen circumstance, and he made the changes with no fuss. A total Tsukiji experience.

Awesome Tsukiji Fish Market tour!!. This is a must-do! A highlight of my trip to Tokyo! Yu-San is absolutely the best! He's knowledgeable, nice, accommodating and fun! He knows many of the local shop owners as well. Highly recommended. Can't miss!

Tsukiji at its best!. Thank you very much, Yu and The fabulous Yoshika! We had a lot of fun at the Tsukiji market including a long and intense walk around, many delikates like japanese omelette, fresh oyster, fish cake and sushi, fruit auction, secret places (;-)), many side information and very helpful explanations, super friendly shops, an entertaining sushi master and last but not least charming and caring guides. Don't miss this event besides the other tour they do offer (experiencing local food).

Fantastic Guide. Meeting Yu and following him during the market tour was really interesting. What I enjoyed more is the he was really to change the tour to satisfy people requests. I really recommend to try this tour also because we could go to not touristic places like restaurant. I personally don’t like to queue and if you don’t know the area is difficult to find something good and with reasonable price. Thanks Yu.

Best way to explore the Tsukiji Market. I joined Yu-san for his in-depth Tsukiji Market Tour last Dec15. It was the best decision I made. I would not have managed to go through the complicated maze of the inner market. I got to see the big fresh tunas, snow crabs, eels, shrimp, oysters and fruits and veggies. Yu guided me to the hidden secrets of the market as well as the the best food the locals go for. I didn't need to line up for 5hrs for the best sushi. Yu showed me where the locals eat. Even if it wasn't in the menu, he gladly offered me my favorite uni sushi. I highly recommend this food tour. He goes beyond what is expected. He even gave me pamphlets and Tokyo guides to help me during the rest of my stay. Yu-san is the perfect host.I will definitely tell my friends to take his tour.

TSUKIJI with Yu and his partner. Thank you YU… :).If you like fish or anything else fresh as vegetables or fruit go there. It will be an adventure guided by Yu and his partner through this vaste area of excellent food. Nothing in the world equals this place. So book those two guys you won't regret it…

Fantastic value and covers all the bases and more!. This tour was the highlight of our. Tokyo stay and the perfect way to see the fish markets and surrounding markets. We got to taste such a variety of foods, saw an auction and so many fish/vegetables/produce/everything possible under the sun, for sale. Our guide was funny, entertaining and full of local knowledge and also so very kind as to take some great photos of us both together, sending them to us later that day. Truly the best value and time spent. Highly recommend doing it this way! It was amazing!

The best tour guide in Tokyo!!!. It was amazing tour in tsukiji fish market.Yu (our guide) knows all the traditional japanese place in the market.And we had delicious sushi that i had ever have in my life.We are planning to join other tours with him.

Fantastic and delicious tour. Yu was an awesome tour guide - incredibly knowledgeable about the markets and the best places to visit. On the tour we got to sample a lot of authentic Japanese cuisine that wasn't touristy at all. He knows the best stalls and vendors with the freshest produce and ended the tour at what has to be the best salmon and tuna I've had in my life! Definitely an awesome tour that I would recommend to friends and family when you visit Tokyo!
